text: Somehow I do dislike malt aroma in wheat bears, caramel does not suit it very well. Nevertheless, decent banana flavor and wheat taste, sadly also malt taste is off factor for me in this beer. Simply not my beer style, rating with respect to overall beer quality
355ml bottle at OnLYou, Jimei. Pours hazy golden orange with a minimal white head. Aroma of malt with a hint of banana. Sweetish finish. No harshness but pretty average.

Beautiful copper color of a new penny. Very hazy when poured properly. Sticks to your palate the way a good hefweizen should. Minimally bitter. Everyone has their own personal perfect beer... this is mine.

Draught at Barrel Head. Hazy orange color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, wheat, yeast, grass and malts. Bitter finish with citrus, wheat, malts, grass and a bit of yeast. Very nice hefeweizen.

Unfiltered hazy golden sunshine color with a creamy white head of foam. Fresh bananas all the way from the aroma to the flavor. Tame doughy yeast. very smooth and wild like a Bavarian brew ought to be. Great job Sierra Nevada on this one.

Sampled from 0.355 l bottle. Hazy, straw yellow with a foamy, white head. Sweetish, moderately fruity and yeasty-spicy aroma of banana, cloves, citrus and pear. Moderately sweet, yeasty-spicy and slightly fruity taste of banana, cloves, pear and a touch of citrus, followed by a medium long, moderately yeasty-spicy, slightly dry and minimally sourish finish. Medium body, smooth and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Nice Weizen!
Bottle. Golden colour with white head. Wheat and cereal aroma. Sweet, wheat, cereal, malt, yeast and herbal taste. Medium body.
Bottle from Liquor Barn poured into a pint. Aroma of yeast and malts. Taste was sweet.
Bottle - hazy golden color with creamy head. taste is yeasty, wheaty malts, dark malts. Medium banana factor. Moderate sweetness. Easily drinkable but lacks real quality. Finishes dry.
Mild wheaty and yeasty and slightly lemoney nose. Pale head. Slightly hazy golden color. Mild and soft lemoney taste. Mild hops.
Im not too into this Sierra Nevada. It has a wit meets wheat taste thats kinda boring.

0.33 l bottle from Systembolaget Stockholm, Sweden. Appearance is golden, almost clear, well, at least it is not cloudy in any way and a small head. Aroma has wheat. Taste has yeast, but no banana, just some sweet relaxed yeast balanced with uptight wheat flavour. To be honest, I excepted a bit more.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2017 Botella de 12 fl. Oz. Comprada en la web on line de La Casa de las Cervezas (Santa Malta). Una gran cerveza, muy fiel al estilo hefe weissen. Color amarillo ámbar, turbia. Poca espuma. Aromas frutales y levadura. Sabor tradicional de las cervezas de trigo, notas de plátano o fruta tropical. Muy equilibrada.

12oz bottle. Pours a burnt gold with a medium foamy white head. Aroma is heavy on the clove with a touch of banana and vanilla. Taste is banana, clove, bubblegum, light citrus, coriander, wheat, and a little yeast. Spicy finish. Light body. Medium carbonation. Fluffy, smooth mouthfeel.
Den smager ikke af klassisk hvedeøl. Den mangler banan og den syntesiske smag. Men ellers en fin øl, og er god frisk i det.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 Bottle from Total Wine & More, St Petersburg. Mid-gold, hazy with a tiny uneven film of white head. Dough, lemon/orange, clove, coriander, vanilla and a hint of ginger. Sweet herbal taste, fairly typical of a good Hefe, but here is more of a bright citrussy hop note than would normally be expected. Sweet/astringent wheaty and lemony finish. Thin body for the style, and carbonated to high heaven. Pretty darn good.

A hazy dark yellow beer with a rather disappointing small white head. Nose has very nixe notes of bananas, cloves, bread dough and yeast. Taste is sweetish with a banana-like flavor and a dry, crisp finish. Licely carbonation and medium palate. Very well made beer with nice notes and good balance. Especially good for the ABV.
Cloudy golden appearance with lots of head. Tastes of banana, pear, brown sugar and herbs. Medium body, smooth carbonation and a finish of warm brown sugar. Mm, Hopfensmoothie
Bottle 33 cl. Yellow, hazy with a medium white foamy head. Wheat aroma, spices and some banana. Light sweet, light bitter with a soft wheat end.
Bottle. Hazy, golden, minimal head, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, & astringent finish.

The American craft beer revolution originally drew on old English traditions more than anything else but a German influence also crept in at an early stage, and this is one of the classic American interpretations of the Bavarian Weissbier style. Medium thick, egg-white, creamy head leaving a dense rim around the glass and a thin veil in the middle, but certainly a lot less frothy than I am used to in this particular beer type; immediately and equally cloudy straw blonde robe with slight ochre-ish hue. Aroma of ripe banana, apple peel, some biscuit, white bread crumbs, dried orange peel, old cloves, white pepper, vanilla sugar somewhere, straw, pear juice, sweet (unpickled) gherkin, sweetbread, melting butter, raw turnip, field flowers, artisanal honey, candied pineapple. Crisp, fruity onset, lots of the expected banana ester (isoamylacetate), sweet, paired with balancing green plum-, starfruit- and unripe kiwi-like sourishness, refreshing with spritzy, minerally carbonation slightly coarsening an otherwise smooth, fluffy mouthfeel. Pleasantly soft bready and biscuity barley sweetness in the middle with utterly soapy and very gently souring wheat, carrying the banana and other fruit flavors onwards to the finish, meeting with an earthy yeastiness and soft hayish hop bitterish touch as well as aromatic phenols - quite strongly so, but still feeling natural and actually quite enjoyable. Banana flavor lingers a bit along with the biscuity malts and softly sourish, very soapy wheatiness. Authentic Bavarian Hefeweizen can be a real treat if fresh enough and served properly and many attempts at this ancient style that have been made out of its historical region seem to lack finesse and balance, often ending up as a one-sidedly banana-drenched caricature of the style. This one, however, understands the refinement, balance and subtlety of it: it is very heavy in the cliché banana flavor of the style, but also adds the spicy phenols that are indispensable for the overall balance; its mouthfeel and overall personality well match the German standard. The only thing lacking a bit for me, is a lush, whipped cream-like head formation, normally established by the wheat, and indeed it seems the wheat factor is a little bit understated here. Apart from that, I can imagine this being an introduction to Weissbier for many young American consumers, and having tasted dozens of German examples, I can only confirm that this is a credible, genuine and very useful beer to get acquainted with the style- though I also think it is a bit overrated here as a result of the American prevalence in its ratings. Sierra Nevada, one of the US pioneers in craft brewing, has done many influential things for the craft beer movement in the New World and its good to revisit them every now and then.

Butelka chyba nie pierwszej świeżości, kupiona z 5 zł. Piana raczej gruboziarnista, szybko znika. Aromat bananowy, lekko chlebowy. W smaku dalej sporo słodkiego banana. Nie wydaje się tak wytrawne, jak większość kolegów z gatunku. Wysokie nasycenie. W porządku, ale na pewno nie jest to top topów.

[backlog] 12-01-15 // bottle at Shady Pines Saloon, Sydney. The beer everything about craftbeer started for me. First CheckIn on Untappd. Cloudy orange beer. Foamy head. Americans can indeed brew other beers as Bud and Miller. This is a nice calssical weizen. Solid banana and clove. Well carboanted. Smooth mouthfeel. Fresh ans tasty.

How: Bottle.
Where: Viking Line.
Appearance: Hazy dark golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Wheat, citrus, yeast, banana.
Body: Light to medium body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Wheat, citrus, spices, yeast, banana, some fruit.

Rating #2170 - 2015.11.13 - Sample at Grape Escape. Yellow pour that is fairly cloudy. Aroma is of grains, citrus, bananas, coriander, ginger?. Taste is fairly wheaty, but complex, and mild sweetness. Overall, this beer is drinkable, enjoyable, and a solid Hefeweizen, but i wouldnt tart it up as being in the RB Top 50.

0.355l bottle. Hazy golden body, thin white head. Aroma of banana, bread, peach and some medicinal hops. Taste of bread, banana, peach and lemon zest. To be honest I was a bit sceptical that this beer is one of the best weizens in the world. Im still not sure it is, and I definitely consider some of the Bavarians better, but this is definitely nice.

4.8%ABV. Kellerbier.

Poured out cloudy gold. 8ºSRM.

Nose has nice creamed corn aroma. Beery with some nice raw dough aroma. A bit of formic acid bite on the nose.

Mouthfeel is beery and carbonated. Palate has sweet pale malt with solid wheat malt body that comes across as broadly sour with a slight minerality which then fades to malt sweet, sweet dough, fresh biscuits. There is cement dust and sawdust. Hops are clean bitter, but not heavy.

Clean finish.
Pours hazy with straw colour and a small wheat nose. Taste is also very typical wheat and very light citric notes. Palate is typical weiss Bier - rather short but agreeable.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung).Trübes Gold mit weißer Schaumdecke. Milder hefiger Bananengeruch. Schmeckt leider ziemlich deutsch!!!!

Hazy orange golden body, huh head. Aroma; grassy hops, meadow spices, sweet malts, maybe coriander. Taste; sweet malts, grass, banana note, meadow spices, fruit notes - leading to a fruity sweet finish. Nice on palate. Overall a tasty hefe, young banana, fresh, likeable. But germans will complain about low head of course. [35,5cl.btl 4.8%abv]

Very good, solid effort recreating a Bavarian Hefeweizen. Aroma is traditional for this style. Flavor and body are very close, but just a tad lacking - in complexity and depth. Still, really good stuff.

0,33 bottle at home - Aroma has banana, clove and slight american hops. On the flavor you get much of the same. Its an okay attempt at a hefeweizen. It would probably be better if the bottle was fresh.
12oz bottle. Poured a hazy golden color with an averaged sized head. Yeast, fruity bananas, and some spice.

UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Rerate, 355 ml bottle, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. I turned the bottle upside down before opening. Hazy yellow colour, small white head of poor retention. The aroma has notes of citrus, and less pronounced notes of cloves and banana. There are also some less pleasant hints of solvent. The flavour is also citrussy, with moderate notes of banana and cloves. Fizzy mouthfeel. Original rating:355 ml bottle, at Peter Gift, Aarhus, Denmark. Deep golden colour, no head at all in the shiny glass, probably due to the pubs ignorant use of rinse aid / rinse agent. The aroma and flavour have some of the typical notes of a hefeweizen (banana and cloves), but this beer was far from the best h.w. Ive had (and I love hefeweizens). Fizzy mouthfeel.
Bouteille 35 cl - couleur jaune, odeur malté, goût malté, épicé, avec des arrières goût de citron
Bottle from Chevy Chase Wine and Liquor. Hazy orange body with medium head. Nose is hoppy, and citrus. Taste is floral, citrus and straw. Creamy texture.

I think the body on this beer is really nice. There are heavy banana aromas that dominate the overall experience. A very good hefe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured in improper glassware (tulip, as I didnt have a weizen available. Huge white, soapy head. Dull straw color. Murky Flint water. Getting a lot of clove in the aroma. Yeasty, clove, and a bit of banana. Watery finish. 

Not really a fan.
Poured from bottle into a pint glass: Pours clear yellow with no head. Aroma of cloves, banana, wheat. Taste more of the same, very clean, really nice. Solid heffeweisen.
Draft at brewery (NC). Hazy yellow. Delicious. Reminds me if Franzenkahner with more clove.
Hefetrübes goldgelb mit wenig Schaum. Malzig, hefig leicht fruchtig, Nelke, etwas Banane, spritzig.

Tap / Tirador.
@ 7 Days Brew, Nagoya, Japon.
A: Hazy amber / Ambar turbio.
T/S: Wheat, banana, fruity / Trigo, banana, afrutado.
Cloudy amber white color. Nice closely banana nose. A bit heavier body than I would expect but still balanced and refreshing with lingering big clovey finish.
Golden with a white head - Some wheat and malty in the aroma - Wheat and malt body theat has sweetness to it - The wheat goes into the finsh - This was nice

Bottle shared with koleminer20 during the after party for The Chouffe Party 2016. Aroma is weird, salty, meaty, slight banana, wheat, Im not a fan. Appearance is straw golden, white head, hazy. Taste is wheat, light spice, somewhat savory, easy-drinking but also terrible. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy body, light carbonation, awful grain aftertaste. Overall, I dont think Id like to revisit this.

12 oz bottle shared by ebone1988 at The Chouffe Party 2016 after party. And how I wish he wouldnt have. The pour is a foggy golden straw color with a thin bubbly collar of white head and a couple spots of soapy lace to be found. The aroma is not good. Its wheaty and light with a strong sweet grain thing happening. Its not malty, nor is it good. I dont recall hefeweizens smelling like this. The flavor is wheaty and lightly spicy. There is a weird grain thing happening on the finish. Its not awful, but its definitely not what I would expect from a hefe. The mouth feel is syrupy and heavy with a lack of carbonation. The aftertaste is wheaty and just not good. Its syrupy wheat and a little spice. This beer sucks.
Pours a hazy golden orange. Aromas of bread/bananas/ and some fruit. Had a taste of yeasty bread with some spice. Not as clove/banana as most Hefs Ive tried. I would actually seek this one out.

Draft @ source. Hazy yellow 3 finger Creamy head. Smells fantastic. Banana, wheat and pineapple. Wow. This is fantasy. At the source. Dense milky mouthfeel. Really great on site. Whoa. Could drink this daily
Pours a little hazy golden body with a thin head. Nice malty aroma. Well balanced creamy taste with a clear wheat character.
Bottle. Color hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma wheat, fruits, flowers. Taste sweet, banana, orange, herbal.

Been a long time since Ive had a Keller or a hefe but its Sierra Nevada so I think Im in good hands. Looks like it should. Mushy mouth, very dry, soft and mellow. Soft, careful yeast with barely a hint of spice, nearly invisible lemon, weak banana. Highly mellow yet very satisfying.

Fairly clear Hefeweizen, with all of the delicious ester profiles present. The sweet tasting clove, banana, and fruity flavors stay strong all the way through and the body is expectedly silky smooth although, a little watery. This Hefeweizen doesnt seem to dry my mouth out as much as the true German ones. Very nicely done by Sierra Nevada.  Definitely a top 50 for the style.

Light traditional hefeweizen aromas. Hazy with healthy head. Silky body. A nice example but the finish changes to an unpleasant malt flavor that throws off the balance and doesnt taste very good. An ok brew but very overrated scores here.

Bottle from Tankaya. Pours a hazy gold with a finger of white foam. Banana bread nose with spicy clove and some grassy notes. Slightly creamy mouthfeel and sweet, but still good bitterness on the finish. Some spicy warmth as well as a bit of light lemony tartness. Enjoyable Hefe, but maybe not as good as any of the Japanese local ones here. Still a nice effort from Sierra Nevada.
Aroma is typical weisse yeast, with banana and perhaps more citric than usual. Mouth follows the nose, with some clove. Very refreshing. Surprisingly good!

355ml bottle served in a pint glass. Enjoyed in a flat room in a Hong Kong business trip. Pours a very cloudy yellow color forming a solid and very creamy white head with good retention and lots of soapy lacings left in the glass. Great nose: Strong notes of wheat, pale grains and phenols. Banana and cloves but not very sweet. Notes of honey and sweet bread. Slightly sweet upfront. Strong notes of wheat and sweet pale malts. Banana-Cloves classic phenols can be felt in the mouth too. Very light to no bitterness as expected. Very smooth mouthfeel. Light but very creamy body. Wheat in the aftertaste. Excellent drinkability. Im not particularly a big fan of Weiss beers but I can recognize a great one. Sierra Nevada not disappointing here...
Bottle, probably not so fresh. Pours clean yellow with a small white head. Weak aroma of cloves and malt. Taste is cloves, wheat malt, sweet. Light body, fizzy.

Banns nutty Belgian yeast aroma and flavor. Taste has a slight bitter yeasty finish. Earthy wheat. Slight sweet banana fruity yeast flavors. Nice amount of body. Solid beer overall. Bit of a lagerish funk in the finish but mild. Enjoyable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle on Celebrity Millennium. Fresh smooth Weizen aroma, not too deep. Hints of wheat, hints of banana. Smooth aftertaste. Nice.
Bottle, probably not so fresh. Pours clean yellow with a small white head. Weak aroma of cloves and malt. Taste is cloves, wheat malt, sweet. Light body, fizzy.
12 fl oz Flasche. Naturtrüb und orangefarben. Kleine Schaumkrone. Leichtes Hefearoma. Leichter Körper. Mild im Geschmack.

355ml bottle. (Rating#2300)
Pours a cloudy deep straw, with a White head.
Spicy, yeasty aroma, phenolics, cloves, citrus, white pepper, wheat.
Off-dry, medium bodied, low bitterness, balanced CO2.
Spicy, citrusy taste, cloves, phenols, yeast.
Well balanced, straight-forward, refreshing. (2016-01-19)

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2016 From Uvinum. BB 31 March 2016. In Bavaria weiss glass. After dinner. Good but was expecting something more special from sierra nevada. Classic but not much banana taste. A bit acidic. Maybe it was a bit in bad state?

Botella. @La Barrica 13. Candas. 31/01/15
Color amarillo, aromas y sabores levadura, maltosa, herbal.

Botella 33 cl tomada en el momento en la internacional 01..01..2016. (r1632). (208 15 C2 2042 S grabado en botella). Color marrón muy claro amarillento turbio con espuma blanca poco persistente. Aromas y sabores frescos maltosos y cereales ligeramente herbaceos algo afrutados y cítricos. Predominio de cereales, algo dulces y puntos citricos. Cuerpo medio algo denso pastoso y espumoso aunque fácil de beber por sus 4.8 vol. Bastante sabor para esa gradacion. Refrescante. Bajarían atole wheat muy buena dentro de su estilo. Para repetir.
Bottle at home. Aroma is yeast, wheat, banana, clove, hint of citrus. Flavour is light sweet with a little wheaty sourness. Body is light to medium. Pretty decent Hefeweizen.
A decent and really nice Hefeweissen. The aroma is banana and clove. The taste is banana, spice, hops and biscuit. Maybee some bubblegum as well. As always Sierra Nevada deliver good beers...

Robe jaune/dorée et opaque. Peu de mousse qui se dissipe vite. Arômes de céréales et banane. Goût biscuit, banane, clou de girofle. Final fruits jaunes. Plutôt courte en bouche. Texture épaisse, carbonatation fine. Une blanche correcte.
Bue en juillet 2014. Très légère. Goût de clou de girofle et houblon subtil suivi dune finale qui sétire sur un arôme de banane. Bonne mais manque de punch

Butelka bączek 0,33l. Kolor mętny złoty, piana szybko się redukuje zostawiając małe ślady na szkle. Aromat raczej ryżu i lekkie banany, zawodzi. Smak to lekka kwasowość a reszta jak w aromacie piwo zawiodło mnie całkowicie, ledwo poprawne.

Reminds me of homebrew. Well balanced, good wheatiness, some banana, light clove. Bit thin in finish. Moderate sweetness with hint of sourness and light bitterness in finish. Drinkable, but cant find any reason to buy it again

Cervesa correcte, és dolça i fàcil de beure, destaca el toc a plàtan tant en gust com en aroma.
Cerveza correcta, es dulce y fácil de beber, destaca el toque a plátano tanto en sabor como en aroma.
Pours a cloudy yellow on tap with big fluffy white head that leaves good lace. Aroma of banana and spicy clove esters you expect from a German wheat. Taste follows, clean and well done for the style.

Tried at Craft Beer Market YEG. Sierra Nevada tap takeover Nov 18. Nice aroma of spices and wheat. Flavour follows up. Nice well balanced flavour profile. Candied bananas, cloves, allspice, zest, grassiness, etc.

Bottled 06/15. So quite old. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Aroma is banana, clove, esters, mild sour note? Flavor is banana, clove, bubblegum, estery, maybe phenolic? I wanna say a little bit of pear. Solid for a heff.

Bottle. Cloudy golden body, head is lower than average for the style, does not stay for long. Aroma has banana and some crisp hops. Smooth wheaty taste with banana. Pretty clean and classic taste. However, its pretty expensive here (3,5 EUR) while all the classic German ones are way more affordable. There are even some discounter German Hefeweizens that cost less than 70 cents per 500 ml and taste surprisingly decent, so in terms of value it just doesnt compete with anything in these areas.

Botella. Color amarillo pálido y turbio. Bien de espuma pero se va rápido. Aroma claramente a plátano y un tanto especiado. En boca destaca el plátano pero también el clavo y los cítricos. Diria que encuentro hasta un toque picante. También tiene cierto recuerdo a las IPA. Bastante buena.

- N: yeast bun; faint ripe banana skin; faint seville orange.
- B: Butter-y, like a Leibnitz biscuit.
- F: Short finish  ginger-y finish (like Badger Beers Blandford Flyer)
Quite orange-y, ginger-y and butter-y for a Hefe  SN putting their hoppy touches on the style. Bit thin later.

Aroma is sweet grain, banana, straw, and clove. Taste is sweet and quite light. Finishes smoothly but not very complex, kind of disappointing. Appearance is a hazy gold with a fluffy pillow head that retains quite well.

Bottle. Cloudy dark yellow with small foamy white head, doughy aroma with a hint of honey, medium carbonation, citrus flavored faintly bitter taste, medium finish with very little citrus peel aftertaste. Nice but not spectacular.

Classic hefeweizen, thus boring flat like any other. Hazy yellow with no head, citric aroma, taste of oranges, bananas and sour malts. Good copycat of a Bavarian beer, without adding anything to the original.
A really good Bavarian style wheat ale. Plenty of malty yeasty flavors not bitter easy to drink, would recommend.

WYGLĄD: Barwa żółta, zmętniona. Piana wysoka, drobna, dość trwała. Oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywne. Mocno zbożowe, nuty ryżowe. W tle goździki. Banan bardzo schowany, ale jest wyczuwalny. 
SMAK: Analogiczne do aromatu: sporo zbóż i...to właściwie tyle. No może jeszcze lekka kwaskowatość.
OGÓLNIE: Nie będę ukrywał, że miałem spore nadziej co do tego piwa i trochę jestem zawiedziony.

Hazy clear golden body, quickly disapearing white head. Weird aroma, bread, citrus, ginger, other fruits and spices. Flavour of bread, ginger, earthy, fruity. Short crispy dry finish. Aftertaste of ginger and spices. I don't know of I like it or not.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home.
 Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized white head. 
 fruity aroma of spices, s and yeast. Fruity flavour of spices, yeast and bananas with notes of hops. Light watery.
Hefig herber, mild hopfiger Antrunk. Die Hefigkeit steigt etwas, frische runde Bitterkeit. Nettes süffiges Bier. 10/10/11/10//10
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI, USA via Kroger. Pale gold, slight haze. Zero head. Bright hops and yeast aroma. Quite carbonated, sharp with citrus and more yeast. Sweet ginger hop finish.

Pours a hazy to cloudy sunny golden with a decently tall eggshell head that settles down somewhat quickly, leaving some spotty soapy lace behind. Nose involves refreshing lemony citrus, a light dusting of sulphur, some banana and spice notes, and some husky grain. Somewhat sweet, lightly bitter, nearly tart. Medium bodied, fairly active, creamy, with a long drying yeasty doughy finish. Tasty and refreshing.

Not great. Bad aftertaste with spicy clove.   

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12fl.oz. bottle. Pours a cloudy, golden orange with a medium, short lived, off-white head that laces. Sweet aroma of ripe bananas, yeast, wheat and clove. Sweet fruity flavour of banana, citrus, wheat, yeast and clove with a slightly dry finish. Medium body with a smooth, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Not bad.

Visual: Pours cloudy luminescent yellow with a smallish dissipating head, thin hazy layer of retention, some lacing, lots of slow and steady micro streams.

Nose: fruity pineapple banana wheat malts. (lvl-4)-pungency

Attack: super crisp, minor palate-rough dry wheat malt

Mid-palate: (lvl-3)-soft sweetness, tangy, light pukey, (MAIN) pineapple, banana, wheat malts

Finish: dry bitter bite hops, clove & banana wheat malt dry finish.

Summary: Excellent drinkability along with fantastic crisp texture. A good all-around beer, although some may not like the dry finish.

Not very familiar with the style.Enjoyed this on the river bank while fishing. My friend had two of these left in his cooler and we enjoyed it during a break in the action. I poured mine into a 32oz Aquafina water bottle.Poured a nice yellow color, I would almost call it lemon. Nice and cloudy, little black specks in there. I cant honestly give you much detail on the head, after all, I poured it into a water bottle.Aroma was citrusy, a little banana, and spicy clove.Taste was much of the same, didnt really pick up much of the banana though. The clove and spices was the highlight. It had a chewy feel to it.Mouthfeel was light, although chewy. Goes down easy. Totally perfect for fishing!Overall, it was very good. I like wheat beers, and this one was a little different. My experience may not have been all that it could have been, because like I mentioned; I poured it into a water bottle.

Pours a hazy straw colour with diminutive head. Aroma correctly described by the brewer as banana and spices. Plays about lively on the tounge for a few seconds only before dissipating to leave a refreshing clean taste. Excellent stuff.
Pours cloudy dark straw yellow with a moderate white top. Aroma of banana, wheat and coriander. Taste is much the same, nice body and chewiness with a light floral hop character.
Bottle at home. Murky orange with no head. Nice sweet fruity aroma. Mild. Citrus notes.
A spicy aroma of clove and pepper, pours a hazy gold color with minimal head and light carbonation. Taste of clove and lemon with a medium body and a spicy finish.
Pretty solid hefe. Nice spicy nose, not too much banana in the mouth, and super crushable.

From bottles, pours a murky light orange, having rolled the bottles to distribute the yeast, with a couple of inches of white whipped cream foam. Aroma of cereal malts, light banana and a noticeable clove element tell me this is the right ballpark for weizen. Flavours of grain, a touch bready, and light lemony hops with the esters mixed in without dominating - clearly a well constructed brew. Medium mouthfeel, easy drinkability. Excellent example of a much abused style.
12 oz. bottle at Waynes World Bar and Grill. Poured golden hazy. Great aroma of orange, spices and wheat. Great full taste and finish. A very good Hefeweizen.
Pours hazy yellow with thin white head. Aroma is tart and fruity. Taste is very smooth and flavorful, a nice example of a domestic hefeweizen. Very nice example.

L:
-pours a cloudy golden with a very small,quickly dissipating,foamy,white head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-wheat,lemon,slightly spicy,slight banana,bready,cascade hops coming through
T:
-wheat,lemon zest,bready
-a little too hoppy for a Hefeweizen
-no german yeast character detectable
F:
-light body
-medium to high carbonation
O:
o.k wheat,but worlds below the top german examples (Franziskaner,Weihenstephan,Schneider etc)

Served on tap. Cloudy orange color with a white head. Medium body. Orange wheat flavor. Wheat citrus aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Golden with a light haze. Its fairly plain but tastes okay. Light hoppy finish.

Date: July 23, 2015... Glassware: Ayinger willibecker... Occasion: well pump replaced, and a tan replacement scheduled for tomorrow--time to drink... Appearance: golden yellow body is murky as a muddy river; ballooning, cratering off-white head leaves maze-like pattern of lacing .... Aroma: intense clove and banana, as expected; some fruity esters from the yeast make for an alluring, if not unique, hefeweizen ... Palate: lively, swirling, creamy body; bombards the tongue with activity, and suggestive of a surprising wheat complexity ... Taste: big, full bouquet of clove, banana, bubblegum, and secondary flavors of apple, pear, lemon grass and ginger--quite a stable of favors.... Overall: Sierra Nevada continues to impress with its portfolio of beers--they have top fermenters locked down, and now the wheat world is served notice that a refreshing, formidable, complex wheat is in the mix now....
Optisch leider nicht die Bombe, überhaupt kein Schaum. Geruch eindeutig Banane, genau meins, Trunk süffig, süß, wieder Banane, dann erst leich bitter. Das haben die gut hinbekommen - lecker Weizen.

I poured it from the bottle into a pint glass. It pours a cloudy orange color with a foamy head and lacing. The aroma is banana and clove. The taste is banana, spice, and biscuit. Its creamy and smooth. This is a good one.

Bottle at home. Pour is hazy lemon with a big white head and sticky lacing. Musty, bready, lots of banana, some spice, grass notes, and dough in the aroma. Taste is big banana, some bubblegum, white pepper, herbs and bread dough with a crisp finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Refreshing on this hot summer day.

Bottle.

A: Cloudy gold with a whispy white head.

N: Banana, clove, peppercorn, cracker, leaves, biscuit, some cayenne even.

T: Sweet and a little spicy.

M: Light body, creamy carbonation, no alcohol.

O: Decent stab at a German hefeweizen. I prefer Weihenstephaner.

A very average weissbier. There is absolutely nothing exceptional about this brew. The aroma is equal parts grain and spice. The pour is yellow and hazy with a thin white head. The taste is more spice and hop than malt. The finish is short and sharp. Ive had better expressions of the style.

Pours a hazy yellow with white head. Nose is bubblegum and yeast. Body is medium. Taste is light German Hefe. For those who find a German rendition on the heavy side as I occasionally do, this makes it. 12 oz variety pack

Tåkete melonfarget med lavt skum. Gjæret dominerer duften med klare toner av banan, honningmelon og krydder. Frukten følger i smaken og avsluttes med en lett bitterhet. Fyldig munnfølelse på et godt karbonert øl.

Bottled 4/7/15, drunk 7/3/15Heavily hazy, deep amber golden liquid is heavily carbonated and produces a massive white head that is well-retained.As with the kolsch and pilsner in this Summer 12 pack, I get more hops up front, with the actual style character in the background. This one has probably the most non-hop character of the three, with light clove and bubble gum and a very heavy mineral water-like character. Rather rustic, with baked bread, hay, some light plaster. Nice, if not exactly classic hefe territory. Anyways, no resin or alcohol, no flaws but it would be nice if there was more spiciness to it.The flavor is soft, with sticky honeyed malts that are fairly well-attenuated wrapping around very light white pepper and clove suggestions. Breadiness builds up but the watery texture and ample carbonation help clear the palate. Tons of bubblegum on the finish and a lingering spicy dryness that is pleasing, if somewhat too brief. Im drinking this right from the fridge without letting it warm and its borderline too sweet/malty, so Id hate to see it if it sat for like 10 minutes, though at the same time, it dosent really give the esters and phenols as much an opportunity to shine. Still, its clean and passable if actually a bit too clean. Were entering American wheat territory here....Also, the beer is oddly very, very watery, much moreso than even a 5% hefe should be.To be fair, Im rating this lower to-style here (a clean, but very, very light, watery, borderline bland, German hefe).  Feel free to add ~.5 to the score if youre scoring this at home as just a "Wheat beer".
Pours clear yellow with snow white head. Nose of banana and bread. Banana and herbs with other fruity notes. Sour and bitter yet a bit sweet; very refreshing.

Pours golden yellow with a whole lotta yeast. Aroma is fresh banana bread with considerable spice. Flavor is lighter than expected with the strong aromas, has kind of a sugar substitute sweetness that tastes kinda weird.

Very cloudy yellow, head and lacing wash away quickly. 
Slightly medicinal up front, then banana bread, bubble gum, faint cloves, bitterness comes through on the finish. 
Has the palate, aroma and sour-ness of a classic Kellerweis. 
Bottled on 4/28/15 
Consumed on 6/30/15 
$14.99/seasonal mix twelve pack at Publix Boca Raton Florida
Cloudy with plenty of carbonation. Light-medium body with strong banana flavor. Very pleasant taste, good hefe.
Highly impressed! Nice aroma. Banana bread in spades! Hazy yellow color, pure white head. This one will have a permanent spot in my rotation.
It pours straw color with a full bodied head that does leave lacing as it diminishes. Aromas of spices, bananas, and wheat,. Flavors of bananas, spices, and yeast. It is light and refreshing.

Aroma: banana, cloves
Appearance: hazy gold, white head
Taste; light sweetness, belgian yeast
Palate: medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Great
Best hefe I have had yet. Rich aroma of bananas, spice and vanilla. Banana clove taste, smooth mouthfeel.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 10A). Bottle 35.5 cl - batch 082014 C217:39. AROMA: wheat aroma with notes of bubblegum and some banana. APPEARANCE: dark gold color and hazy. thin white head with low retention. TASTE: faint bubblegum, banana and vanilla with a wheat background. low bitterness with a semi-sweet and wheaty finish. PALATE: medium-low body with below average carbonation. OVERALL: a not so bad german-style hefeweizen.

Pours a golden yellow color with no foam head, just a little white lacing. Aroma is cloves and banana. Flavor is slightly sweet wheat, clove, and banana. This is okay, but probably not something I would buy again.
Clove, banana, bubblegum, grass, lemon. Pours a cloudy golden color with a white head and good lacing. Flavor similar to the aroma with a slight tang and medium body.
Good yeasty wheat beer poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip. Aroma of a farm in spring. Tasty.
Goldig, trüb. Geruch nach Aprikose, leicht bananig. Im Geschmack auch Hefe. Recht nett, aber auch kein Überflieger.

Sehr extremer Hefegeruch: brotig, schwach nelkig. Geschmack ebenfalls sehr hefig mit Nelke, kaum Banane. Im Nachgeschmack leicht bitter, aber auch nicht ganz so vollmundig, wie man vom Geruch her denken würde.
12FL OZ ($15.99 12 pack) This was a pretty good hefe. pours pretty nice. carbonation could have been a tad higher but overall this was a pleasant experience.

BOD 314/14. Pours a cloudy light amber. Outstanding head volume and retention, normal lacing.

Light nose with a hint of clove and banana over biscuit with a light airy touch of citrus notes, possibly orange.

Medium body that is almost creamy. Perfect carbonation that starts with a nice effervescent burst in the middle and a prickly explosion in the finish that imparts a nice little snap.

The flavor profile is world class. Bold in intensity, very complex and balanced to perfection. It begins with a blend of flavors that separate into the finish. A light tart biscuit sweetness arrives first, then banana, bubblegum, lemon/orange, wheat and yeast. Underneath is a clove presence that continuously increases in intensity and dominates the finish. Clove lingers in the somewhat dry finish that is also a bit tart.

Pours a cloudy straw with a nice head of tightly packed white bubbles. I dont give fives for appearance very often but, for this style, its nearly perfect. Aroma is lean and fresh: hay, floral, basement aromas, and very light doses of clove, cooked vegetables, ginger, and cough drop. Taste is near balanced with just a slight nod to sour. Thin watery palate with a quick bitter burst finish. Surprised at how good this is!

12oz bottle. Pours cloudy pale straw color with little head. Hop aromas compete with the banana, clove, which are all mild. Flavors are laid back. A mix of Bavarian Hefe flavors with a touch of lemons and a slight tartness. Very refreshing, and a nice palate. Not quite up to the true German style, but I would buy more.

From bottle at home. Pours hazy pale gold, with a full white head. Aroma features notes of banana, and clove (becoming more pronounced as beer warms), with bubblegum and bread dough thrown in. More of the same on the palate with a dash of sour. Highly refreshing. Resolving to drink many of these this summer.
Golden hazy color, nice white head, aromas of banana, pineapple and cloves, flavour is banana and yeast.
Bottle: It poured a hazy golden orange with a white head. The aroma was wheat, orange and spices. while the flavor also has a hint of banana. The taste is slightly bitter but well balanced.
Banana, citrus, peach in taste. Not very sweet. Hazy yellow colour, medium head. Bit starchy? Very good hefe overall

Orange, white head, and mid retention. Banana, citrus, mild caramel, wheat, and spicy aroma. Medium bodied, sweet & spice notes, mainly fruity, with lemony notes on the backend. Great balance, nice dry notes, and mild hop bitter notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A style I really like, and this is different, but it works. Looks a bit like fruity dishwater; has the right cloudiness but no head at all. Body is light but not watery and well carbonated. Aroma is as it should be: banana, clove and pepper. Taste also has dough and a fruity mix of orange and pineapple.
Gulbrun klar med høyt hvitt skum. Fin tåkete lys brun etter bunnfallet tømmes i. Lukter hvete og noe sitron. Medium fylde. Smaker syrlig sitrus, banan, koreander og hvete. Tørr. Medium kullsyre.

Small bottle from the cooler at Bottle Jockey in Burnaby. A cloudy yellow beer with generous white head and fruity nose. Tastes mostly of fruit, rather sweet and with some sourness too. Low bitterness as expected. Yes, a very enjoyable beer, and not a bad Hefeweizen, but tastes a bit too much of pineapple for my idea of a perfect heffy. 3.4

Opaque light gold, almost milky - medium white head. Peppery cloves and some barnyard yeast on the nose, almost like a saison. Spicy, sour and sweet notes, some yeast, some light banana. Finishes refreshing, rich and a bit sour. Very nice.

Bottle: Dense, bright, hazy yellow body, opaque & topped with a creamy, frothy white head that lasts for days. Aroma full of wheat, baked bread, clumpy yeast, clove, a hint of banana esters, faint pear, straw, maybe even a touch of mint. Flavor follows through exactly with amplified notes of clove, biscuits, banana bread, bubble gum, mint, grass, mild pear skin. Nice finish of clove, bread, a soft blanket of wheat, & a chunky yeast finish. Good body, just on the edge of chewy but still remaining very drinkable. Ive always enjoyed this beer, really good take on a German hefe.

Pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Aroma of classic german sweet esters which brings you subtle banana notes, sweet orange, weak bubblegum, some floral notes and weak hoppy notes. The taste is also rather sweet and refreshing with a more hoppy profile along with those sweet esters, some citrus, banana and orange. Very refreshing and a nice take on the style!
12 oz bottle to tulip. Pours cloudy blonde. Aroma of banana, light clove, orange and mango. Taste is juicy fruit, tropical, sweet malts and a little floral hop bitterness.

Reading some reviews you might think this tastes like a German hefe. It doesnt. At least this bottle didnt. The haziest beer Ive seen due to suspended particulate matter. The blonde color is spot on. The aromas and flavors barely hint at the clove and banana elements characteristic of actual hefe. Not a bad beer but very disappointing when measured against what I was expecting. This is no Ayinger Ur-Weisse. I would not buy this again.

Hefeweizen one of my least favorite styles yet I can appreciate the quality brew that this is. Bit of weizenbock characteristics in this but in a more approachable form. Well done.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 oz bottle.

Aroma is grainy and sweet. Wonderful Hefeweizen taste with hints of banana , clove, and vanilla. Just a slight hint of sourness on the backend. Bitterness was perfect, well balanced just like a traditional Hefeweizen should be.
Bottle. Cloudy-yellow color with good and noisy foam. Aroma: cloves, wheat and fruits with soap. Taste: banana, juicy, clove, lively carbonation, tasty weizen.

This 12oz bottle was bottled on 30th December 2014 and poured into a Duvel tulip glass. The beer poured a very hazy straw gold colour with two finger white head that dissipated quickly leaving behind thin but nice lacing. There were earthy wheaty aromas with orange, banana and cloves poking through. Taste was mainly of ripe banana and bready wheaty malts with hints of citrus and a touch of hoppiness at the end. It was light bodied with medium carbonation and a dry finish. Overall this isnt the best hefe that Ive tried, but its certainly up there and a good example of one. Its very easy to drink and I would definitely consider this during the hot summers.
From bottle in weizen. Cloudy and golden with beautiful head. Hints of clove and spice on the nose and palate. Quite a smooth hefe...one of the best Ive had.

Hazy yellow beer, small white head. Yeasty nose with sweetness, banana and clove. Flavor is wheaty, yeasty, fruity notes with banana dominating. Speaking of dominating, the sweetness. Finishes dry with wheat and banana. Too sweet for me.
As far as hefes go, this one is near the top of my list. Typical hef aromas, bread, banana, yeast on the nose. Caries over to the taste with a good dose of malt character, biscuit, etc.

Bottle. Pours a golden color with a small head. Aroma of herbs, citrus and yeast. taste of herbs, yeast, bit of banana, light sweetness with a bit of spice. Easy bitterness with a bit of tart in the finish. Moderate body, crisp and refreshing with a nice tart feel. Enjoyable beer.
Cloudy golden with thin white head. Aroma of clove with a hint of banana. Yeasty flavor, still a hint of banana, refreshing. Pretty good.

12 ounce bottle. Hazy orange gold color sports a moderate Rocky white head. Rich yeasty wheat malt nose. Zesty wheat malt flavor redolent of lemon and cloves. Salty and peppery spice in mid taste. Tart and refreshing. Long yeasty lemon peel finish.
Flaska från @majsvalling, tack! Grumlig gul vätska med stort vitt skum som lägger sig snabbare än man öppnar RateBeer. Doftar skumbanan och svagt jästigt. Mild Hefeweizen, trevlig.
On draft. Cloudy yellow color with one finger white head. Banana, clove and yeast aroma and on the taste. My favorite American version of the style so far.

Cloudy yellow color with little foam. The smell resembles of a Belgian witbeer with lots of yeast. The taste is a little salty sourness with fruity notes. A nice mixture of wheat- and witbeer, but nothing really sensational. A solid great beer, not much more.

Hazy orange color with white head that goes down quickly. Smell of citrus, spices. Nice spiciness and a hint of sourness. Carbonation and texture is silky. A Weizen-based beer this is definitely, but more on the citrus side. Unusual for a Hefeweizen. Not a bad beer though.
330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet. Tiny tan head. Hazy pale orange body. Aroma is apricot, cloves and banana. Sour and slightly sour on the tongue.
Tap @ Sierra NC. Hazy orangey gold with thick head. Smells citrusy and spicy. Tastes dry and floral with a hint of spice. Heavy feeling.
En Kellerweise en härlig vårkollektion är svårslagen, dricker den i trädgården medan jag väntar på att grillen ska få den rätta glöden.
Not quite clear gold with a fizzy head that fades away to nothing. Sweet wheat aroma with a bit of banana. Taste is similar but weaker with yeast and citrus.

Hazy golden color with big off-white head. Lots of carbonation. Aroma is yeasty, witty and bready, with banana and a little hint of spices. Taste follows the aroma, with banana, bread and a little bit of clove as well. Sweet finish. Good reproduction of the style, but there are a lot better Hefeweizens on the market.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with a frothy head. Cloves, candy bananas, herbal notes, yeast, grains, cookie crumbles and some light vanilla.

Draft pour at special brews. Poured appropriately into its own individual glassware. Always a good start. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a huge foamy head. Kind of an odd wet dog like aroma. Wish I was kidding. Well, its different. Ill put it that way. Flavor is dry, mild, and mostly empty. The most flavor comes in centuries into the late palate (exaggeration). Soft grains, and mild fruit. Weird beer for me, but what do I know. Not so much for me.

It's good not great. A nice hefe. I'd drink it again but not a style I usually seek out

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Doesnt smell like a hefeweizen, i get spice and fruit.
Appearance- A slightly murky golden color with a small white head. Doesnt look like a hefeweizen.
Taste- Has a nice semi-tart flavor but doesnt even come close to a hefeweizen stle beer in the flavor department.
Palate- A medium bodied beer with moderate carbonation and a dry finish.
Overall- Not a bad beer but it is not in the flavor category of a hefeweizen.

Bottle. Nose is cloves, banana, orange, barley (odd), slight wheat. Taste is malt, banana, slight clove, wheat, the strange orange note, leading to a surprisingly bitter note, and a dry yeasty spiced finish. Mouthfeel is too carbonated.

This didnt have the right taste profile for a hefeweizen (though its a style in which I am only a dabbler in), and was a bit bland.

12 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at 40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a hazy straw gold, with a thick white head with decent retention.

Smell: Floral and citrus, which is not at all what one wants to smell from a hefeweizen.

Taste: And as the smell indicates, my Wall O Hop sensitivity strikes. This tastes like compost pile runoff, no other flavors perceptible.

Mouthfeel: Light and effervescent.

Overall: This is in keeping with every Sierra Nevada experience I have had, with the exceptions of Narwhal and Tumbler. Please discontinue this. It is emphatically not an actual hefeweizen.

Bottle. Pours a hazy pale golden with a white top. Nice aroma of wheat, banana-esters, dough and pale malts. Taste is lightly sweet at first but with a very well balanced finish. Light pungent notes from the wheat and a very subtle bitterness. Fairly light bodied and drinkable. A fine hefeweizen on the lower abv-scale.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy gold with white head. Aroma is grass, grains, yeast, herbally and floral with some sweet fruity notes. Taste is moderately sweet with flavors or banana, bubblegum, yeast, wheat, floral. Pretty good hefeweizen but not quite as good as some of the best german hefeweizens. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Irregular, just off-white head over lively carbonated unclear yellow to orange-golden beer. Clove, allspice, Jamaican pepper, other spices; some faint banana and citrus. Dry-spicy (nutmeg too?), light bitterish onset but then converting to light acidic wheat and fruitesters, fusels. Very carbonated; light to medium bodied, faint wheatslickness, refreshing. Nothing but very classical Hefeweizen - maybe a bit lighter MF.

Bottle. Pours in hazy yellow body with low to no foam. Aroma is fruity, yeasty, malty. Taste has yeasty sweetness, wheaty, medium fruity bitterness. Very refreshing. Body is full, high carbonation. Nice.

Bue en bouteille de 35.5cl, couleur blanche-blonde trouble, mousse épaisse et bonne effervescence, une bière avec les goût de malabar et de banane continuité sur le pain blanc et fin de bouche sur une pointe dacidité.

3 finger fluffy white head. Nice lacing and pale gold color. Aroma is clove, banana, yeast and pepper notes. Light to medium body that is silky smooth w/ moderate carbonation. Very tasty flavors of banana, clove and general sweetness from the wheat. Also getting a slight bit of belgian yeast/funk flavor. Detecting other flavors in there but it is complex and difficult to discern. But very pleasing in general. You get a slight peppery spice toward the end and the beer finishes somewhat dry. Excellent session beer at only 4.8%!! My new go to hefeweizen!!
Bue en bouteille de 355ml. Bière plutôt bien faite mais rien d'exceptionnel non plus. Les allemands font bien mieux. Correcte mais sans plus.

Bottle @ Koht, Tallinn.
Another checkmark for 1001 beers book :). Well balanced, light floral-citrus aroma. Good.

355ml bottle into weizen glass. Subtle wheat/hop nose. Pours a translucent honey/caramel colour with the typical towering white head. Quite watery and lightly bitter. Finish has distant banana and hop notes. Refreshing but not involving.

Aroma of yeast (makes me think of raw bread dough), citrus, and clove with faint banana. Taste follows the nose. Citrus, clove, and grain. Respectable American production of a German classic at a really good price.
Dorado turbio con espuma blanca poco persistente. Aromas de intensidad media de plátano, clavo. Cuerpo ligero, inicio dulce de banana y final débilmente secos. Fresca y muy bebible.
350ml bottle in Singapore poured cloudy pale yellow the aroma is light wheat subtle banana & fruity tastes of fruit mild spice bit of wheat sweetish carbonated ok

Bottle from cellarbrations super store hami hill. Pours yellow/orange with a thin white head. Body is light with low to moderate carbonation. Aroma is cloves and banana with slight cinnamon. Taste is fairly similar but quite laid back for a hefeweizen. Quite easy drinking. Not bad

Pours a beautiful, hazy yellow, gold with a thin, white head and great lacing. Aroma of ripened bananas, buttered biscuits, lemon & tangerines. Flavour was of flowers with notes of banana, clove, yeast, nuts, grass hay, honey, some light caramel notes. Overall decent, drinkable beer.
user_location: The Crystal Coast, North Carolina, USA

text:
Bottle - big foamy head, hazy dark straw color, definite typical hefe banana and clove aroma and flavor, with a mildly sweet wheat backbone, very good traditional hefe

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Craft Beer Rising (London, 19 February 2015)

Pours cloudy yellow with a thin head of clean white foam. 

The nose shows mostly bubble gum and banana. 

The palate also shows similar flavors. Lightly carbonation with a full body. Just a simple standard hefeweizen.
Pours hazy gold with a small White head. Smells of banana clove aroma is crisp and brief. Taste is slightly sweet and slightly tart with no real bitterness. Classic hefeweizen fruit and spice

Sampled at tasting. Pours hazy gold with medium head. Aroma very faint of bread and yeast. Taste is mild and with a clear bitterness. This was only a sample but didnt live up to my expectations. Might renew this anfter having had a full glass.

Láhev 355 ml. Aroma je sladové s jemným nádechem banánů a kvasnic. Pěna je jasně bílá, jemná, nízká a nedrící. barva samotného piva je lutá a kalná. Chuť je zakulaceně sladová s jemným méně výrazným nádechem ovoce, fini je středně, kořeně hořký a drící, má lehký, nepříli chutný ocas. V ústech pivo působí plně, má střední říz a je hůře pitelné. Vskutku od tohoto piva jsem čekal daleko víc, bylo to vcelku zklamání, chuť mi nepřijde tak komplexní a hluboká jak se propaguje v popisu a najdou se i lepí kousky, ale na druhou stranu to není ani nejhorí.
hazy yellow colour, medium sized white head; aroma of wheat, some citrusy and banana notes; taste of citruses, and bread;intensive carbonation; OK weizen

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a weizen glass in late 2013.

A: Strangely, almost no head. Lots of cloudy yeast.

S: Citrus, cloves.

T: Follows nose. Slight bitter aftertaste that quickly fades.

M: Smooth.

O: This is a great hef. Its very close to the German hefs, but it does have a slight hoppy edge to it. I enjoyed it.
UPDATED: DEC 3, 2015 How: Bottle Appearance: Hazy orange, medium white head. Aroma: Banana, orange, floral. Palate: medium body, average carbonation

330ml bottle. Cloudy orange color. Small size, white head, stays. Sweet, banana, herbal notes in aroma. Sweet, banana, fruity, grassy, bit of hay in taste. Soft carbonation. Mild bitterness. Lacks of depth, but drinkable.
Poured a hazy, milky light yellow/amber with a frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, bananas and cloves. Light body, flavour as the aroma, well balanced and a good example of the style.
For a hefewizen this was good, but not my style in general. Refreshing and would be good on a hot day.

Pours a beautiful hazy orangish gold with a frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, cloves, bananas in a delicate balance with a hint of sourness in the background. Taste is spicy wheat, cloves phenols and banana esthers, light bubblegum and a complex sourness from the wheat. Excellent American hefeweizen!

pours a murky gold with a decent white whispy lacing head. Aroma is slight hay and good skunk. Tastes bright, full, with a hint of clove or coriander. The spice is still present in the pleasant lingering finish. I really like this beer.

Great yeast aroma. Creamy banana dominates with some clove, but overall not a bitey yeast. Full body. Refreshing light citrus. Raw grain. Nicely balanced, calm and well executed. Drinkable and approachable.

Lustrous golden yellow. Quickly dissipating head. Wonderful scents of banana, yeast, marshmallows, and mild citrus. Slightly lighter and more refreshing than a stereotypical hefe. Incredible flavour. Banana dominates, but a smooth combination of yeast, cream, and citrus is present as well. Mildly hoppy finish. Wonderfully flavourful easy drinking hefe.
On tap. Ours a cloudy gold/Amber with moderate foamy head. Aromas of dusty malts, bananas and toast. Flavors are similar with creamy banana and earthy wheat. Full.

Lively, hazy yellow beer with a frothy head with a floral banana smell to it. Flavour has a heavy dose of banana in there too. Sweet and bitter is well-balanced. Its not anything you wouldnt expect from the style but its mellow, very drinkable and very well done.

Bottle. Aroma distinctive weizeny clove, spiciness, lemony. Hazy yellow colour. Taste is also rather at the spicy-clove-lemony side, a bit drier and thinner than some other weizens, with a very light soury-spicy twist in flavour. Really good.

From 0,355l bottle, BBD: 17/02/15 Pours deep hazy straw to golden liquid, medium white frothy head, fell down quickly, Aroma: banana, floral, wheat, lemon, Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, light to medium sour, wheat, banana, sweet notes, clove, lemon, Palate: light to medium body, slick texture, soft carbonation, long sweet fruity finish, Overall: very surprising interpretation of the original german hefeweizen style, lighter body, lower carbonation, after banana dominates other fruity and floral notes typique for west coast craft breweries, very drinkable piece. Pity of the absent head - fell down quickly and perhaps even more floral notes in the taste.
From a bottle. Mild floral aroma, pours slightly cloudy, minimal head, not my favourite style but OK.
On tap at Royal Oak Beer Fest. Beautiful cloudy blonde. Creamy mouthfeel. Well balanced notes of wheat and yeasty banana.
Pretty much spot on hefeweizen. Toasted wheat, toasted malt, banana, clove, yeast and spice. Pours a hazy dark yellow. Medium mouth, a bit svelt.
Kellerweis is a wonderful beer. I found it to be very complex and has a nice golden appearance. It is interesting because it is a bit cloudy.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 12 oz. bottle from BevMo. Nose of yeast subtle spices and hay. Gentle Belgian spice overtone (citrus, coriander and cloves) is almost understated against a bready wheat malt base for a light and very creamy hefe. All the way to the dry finish its never over the top. Exceptionally smooth, balanced, tasty and drinkable.

(bottle) murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of vanilla and banoffee pie, hay, wheat, some yeast and light bubble gum. flavour is mostly fermented peaches and caramel, slightly earthy, with a medium sweetness, more hay, wheat and some light banana in the finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.
Draft at Ale House. Pours murky yellow brown with a white head. Aroma is banana, wheat, mild clove. Flavor follows. a bit sweet, not quite enough clove to balance.

Draft at Gravity - pours a vibrant yellow with bright white head . Typical clove and banana aromas . Light body but not lacking in flavor . Nice representation of the style . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0,33L bottle. Pours hyazy orange with off-white head. The head stays for some time. Aroma is intense sweetness, fruits, banana, and citrus. Flavor is very sweet, wheat, fruits, citrus, banana. Overall: very good weizen, maybe a tad bit too sweet.
350ml bottle. Pours hazy orange / gold with a modest off-white head. Aromas of almonds and oranges. Balanced, medium bitterness and modest carbonation.
Aromas are sweet a little citrus, color is blond and cloudy, Sweet flavor, wheat is obvious, overall ok

Bottle. Pours orange golden with some haziness, small head for a Hefeweizen. Banana, wheat, hay cloves, pepper, aomonds and oranges. Some restrained notes of caramel and vanilla. Medium bodied. Dry and orange-fruity finish with balanced bitterness.

Cloudy (almost opaque when first poured) bright straw-colour with diminishing head and no legs. Smells quite fresh - lots of orange, banana, light phenols (clove, spice, yeast), wheat, bready malt, bubblegum/potpourri. Aroma is more sweet and less spicy than typical hefes. Taste is similarly sweet, spicy, wheat/pale malts. Body is light and very creamy. Fizzy. Very drinkable, quite sweet. I like that the palate is velvety smooth rather than aggressively frothy/spicy.

Aroma: wheat, grain, some light banana. Appearance: dark, hazy yellow, massive, frothy, white head. Taste: light sweet and butter. Palate: malty sweets continue, wheat, grain Overall: very nice Hefeweizen, well-balanced. Pint at Yard House - The Link, Las Vegas.

Julie says it taste like sweaty but not yeasty Andy balls slightly sweat a little gritty she give a 1 and it was warm

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Hazy, dark golden body, with a massive, frothy, slightly yellow head.
Typical Hefeweizen aroma of banana, orange, some citrus, clove and other spices, grains.
Taste is smooth, with about the same aromas and also vanilla and some more hop notes.
Mouthfeel is medium to light, slick, with a low carbonation and it finishes spicy, slightly bitter and fruity.

Very good! Pretty much how I like a Hefeweizen, easy to drink, but fully aromatic, smooth and with the yeast, malts and hops in a well balance. Could easily be from Bavaria if you didnt know it.

12 oz. bottle from Cash Wise in Williston. Appearance: finger og white head, golden color, cloudy, head does lasts only as a film. Aroma: banana, light sweet cereal, slight orange hops, light clove. Palate: light body, average carbonation, light to moderate light bitter finish, refreshing and slightly oily texture. Taste: light sweet cereal, into sweet orange and banana, and then into light spicy bitter hops finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 Bottle. This is a ridiculously high score from me for this style of beer- usually would not even finish. Decided to be a bit more open minded and am finding it both interesting and enjoyable if a bit sweet for my palate. Pours cloudy yellow with a hint of orange. Quickly fading white head- no lacing. Definite banana and variety of spices reminiscent of Belgians- clove, pepper and coriander. Nice citrus notes and wheat give it balance. Definitely on the sweet side and somewhat yeasty,  but sour notes in there as well. Nice and smooth on the palate with a satisfying and almost silky mouthfeel. Spicy notes from the Perle hops.  Lots going on here- feel like I need to have another to fully explore flavor profile. As always with Sierra Nevada- solid, eminently drinkable and complex enough to keep me from being bored.  50% wheat. 50% barley.

im luke warm on Sierra Nevada beers, and wheat beers in general, so i was not expecting greatness here, but it was actually a pleasant surprise. the brewers description has it down...lots of banana & clove and a little bit o hops in the finish. Better than average for the style even. 1/10-very nice on tap as well."
Enjoy it! Big and thick foam with a golden color. Good balance of spice and sour. Maybe a bit of banana or cereal.

Aroma: Medium-high clove, Medium banana. No, wheat or hops. Light citrus 
Appearance: Body: Hazy straw. Head: Large, white, fizzy. fair retention.
Flavour: Medium clove, medium banana. Well balanced. Crisp, slight tart. Dry finish with citrus aftertastes. No hops flavours, No malt flavours
Mouthfeel: Light body. High carbonation.
Overall: Light esters initially, later (with warming) releasing more. Expected more malt in aroma and flavour.

355 ml bottle, poured. Thanks Andre!
15A. Weizen/Weissbier
Cloudy, light orange. Big, frothy ehite head. Classic estery hefe-aroma. Light, refreshing mouthfeel. Flavour has banana and citrus with a nicely bitter kick at the end.
Cloudy orange color, fast fading white head, aromas of spices (pepper) and citrus, average-to-low carbonation, short finish, a little astringent, very light bitterness, slightly sweet, refreshing

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a white head. Wheat, banana, clove, and bubblegum aroma. Wheat,banana, clove, bubblegum and lemon flavors. Light body and average carbonation. Clove and wheat finish. Solid.

Lastin foamy white head atop a cloudy Amber brown body. Nose is sweet, tonic and wheats. Nice mellow mouthfeel, more German malt presence - as I would have expected an American Wheat. I suppose the Kellerweis should have been a giveaway. Somewhat light on the bubblegum - but it's a smooth and easy drinking Hefeweizen. Sampled at the Moon Under Water.
(Bottle). Aroma of sweet malt, wheat and yeast. Taste of wheat, malt, yeast and citrus. Dominant carbonation. Sweet and a sticky aftertaste. To sticky sweet!
Flaska på hamnmästaren - väldigt ljus och doftar av skumbanan och smakar väldigt mycket skumbanan. Len i känslan

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Nice cloudy appearance. Aroma if clove, banana. A touch of vinegar too. Tasty, pretty ripe banana dominated taste with a touch more bitterness than your usual hefe. Slightly sour. Good mouthfeel though, still good. Decent.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours cloudy gold with a white head. Taste banana, sweet, wheat. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

The appearance fuses an opaque golden color with a large, pillowy white head that fades fast. The aroma blends wheat, banana, and a hint of green apples, and the taste is slightly sour and slightly sweet with a heavy wheat flavor being present. The thick texture, medium body, and soft carbonation arent anything special or wild, but they do help support the flavor that comes through. The finish has a slightly grainy flavor, but it does fade into a nice sweet thickness on the tongue over some time.
UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 A cloudy orange appearance on the pour with a good, foamy head. A beautiful orange and banana flavour with a malty finish. I could easily drink quite a few of these.

Pours pale yellow with medium white head. Aroma of bread, citrus, banana, very plain. Taste is more of the same, with excessively high carbonation. Even the cheapest Hefeweizen in Germany has more flavor than this.

This must be an acquired taste by Americans for a fizzy, candy Weis beer. It doesnt compare with anything traditional in the Bavarian Weizen family. Sierra Nevada has done a good job in marketing to the taste of the coeds in Chico. And this one is an American invention.
Jaune brumeux avec un tête moyen qui rétréci assez vite pour le style. Larôme des clous de girofle, agrumes et levure. Le goût est similar. Très bon mais pas un hefe de première qualité.

2014/08/29 - Pours a hazy yellow/orange colour with foamy white head that quickly reduces to a lingering surface film. No lacing. Aroma is wheat, yeast, dough, bubblegum, bananas, citrus and spice. Taste is wheat, yeast, banana, orange & lemon citrus, clove, coriander and white pepper. Mouthfeel is medium and silky, with lively carbonation and a slightly spicy, mildly drying finish. Pretty good, but nothing exceptional. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy amber with quite a large amount of head. Not a huge aroma, suited to the hefeweizen style though. Very smooth on the palate, with lemon hit lolling down to a fruity aftertaste. A well balanced beer.

Solid beer. Complex.          

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Golden, opaque, medium/large foamy white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, citrus, floral hops. Taste sweet with a really well balanced, light sour and light bitter finish. Smooth, thick oily texture, low/medium carbonation. Really nice hefeweizen. Great beer.
Light overall taste. Nice golden color with little head when poured. Nice banana notes on the finishing end, but doesnt linger too much on the palate.

Pours a glowing, slightly hazy orange-amber body. A foamy, one finger wide head slowly collapses to a fine lacing.

Has a satisfying nose, full of yeast, hay, clove, cinnamon and hints of lactic acid, enjoyable balance between soft and spicy elements.

Dough, white-bread yeast up front, soon joined by a flavorful spiciness of cloves and orange peel. The spices add to the smooth yeast impression as does the tingling carbonation. The wheat profile gets pleasantly subdued by a floral hop bite, which defines the finish by a slick slighty bitterness.

0.355l bottle. This is a cloudy good looking weiz. A bug fluffy head located on the top - bright white in color and the beer has the correct orangey look as well. Lots of wheat sweetness on the nose blended with the sweet ripe banana, eastery yeastery, orange zest and traces of cloves and white pepper. Just like it should smell! Easy light wheat flavors. Its not thin or watery in the mouth and the bubbles ate sharp but about average. Lightdrinkable and quite refreshing to drink. The wheat sweetness shines through and it is again quite banana infused in the taste. Slightly peppery tail. Yeah, a really good non complicated heffe weiz. 17.05.2014
Draft. Cloudy yellow color, small white head. Aroma of hay. Taste is lemon drops, more sweet than sour.

Bottle at Cafe Nero, august 4th 2014. Cloudy yellow body with a big white head. Aroma of bubble gum, banana, wheat, grass. Taste of citrus, banana, bubblegum and a light spicy finish with a mild wheat and yeast aftertaste. A proper hefeweizen.
Draft - Wheat, banana and some orange. Hazy yellow with a decent white head. Creamy banana and orange with a bubbly light body.

Beautiful, cloudy, apricot hued pour with sticky resilient foam. Browned banana, zesty clove, distant mint and some mace; enormously herb forward with the ever balancing banana creaminess and doughy yeast for its pillowy center. Golden delicious apples offer a substantial sweetness and light acidity.

White dough and prickly light spice in the flavor with mild fruitiness bringing to mind Bartlett pears and pineapple, though the gentle banana notes are always the clearest. The wet dough sensation generally overwhelms the brisk spiciness.

This is amplified throughout the mushy, yeasty body. Zippy carbonation flashes briefly to be thoroughly softened before the finish. Lingering banana sweetness with the tiniest hint of goat milk. Generally flavorful example held back somewhat by textural issues and a boring yeast component.

Light orange cloudy body with big creamy head. Long lacing. Aromas orange, citrus, honey, hay. Palate tart fruity wheat yeasty. Carbonation is soft smooth and mouthful. Aftertaste is fruity little cereal, and yeasty. Overall average Weissbier. Nothing special here but drinkable.
Bottled 350ml. Average hazy golden look to it. Fresh smell of yeast and ripe bananas. Soft but full of flavour. Nice and friendly aftertaste.

Yummy! The banana notes when poured are delicious. Good wheat taste but not ever bearing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Flaske fra vinmonopolet Mortensrud. Uklar, gulaktig farge. Hvit skumtopp. Moderat karbonert. Smaker hvete,banan,nellik, frukt og gjær. Velbalansert
Dunkel lys gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av banan, gjær, frukt og krydder. Smak av banan, gjær, frukt og krydder. Fruktig. VP Kvadrat.
Duft av hvete, høy og en anelse sitron. Dunkel gulbrun farge. Tynn hinne skum, noe heng langs kant. God smak av hvete og appelsin med en liten syrlig ettersmak.

This is an excellent hefeweizen. Sierra Nevada does a great job with this one. Nice and sweet, well balanced. Sweet bready taste, like almost banana bread. Great stuff overall and super easy to drink.

12 oz bottle poured into a hefe glass. Big banana and clove notes greet the nose along with a touch of dampness / bread dough, and wheat. I also pick up, distinctly, "Nila wafers" - basically a combination of the banana, with some biscuit, and vanilla. Theres also a light floral touch and some pine in the aroma. A big, hefe spongy creamy white head tops the opaque hazy gold yellow body. The head retains quite well and leaves a messy, poofy lace. I would say this is a pretty shining example of what a hefe should look like. The taste is a medium sweet and medium light bitter with just a touch of sour. The body is somewhere between medium and light, maybe more on the light side and has a thin, watery texture. Theres a surprisingly low amount of soft carbonation - or maybe its just so soft that I cant feel it - nonetheless, its very smooth. Theres a big banana and clove finish which starts to turn more towards clove and vanilla in the aftertaste with a touch of pine and tropical fruit.

355mL bottle. Pours clear pale gold with a small white head. Wheaty some with some esters and yeast. Mild sweetness, little bitterness and a bit of acidity. Light body but fullish mouthfeel, average carbonation and a short finish.
Bottle 35cl @ Kultainen Apina. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Banana, bubblegum , spices in the aroma. Wheat, citrus, banana, spices in the flavor.

Bottle.

A- Wheat, citrus, banana, spices.

A- Yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Wheat, banana, citrus, spices, yeasty. 

P- Light body, average texture, average carbonation, smooth finish.

O- A good Hefeweizen that has a deep enough complexity that no one thing stands out above the rest. Balanced well and would be easy to session.

Cloudy medium yellow body with a very large, creamy, white head that stays thick and laces the glass well. Dry, very spicy, yeasty, fruity and rather strong aroma with lots of delicious banana. Strong flavour that is initially dominated by coriander and a generic spicy feel mixed with honey, then yeasty banana, citrus and other fruits. Not much sweetness or bitterness, but quite dry and with some acidity. Unusually citric, refreshing and crisp mouthfeel, its light on the palate and lively carbonated. The perfect summer wheat beer! 
[35.5 cl bottle, from Vinmonopolet Online]
Bottle. Sour, awful beer. Searched hard to find something appealing, but to no avail. A style not for me.
It has sweet and fresh aroma of green grapes and light malt . The appearance is bright and cloudy with minimal head. The taste is pleasant and lightly balanced with a fine fizzy carbonation.

Notes from Family Hefe Tasting. Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head. Aroma has spices and pickles. Taste was led by pickles or vinegar or some other tangy spice. Some vegetalness as well. 11.2 This was the highest finishing American Hefe in the tasting; but only finished midpack overall.

Appearance is cloudy deep yellow/light golden with a frothy thick white foam cap. Aroma is typical spicy clove, banana, and bubblegum. Taste is bready malt with spicy clove that stands out, but also has a slight metallic taste. Banana character is there, but stands down to the clove. Mouthfeel is medium for the style with moderate carbonation. Not as creamy as most examples. Finishes extremely dry on the tongue with lingering clove spice. Overall good, but lacks the creamy body of its German counterparts and seems to have a slight metallic taste
Bottle. Pours hazy golden brown with nice white head. Nose is wheat malt, grass and honey. Taste is dry. Decent hefeweizen.
Tiheä vaahto, samea, vaaleankeltainen väri. Paljon banaania tuoksussa ja maussa. Suutuntuma jää jälkeen saksalaisverrokeista.

Pours a cloudy golden orange with big just-off-white foam head that retains well. Banana aroma and some malts and faint citrus. Taste balanced sweetness and bitter. Vibrant carbonation. Finish slightly sweet.
Draft. Pours a hazy golden orange color. Aroma is banana and wheat. Taste is sweet, creamy, and follows the aroma.

Gostosa, um pouco de gosto residual, mas ainda sim bem refrescante. Leve e clara.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft. Looks to style. Feels great. Nice smooth creamy feel. Everything one would expect of a great hefe. One of the better/best American made hefeweizens for sure. I would have no problem downing a boot.

Leuchtend goldgelb im Glas, fester weißer Schaum. Nicht ganz so fruchtig in der Nase wie die deutschen Versionen, irgendwie aber auch schon. Aber sehr gut trinkbar, muss den Vergleich mit den bayrischen Bieren nicht scheuen

Surely one of the better American version of the style. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice big foam head that has good head retention.
Malts and yeast help to bring out a nice banana scent. Lemon zest can you get too.
Flavor is sprite with banana and clove taste. Tart. Flows easy over the tongue smooth.
A good refreshing version of a German classic.
Drink well my friends

Bottle pour courtesy of Jaclyn. Matte straw color with fluffy white head. Webbing. Well done. Full nose of cereal grains, light banana and clove. Runs sweet on taste, with heavy bubblegum. Pale malts and dough. Limited banana and apple.Creamy mouthfeel. Good play at style, but not at the same level as continental offerings.

The body is very cloudy with a pale yellow/tan color. Its head is like any good Hefeweizen, it is tall, thick and fairly long lasting. This makes for good lacing on the glass. In the nose I pick up lots of bready and phonic yeast character with notes of banana and spicy clove. On the tongue there are loads of bready yeast notes with hints of mashed up banana, clove and tangy wheat or sour dough bread. I am also getting very slight notes of pineapple or some other tropical fruit. The body has a solid medium feel with a firm smooth texture and mild carbonation.
Bottle bier huis ossett. Really hazy yellow halo white head. Aroma is banana yeast clove. Taste is same slight spice wheat some creaminess. Medium body. Good stuff.
Bottle from Glug Newcastle. Pours a deep golden/orange hue. Nice thin but lasting head. Delicate, subtle flavours of banana, citrus, cloves and wheat. A fantastic Sierra Nevada brew

Pours with a solid white head. Color is a hazy yellow. Aroma hits your nose with banana and a slit spice. Yeast is traditional Belgium and a bit of funk from the open fermentation. Nice smith summer drink.

Shared a 35,5cl bottle. Pours a cloudy pale yellow colour with a thin white head. Aroma is banana, clove, wheat and lightly yeast. Average carbonation and medium to light body. Taste is well balanced light sweet and light bitter. Overall, a very good refreshing beer.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Storo enjoyed at home
Orange hazy, big white head. Smell of bubble gum, banana, clove, wheat and light malts. Moderate sweet, fruity, alot of yeast flavors; more bubble gum, hints of citrus and spices. Ends with a moderate bitter finish. Quite descent take on a traditional Hefeweizen
Bottle, Non solo bar, Stockholm. OK, but too pronounced fruity features in the aroma for a Hefeweizen to my taste.

Flaska från bier-deluxe. Gyllenfärgad, grumlig, högt vitt skum. Stor friskt syrlig jästig vetedoft med lite nejlika. Fin frisk mustig smak, mjuk, krämig munkänsla. Smak av vete, curacao, nejlika, jäst, fruktkola, mynta. Fin komplex smakbild, aningen större beska än en hefe och lite åt wit-hållet i smakbilden.

Bottle. Hazy cloudy yellow with a thin white head. They nailed the style on this one. Banana with a hint of clove spice, medium carb, and easy on the palate. Smooth sweet finish. Paired perfectly with sliders on the grill on a hot summer afternoon. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle thanks to ruigo. Thanks for this beast! Appearance is dark gold, high cloudy. Thin white head. Body is medium and light crispy. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Some nice tartness. Aroma is banana, clove, wheat.

Hazy yellow pour with large white head. Aroma of wheat, citrus, grassy, and yeast. Taste of wheat, grassy notes, citrusy lemon and yeast. Light bodied, nice carbonation, just the average run of the mill hefeweizen.
Just not my cup of beer. While I am not a fan of thr style this doesnt rate in my view. From bottle hazy as you would expect but lacks aroma. Refreshing for a summer day nonetheless.

Flaske 0,33l fra Vinmonopolet Tromsø Langnes. Mørk aprikosfarget. Uklar. Veldig høyt kritthvitt tett skum som varer. Litt lacing. Beskjeden sitrusaroma. Myk munnfølelse. Smaker mest av banan med innslag av gjær. Svakt syrlig ettersmak. Sedimenter igjen i flaska.

12 oz bottle shared by durwoodx. Thanks Darrell! Pours a hazy golden yellow with hints of orange and fading bone white lacing. Aroma is yeast, bread and citrus notes. Flavor is soft and slightly tangy. Wheat, lemon and pleasant vegetal grassiness. Great example of the style.
on bottle. pours cloudy golden. Aroma is slightly fruity, with bananas. Taste has bananas. The beer is full bodied a nice summer beer.

Flaske fra polet, hjemme: lett uklar gylden og flott hvitt skum - akkurat slik en hefeweizen skal være. Pirrende duft av nellik, malt og litt humle. Deilig frisk og typeriktig smak med fin munnfylde - perfekt karbonert. Kan godt greie noen av denne i sommer.

Transfer from BA review on 5-19-12- 
Poured from bottle into weizen glass

Appearance  Pours a very hazy light yellow-orange/golden color. There is a billowing white head that is formed upon pouring. The head has a good persistence and fades to leave a good level of lacing on the sides of the glass.

Smell  The aroma is heavy of banana, yeast, and pepper; very classic Hefeweizen. Mixed with three three stronger previously mentioned aromas is a lighter citrus aroma in the background.

Taste  A lemon citrus and bready flavor meets the tongue. These are soon meet with flavors of yeast, which bring with it a flavor of banana and pepper.
