The banana is light, but the pepper gets stronger and stronger as the taste advances. Other spices and some sweeter citrus flavors then work their way in toward the end, with the pepper and yeast taking big command of the taste. In the end it has a very yeasty, peppery and citrusy flavor.

Mouthfeel  A medium thickness in body and an average level of carbonation. Nothing too special here.

Overall  Not bad, but nothing too spectacular either. Easy to drink but nothing special.
Very nice beer. Great banana and some citrus, even hibiscus flower aroma. Pours cloudy orange with good head and lacing. Soft sweet finish with some sourness. Soft carbonation.

350ml bottle, pours golden brown with a white head and a lot of haze in the glass. aroma is wheat malt, grasssy with a little spice and honey. Finish is dry and balanced. Good hefeweizen but not as full bodied as some of the best.

350ml bottle bought at Vinmonopolet Langnes, Tromsø. Served comfortably chilled. Steady bubbling, white head. A wheat haze to a golden coloured body. Moderate aroma of spiced wheat. Mixed taste of clove, citrus and ripe banana on a backbone of wheat. Drying yeast to the ending. Feels a bit thin on the swallow. Fresh, and a fair version of the style, not overly sweet (at home 06.06.2014).
Cloudy gold almost orange; thin offwhite head; light aroma some graininess; Flava is rich grain yeast and notes of bananna; feels medium decent fizz; fjnishes dry grainy yeasty slight tartness
Pours a nice yellow-orange color with a good head. Aroma of malt and citrus, a hit of banana. Sweet citrus flavor with a banana bread finish. Great balance, good mouth feel.

Has the aroma of fresh bananas, cloves, and a yeast/rye character. Pours a hazy orange color,with a thick dense head. Tastes again of fresh citrus, clove, with a somewhat mild hops flavor profile. Great on a hot summer day.

Aroma-not much there but a faint hint of cloves and vanilla.
Appearance-hazy, beautiful golden color with a frothy but average head.
Taste-slightly sweet and not very bitter, just a bit sour
Palate-light to medium bodied, slightly creamy texture with lively carbonation.
Overall, this is an outstanding beer in its class. I could see myself enjoying this at any time of the day in any weather. Wasnt much to smell or look at, but the taste definitely made up for it, in spades. The Sierra Nevada boys have done it again!
Pours clear yellow with a low white head. Aromas of honey, rye bread, orange rinds. Taste is orange, honey, rye bread.

Bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus. Hazy murky orange color, medium sized white to off-white head. Aroma is lightly wheat, sweetish, lightly banana and some other fruits. Tastes about the same. Fortunately not that overpowering banana, quite well balanced and actually quite pleasant.
Bottle @ benzai. Opaque yellow to orange. Smells sweetish, slightly banana, some herbs. Tastes sweet, wheat, banana, slightly smoky. Thin to medium body, soft carbo.

Nice. Has a sprightliness I'm unaccustomed to in this style. Nice banana notes that I am accustomed to. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very good taste aroma and appearance. Def one of the best american hefeweizens that I have had
0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours hazy yellow with a high head. Aroma is malts, wheat and citrus. Flavor is malts, wheat, citrus and yeast. Very nice.
[Köpenhamns ölfestival 2014] Det här var rätt juste, smaken bar toner av banan och citrus. Kroppen var okej och balansen finjusterad, uppelevelsen i sig? God!
Köpenhamn ölfestival 2014] del jäst i aromen, citrus. Likaså i smaken, relativt lätt i kroppen.
Decent not spectacular.....very refreshing clean crisp beer....banana cloves hops...probably will drink again.

Bottle at home. Has a very cloudy light orange colour and a big, creamy, light beige head. Sweet and fruity aroma of banana, spices, grass, lemon and soap. The flavour is also sweet with spices, hay and sweet fruits. Soft and slick mouth feel, and has a light bitterness. A fruity and spiced hefeweizen. Nice.
Bottle 0.335l at home, Oulu. Originally rated 05082012. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, banana, wheat and malts.
Fruchtig-bananiger Geruch. Trüb-gelbliche Farbe. Bananig, leicht hopfig im Nachgeschmack. Helle Früchte. Etwas wässrig.
Too much hay, biscuit, and wheaty dough for my liking. To be fair, Ive yet to enjoy this style.

Appearance - Dull light yellow. Aroma - some banana, bubble gum. Palate - prickly. Taste - Lots of lemony. Overall - great American rep of the style.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Poured from bottle. Hazy yellowish orange pour with white head. Aroma smells of biscuits, banana, clove maybe orange peel? Taste is well balanced with very little bitterness..smooth but doesn?t linger on the palate as long as you?d want. Overall a nice beer. Very good hefe.

15.05.2014, 0,35l bottle @ home:
Big creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh, citrus, yeast, hay, dough, wheat, bubblegum, hints of dried fruits. Taste is slightly dry, yeast, wheat, hay, dough, weeds, citrus peel, grass. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Sredniawe piwo. Z niewielka piana, osadem niezlym, ale nie takim jak w bawarskich piwach. Stanowczo go za malo, za malo drozdzowe. Dominowal posmak bananow i wanilli. Lekko cytrusowe. Koloru jasno zotlego metnego. Niezbyt nagazowane. Bardziej jakby skrzyzowanie Belgian Wit z pszenica niemiecka. Ale nie bylo to idealnie odwzorowane Bawarskie pszeniczne piwo. Do takich mu sporo brakuje.
Poured Following directions on the nottle. Really enjoyable, authentic, low alcohol and perfect for hot days.
(bottle) hazy copper colour with a medium tall white head; aroma of spice, banana; balanced flavour with a long light bitter finish; average

Draught at St. Augustines, VancouverMuddy blond color with a darker hue; small creamy head. Light, fresh, a bit fruity, balanced, with correct bitterness; it has a delicate banana touch, while the spices are really low; it also has some soft sweetness.Pleasant.
Cloudy yellow,lasting white head.Lightly tart citrus nose. Soft carbonation.Spicy coriander yeasty palate. Good lacing
Draft at Moriartys. Cloudy pale pour. Slight head. Decent Hefeweizen but so not my style. Toasted bananas. Not awful, but cannot generate any enthusiasm for this.

On bottle at Beer14. Golden color, good foam. Good fruity aromas, banana and some citrus. Medium body & complexity . Very well balanced. Enjoyable

Sample from bottle at Beer14. Pours just slightly hazy pale golden with a white head. Mild fruity with lots of banana, mild spices and wheat. Deliciously balanced and refreshing!
355 mil bottle cloudy yellow in colour white head banana and cloves in aroma nice wheety banana yeaty citrus very good hef

12 ounce bottle pouring into glass. Has thick head with nice lacing. A light amber color and then unfiltered look. Lots of sweet fruity notes like banana. Slight bitterness towards end of swallow but then disappears and leaves sweet finish. A very nice beer.

Keg @ The Cottage, Galway [160414]
Yellow orange, hazy, thin white head

Bottle from Highland Package. Transparent gold with white head. Aroma of clover and hops. Taste of banana and malt. Smooth light-bodied aftertaste. Pretty good.

Not a huge fan of his style but i gotta say this is a great overall! Heavy citrus with fairly heavy fermentation, delicate but complex

This is a really citrusy Hefeweizen! The aroma is excellent with citrus notes, wheat, and faint bubble gum. Taste is similar light citrusy flavor, with wheat, and faint bubble gum notes at the end. The finish is a little sticky sweet that lingers a bit. Eat something salt with this to cut that and you be just fine dude.
Hefeweizen used to be my favorite type, but Ive moved to darker beers. Poured into a frosty mug. Good head, cloudy amber, slightly more bitter than normal, wheat and grass.
Best American made Hefeweizen by far. It actually tastes like a real German Hefeweizen, comparable to Weihenstefan.
Cerveja de coloração amarelo ouro, boa formação de espuma e boa persistência. Bem condimentada, fermento e pão.

Pours a very cloudy golden-yellow with a thin frothy white head. Aroma is slightly nutty, banana bread, clove, and coriander. A quick whiff is like a piece of banana nut bread that just came out of the oven. Flavor is exactly what youd expect from the aroma. Slightly spicey start fades into a banana nut bread flavor, with a long sweet malty finish. Absolutely delicious. Medium bodied, with perfect carbonation make give it a full feel yet still crisp and refreshing. Overall this is an excellent Hefeweizen.

Appearance: very hazy and cloudy gold color, pours with a very large white head with good density

Aroma: banana, clove, smells very good, 

Taste: banana, has a tang to it, very slight bitterness on the finish, 

Palate: lively carbonation, leaves mouth kind of dry, light mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste

Overall: could use more froth in the mouthfeel, I really don't like this much bitterness in my hefeweizens, not bad though 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Good hefe beer.nice pour and head,great color...over all a very good style and beer.could be my favorite hefeweisen
Backlog. Tried on tap at Green Lion Inn. Mostly bread with some spices and tropical fruits like banana.
UPDATED: MAY 7, 2017 12 fl.oz bottle. Pours hazy bright golden colour with a huge goo lasting off-white head. Aroma of banana and wheat. Taste of medium sweet banana, mango, wheat and yeast.
Tap at Dada, Sheffield. Bready, chewy, spicy, tasty hefeweissen. All bases covered. Looks good, too

Keg at Craft Islington. It pours cloudy pale orange with a small white head. The nose is earthy, wheat, bruised banana, spice. The taste is soft, orange squash, banana, wheat, earth, light spice, touch of creaminess and light bitterness with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Not a game-changer, but well balanced and rather drinkable nonetheless.

pours hazy pale yellow with a small white cap, some retention and lacing. ripened bananas, cloves, pepper, other spices, hint of wheat acidity and bubblegum, grass and bitter herbs, hint of sweetness - honey, chalk. moderate carbonation - slightly lacking, light body, balanced spicy-grassy-peppery finish. enjoyable but nothing spectacular.
bottle. hazy golden with small head. excellent hefe with light banana and bubblegum. lots of flavor here.
in bottle. pours hazy yellow big white head. on the nose is big spice, bread and faint banana. Taste was lacking on just about all aspects. mouth feel was watery. great brewery not there best beer.

Uklar gul med gærsvæv og holdbart hvidt skum. Duften er meget"tysk" med sødme, koriander og banan. Smagen er sød, men rigtig fin balance med den diskrete humle. Eftersmagen er lang, sødlig og let syrlig.

pours a cloudy yellow color with a thick white head. the aroma is wheat, cloves and little banana. the flavor is wheat up front with clove and slight banana at the finish. this leaves very little on the palate, making it very refreshing.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow body under a one finger frothy white head. The nose is very yeasty with lots of fruity esters and wheat. The flavor is pretty solid, lots of yeastiness with some esters of bubblegum and banana, clean wheat. Light to medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Solid stuff, nothing exciting, but thats sort of the deal with the style.

12 Fl. Oz bottle poured into Hefeweizen glass. It pours a cloudy, straw golden color. 1.5 finger of white, frothy head. It smells of bananas, bit of clove, and bubblegum. The taste goes the same with slight spice but light and smooth palate. A great choice for the summertime!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

on draft poured a hazy yellow color with little white head. the aroma of bread and wheat and yeasties blended very well together...the flavor was spot on with the wheat and yeast working together. a bit of banana in the mix almost belgianese in flavor. loved this beer.

Nice cloudy orange color with not very long lasting head. Aroma is yeast with malts and hints of fruits. Taste is malts with a little bit sourness. Aftertaste is some fruits and also a little bit soapy. O.K.one.

In glass its a cloudy yellow beer with a regular foam head who dissipate quickly. Indeed it has pretty good citrus, herbal, banana aromas but not too much malt notes, the taste is regular, the hops flavors are lost, and the malt flavors prevail. At the finish the sensation is quite watery. I dont think on this one like the best example of a hefeweizen actually.
cheese, dough, hazy, golden, orange, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, chalky,light body, medium body, creamy, average carbonation, astringent, tangerine?

Bottle: Pours a nice hazy golden color with a fairly big white head. Aromas are banana... yeasty. But there is a strong sweet malt backbone as well. The taste is just what you expect with a sweet banana background to the full body that the yeast provides. This is a solid wheat beer. Very well balanced and enjoyable.

A strong rubber aroma taints the better aspects of this beer, the appearance is spot on, but the rubber aroma transcends into taste to leave this beer with a sour rubber aftertaste that derides the clean front end and palate. Overall, it was very hard to appreciate. Perhaps it was a bad batch.
Sample at a tasting. Hazey yellow body with a huge white head, follows the style well. Perhaps too well, as it has loadsof banana flavors and such.

355 ml bottle from Pompano Beach, FL. Pours a hazy gold color with a short and short lasting head. Aroma is citrus, bubblegum and bananas. Taste is at first like a classic but watery Hefe. But then suddenly the IPA tartness ruins it completely. Not a good example of style at all. But that being said it is a tasty beer.

Pen & Paper Log (Mar 2011)

Aroma - some banana esters and that classic yeasty malt nose, but with some floral notes as well.
Appearance - hazy orange-gold with a hint white head, not as impressive as other Hefes
Taste - its got a bit of that banana and bubblegum, some wheat as well of course and yeast.
Palate - the body is light to medium, texture was wheat somewhat thin, the carbonation was soft and appropriate, finish was short.

Good hefe but no distinct flavor of banana or cloves or bubblegum. Some citrus. Refreshing with just the relight carbonation.

Pours a cloudy light golden colour with a big soapy head that looks like a hefeweizen should look like. Good aroma of hay, bread, dough, spruce and some spices. Flavour is much alike, good balance. Not too sweet, Nd good carbonation, which makes it really refreshing! A really good hefeweizen indeed!
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy gold with cream colored head. Aroma of citrus, spice, and yeast. Tastes a bit like banana with hints of lemon.
UPDATED: JAN 16, 2014  golden color, white foam head, cloudy, citrus aroma, creamy feel, average carbonation, long finish.  I am a heff fan and this is one of the best that I have tasted.

Bottle from Au Grain DOrges/ Hazy pale yellow color, decent white head / Aroma is esteryb(banana and bread), wheat, orange, spicy / Flavor is yeasty, wheat, spicy / Medium body, creamy, low bitterness, long estery wheat finish

Bottle - Hazy golden pour with a thin foamy white head. Nose is all bananas and bubble gum, light clove, and sweet wheat. Classic hefe. Taste is sweet banana and bubble gum with minimal spicing and subdued sweetness. A bit of mineral with some sweet wheat. Thick and slick with medium carbonation. Very good--world class. Love the 4.8% though...could session this sucker.
I like it. I would get it pregnant. If you know what i mean. If you dare disagree, i fight you. Challenger, come forth.

Pours attractively, with a very hazy yellow and a big white head. The aroma is very bready and dry, and the flavor is subtle, with banana and yeasty qualities. I found it to be a little thin or flat at times, esp. the mid-palate. But it finishes long. Decent. Bottle.
Pours clear golden with thin head that dissipates quickly. Tastes of dough with a sweet finish. A tasty beer!

Poured from a bottle a hazy golden with a thin white head that dissipates quickly. Yeast and bread aroma. Flavor is yeasty with some banana. Slightly sweet and light bodied. Highly carbonated. Finishes very dry. Nice beer thou I don't prefer the style.

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2014 A spectacular hefeweizen made in the Bavarian tradition. This ale has lots of banana taste and sweetness from wheat malt. Sierra Nevada proves to be one of the few American breweries that can truly capture the earthy, refined flavors of an authentic German Hefeweizen.

Pours gold. Light head. Got creamy taste without feeling thick. Light hops. Very Belgian.

Bottle 0,33l. Pours a slightly cloudy tan colour with a thin white head. Aroma is grain and yeast. Taste is yeasty, cereal, and hints of banana and citrus. High carbonation.

Finally getting around to this one, before it breaks the 1000 mark.

10-19-2011

Bottle into a glass. Pours golden yellow with a medium white head that dissipates quickly. Smells of bread yeast with a hint of banana. Light mouthfeel. Tastes of banana and bread, with a hint of clove. Excellent hefe.

Bottle. Light yellow, foggy. Small white head. Aroma is sweet with yeast, grapefruit and grass.

Taste has citrus, butter and sweet syrup. Somewhat sweet overall with a short aftertaste. Shallow mouthfeel. Very easy to drink but very different in comparison to the German weizens.

Bottle: Cloudy, amber gold with a light white head that is persistent. Wheat, citrus and lifted. Loads of esters with dominant banana. Very primary. Clean. Yeasty. Dry, slightly sour wheat profile. Low bitterness. Medium weight but long. Like a simple Chardonnay. Slightly reductive finish.

In typical hefe fashion, she pours hazy straw gold with a thick 'n foamy white head. Aroma is sweet banana, cloves, floral notes and yeast. Taste amps up the banana and bread flavors. I am drinking a slice of banana bread in fact. Dry on the palate and a wheatie aftertaste. One of the best American hefes that I've ever had. Highly enjoyable.

Yeast, banana bread, and honey, with undercurrents of tin and wheat grain. Pours a deep, hazy orange with some whitish froth stirring up top. 4oz. serving at the Grog.

Pours murky banana, two finger white head.

Smell sweet earthy banana and gum, bit of clove

Taste sweet yet hoppy, stronger flavor than most weisse beers

Light body

Decent

Bottle at K1, Örebro. Pours hazy golden with a smal white head. Aroma has banana esters, wheat, light candi sugar notes, spices. Taste is sweet banana, light spices, light bitterness, light citrus. Medium body.

The Kellerweis pours a mostly cloudy yellow with a an eggshell white head that leaves decent lacing. The aroma is banana bread with butter. The flavor is bananas, clove, bread and butter. Overall this is a decent brew.

On tap at Unos cloudy with a hint of citrus and hay notes. Great mouthfeel. Clean finish
A bit of a skunky aroma here. Wheaty flavor with a bit of carbonation and some light fruit nose.

This beer is a lovely change from other wheat beers readily available in Australia, with a nice combination of flavours and aromas including ripe banana, lemon and clove. I used this beer to make a batter for fish and it was very nice, light and not overpowering whilst bringing pleasant flavour to the fish. It is a beautiful summer lunch beer that refreshes and quenches your thirst.
I absolutely adore this beer. For a damn good knockoff of a Bavarian, and at this price...this is just winning all around. Dank.

Bottle. Cloudy straw with small white head. Typical aromas of banana, wheat, cloves, citrus, yeast and just a hint of bubblegum. Lovely intertwined and complex flavours of wheat, spice, citrus, yeast and banana along with good carbonation. A really good example that's among my favourites for this style.
Fantastic hefe that is without the strong banana flavors you might find from others in the same style.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2013 Good American hefeweizen. Golden color, citrus under note mildly spiced hint of a banana note

500 ml bottle at Fox and Hounds, Åbenrå. Hazy orange with a light, white head. Aroma has typical weissbier elements like banana, wheat and some bubblegum, but there is also a hint of caramel, honey and oranges. Flavor is sweet citric fruity with some caramel malt, banana, wheat, fruity yeast and a bit spicy. Medium body and decent aftertaste. This is a decent hefe weissen with several extra nice flavors making in more interesting. Still without being to experimental, rather true to the style. Nice version of a not very exiting style.

Keg @ Friends of Ham, Leeds. Nice typically German hazy colour with a good weizbier aroma containing plenty of bananary-yeast action that continues into the taste, although not too full on compared to its German counterparts. Still, couldve fooled me.

Bottle, poured into small white white glass. Dull, hazy gold colour, quickly receding white head. Smells like any wheat beer should, bananas, some citrus and a very gentle background spice. Taste is moderate, but in a good way. Not too much of anything, very balanced. Spritzy carbonation, short finish. Enjoyable, but probably better suited for summer.

Rated on 9-05-2009 at Crown Liquors Event (Bottle) When poured, this beer forms a small white head, cloudy straw body, no visible carbonation, and a fair amount of lacing. The Aroma is banana, clove, spicy, wheat, yeast, and citrus. The Taste mimics the Aroma. The Palate is tingly and this beer is medium bodied. Overall, I enjoyed drinking/rating this beer as the flavors came together very well. This beer is worthy trying and a beer I would enjoy drinking again.
From bottle to glass. Straw color not as cloudy as a German hefe. Aroma of wheat, light clove and banana. Sweet wheat banana with a dry wheat finish. Good drinkable beer but not my favorite hefe.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; golden yellow pour with creamy white head, slight medicinal aroma, taste has cloves spice some bananas and a yeasty background.

Poured from bottle, pale hazy yellow with the suspended yeast. Thin white head. Smells of bread, light citrus, pears. Tastes subtle but complex, lots of yeasts but nothing overpowering like banana etc. Best hefe I've had.
12oz to shaker. Clean golden yellow. Bready malty aroma. Wheat, banana and spice flavors. Biting carbonation.

Bottle from Drinkmonger. Murky pale golden body with a thin white head. Aroma of sour lemon and pale malt. Muted flavour of lemon sherbert, straw and grass. Slightly peppery. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Average carbonation. Too weak and subdued for my liking.
350ml bottle. pours a very cloudy amber colour. aroma is of wheat and malts. slightly zesty. taste is really nice. sharp, wheat and full mouth feel.

Bottle pour. Yellow color with a cloudy haze (suspended yeast) in the glass. Very thick light cream head, excellent retention. The aroma is very strong with yeast. The taste is very smooth and mild, light bans notes. A session hefeweizen, overall a great beer.
Bottle from brewdog online. Hazy orange color, white head. Aroma is sweetness, sugar, yeast, plums. Belgian style sweetness on taste, wheat, yeast, some hops and banana.
bubblegum banana aroma. cloudy yellow with a good white head. taste is light sweetness light bitterness. light body. not the best but good.
A slightly cloudy tan color with a thin white head. Aroma is grain and yeast. Taste is yeasty, cereal, and hints of banana and citrus. lively carbonation.

Not a bad beer. I expected a clearer beer, but they actually left this one unfiltered and cloudy. Good esters a slightly creamy texture. Light sweetness. Only draw back is that the bitterness in the finish clashes a little with the rest of the beer.
This is a very good hefe. Light, bright, with some banana, grass, and hay in the aroma. A bit of bubblegum, but all of which is pretty subtle.
Pretty good hefe from Sierra Nevada. Can definitely have a few of these. They are really showing everybody that they can brew just about any style.
Aroma of wheat and citrus. Taste of slight banana. A good example of a german hef. Would definitely drink again

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2013 Cloudy gold color, white, loose foam. Yeasty nose, 
Light to medium body, very smooth, refreshing due to a bitter, faintly sour and well carbonated mouthfeel, balanced by a subtly sweet background. 
Citrusy, yeasty (reminds one of levedo de cerveja)  bready, cloves and coriander seeds, ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. This one poured a cloudy yellow color, medium sized white head. Aroma was some grain notes, yeast, lemon citrus character. ABV makes this quite sessionable, very enjoyable to consume. Id say this is a pretty good representation of a German Hefe, though its nowhere near as crafted as some of these guys who have been in the game for centuries, but Id reach for this in a pinch.

Hazy Yellow Color with a voluminous yet soapy head with no carbonation or lacing. Nose is banana, bubblegum, clove, bubblegum, and light caramel. Flavor is cloves, bubblegum, floral hops, pale malts and bananas: Dry aftertaste. Body is light and has no carbonation. Fairly flavorful albeit a bit on the dry side.
Nicely done to style. Pours hazy yellow with a bright white head. Aroma is light banana and citrus. Light body, crisp citrus finish.

12 oz bottle served in a Paulaner Hefewiess glass. This beer pours a hazy golden-yellow with a tall but somewhat short-lived white head. Some sediment left on the bottom of the bottle. 
Banana and clove in the nose, but not as pronounced as in some Bavarian versions, and less ripe banana than in tasting.

M: light body; near medium carbonation.

O: perhaps the first SN beer I dont want to have again. Not bad and an authentic version of this German style, but it is a style I dont usually care for.
Ve Ryan much like a Bavarian wizened, full of bread and banana notes. Pours hazy golden with thin creamy head. Full body, heavier mouthfeel. A taste of Germany from California.
Golden, hay unfiltered yellow color. Wheaty, citrusy aroma with a slight funk. Taste is light, citrusy.. great.
Draft at Zinburger. Hazy orange with white creamy head. Aroma is banana, wheat, hops, orange, and bread. Medium and smooth palate. Very soft carbonation. Taste is big sweet.

355ml bottle at home. Pours hazy light orange, head good at first, but soon disappears to nothing. Banana and clove aromas, as expected, with some lemonade-y citrus and wheat. Good balance on the whole between the light sweet and light bitter notes. Some yeastiness. High carbonation. Good, but the Germans do it better.

12 oz. bottle. It pours a mostly clear golden orange color with a nice white head and streaming bubbles. The aroma is nice with clove, pepper and lighter notes of bubble gum and under ripe banana. The flavor is strong with wheat, clove and bubblegum in the finish. Full bodied for a lighter beer. Good German character. A go-to beer as a local summer refresher that tastes authentically German.

A cloudy, light yellow beer with a medium and white head. The nose of wheat, yeast, sourness and some bananas. Taste of wheat, nice fruitesters, some sourness, overally the taste is quite dry. Medium bodied, high carbonation turns this beer a fresh to drink. Nice hefe, strongly wheatish and quite dry.

Bottle into a Cropton glass. Bright cloudy orange with a fine head on it. Lovely clove wheat aroma. Light, crisp wheat taste, with both some sweet and sourness, very nice. Smooth and conducive to a good session, though slightly lacking in depth.

355 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Cloudy golden yellow with white head. Aroma yeast, banana, sweet malt, citrus and a little clove. Taste is of yeast, banana, spicy, cloves with a long yeasty finish with some hops in it.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours cloudy yellow with white head. 
Aroma yeast, banana, wheat. 
Taste banana sweet, fresh bitter. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Not super not bad.

Bottle from Ale Jail, cloudy lemonade pour. Aroma of banana, clove and some earthiness. Taste is a bit sweet banana, fades into clove and a wheat finish.

Pours golden orange with a fruity orange aroma. Good flavor but very carbonated and finishes way too sweet.

Kellerweis is another example of an overall comment I have of the entire Sierra Nevada portfolio of beers: Technically clean, but lacks depth of flavor. Sierra is the sixth largest brewery in the U.S. and its mass production level prevents it from delivering exceptional beers in any category. We owe Sierra a thanks for pioneering the craft beer business, but unfortunately, its beers have become more macro than micro.

Hazy orange color. Aroma is yeasty and wheat. Taste of banana , wheat and spices. Good beer.

From stevencons six pack. Cloudy orange pour with a frothy white head. Estery and phenolic yeast aroma and orange cream. Flavor is the same with a smooth body and spicy finish. Not too shabby.
12oz bottle. Pours hazy yellow color with two fingers of creamy white head. Aroma of ripe banana, clove, wheat, and Belgian spices. Taste of banana, clove, wheat, and herbal hops.
Golden appear. Big yeasty aroma. Creamy smooth palate. Moderate hoppy. dough, banana flavors. Sweet middle and finish. Not a bad brew, but too sweet for my liking.

This beer its great. Definitely some fruity esters of banana. Carbonation is awsome and the color is spot on. Home run in my books. A definite go-to for any party or quite night at the casa de awsome.

Nose is banana, wheat, lemon, a little spice. Taste is lemon, wheat, a little yeasty, a little coriander, a hair of funk. Very smooth, not bad at all.

Bottle. Pours murky golden with a white head. Aroma is banana, exotic fruits and yeast. Taste is medium sweet and a bit creamy. Medium body with lively carbonation.
These were tasty! Fruit and bread dominate the smell and flavor, this beer really lets the yeast shine, even in the cloudy appearance. Refreshing mouthfeel, this goes down easy on a hot summer day.
Pours a cloudy orange color. The aroma is of a typical hefe with Belgian yeast. Slight tang to it.

Slightly understated for a Hefeweizen. High carbonation minimized typical creaminess, flavors of banana & yeast were muted, clove was difficult to detect. An amazing weizen beer. I dont normally reach for this style, but this interpretation is great. True bavarian yeast, notes of banana and clove. Doughy flavors. Beautiful color. Living in Hawaii, most weizen beers from Germany are dead by the time they get here. Sierra Nevada Kellerweis comes to Hawaii in a chilled container from Chico, and the difference is completely noticeable. Bright, clean, delicious.

Hazy yellow. Small white head. No lacing. Aroma of malt. Slight banana. Almost a Hefeweizen. Bitter. A bit catty. A little sour in the back. Okay.

A pretty standard hefeweizen. Smells a bit skunky when poured. Finish is a little more bitter than I normally like in this category.
Bottle: Nice solid weizen, malt, banana, vanilla, dough. Food Pairing: White Fish.

Yellow/golden pour with a creamy white head. Aromas of sweet citrus, banaa, spice, wheat and yeast. Taste is sweet lemon, some spice and clove, bread, and wheat. On the sweet side but a good flavor.

Lager glass. A very complex smelling beer, lots of spices and maybe just a hint of banana. Pours a cloudy off gold with some fast dissipating head. Bottle. Almost opaque amber-orange. Apricot, citrus and some dry banana in the nose, tastes a little old with yeasty sweetness and bitter undertones. Medium body and a little bread in the finish. Nice.

This is really fantastic. None of that weird earthy/borderline chemical aftertaste that you get with so many hefeweizens in the US. Just straight up, full, bold flavor that goes down ridiculously easy on a summer day.
Pours cloudy lemon. Lovely haze. Wheat earthy aroma with hints of lemon. Taste of citrus hues with nice kick from carbonation. Nice bitterness makes it a lovely balanced wheat beer.

Pours cloudly light golden yellow with a one finger white head. Aroma is of sweet wheat malts, yeast, banana, cloves, bubble gum, and some spicy herbal sage and pepper. Taste is banana, cloves, sweet wheat bread, bu nor gum, earthy spices (pepper and sage) and some light spicy hops. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a dry, crisp, slighty bitter, refeshing, medium long finish. Overall, a very nice Hefe that tastes like it was brewed in Bavaria instead of NorCal.
Poured cloudy yellow/orange with a bubbly white head. Aroma is floral and citrus. Taste is oranges with a little bit of vanilla on the tip of the tongue. More robust than your average hefe.

Bottle sampling at tasting. Cloudy golden color, typical hefeweizen aroma with banana, clove, bublegum and spicy notes. Sweet, with more fruitiness. Medium body, smooth, good carbonation.

Cloudy yellow pour, hazy. Spice and yeast esters. Taste is clove, a dash of white pepper and some banana. Finishes dry with a lively carbonation. Decent.
Malty and floral aromas. Pours murky yellow with a thin white head. Good grassy/cereal flavors. Good refreshing beer.

Poured out of the bottle in the standard fashion. The appearance is beautiful, completely cloudy with residue all about. Although Im enjoying this hefe, its just not something Id reach for when I can buy great German hefes for the same price. Poured from a bottle, San Diego. Smells like an abbey beer - earthy, with some gentle fruitiness. A very light and refreshing beer, very pleasant. This would be a perfect summer beer to drink while outdoors.

Not one of my favorite beer styles, but fond memories of sitting in a picturesque Bavarian town plaza, taking a break with a hefeweizen on a hot summer day while bike touring down the Danube give it a certain sentimental value. And Sierra Nevada Kellerweis is a fine example of this style. A light and refreshing, cloudy and yeasty summer wheat, it is far better than the several other dull banana flavored American Wheats that Ive tried.
Bottle with Pedro. Pours a cloudy gold with bubbly white head and some lace. Nose of wheat, hay, banana, lemon, spice. Medium to light body. Not a bad hef.
Muddled yellow beer, a helluva foam, not much taste, but smells good nonetheless

Awful. Flat. Terrible. Maybe something was wrong with my bottle. Looks like a glass of piss.

Slight edge of banana but nothing particularly exciting. A fairly typical wheat beer.

Aromas of banana, pineapple, lemongrass and dough. Pours a hazy yellow/orange color with a tight white head - some lacing. Opens fruity and refreshing and dries out leaving a crisp, short finish. Very nice wheat and one may keep on hand more often this summer.

12oz bottle.

I was sold when the bottle stated it was fermented like kellerbier in Germany.  Less carbonation and a more mature taste.  Still has the banana-like flavor associated with American Hefeweizen.  

Very good bier.

12 oz. bottle pours a straw orange/yellow color with two-finger white head that leaves a little lacing.  Aroma is full of bananas, cloves, wheat, and lemon, as expected for this style.  Taste is slightly bitter and spicey.  Medium to light body with average carbonation and a lively mouthfeel.  A thouroughly refreshing American Hefeweizen true to the style which has no disappointments.

Draft at Draught 55. Pours hazy orangey yellow with no head.  Aroma of bread, wheat, citrus banana and cloves. Taste is similar to the aromas, bananas, cloves, wheat and citrus. I dont know if I got a bad pour of this, but this did just not hit the right notes with me and I actually stopped drinking it about halfway through and asked for something else. I think Ill have to try it in the bottle to give it a fair shake.

I have had this beer in many formats.  And as is the case in any hefe, freshness is key!  This beer is an absolute perfect representation of this style of beer.  However, make sure it is fresh.  I have had a bottle that was at least 4 months old and the flavor and aroma dropped off, but this is not unusual to this style. Recently, I had it on tap at the brewery and I was very happy indeed! (plus it was only $4 in a proper glass!)

Poured with yeast swirled in.  Appearance is a very cloudy straw yellow, with a big frothy white head.  Aroma is the expected charcteristic hefeweizen combination of banana, honey, and clove.  Flavor follows suit with a perfect balance of the above elements and a very light and refreshing tartness.  The only thing that keeps this beer from being the greatest hefeweizen Ive tried is it lacks the few extra layers of complexity I find in Weihenstephaners hef.  That being said, this beer is absolutely fantastic.
Has the correct cloudy appearance. wonderful taste of banana and clove. overall a wonderful an authentic hefeweizen

Very good American heffewiezen. Tasted a lot like the ones I had in Germany. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured from a chilled bottle into a glass. Rich cloudy yellow color with a nice medium head. Slight metallic and banana smell.   Slight bitter after taste with a decent initial wheat beer taste.

Golden and hazy with a thin head and floral, ripe banana nose. Mildly-carbonated, with a somewhat malty mouthfeel followed by banana, spice, and lemon. Reminds me of Weizens I had in Innsbruck and Munich but with a more mellow flavor.

Tap. Pours hazy gold with thick, creamy white head. Aroma is pear, apples, banana, light herbs, cereal and cookie malts, and light floral hops. Flavor is smooth, bready malts with good supporting light fruit esters, herbs, and a touch of hops; well balanced with a dry finish. Light/medium body and medium carbonation.

Sierra Nevada Kellerweis just hits all the right notes making for a classic, tasty German Hefeweizen.  Nice fruit and clove aroma coming from a think bubbly head.  The pour is yellow and cloudy.  (Swirl the last third around before pouring it in the glass for the best flavor.)  Intense banana flavor tempered by a light clove note.  Faint banana flavors linger on the palate.  Kellerweis is a refreshing classic hefe that wont disappoint!

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured cloudy golden in color with a decent size white head, OK lacing. Aroma is mostly of citrus fruit and malts and some spices. Taste is very similar, sweet, refreshing citrus flavors mixed with malts and grain. Very good beer, quite enjoyable and super easy to drink. Nice...

12 oz bottle from Wilburs.  Golden, pale and hazy with a small white head.  The aroma is of lemons, wheat malts and spices/herbs.  Similar flavor, bananas, citrus and clove.  Medium body, smooth and soft feel.  Pretty refreshing.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 Initial Rating 5/11/13 3.7  Hazy orange yellow.  One finger white head.  Smells like a loaf of sourdough and old bananas.  Medium carbonation leads to acidity coming from the carbonation overshadowing lactic tang Im looking for.   Flavor is rich and yeasty though with brinyness and smooth mouth residue.   
Second Rating 5/1/14 3.8  Same flavor notes as before, the lactic tang of a kellerbier was more noticeable this time around.  I like it!
Bottle at home. Pours a medium copper with minimal head. Aroma is banana, yeast, grassy. Taste is balanced sweet and spicy. Light mouthfeel. Good representation of the style. Anytime beer.

Bottle shared with McTapps. Nice one for sure. Expected to get a mix of german, belgian und US and that is exactly what I got. Starting with some hops and citrus this one continues with a nice mixture of sweetness and some sour fruits. Ends fruity and ripe with a bit yeast and hops. Unusual Weizen for a german guy. And that is what makes it quite special. Made with love and knowledge. Top.

Was very looking forward to open this bottle, as I -in general- think that Sierra Nevada is a good and solid brewery that makes constantly good beer. As a matter of fact, there are unfortunately not much more beers of other American breweries than Sierra Nevada available in Germany, so only to have a German Hefeweizen of this American brewery makes the beer probably very special to many drinkers. It has got a light milky light amber colour with low steady creamy head and medium toi smooth body. Nose of Belgian witbier. Taste of mild hops, mild grains, ligth yeast, green nuts and green apples. Easy to drink and I -as Im not THAT keen on German Hefeweizens- really enjoyed this "Hefeweizen". But it tastes totally different than what you get in Germany.

A - Pours a hay pale gold with a frothy 2 finger bone-white head

S - Generous amounts of wheat. Raw doughy yeast, banana, clove, lemon citrus.

T - Lots of wheat with some lemon zest behind it. Fresh bananas, faint grassy hops, mellow clove spice. Finishes with a zest of lemon.

M - Full feeling, lush, soft, chewy, with minor lively carbonation.

Love the mouthfeel! Everything worked well together. Highly recommended.

Serving type: bottle

04-25-2011

355ml bottle from a publix in Kissimmee Florida. Hazed golden with a lasting white head. Full wheat, light banana and clove aroma. Flavour is similar, on the lighter side of the style. I dont know why I still try new hefes. 
FLVC2 #11

Poured into a weizen glass, has a hazy golden colored body with a three finger white foamy head that dies at a good pace and leaves some really nice lookin clingy lacing, banana smell from the esters and clove spice up front, slight citrus making somewhat of a presence; taste is sweet and spicy through previously mentioned flavors, estery aftertaste and finish
palate is light to medium, semi-sessionable, carbonated just right
overall, not usually into hefeweizens, I would definitely have this again
Pours a beautiful, hazy yellow color with a thin head.  Yeasty aroma.  Great flavor.  A nice light hefe.  Perfect for a summer day.

Smells of a stong IPA... Taste is light, finish is slightly bitter, but not overwhelming. C+ beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy golden colour with a massive head. Aroma of wheat and some smoke and yeast with banana esters. Taste of banana and yeast. Round, smooth feeling with flavour of wheat. A slight background taste of citrus.
Clove, sulfur-ish yeast aroma, with a little banana, dough, and tartness. More banana in the flavor, with a lot of spice, some bubblegum, and sweet, bready malt.

Bottle poured a hazy yellowish-orange hue w/ good head and some lace. Aroma and flavor are similar: cloves, banana, spices, citrus, yeast. Light sweet initial flavor with a bitter finish of short duration. Medium bodied, ample carbonation, and smooth mouthfeel.
Draft at Columbia event. Pours a cloudy golden straw color. Classic hefe, bananas and ester in nose, finish slightly spicy. Lacks overall complexity of best German examples, but a really nice beer.
Very nice and fine aroma, thick in features and also storng in taste. Was nice to have it and with the brewerys signature.

Bottle pours a cloudy light yellow.
 Pleasant sweet aromas of, cloves, bubblegum, banana and wheat.

Taste. Mainly wheat flavours followed by banana and bubblegum flavours finished nicely with a nice clove flavour and other spices i cant specify.

Overall. A good beer with almost no bitterness, clean and refreshing whilst still delivering plenty of flavour.

The Draft House, Tower Bridge, London (355ml bottle, £5.95):
Wheat and plenty of spice with some clove and light banana notes. There is some citrus and yeast coming through too along with a hint of bubblegum.

Cloudy, golden amber with a thin, bubbly white lacing about a half centimetre tall. This turns slightly patchy after a while but doesnt hold too badly.

Wheat and spice aroma along with a nice helping of clove but the main taste is a mix of banana that is stronger than in the nose and a fruity citrus flavour that is backed up with some lemongrass.

Medium bodied and very smooth to drink with nice, good strength carbonation that gives the drink a lively and refreshing mouthfeel. There is a light citrus tang and a fruity sweetness.

Great hefeweizen that went down a treat and was well worth the wait in getting to try it. There was  a good balance between the sweet flavours and the spice with a good body and a nice, refreshing mouthfeel.

355ml bottle bought at CitySuper in New Town Plaza, Shatin.
Cloudy hazy golden honey colour with dirt like yeast sediments; Two finger head with crumpety white foam which last for about 2 minutes and then fell flat dramatically (unlike Germans hefeweiss, which usually stay pretty frothy throughout); Small sticky lacing and active carbonation; Very fragrant aroma of banana, vanilla, caramel, malt, clove, and spices; Pleasant taste of light malt, light caramel, earthy yeast, cloves, tartness, faint hint of citrus and grass; Light body, crisp palate; Taste is nearly non-sweet light malt in a very light tart background, with pleasant slight phenol, cloves, and spices; Hoppiness is minimal, with faint citrus taste and almost no bitterness. Finishing is clove and tartness; Slightly dry after taste, very easy to mouth.

Comments: This is a very good but not great hefeweiss. I have to applaud SNs effort in making a hefeweiss on par with the likes of Paulaner, Meisel and Keiler. The minus being a head fell flat so spectacularly and taste is rather monotone and not earthy enough. Its a good one from NS alright, the Germans are still the Hefeweiss expert, though.

Banana, wheat, and sweetness in the aroma.  Straw yellow in color..nicely carbonated with thick white head that sustains.  Beautiful mix of fruit, spice, banana, sweet wheat with the perfect amoutnt of bitterness on the end (slight).  Outstanding!

Good example of the style. Slightly fruity on the nose.  Goes smooth into the mouth with a little carbonation present. Crisp on the swallow with a nice mellow fruity bite. Very smooth overall and just a good beer.
Excellent example of hefeweizen..  Smooth and flavorful with a nice wheat taste.  Perfect for a summer day or anyone who loves wheat or German beers.

Pours a clear lemon cream color with an average head.  The aroma is like many hefeweizens tend to be; bananas, citrus, a bit of malt.  The flavor is all of that, too.  I thought there was a light but noticeable accent on the hops, too.  The close was a bit grassy and bitter.  I liked that.  Ill have this again this summer.

350ml bottle from BeerRitz. Pours a hazy yellow colour with a frothy white head and aroma of yeast, spice, banana. Taste is similar with citrus and a light bitterness. Creamy milky smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation. Very drinkable.

Kinda yellow and hazy, good head, rising bubbles, ample lace.  

Aroma and flavor are full of typically hefe stuff: cloves, banana, spices, bubblegum, citrus, yeast.  Quite typically hef, but to be more specific, its more likely to set the standard than simply be listed as typical of the style.

Body is quite thick, smoothly carbonated, yet easy drinking.

Definitely worth the cost of the sixer.  A must try for hefe fans.
Good scent with a good taste. A really good wheat beer anyway. Good with aftertaste that might disappear a little too fast.

I continued my spring patio low abv tour with this Hefeweizen.  I have to believe that I have tried this before, but I obviously did not give it the proper appreciation.  This beer was every bit as good as a Weihenstephaner.  It poured a hazy burnt orange and had the lively palate that makes these German wheat beers so refreshing.  The flavor notes were caramel and citrus.  I will be grabbing a few six packs of this brew throughout the spring and summer.  Draft - Leons Full Service - Decatur, GA

Best hefe! A hazy golden ale with rich banana note on the nose. The flavors are deep and layered the finish is crisp with wild notes probably from the complex brewing process. It's a must drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy
Draft->shaker.  Pours hazy gold with small white head.  Aroma: wheat, yeast, banana.  Taste is same.  Very good for the style, but not my style.
Ok beer...nothing great of note...wheaty heffeweissen taste of course ...a decent beer

Up there with the the great german breweries. This one is right on style. Nice complexity and very enjoyable. Advantage for this one is the price is right at the distributor. Available year round, but spring into summer is my favorite time. Best american made hefe Ive had.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Nice crisp and dry wheat beer. Very refreshing. Great for summertime. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Nov 2012 - a nice, but fairly average, wheat beer.  Some sweet esters and citrus.  Not enough in the aftertaste for me.

Poured a hazy, light golden color with a big, foamy head that quickly dissipates.  Had aromas of spicy cloves and a bit of banana.  Was moderately sweet, and had a bit of spice on the tongue.  Had an aftertaste of bananas.  Really light for a hefe, but it is a nice sessionable beer for a real good price.

355 ml bottle.
Originally rated on 20100410.
Pours hazy golden color with a large head. Aroma of wheat, hops, ripe frutis and yeast. Flavor of wheat, yeast, hoppy fruits and some hay. Has the usual house flavor.

A decent Hefeweizen but nothing special or flashy.  I would drink again.  Not my favorite from Sierra Nevada.

Pours a terrible cloudy yellow piss color with a small white head which quickly disappears. Aromas are banana, pear and smoke. Not that sweet, not that bitter, just watery. Short finish. Quite disappointing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aromas of orange and banana are moderated by smoke, sawdust and seawater. The taste is sweet and sour with similar flavours. A beauty.

0,355 l bottle  from Bierzwerg.de   BB 09/08/13
First of all: From a bavarian perspective the bottle is too small.  :-) 
Appearance: golden, cloudy, minimal head, white foam 
caramel, bread, cereal, citrus, fruits, hints of banana and clove
medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation
Overall: Only an average Weissbier. Not bad but also not "great". Just average.
Hazy yellow-orange with a fast falling white head. Spicy phenolic aroma. Bready, yeasty flavor with some characteristic weizen spice - a hint of bubblegum. Well done weizen.

A - pours very hazy unfiltered apple juice w no head. S - wheaty, Belgian yeasts, over ripe applesspices (coriander) M - creamy mf. Nice full bodied heff. Uncommonly rich with a little bite. T - Belgian yeast, and wheat notes dominate, notes of bananas, overripe apple and unsweetened citrus, coriander. Nice lighter malty ending. O - very good rather complex heff. Rich and creamy. 7-

Bottle. Pours hazy, deep yellow color. Aroma of fruit, bananas, clove. Taste is semi sweet, good carbonation. Overall, this is a well done beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Cloudy golden color. Thin foamy white head. Aroma of coriander, spice, and wheat. Flavor of spice, wheat, and creamy banana. Nice balanced beer and very tasty.
Bottle a baron. Cloudy Orange thin whit head. clove aroma. palete is too minerally. thin. no malt. fake.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden orange with white head.  Yeasty, wheat, banana aromas.  Yeasty, wheat, citrus flavors.  Pretty nice wheat ale.
Good hefeweizen. Hazy gold pour with small white head. Aroma is banana pudding and yeast. Flavor is similar with a little added sweetness.
Pours orangeish gold with small head that sticks around and leaves a creamy ring of lacing.  Big zingy lemon and pepper aroma.  Taste follows suit.  Very refreshing.

Tap. Pours cloudy golden amber with a small white head and nice lacing. Aroma is the classic - banana, lemon, wheat, yeast. Flavor is about the same, light bodied but chewy, if that is possible. Quite a nice hefe.

On tap at Best if the Bay event. Aroma is straight banana ester and some yeast. Flavor was somewhat ruined by the lack of carb. Very creamy...need some fresh. One of the best hefe's?! Meh.
