On tap at Anchor and Hope, banana aroma and taste, smooth palate, did I mention banana?
One of the best hefeweizen beers I have had.  This beer has a fruity after taste that is just like the bottle proclaims "reminiscent of ripe banana".
From a 12 oz bottle at home.  Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a white head.  Biscuit and lemon aroma.  More of the same in the flavor.  Light and refreshing finish.

Bottle. Pours a deep gold and a frothy head. Smell is of flowers cloves and citrus. Tastes like a very genuine Bavarian Hefeweizen. Mmmmmmm. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: wheat, banana, some clove, yeast, bread and light malts, a touch of floral hops.
Appearance: pours a very hazy straw color, fluffy white head with great retention and lacing.
Flavor: bread, yeast, light malts, some lemon, banana, light spicy hops, low bitterness.
Palate: medium body, medium-high carbonation.
Overall: great brew, very drinkable and refreshing.
Hazy golden with a nice fizzy white head that climbs up the glass. Wheat, bread and spice aroma. Really nicely carbonated, taste of wheat, banana, clove. Great hefe!

Aromas of clove, banana, tangerine, and flowers.  A soft, hazy, yellow-gold, with mostly lingering, white head foam.  Dry, with a very light degree of sweetness probably only perceived through the mellow fruity esters, that is balanced beautifully with spicy, floral hops.  Light-medium bodied, with lively carbonation, and a very clean finish with lingering earthy and fruity notes.

Single bottle.  Pours typical hazy dark gold.  Big frothy head.  Aroma is lots of wheat with some light fruit--taste is very similar.  A little light for me, but an interesting take on a Hefeweizen and certainly worth a try.
On a boat. From a bottle. Delicious smell. The flavor is almost as good. Hoppy and fruity.

Keg @ The White Horse. The pours a deep, hazy egg yolk color with a wispy white head. The nose is strong clove, banana, robust fragrant yeastiness. Sweet, inviting, simple aromas. The taste is very much of a traditional hefeweizen. Banana smoothie, mild clove. Crisp, clean flavors. Hints of marzipan. Light body, very smooth. Overall, this is much better than I thought it would be. A very well crafted beer. Nice stuff.

35,5 cl bottle @ Kahdet Kasvot. Rated on 13.05.2010
Aroma is somewhat sweet with banana esthers, citrus and yeasty notes. Flavour is slightly sweet with yeasty notes, banana esthers, citrus and floral notes. A bit watery palate and light feeling here, at 5,5% this would probably be better. I think this is a bit overrated.

Bottle (12 oz). Thanks to Sebastien F.! Slightly hazy yellow/golden with a small quickly diminishing white head, no lacing. Aroma of wheat, banana, bread, spices and slight citrus. Taste is greenish with banana again, spices, citrus and lots of yeast. Medium body (but heavy for an Hefeweizen). Not to drinkable for the style, but still pretty good!

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2013 Slightly hazy yellow gold with good head that hangs around well enough and leaves decent lacing.  Wheat and grain aroma with banana and clove.  Taste has a wheaty tang with a hint of tartness.  Banana and spicy clove flavors with a bit of pepper.   Sweet up front with almost no bitter.  Moderate mouthfeel and low carbonation.  Good hefeweizen and drinkable.

Pours golden with white head that leaves quickly.  Citrus and clove smell with yeast and just a hint of banana.  Light, watery mouth feel with very little lacing. Taste is yeasty with little to no bitter taste and good carbonation.  Very good and easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 2, 2013 Poured cloudy yellow with almost no head and what there was went away fast.  That was disappointing. Checked the expiration date and it was passed.   Some lacing.  Nose is inviting,  traditional. Yeast, banana, a little spice,some bubblegum.  Its very aromatic so Im hopeful.  Taste follows the nose all the way.  Low carbonation, smooth, a little citrus hops, a little pepper.  Thin and weak.    No legs. Frustrating because it had all the right ingredients but it was  half hearted and lifeless.  A good hefe should be turbid and uplifting.   I expected more.
UPDATED: AUG 25, 2014 Light orange pour, large white head, nose is citrus, taste is citrus, bananas, lovely finish.
UPDATED: APR 13, 2013 A really tasty hefeweizen, nutty and fruity with some spice on the aftertaste. Notes of banana bread and cinnamon. Cloudy golden pour. Very drinkable.
Bottle from my Secret Santa, many thanks. Hazy orange color with small white head. Banana, clove, wheat, yeast in aroma. Taste, banana, wheat, clove, light tartness in finish. Not very impressive.

Strong citrusy aroma. Cloudy, golden colored. Strong citrus flavor with a very smooth finish. Good hefe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy gold topped off by a thin white head. Aromas of spice and apple juice in the nose. Taste is classic hefe - banana, clove, orange - though with a spicy dry hit at the end. Lingering aftertaste. A classical hefe.

Aroma - Banana bread and baking spice
Appearance - Cloudy yellow, like watered down orange juice
Taste - Tastes follows the smell, banana bread, baking spice, sweet but nicely balanced, smooth
Palate - Creamy, pleasant fizz
Overall - Excellent beer, amazing Hefeweizen, right up with 	Weihenstephaner as my favorite of the style.

This is a wonderful German Hefe. Good wheat and citrus notes and the spice make this one. Good golden color with good forming head when pored correctly but little lacing. Good taste and good finish. Enjoyable.
Pours cloudy yellow, big fluffy white head. Banana and spice on the nose. Flavour follows the nose, with a clove sourness in there. Soft carbonation, long fruit spice finish. Lovely.
Hazy orange pour with small off white head. Slightly fruity + yeasty nose. Nice wheaty texture. Semisweet  Light and inoffensive.

Tap at the Pine Box, Seattle - 08/11/12.
2 reviews herewith firstly, and the one I leave my ratings with is the standard beer from tap. The 2nd review was the same beer, parallel tasting but via a Randall. Randall contained less hops than you would expect via Randall but contained 3 or 4 large ripe orange peels to infuse this flavour on the original product!
Non Randall : - Pale hazy light amber/yellow with a thin white head.
Nose comprises wheat, pale malt, grain, light citrus.
Tastes of light yeast tones, touch of nana, clove, touch of diacetyl.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Ok slightly above average Hefe in my book - Im sure there arent too many Bavarian brewers shitting it at this one mind !!!
----- Randalized version infused with hops and orange rind/peel.
Hazed dark amber/orange in appearance with a thin off white head that soon reduces to a pond.
Nose is bitter orange, dung, figs, dried fruits.
Tastes of Seville orange, Cointreau licquer, caramel notes, light spice.
Medium bodied with soft carbonation leading to a fruity finish.
A - 4; N - 7; T - 6; M - 4; O - 13 (Total 3.4).
There you have it - Randalized version shaded it, but more so in appearance and nose than taste!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Draft @ the Ale House. Pours a light golden color with a frothy two finger head. On the nose its smooth and floral wheat, biscuit and a touch of clove spice. On the palate its alot of the same. Well balanced with anice refreshing mouthfeel. Just enough spice and hops to make it interesting but also not overwhelming in the least bit. A nice session beer.

Mild and pleasant aroma. Little to no head retention , no lace. Taste is very mild and refreshing. Very little hop aroma, flavor, and bitterness. Overall it is a great tasting beer, and would recommend it for BBQs.

12oz bottle poured into pint glass.  Hazy dark-ish straw color with thin white head.  Aroma of banana, cloves bread and yeast.  Taste is sweet wheat, more yeast and clove, some sourness, ending on a slight bitter note.  Creamy medium body.  Nice.

Pours a hazy dark straw color with two fingers of eggshell head that diminishes in minutes. Aroma is fruity and sweet, banana, bread and other fruity notes. Flavor is sweet wheat, mild banana, bread dough, and grape. Mild sweet wheat finish. Moderate carbonation, medium body, and a smooth mouthfeel, Highly drinkable. A delicious hefeweizen.
Cloudy light gold pour, creamy white head. Yeasty, herby aroma. Spicy, slightly sweet flavour, a little orange, very little lingering bitterness. Extremely easy to drink.
Looks very watered down.  Aqueous.  Slightly hoppy aroma, mixed with apricots and dirt!  Definitely aqueous flavoring.  Hides the flavors.  Could drink a lot of this, because its not too heavy.

Single bottle purchased at a Utah State Liquor Store in Kimball Junction, Utah on 11/03/2012. Colour: Cloudy medium yellow with orange hints and minimal head. Nose: Strong wet wheat mixed with spinach, malt bread, pepper and herbs. Taste: Medium-light sweet, light bitter, light sour. Very light malt coincides with extremely soft and consistent grain....right through to the finish. Light caramel aftertaste. Not the best SN product but still well constructed.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2013 Hazy, bright yellow, straw-colored.  Really really excellent doppelgänger: reminds me of Germany!  Good description up top...I want to know whos recipe they stole.  Seriously delicious.

Pours a hazy gold with quick to go white head. Aroma of banana, cloves, and yeast.  Taste like yeast and cloves. Sweetness is more on the nose than in the taste. Nice bitter backbone. Very refreshing and easy to drink. Very balanced. Delish.
The head is medium, the body orange cloudy. It smells yeasty sweet. The taste is yeasty a bit malty a bit flat. Not my favourite from this brewery. 10/7/7/8/7/8

(old notes) Hazy golden pour with a thin, quickly-gone head. Aroma is heavy yeast with some orange and clove, not as much banana as most American made hefe. Taste follows - nicely yeasty and spicy, citrus but not much of the banana/vanilla sweetness. Good bit of carbonation.

Definitely one of the better American made hefe/kellers I have had.  More dry, with less banana/estery sweetness that seem to plague many in the style, even authentic German ones.  I could definitely put back a couple of these in a sesh, which is more than I could say for most weizens.
12 oz bottle pours a cloudy golden color with a small white head.  Aromas of banana, clove, yeast.  Light bodied, but complex, a great example of this style

Bottle.  Poured flat the head disappeared so fast I didnt notice it.  A rich cloudy yellow in appearance with a light bread and clove/banana aroma typical of Hefeweizens.  Easy drinking with a soft palate.  A light yet lingering sweet taste of clove, banana, and yeast.  Overall a good American interpretation of a German classic. A nice refreshing drinkable beer.
Bottled. Poured hazy pale golden in colour with a thin whitish head. Perfume and wheat in aroma. Wheat and chewing-gum in taste. Not too sweet, nice hefeweizen.
12oz bottle. Cloudy white yellow colour. Small white head. Some banana. Quite clean. Dry. Not much fruit. Bitterness is rather high for a hefeweizen. Quite nice though.
Hazy golden colour, yeasty, banana and citrus. A very nice hefeweizen

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a very hazy dark yellow with just a thin white head. I took off some for this as a good hefe should, IMO, have a thick fluffy head.

Aroma more than makes up for the poor appearance. Tons of banana and clove as well as a little bit of tropical fruitiness.

Flavor continues with banana and clove but there is also a decent taste of ginger from the yeast presumably. More tropical fruit and a little bit of light bready malt. There is a slight tartness towards the finish but it doesnt really detract from the flavor. Hops are practically not existent but there is a pleasant clean, dry finish.

Overall, really one of the better mass produced hefeweizens out there. A wonderful warm weather beer and a great example of the style.

Bottle from Bierzwerg: Golden pale colour with medium to big white head that "stays". Aromas of yeast (obviously), banana and citrus. More or less, the taste was the same with a hint of ginger. Medium carbonation, light/medium body with a good aftertaste. Overall, a good brew.

Bottle. Grassy aroma with a hint of citrus. Cloudy pale golden with a very light head. Light wheat flavor with a hint of citrus and maybe clove; a bit on the sweet side. Smooth with a bright effervescent feel in the mouth. Light and very refreshing - nice warm season beer.

Bottled 350ml. -from Brewberry, Paris. Hazy orange/golden coloured, medium sized white head, fruity banana nose. Sweet malty, strong banana and yeast with light spicy notes in the finish. Mild and smooth but pretty ordinary and really overrated brew.

Bottle. Yellow hazy. Nose has the ripe banana / clove / yeasty esters, with a creamy-buttery/corn malt backing. Body is well carbonated. Mostly cloves, esters-wise, a bit thinnish even though almost creamy on the palate. Well made weiss, but short on the finish, with a buttery twang. Probably the best american german weiss, but a bit from weihenstephan still..Update: after adding the yeast, the body got a whole lot better.
040712: Good Light cloudy golden beer with fine CO2 level. Ok wheat flavor but a little sharp in taste.
330ml botle. Smells yeast salt bacon, smokey. Tastes smoke, cheesey dough yeast. Really lovely weiss.

Spicy, sweet, bitter, and overall pretty tasty. Clove and bananas dominate a nose that is also Decorated by some resins hops. The body is medium-to-light and cloudy. The taste is less subtle than I was expecting, but I liked it a lot. Quite a good session beer.
Clean, clove nose.  Hazy and medium yellow.  Strong clove start  followed by sweetness/clove...ending with a nice banana flavor.  Moderate chewiness, mild carbonation that disappears quickly.
Oh wow, now Ilike a Hefeweizen, but this is spectacular. Everything I like, bright and light, barnyard and citrus, a bit of spice. I have got to get more of this.

This is a great beer.  Taste is fantastic!  Definitely one I will be keeping around.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured into my Allagash Brewery flute (?) from a 12 oz bottle. It looks like a sort of beautiful hazy orange amber heaven in the glass. I was really too dense to pick out the various components, but I found this to be an incredibly delicious and refreshing wheat beer. It just brings to mind the perfect summer day.

355ml bottle. Banana yellow, but completely opaque. Head is fluffy, but moderately sized. Wheat, clove, banana, orange and dusty yeast in the aroma, but still light smelling. Taste is light fruity sweetness, some herbal hops, clove and yeast. Body is quite fizzy and disappeared in my mouth. Overall, body is so light, but in a delightful way. I almost wish I could have tasted it more as it evaporated in my mouth. Good mix of German and California styles.

12 Fl Oz bottle.  Pours a bright hazy yellow with a clean white head.  Aroma is citrus/tropical fruit with some banana and bubblegum.  Taste is a light to medium sweet.  Have always been unsure of the term umami but to me this might be it.  Mouthfeel is full and lively with a short satisfying finish.  This is an exceptional hefweizen and a great summer beer.
Pours a light golden color with a moderate head. The nose is light and citrusy and very inviting. Light and easy on the palate and a nice finish to a spicy meal. Very good floral and citrusy taste.

Bottle. Banana is big, some spiciness, too. Hazy honey apple juice color, some floaties, little head. Fruity sweetness is strong in initial, mild sweetness in mid palate, and a tingling mild aftertaste. Crisp and light-bodied. Very solid little beer, w/o much character.Yeast sediment didnt want to swirl out of the bottle -- and actually the beer was better without it.
I do like Sierra Nevada. They seem to be able to create beers that are bigger than the sum of their individual parts.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy orange yellow.  Head disappeared fast.  Atoms is orange, some lemon, coriander.  Med light sweet. Slick and slightly velvety   texture.  Light body.  Slight pepper spice.  Easy drinking.  Very refreshing.  Banana flavors come as it warms.

12oz bottle, from Downer Wine & Spirits. Pours a cloudy, yellow-amber color with a white head.  Aroma is fruity, banana, clove, maybe a little orange.  Medium on the palate with creamy carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, wheat, yeast, bubblegum, clove, with a light, malty sweet finish.  A very good Hefe.
Pours cloudy yellow with large white head.  Aroma and flavor both have hints of banana, cloves and bready malt.  Not too complex, but its a nice refreshing beer with a good flavor.
Hazy yellow with nice white head. Faint resemblance to the typically sweet and wheaty hefeweizen. Instead its a bit on the tart/sour side without actually being sour. Interesting.
Not bad. Slightly hazy golden. Some banana aromas and flavours. There is quite a bit of wheat and citrus too. Refreshing, but only a bit above average for me.

Well this hefeweizen seems to be a basic, I cannot tell anything to special about this beer. Still good have not had one I disliked.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: AUG 5, 2012 Interesting aftertaste. Lots of variety thought the time it is on your palate.
Draft in Cambridge, MA. Nice deep amber, cloudy yeast and malt backing. Sweet deeper fruity wheat, good rich body. Not too sweet, interesting take on an American-German hefe.
Given my strong dislike for Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, I expected not to like this brew either. On the contrary, I REALLY liked this beer, mainly because there was an underlying flavor of bananas!
Hazy golden with a nice fizzy white head that climbs up the glass.  Wheat, bread and spice aroma.  Really nicely carbonated, taste of wheat, banana, clove.  Great hefe!

Pours hazy lemon yellow, mild off white head. Nose is wheat, banana, subtle clove, bread, and grass. On the palate, cereal malts, wheat, subtle yeast. Pleasantly rich, yet drinkable. Some mild sweetness and subtle spices. Sessionable for sure.

Lovely cloudy deep yellow colour with a fine alsting white head. Ripe banana and a mild wheat aroma. Not that thick rich texture that the normal german hefe weisse often have. Fresh lovely moderate sweet wheat flavour. A small touch of banana and yeast. Summer party oh yeah. Suitable in all kinds of weather.[Bottle from Auchan Market in Luxembourg]

Draft at pony bar with Brendan and Andrew. Pours a ridiculously hazy orange body with thick white lacing. Aroma is wheat, light fruit. Mouthfeel is lightly carbonated with notes of wheat dominating and lift notes of banana and clove, balanced well.
Tap @ Pony w Andy James. Yellow pour with very big white head and a sweet citrusy banana aroma. Palate is grassy and a tad zesty with medium carb and notes of dry banana and cereal. Good stuff.
On tap at pony bar.   Nice and balanced hefe... Not overly banan or clove where you get sick of it.  Sessionable wheat hefe brew.  Happy with this brew

From bottle to glass. Some clove and banana aroma, but not as pronounced as some of the German wheat brews.  Color is hazy golden with with head.  There is quite a bit of sediment left in the bottom of the bottle.  I hope Im not missing out on any additional flavors.  Creamy texture and a little bit prickly on the carbonation.  Overall, the best American wheat Ive had yet, but I still think the Bavarians do it the best.

Bottled April 21, 2012.

A: Murky orange body with pale straw color on the sides, fine carbonation particles are seen in the body with a decent sized white head on-top, but not the best retention. This is a nice looking beer for the style.

S: This is a sweet leaning aroma with bananas and a nice dose of spicy cloves showing through. This smells very similar to what I remember Weihenstephans hefe, and thats a good thing.

T: A moderately sweet intro of crisp wheat slowly yields to banana that gets progressively stronger and has a nice presence by the finish. A mildly spicy cloves finishes the beer.

M: Crisp medium thickness body with good amounts of carbonation.

O: This is an excellent hefe, on par with the best of them and I highly recommend it.

355 ml bottle.
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma of wheat, light spiciness and light fruitiness as well. Flavour of wheat, dough-like yeast, hay, orange, grains, floral hops and light citrus. Light bodied, thinnish mouthfeel and a light, fruity and somewhat bitter finish. Not very refreshing and quite musty.
Banana flavor and clover.  Crisp and carbonated.  Layer of yeast on bottom.  Golden.   Good here.
Pours cloudy with a small foam head. Bready, slight Esther, citrus zest. bannana, lite malt, very light hop aroma, appropriate bitterness for kellerweis. Hay, basement aromas, dough, earthy
Bottle. Hazy lemon orange with a white head. Aroma is more whit than wheat. Flavour is thin fruit with a wheat and yeast finish. Dry palate

Smells of wheat as on expects. Lively CO2, bit floral with a light/faint hint of citrus zest. Nearly no head. Natual pale golden and hazy in colour. Light sweet at first, showing some bitterness ending in a pleasing sour-sweetness.  Rather light refreshing, silky body. Fizzy with a lingering but pleasant finish.
A favorite summer treat, not too alcoholic or heavy. Nice light, lemony, bready, yeasty taste. Bottle finished, so be sure to get the yeast mixed in from  the bottom.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy/hazy amber color with a medium amount of white head that disappears quickly (little lacing).    The aroma is mostly spicy with major notes of coriander and clove and a small amount of banana.  The taste is more of the same, but with not much banana or citrus present.  The beer is refreshing but there is really nothing unique or distinctive in its flavor that differentiates it from other wheat beers.  This is very drinkable but also pretty standard.

Pours cloudy yellow with minimal head. Aroma has some nice banana and pineapple notes along with some spiciness. Taste is more of the spicy banana-pineapple flavors with a tingly carbonation sensation that rolls down the palate. Highly enjoyable and refreshing.

Solid hefe, nice fruity/banana aroma, slightly hoppy, lemon/citrus dominates the beer, I was hoping for a little more flavor, but still very good nonetheless, great beer for summer, but not spectacular

Pours cloudy, honey gold with a tall, thick white head.
Scent is malt, wheat, banana, cloves.
Taste is yeast, slight lemon, banana...
Nice soft wheat flavour....velvety.
A lot of good taste running through this one.
Quite enjoyable.

12oz bottle. It pours with a huge frothy head and a hazy yellow-orange color.  Smooth malt flavor, hints of banana and clove complexity along with a bit of lemon tartness and fresh wheat bread flavors.  Some bartenders may want to add lemon to this style, but I think its best without.  A refreshing brew.

Bottle 350ml, a cloudy orange beer with medium head. Nose is astringent, aroma is a bit sour and lemony, low complexity and malty, fruit part is a bit low too. On the way to an hefeweizen but stopped on a wit station !

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2012 28/VI/2012 - 350ml bottle from The Bottleshop (Canterbury) @ home - BB: 1/VII/12 (2012-661) 
Cloudy pale beige to yellow beer, very small white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: some citrus, grapefruit, quite some spices, hay, barnyard, little sour, is that bretta? MF: good carbon, light to medium body. Taste: citric start, grassy, some hay, wheat sourness, sweet malts, bit of grapefruit, orange peel. Aftertaste: grassy, hay, bit earthy, bitter hops, some citrus and wheat, a little bit of ripe banana, bitter ending.

Pours a hazy bright golden color. Creamy white head that hangs around. The aroma is banana, yeast, and cloves.  Flavor is lemon, citrus, yeast, spice. A medium to light body and an average level of carbonation. Good beer and light enough to drink a few.  Tastes great served very cold.
Bottle to pint.  Looks good; nice and hazy like a hefe should.  Smells doughy.  Tastes solid witha good mouthfeel.  A good example of the style.

Pretty beer. Deep dark orange with a perfect circle of foam. Aroma has a nice grass and lemon tones over banana sweet wheat and yeast. Taste has some sourness (might be imagined from the lemon flavors) and nice spicy hefeweizen flavors. Very light and refreshing mouthfeel, almost creamy and lots of carbonation. Wow, nice beer.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2013 Bottle from Wegmans.  Pours hazy yellow with a nice, big, white head that hangs around for quite awhile.  the aroma is fairly spicy with a lot of clove and light banana present.  Taste is pretty classic hefeweizen with a little extra spice on the finish.  Very nice.  the palate is pretty thin but you want that in a lighter German-style.  Overall, pretty darn good during the warmer seasons.

Poured from a bottle into a hefeweizen glass.  Poured into the glass a opalescent gold color, swirled the yeast and then added to the glass which produced a cloudy deep gold, the same color as the label.  Lots of head that dissipates with little lacing.  The nose is lots of bannana, lots of coriander, all fruit, very wheaty.  The taste is all that is promised with pure wheaty flavor, lots of bannana, and good spice of coriander.  Palate is very creamy with a good finish that lasts.  Very easy drinking, very sessionable.  Tasty SN offering.

This was excellent. As a wheat fan, I wasnt shocked at the quality of SNs hefeweizen. Another example of why taste parties are such good ideas in this part of the country; this beer was the top choice of all sampled on 6/9/12

Aroma of tons of ripe banana, clove, wheat and some pear. Taste follows nose but I also get some bubble gum sweetness. Plenty of carbonation. Very good and full of flavor. I loved this beer, very well done.
14th December 2009Cloudy gold beer. Fluffy white head. Dry and semi soft palate. Light wheaty malt with a hint of spice. No citrus flavours here. Pretty average tasting but competently brewed.
Cloudy yellow/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of wheat, clove, & bananas; Flavor of wheat, bananas, some clove, and light citrus; Nicely balanced; Good hefeweizen overall.
(draught) hazy gold with small head. Aroma of clove and banana.Flavor is wheat malt, clove, banana, yeast.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2016 BB 27/10/16. Poured a clouded murky (unfiltered) light honey brown with a big bright white frothy head that retained very well, settling to a thin cap; laced well sudsy. Carbonation high, lively and fine. Aroma of light spicy cloves and, subtle banana; not overly yeasty, not very wheaty. Taste sweet banana, soft spicy cloves, sweet pale malt and subtle wheat tines; soft but typical wheat beer. Light to medium body. Smooth, slightly creamy and crisp with a slightly fizzy mouthfeel and a sweet low bitterness finish. Easy to drink.
On tap pours hazy yellow with silky head on top. Nose of clove and wheat. Taste follows inline and good size body for low abv.

Poured into a tulip glass. Light yellow color in the pour. Once settled in the glass it is opaque golden colored with a finger of white head that quickly broke down to a thin covering.
Smells great. Lots of banana, some nectarine and orange.
Nice taste. Starts like a normal Hefe with some banana. Then an undercurrent of bitter takes over with a sparkling water ending.
Crisp with moderate carbonation.
Hefe is not my favorite style. I liked this one because it was not overly fruity. It had just a touch of banana at the beginning and then mixed it up with a more interesting flavor sequence than a normal hefe.
35 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy yellow with a decent white head that quickly fades leaving virtually no lacing. Aroma is banana, yeast, wheat. Taste is banana, yeast, and a hint of malt.
Bottle. Pours an orange cloudy color with huge thick white head. Smells and tastes or orange, lemon and some banana. Very flavorful with a good balance of sweet and tart
bottle-pours a hazy golden colour with lovely white head. A nice banana hit on the nose. a well balanced version of a Hefeweizen. Very enjoyable.

Good beer. Musky cider mash aroma. Murky cider appearance one inch head lots of creamy lacing. A mildly crisp wheat flavor that finished slightly bitter. Very smooth palate,  not my preference but on point for a hefeweizen. Nice balanced beer I can see why it has such high ratings.
Good hefe! Pours great cloudy golden w yeast suspended. Aroma of banana and cloves. Mouthfeel is nice could be a bit bigger but nice. Great hefeweizen freshing on a hot summer (or spring) afternoon.

The smell is of banana and clove. The color is exactly what I would expect of a hefeweizen... pale yellow. The taste is amazing. Overall this is mine and my wifes favorite hefeweizen. Cant get enough!

Cloudy, dark yellow pour with an enormous head that lingers.  Yeasty aroma with clove and spiciness.  Huge banana and clove flavor, very sweet.  Almost tastes like a sugar cookie.  I dont usually like Hefes but I really like this one.  Will definitely drink again.

On draught at Il Bar Albuquerque. Pours a dense, opaque straw color with a slight white head. Slight phenolic character. Light to medium body. Soft wheaty flavor with slight hops crispness. Efferves ent. A nice summer beer.
Pours hazy yellow....aroma of orange spice bananna.. Taste is similar.  awesome beer..very smoth and well balanced
Cloudy golden pour with a big white head. String banana and clove aroma. Banana and clove in the taste along with citrus and yeast. Very lively on the palate. Very good.

Originally reviewed: 8/10/09. Poured into my weizen glass. Pours a very cloudy light gold with a big frothy white head filling the rest of the glass. Retention is fair, and it leaves plenty of sticky lacing all over the glass. Smells spicy with hints of bubblegum and banana bread mixed in. Very refreshing.

The mouthfeel is bubbly and crisp. Plenty of carbonation in this one. This is a very unoffensive Hefe. Nice balance of sweetness and spice. Theres even a bit of a hop bite lingering on the finish. This is a very solid beer that, when in the mood for this style, I would glady stock in my fridge.

Hazy yellow with a whitish head and nice lacing. Aroma of banana, spice, citrus and wheat. taste is about the same, with bolder flavors than most hefes. Medium bodied, smooth and crisp. One of the better ones out there, and one of the few that stacks up against the Germans.

Aroma has a very nice bitter fruity sweet smell. The appearance was an amazing golden foggy color with a nice white head that diminishes within a few minutes which leaves very nice lacing, the taste was very nice smooth and feeling with hints of a banana flavor and some good bitterness malty flavors. Overall a very fine and tasty beer.
Lovely rich hefe.  Found this beer to be more robust with big flavours than a standard hefe, but still has all the trademarks of a good hefe with banana and cloves on the palate.

Pours a cloudy straw. Subdued effervescence. Spice and bananas start strong and linger nicely. The uncharacteristic maltiness doesnt allow the wheat to come through. A nice, rare mix of robust and refreshing.

Bottle. Golden, cloudy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish aroma, faint sourness and light fruitiness with banana. Body is light to medium, malty  lightly wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, light fruitiness with light banana. Finish is short to average, malty  lightly whety and lightly sweetish, faint sourness and light fruitiness. Quite light-bodied "hefe" - lacks the banana. Not so sweet, though.

(bottle) Poured hazy pale amber with a slight white head. Aroma was a bit too subte: lemon with hints of esters / banana. Light body with good carbonation. Like the aroma, the flavour was a little underwhelming, with some spicey yeastiness and hints of banana. Overall, a bit bland, but a decent refreshing beer.
TAP: Cloudy yellow/orange pour with a white head. Banana on the nose. Taste is clove and banana. Flavor is nice a light but not watery.
Pours opaque gold with three fingers of white fluffy head. Smells of wheat, yeast and a hint of lemon. I taste lots of bananas with a bready finish. Very nice beer.

Banana, Cloves and Oats on nose. Appearance is a light, creamy brown color with a moderately large foam top. Taste is a lively, sweet flavor of orange, coriander and subtle notes of vanilla or banana in the background. Carbonation is masked by the pleasantly balanced flavoring. Overall, a nicely flavored malty sweet brew with interesting flavors of vanilla, banana, cloves, oats, orange and caramel. Good drinkability, B rating.
(bottle 16/04-2012) low fading white head, slightly unclear yellow color, yeast aroma, medium co2, slightly bitter, fit body. BB date 01/07/2012.

355 ml bottle into a glass.Pours a cloudy dark straw color, with a small amount of off white head that quickly fades.Aroma is of citrus and yeast. Flavour is complex, with more citrus and some slight bitterness on the attack. Flavors of grass and apples as well. Finish is yeasty and lingers, with lots of overripe banana. Overall a very nice beer.
12 oz bottle pours a cloudy yellow with a white head.  Aroma of yeast, malt and sweet bananas.  Taste was the bananas and yeast.
Excellent example of a hefeweizen. Maybe just a touch more banana for my preferences.

Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a large white head. Aroma is of banana, clove, caramel. Taste starts off a bit sweet  but finishes with some hop bitterness. Well balanced and very easy drinkability.

A: Pours a beautifully cloudy golden yellow color thats surprisingly well blended in spite of its yeasty fog. The head isnt particularly impressive, its a one head white color with mediocre retention/lacing.

S: Theres a heavy noble aspect to this, which leads me to suspect it was well hopped with Saaz, Hallertau, and the like. Beneath the earthiness lies some banana and clove character.

T: I notice the clove notes first and foremost, but also a hit of noble hops on the finish. I also find a bit of citric character buried beneath the weizen notes, an excellent addition, in my opinion. The yeast is noticeable but it never gets in the way on the back end, always a good thing. Flavorful and easy to kill.

M: Very, very well carbonated without being overly so. Medium bodied with an amazingly crisp, subtly dry finish. The drinkability factor is incredible.

O: My favorite American-made hefe, and my favorite Sierra Nevada beer. Not quite on the same level as Weihenstephaners (brilliant, brilliant) hefe, but easily on par with the Ayingers and Franziskaners of the world, perhaps even a touch better. Plus, its cheap and very, VERY easy to find, which is criminal for a beer of this quality. In fact, Id even consider it a go-to beer for me - the highest compliment you can ask for.
Golden colour, nice head, smooth with great aroma. Hints of banana and peach with less medicinal after taste than the nose suggested.
Pours hazy gold. Smells like a Hoegaarden. Notes of banana and bubblegum. Pretty clean. Great warm weather brew!

Pours cloudy, unfiltered and ends with a nice head and lacing. Banana and clove aroma with a sweet flavor. Very nice on a warm day. Similar in style to Blue Moon but with better construction, mouthfeel and taste. Good session brew for Spring and Summer.
Cloudy white yellow colour. Small white head. Some banana. Quite clean. Dry. Not much fruit. Bitterness is rather high for a hefeweizen. Quite nice though.

Good beer overall. Poured from a 12oz bottle into a Hefe glass, properly, the color is a nice cloudy wheat with strands of yeast drifting down. The head is a smooth white, and left almost zero lacing on the glass.

It smells like a banana smoothie, and a slight hint of clove. 

The first impression of this beer is banana. Its very sweet and creamy, until the bubblegum cleans it up half way through. You also get a bit of spicy citrus near the finish. On the way down, the dryness of the yeast, and a lingering taste of those dried banana chips from trail mix hits you. Its all very well balanced, and the carbonation level helps propel those flavors.

Overall, another solid brew from Sierra Nevada. Its not my favorite style of beer, but its pretty refreshing and well rounded.

Appearance was hazy amber golden with huge white 3 finger lasting creamy head, lacing everywhere. Aromas where the stars with bananas,cloves, bubblegum, lemons, bready  cereal honey yeasts. Taste where  sweet  neuctar of  bananas & spices upfront then the lemongrass piney bite at the end. Palate was silky creamy carbonation, medium body with long dryish caulky smooth finish. Outstanding Hefe for the [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Nevada...
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, citruss, grassy hops. Taste is wheat, light yeasty, spices, citrus, grassy hops. Medium body, lively carbonation. 300312

Poured from a 12-oz. bottle into a pint glass. About two fingers of head. Color was hazy wheaty, pale. Nice layer of white lacing that lasted for most of the pour. Non-existent on the sides. 

Smelled of cloves, wheat, grass, grains and lemon. 

Tasted pretty similar to the nose. Got cloves first, but not too overpowering. Wheat and lemon grass.

Medium body. Sticky texture. Above average carbonation. Clean, crisp and refreshing finish.

A pretty good hefeweizen, but coming from Sierra Nevada I expect nothing less. This beer got better as it went down. Definitely would give it another try.

Classic hefe citrus-banana aroma and hazy lemon-yellow color. Nice flavor of wheat and malt against bitter citrus. Almost spicy. Flush body, drinks easy even with the zest. Above average example of an American made hefe.
Shared at a tasting, pours yellow hazy with a small head, aroma of lemon, yeast, honey and wheat, flavor of, yeast, lemon, honey and bubblegum, medium bodied, nice

Hazy colored golden pour. Nose is fruity with hints of banana and slightly floral. Taste is fruity again with banana flavor, on the light side, which makes it 
easily drinkable and a nice thirst quencher. Finish is short and dry, basically a nice thirst quencher, not for hop heads, but than again it is a hefe. A bit boring. Quaff Score 7 / 10

Pours a hazy golden yellow with a white head and aroma of wheat and banana. Taste is sweet, of wheat, yeast, banana, and citrus notes with a dry finish. Drinkable, light, refreshing brew from Sierra Nevada.

350ml bottle.  Pours cloudy, sunshine yellow, snow white lacing.  It looks tremendous!  Aroma: Cloves, banana, bread.  Taste: Ripe bananas, slight cloves, hints of citrus, some breadiness.  Sharp sweet finish - overall, a wonderful beer that Id love to be able to try on tap at some point...preferably in the sunshine.
Pours a bready gold, smells well balanced, perfect on the palette. I really, really like this hefeweizen.

Cloudy golden with lots of carbonated bubbles.  Aroma is soft. Banana and bread. Perhaps some very minor clove. Flavor is a little more authoritative in presence than the aroma.  Initial flavor has a little acidic bite. Followed by malt and banana.

Beutiful beer in glass. Hazy golden color, with a nice pillowy white head. Aroma of citrus and spices. Taste is of bananas, lemon, pepper, and clove. Crisp and clean, a refreshing beer that goes down easy. Would have again
Copper-colored hue. Minimal head and lacing. Aroma reminiscent of cloves, banana peels, and fresh yellow peppers. Crisp, dry mouthfeel with an overall easy level of drinkability.

In bottle. Poured as suggested so a cloudy light golden colour with a huge white head. Lovely aroma of banana, cloves and wheat with some lemon sourness also. Similar flavours with just a little grassy hop character. Bananas linger with a dry finish. Heavy carbonation. Lovely.
Full flavored, sweet from the bready yeast, tart from wheat acidity. There is are big lemon zest notes in the end with faint spicy hints of coriander and white pepper.
Bottle:  Top of the line hefeweizen.  I hope to be able to find one of these beers again soon.

Poured from a bottle into a pint glass.pours a hazy golden color with a two finger head that leaves some decent lacing. Aroma was of yeast and cloves with faint hints of banana. This beer is very complex with flavors with a velvety smooth full palate taste of yeast some hints of clove and a refreshing finish with banana on the back end ....this is one of my all time favorite heffeweizens another great brew from sierra Nevada....cheers
Cloudy pale yellow colour with a white head. Yeasty aroma with wheat and some banana. Smooth, full palate. Yeasty aroma with cereal, wheat, some banana. A decent hefeweizen.
Beautiful golden color with nice haze and white head.  Light clove-banana aroma and taste.  Light bodied hefe.

Pours a somewhat golden yellow. Cloudy and thick white head which disappears quickly. Aroma is grassy and malty. Taste is a fruit salad...bananas, citrus, grape and some pineapple with a frothy almost bubbly complexion.

Long Island, NY - 12 oz. bottle poured a hazy blond color with moderate head and thick spurious lacing. Aroma was of phenolic bananas, a hint cloves and tiny streak of citrus. Taste was slightly sweet with a yeasty banana overtone. Well done German hefeweizen from Sierra Nevada, brings back memories of living in Europe.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From notes.  First reviewed 11/29/2010.  Poured from a 12 oz. bottle into a pint glass.

Kellerweis pours a transparent pale yellow color, leaning toward golden. A frothy white head forms, yielding rocky bubbles, but it fades quickly, leaving just a few islands of foam on top. Carbonation is visible from the bottom of the glass rising up.

A nice bouquet of aromas. With a pale malt backbone, banana and clove really pop, demonstrating the style quite well. 

The light malt is noticeable in the taste, but it does not dominate in any way. Smooth banana and clove flavor really take over, while some light floral hops contribute to the supporting cast in the background. Finishes with a light sweetness and more banana.

It feels bubbly, somewhat dry, and crisp on the tongue. Light body, medium to full carbonation.

This is one that I would be happy with on a nice summer day, sipping away until I forget how many I have had.
Bottle.  This beer has a beautiful golden cloudy appearance, and it smells exactly the way a hefe-weisen beer should.  The taste of bread will hit you like a brick.  Overall an excellent beer.

Cloudy, golden pour. A really well crafted hefeweizen. Strong notes of banana, lemon, and clove on the tongue with a decent bodied mouthfeel. Aroma of citrus, bread, and apple. An easy drinking hefe - tasty and sessionable.
nice aroma with a good cloudy wheat beer appearance. it has a good flavor and just slightly a little too hoppy for a wheat beer.

Tasted from bottle into nucleated pint glass. Poured a cloudy yellow color with fluffy white foam, lasting with lace. Highly aromatic, strong banana and clove, husky whole-wheat bread. Yeasty flavor too, bready with a tart hops balance. Light body but with a dusty/chalky impression from the suspended yeast. Strong carbonation splashed it all around, complex aftertaste eventually finished dry. Another truly delicious brew from Sierra Nevada.

Poured from bottle, was banana color and very hazy. the smell was an overpowering bananas and slight hops, very sweet smelling. The taste is very fruity, especially citrus fruits. Just like the smell it has a sweet taste. Overall, it is a great beer.

Very good. The nose is yeast rolls and some bubble gum and clove. The beer is a hazy orange with a quickly disappearing head.  The taste is clove heavy but balanced with sweet malt and lightly bitter hop.  The body is medium and very smooth with just a great touch of tart crispness. Delicious.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2015 350ml bottle. Glowing cloudy yellow with creamy stable white head. Citrus fresh aroma, clove, wheat and yeast. Nice light and fresh, citrus accentuated composition. Body is minimally too light.
Bottle. Nice Hefeweizen. Lots of citrus and spicy clove. Maybe a bit too much carbonation. Finish is crisp and a bit sour. Tasty.
UPDATED: APR 30, 2012 pours a nice golden hazy, aroma is banana and clove, flavor is banana, clove, coriander, wheat, and bubblegum, med body, great summer beer, my favorite for the style

Straw coloured and cloudy with a thin head and lacing. Absolute citrus fest, particularly lemongrass, hops hint of sugar. Very refreshing. Perfect for a summers day in a beer garden after work. Simple but enjoyable[

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy orange with a large fluffy white head. Smells like wheat, hints of yeasty bread, and mild banana and clove notes of the typical German Hefeweizen. Taste is light, mellow, wheaty with a very faint bitterness and hints of banana. Light-bodied with a smooth, velvety texture and average mouth-carbonation, Sierra Nevada Kellerweis Hefeweizen finishes light, but strongly, a solid wheat flavor.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2015 12oz bottles from Great Grog & Bermerchants.com. Cloudy yellow brown colour, good head. Dry grainy banana aroma. Sweet cereal biscuit banana flavour, spicy clove aftertaste.Sharp but light and refreshing. Easy to drink. Would be better if it came in a bigger bottle.

Hyfsat stort skum över den grumliga ölen. Framför allt citrus i aromen. I smaken hittas citrus och lite banan, men den är på tok för tunn. Att jämföra denna med en "tysk" är som att jämföra en cola från en sodastream med en Coca Cola.

Gulorange lätt grumlig öl utan den tyska weissbierens kraftiga äggviteskum. Doftar nästan ingen jäst utan bara citronig citrus. Citrusbeska och något jäst i smaken. Liknar mer en Zwickl än en German Hefeweisse.

Has the yeasty aroma of a German hefeweisen which I love.  Bright yellow cloudy body.  Yeasty flavor with bits of lemon, clove, touch of banana.  Smooth middle taste with slightly sour end note.  Probably the best American made hefeweisen I have tried.
UPDATED: AUG 30, 2013 Oddly enough, Sierra Nevada?s best beer is their hefeweizen. Furthermore, this is actually one of my favorite hefeweizens.
Pours a cloudy yellow with a nice white head. Aroma is quite wheaty with some yeast and banana. Taste is the same. Quite nice.
This beer taste like bananas to me. has a grass flavor to go with it. im not a huge fan of this style of beer. but it was drinkable

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2012 12 ounce bottle into weizen glass, bottled 8/25/2011.  Pours a nice and hazy golden straw color with a nice 2-3 finger dense and fluffy white head with fantastic retention that reduces a nice cap that lasts.  Some spotty lacing on the glass; and some nice fine carbonation is streaming up from the bottom.  Aromas of big banana, clove, bubblegum, lemon peel, pepper, bread, wheat, and yeast spices.  Fantastic and classic hefeweizen aromas here with great balance.  Taste of banana, clove, pepper, wheat, yeast spices, lemon, and some breadiness.  Lingering notes of yeast spices, bread, clove, and banana on the finish for a bit.  A hair on the watery side, but still has a very nice flavor profile.  Medium-high carbonation with a light-medium body.  A very smooth and drinkable mouthfeel that is highly enjoyable.  Alcohol is hardly even present as expected of 4.8%.  Overall this is an excellent and well balanced hefeweizen.  Very drinkable, enjoyable, and widely available at your local grocery store beer aisle.  Definitely something I will keep in mind next time I want a tasty session beer at a good price.

Purchased at Breeze Thru Wine & Spirits in Milwaukee, WI; enjoyed at home on a Thursday night.  Appearance a very cloudy bright gold with a thin white head that rims around the glass.  Aroma of banana, clove, vanilla, smells like a good weiss beer.  Taste goes down incredibly smooth, banana / candy flavor comes out well, a bit of clove / pepper, solid example of the style.  Its pretty good, doesnt reinvent the wheel but thats alright.

(Bottle) Pours cloudy yellow to pale orange with a white head. The aroma is quite ester-ish with banana and tart pineapples. Clove and incense-like phenols in the background. Doughy and light tart wheat. Light herbal and grassy hops. Touch of vanilla. The flavour is light sweet and light acidic and tiny bitter. Notes of fruits, wheat, light smoke and hops. The mouthfeel is clean, light round and a bit watery. Bananas and mild citrus on the finish. Light bodied.

Bottle at home, poured with sediment as suggested. Opaque pale yellow/orange, thick rocky white head doesnt seem to go anywhere for a while. Nose is big banana, cloves, great hefe character, touch of vanilla also. orange/lemon hops perhaps too. Surprisingly creamy and subtle palate, hint of banana, bubblegum, soft vanilla perhaps, lemon & white pepper hops on the finish. Fantastic mouthfeel - full-bodied and creamy yet really nicely prickly, very impressive.
Pale goldy colour with white head. Smelt bananas and some spices. Texture was creamy. A good beer, easily drunk on this hot day.

A: Straw yellow with a tinge of orange. Moderate white foamy head. Moderate lacing and decent retention.

S: Banana, yeast, wheat. Floral and grass tones.

T: Wheat and lemon up front. Followed by yeast, banana and a nice floral finish. Nice, subtle bitterness.

M: Clean. Crisp. Refreshing.

O: Nice on a warm summer evening like tonight. Nice to SN putting this out on the market... should be a nice, affordable, hefe... hopefully it will replace some of the more mainstream crap hefes out there at a lot of bars.

Bottle 355ml @ Mary McGee, Holstebro
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, banana and fruity hops. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Rating no. 1001 for this beer, which Ive been looking for a long time without luck, for some reason. Slightly hazy golden body, small white head. Nose is clove, banana, sweet pale malts and hints of bubble gum. Pale malts, clove and banana in the taste, like a classic hefe without adding anything to the genre. A bit short on CO2, which makes the beer slightly sticky with the sweet spicy tones. Otherwise, a fair hefe but vastly overrated IMO.

12 fl oz bottle shared by Lubiere (merci!), served cold in a tulip glass. 24SE11.
App.:  Cloudy bright amber with a frail white head.
  
Aroma:  Some grain/cereal/wheat, wet hay, slightly metallic, a bit lemony, light fruitiness, faint esters, a bit of dirty wet ash, some banana bread.
  
Palate:  Medium body, pillowy effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Vanilla, banana esters, wet hay, wheat, a little grass, an unfortunate oxidized fruit note, slightly metallic and tangy, a bit old; dry with very little bitterness and an old apple juice, wheat finish.

Showing its age.
Cloudy appearance with a foamy head.  Blonde color.  Smell is banana and spice.  Creamy mouth feel.  Banana after taste with some peppery notes.  Not bad, but not crazy tasty.
Taste hefe.  Very stereotypically banana and clove with a nice citrusy wheat background.  Very refreshing and easy drinking.  good stuff.
very very cloudy yellow with a thin head.  Typical spicy aroma.  Banana flavour with a slightly sharp edge.

Pours a pale yellow colour and produces a hazy unfiltered look. The Aroma is pleasant honey and wheat odors.....The Flavour is characteristic of a typical german hefe with yeast and banana flavor......the mouthfeel if full bodied for a hefe......not at all thin......overall I rate this beer amongst the best of the best of the hefes.....way to go SNB.....cheers......
Poured a cloudy gold. This beer had what I would expect from a hefe. Not as rich as a German Hefe, but nor bad at all. Would buy again.

Cloudy deep gold with nice head that reduces to a thin overcoat, good lacing.  Taste is strong banana and sweet malt with carbonated bittering showing up midway through.  The finish doesnt quite work for me, continual strong cloying notes of banana and cloves that leave a lingering coating on the tongue.  Each successive bottle tastes heavier than the last, so not much for sessioning.
Bottle. Pale straw with white head. More similar in appearance to a wit beer. Light flavour for a hefe. Mild banana clove action. Good carbonation. Very nice. Interesting.
From bottle. Pours golden yellow, cloudy. Spicy aroma with a little hops. Taste is similar, more like a wit than a hefe. Different. Good

Bottle at home. Helsingborg, November 2011. 

Thanks Marvid! Pours golden, cloudy yellow with a firm white head. Soft aromas of bananas and malty wheat. Quite yeasty with some sweet toffee and hops in the aroma. Light smooth taste with pronounced wheat flavours, bananas and spices. Nice Hefeweizen!

soo for a hefeweizen it is amazing coming from america taking on the big guttsy german weise beers and it does a great job of it with heaps of flavour lasting with that great wheat taste it last making u want more but at the same time light to drink, making it a great session beer to

Bottled, 350ml from Favourite Beers, Cheltenham, Gloucs.  Cloudy yellow gold with off white head, short lasting. Heavy spicing in the aroma leading to the same within the beer, banana and cloves to the fore. Overly sweet, not exactly subtle, didnt really fit the billing.
