Dirty orange colour with a bit of synthetic head.  Cloves and bubblegum.  Nice beer but not as good as a true german hefe weizen.  A little cloying and too refined for my taste in this style.  That said, is good.

Bottle: &nbsp Cloudy straw, a little dirt y, miniscule white head, dies quickly leaving sparce lacing. &nbsp 

Wheaty nose, very faint banana and clove. &nbsp Smooth wheatiness on the tongue, mild sweetness... very smooth this 

is. &nbsp Not heavy on the spices, but body and mouthfeel make up for it. &nbsp Goes down like silk. &nbsp Slightly 

airy, but mainly a good wheat backbone. &nbsp Very clean. &nbsp Simple, yet tasty. &nbsp Could use a smidgen of some 

spices as it warms because it does get a little bit mealy otherwise. &nbsp Great summer quencher, and another treat 

from Sierra Nevada.

25 Nov 2011, bottle. light yellow and fairly hazy, steady bubbles, thin fizzy head. slightly vegetably, sweet malt wheat beer.  thin body and very fizzy. again, vegetably, grassy wheat beer. really not very nice.

A very crisp, clean, beautiful hefe.  I dont find myself picking up a wheat beer all that often, but to me, this one sets itself above any other Ive had.  Pours beautifully - very cloudy with a nice white head.  Finishes clean - goes down easy, but is never weak or watery.  Wheat and yeast flavors are prominent with less citrus than your garden variety wheats.

bottle pour. cloudy light orange in the glass with a nice thick head that is here to stay. aroma of clove, banana and spice. medium body and a very active beer. taste follows what you smell but with some nice hop flavor as youd expect from Sierra Nevada!

Bottle from King&Godfree. Very tasty, malt-driven. Aromas of banana, caramel, and hints of nuts. Taste is sweet, with light bitterness, and average length. Palate is oily, and medium bodied. Yellow, cloudy, with a frothy head.

Tasted on 11/6/11 from a 12oz bottle purchased at Kroger in a mixed six pack.  Pours cloudy yellow with a very light orange tint and a thick, rocky white head that slowly recedes to a nice collar.  The nose is quite earthy with nutty banana, clove and other baking spices, and a bit of bread malt.  The flavor has a bit more bitterness with the baking spices and bread malt up front and the nutty banana earth on the back of the palate.  The body is medium, but the carbonation is very lively and mouth-filling, creating a creamy texture, and a long spiced banana an lightly bitter finish.
Truly awesome Hefe...Beautiful milky, golden orange with a nice white head -  spicy, floral and a clean dry finish.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Bloomington, Indiana, USA

text: Orange-y yellow in color, with a medium head. Tastes great, and has the strong fruit and spice flavors that you would expect from a hefeweizen.
Bread, hay, banana, citrus, floral, very easy to drink. I love the banana notes that pop up in the drink a little later in the drink.
bottle; hazy golden with small white head; aroma-bread, banana, dough, citrus; taste-medium sweetness, mild bitterness, moderate carbonation. Very decent

Bottle - pours a pale cloudy yellow with a frothy white head and a blizzard of bubbles.  aroma is fruity with cereal and a hint of yeast.  dont really get the banana but there is a hint of bubblegum.  nice clean finish.

355mL bottle poured a slightly hazy golden color with about 1 finger of white head and some traces of lace.  Aroma is citrus and wheat with a trace of yeast.  Taste is light malty sweetness with some orange zest and mild hoppy finish.  Pretty darn tasty.
Beautiful. Like orange juice and toast. A very nice Hefe. Even my friends who hate wheat beers can tolerate this one.

A hazed amber hefeweizen with a thick off white head. In aroma, a grassy herbal sweet honey and fruity esters, solvent notes, some light peaty notes. In mouth, a sweet banan with dry powdery spices, chalky, a bit old and tired. Tasted with Probstk.

Another addition to the AW Beer Hall of Fame!!!  Served fridge-cold, this brew poured up a hazy, cloudy golden amber colored body with a hearty pearl white colored foamy head with amazing retention and lacing effects. Aromas and flavors of wheat grains, lemon-grass, hops, apricots (maybe a tease of tangerine?) and something akin to wild honeycomb.  Light to Medium in body, this brew is absolutely like velvet or silk on the tongue!  Very creamy with a crisp, clean finish with just the right amount of bite from the hops to make for an easy-to-drink hefe!

12oz Bottle, poured at RIFT calibration tasting. Surprised to see that I hadnt in fact already rated this one. I thought it was the easiest drinker of all the examples we tried, even though it denuded a lot of the classic flavors. Very clean, but also very safe, which detracts from some of the rich fruity and yeast joy of the style. Slammable, however.

pours straw, hay color. egg white structure 2 finger head. retention is quite long.

light pilsner aroma. bananas. cloves. mmm. spicey

wow. quite delicious. fruity. malts are light. little hops.

carbonation is low. mouthfeel slightly cloying.

pretty good. great for a session beer.

It seems one doesnt find stellar wheat beers outside of Germany and this sample doesnt prove otherwise. Fresh enough on the nose with pepper and sweet lemon but otherwise a bit pedestrian to taste. More spicy lemon but quite suble, leaving me a bit underwhelmed.
Pours a hazy pale orange with a thin white head. Aroma of honey, yeast, and banana. Flavor of yeast, banana, and cloves. Pretty good.

Appearance is opaque orangish yellow with 1 finger of whipped egg-white foam that fades to a nice skin.  Aroma is farty yeast, spicy clove, and banana.  Taste is all of the above plus a delightful cereally wheat character.  Body is light to medium, sticky, average carbonation, spicy aftertaste but a bit watery on the finish.  Overall, a tasty wheat and my favorite American example of the style.
Golden yellow, white head. Aroma of yeast, citrus and wheat malt. Too much like ale. Flavour has banana, citrus and some tartness.

Pours a cloudy gold with billowy white head.  Head recedes within a minute.  Aroma of banana bread and slight clove.  Taste hints of clove.   Mouthfeel is smooth, but the carbonation bites the tongue.  Wow.  Finished this one quickly.  That was a tasty beer.  Not the best hef Ive had, but close to it.

Hefiger, aromatisch gewürznelkiger Geruch. Süßlicher hefiger Start. Im Mittel aromatisch, nelkig und gewürzig. Sahnig, zitronig-herb abfließend.
Nicht übermäßig ausdrucksvoll, dennoch ganz nett und schmackhaft.Test vom 10.11.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche

Pours a cloudy light yellow with a decent head on it out of a bottle.  Aroma is banana and citrus, as is the flavor.  Its a really nice hefe.  Though Sierra Nevada has been distributed to my area for quite some time, Im only now starting to really appreciate their beers.  My 300th Beer!

From a 355ml bottle on 22/8/2011. Pours an extremely cloudy straw colour with a small head/ Has a light aroma of banana and a touch of citrus. Flavour wise, there are no real surprises - more banana, spices and a slight lemony tang at the back. All up, this is a refreshing and well put together hefe.

355ml bottle from Dan Murphys. A cloudy orangey-golden beer with a smallish white head for the style. Spicy nose with strong banana, cloves and some citrus. Taste is medium sweet with a soft spicy citric finish. Medium bodied with a lively carbonation. A decent Hefe.
12 ounce bottle, nice aromas of banana, and clove, with the flavor to match.  a decent hefe to cook out with.

Great looking hazy golden pour with a thick creamy head. Lots of banana and clove spice, even a hint of hops there too. Light body and quite lively carbonation with a creamy like texture. A beauty pared with Summer and fresh seafood.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy honey colour with a fluffy white head of medium size and high carbonation. Fresh, spicy aroma. Sweet malt body with typical spice and some banana. One of the best examples of the style and also one of the easiest to drink. Very good.

This is probably the best American version of a hefeweizen that Ive had. It doesnt quite match up to some of the great Bavarian examples like Weinstephan or Franzsikaner but it is still good. There is a nice estery clove and banana character with slight hint of sulphur. The beer has good hop bitterness and a lean dry finish.

Bottle in a weizen glass. Pours hazy honey with rich white head. Aroma is banana and mild spices. Taste is sweet and slightly bitter. Goes down easily and leaves almost no aftertaste. Overall, an average beer that is easy to drink.

Love me an unfiltered hefeweizen. Cloudy and robust wheat flavors. Heavy banana on nose. Light hops on finish. Bananas and cloves all over the place. Not very elegant but very drink in the hot sunable.

A faithful hefeweizen, down to the deliciously cloudy pour - the most opaque hefe Ive seen in a while. The usual banana and clove phenols are livened up with fresh apple and a little spice, with a light citrus finish not unlike Belgian witbier. The malt doesnt assert itself a whole lot in flavour. Creamy body from the sediment and wheat. Light-to-medium sweetness and a pinch more bitterness than most German examples. Very refreshing.

12oz. bottle.  Sweet, spicy aroma, full of yeast esters and wheat grain, with notes of banana, clove, bubblegum, honey, and light citrus.  Thoroughly cloudy light golden color (bottle swirled and poured) with a foamy, lasting head of white.  Well-balanced flavor profile, with honeyish, grainy, lightly toasty and wheaty malts, tropical fruit, spices, very light bitterness and a certain light, cleansing, refreshing citric tartness appearing towards the finish.  Creamy and effervescent on the palate, light-bodied.  Just a really refreshing, tasty, well-made German-style Hefe, this is not the first sixer that I have picked up, nor will it be the last.

Stubby bottle pours to a hazy looking gold brew.  Leaves little or no head.
Aroma is not the best but this is compensated by a very deep an complex flavour. Average palate.
Im thinking I got a really bad bottle after reading the reviews but its not something Id be hurrying back to.

The first time I had this beer I really didnt like it. Maybe it was the presence of banana in the flavor. After subsequent tastings, my impression has improved. Solid, but not something I will find myself going out of my way for.

Stubby 12 oz bottle into a 16 oz tall pilsner glass. Swirled and poured in the last 2 ounces. A - Cloudy light orange/dark yellow body. Dirty soapy off-white head. S - Fairly typical hefe smell. Wheat, lemon grass, clove, black pepper and a hint of meat. T - Similar to the aroma. Light wheat flavor and some lemon and belgian yeast. Mild spice and sweetness towards the end. Faintest hint of bannana. Carboantion is nice, but the bodys pretty thin. O - Witbiers really arent my style, so much so that Allagash white was a drainpour for me. Something about the clove, black pepper and lemon grass that reminds me of lunchable grade sausage. I can do hefes though, and this one is really solid. Certainly the best American hefe Ive tried. As always with SN, its priced extremely well too.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours a hazy amber with a small white head. Banana iand cloves immediately hits the nose. Much the same in the taste with some sweet yeast and orange peel. Nice sessionable hefe

Bottled. Pours hazy and pale amber with a medium sized white head. Nose of spices, bananas, cloves and yeast. Medium sweet flavour with yeast, bananas and spicy + wheat notes. Medium bodied, watery texture and average carbonation. Ends up more dry with alittle bitterness. A nice and crisp hefeweizen.

[3829-20110723] 12floz bottle. Mild orange peel aroma. Hazy, pale orange body with a quick bubbly white head. Shredded orange peel bread flavour. Medium body. Drinkable, repeatable, nothing super special though. (6/3/6/3/11) 3.1+
(From Premier Gourmet, Buffalo, NY)
Dirty golden pour.  Nice aroma.  Wonderful wheat flavor with a little spice at the end, very refreshing!

2011-07-22. Hazy pastel yellow, small white head. Mild aroma, sweet banana esters, light wheat notes. Flavour is similar, sweet fruity character, muted banana notes, mild wheat character. Sweet pale malt. Average plus palate. Enjoyable wheat beer. Bottle from Premier Gourmet, Buffalo
Full flavored wheat ale.  Pours yellow/orange and very cloudy.  Lots of spices, fruit, grass through the palate.  Enjoyable, and a good hefe, but a little thick and sugary for my taste.
Cloudy golden yellow colour with a medium white head. Aroma is clove, banana, and wheat. Taste of lemon, banana, clove, and grain. Nice summerbeer.
Sample @ HBF 2010. Originally rated on 9.4.2010. Decent hefeweizen. Slightly hoppy and spicy.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a German wheat beer glass.Appearance: Yellow/dark golden-brown hue. Very hazy but some translucency. Plenty of carbonation visible, no yeast chunks, though. Forms a large, bright white, foamy head which retains very well and laces the glass.Smell: Sweeter than a German hefeweizen with light banana and clove-like scents, combined with flowers and candy. Taste: Theres a definite distinction between German and American wheat beers and right off the bat, Kellerweis plays into safer American territory. The palate is remarkably light and clean - the first two descriptions that come to mind upon the initial swig. Light banana candy, clove-flavoring and a melange of spice rack spices are all prominent throughout the palate. Despite this complexity, the actual robustness of the palate is mild throughout. It doesnt taste like any kind of supermarket brand "summer wheat ale", yet it doesnt have the pure energy I look for in a hefeweizen. Not that theres anything off-putting to the taste here, though. The candy-like sweetness is overt from beginning to end with a hint of bitterness in the middle and a quick burst of authentic clove and other spices right on the finish. Mouthfeel: A little thicker than most American beers of the style. Slight carbonation tingling sensation. The aftertaste is clean as a whistle.Drinkability: While I wouldnt jump for joy for this beer overall, I can honestly say its sheer drinkability value alone is amazing. The mild palate, soft mouthfeel and clean aftertaste make it an absolutely perfect beer for the warmer months. Definitely the kind of beer Joe Six Packs and beer nerds alike can chug and enjoy and at 4.8% ABV can be so for long durations.Overall, Kellerweis is probably one of the better American hefeweizens Ive had, but its still just a good beer at the end of the day.

On tap at US Beerfest, North Bar, Leeds. Pours a happy, hazy yellow, with a big foamy, yet unintrusive head. Aroma is nice - spice, citrus, yeast. Taste is slightly refreshingly sour, with banana, lemon and hops. Finish is a bit watery, but refreshing. Very nice indeed, hits the spot perfectly and is a great summer beer - I was maybe just expecting a touch more from it. Still very nice, though.

Pours a lively sunny color with a cloudy character.  Nose is citrusy with a little bit of yeast and hints of banana.  Taste is lemons with bread malt and a bit of spice.  Mild carbonation.  Medium bodied.  Excellent session beer.
Grabbed a sixer for hot July week.  Pours light straw yellow with huge foamy head.  Tastes of cloves, bananas, yeast, some citrus, and grain.  Nice easy drinking

I followed the pouring instructions that are so kindly included on the label... Light hazy gold liquid, very attractive. Thin white head. Huge spicy aroma! My happy nose also detects banana and floral notes. Flavor is zesty and zingy, with citrus juiciness. Great tingly carbonation. A bit watery finish. Overall a great example of this refreshing Summer style.

Sierra Nevada Kellerweis has a very thick, fluffy, white head and a hazy, yellow appearance with some bubbles streaming up and a nice amount of lacing left behind in splotches. The aroma is of white bread and slight banana, and the taste is likewise of white bread and banana, with coriander and a tad of hop bitterness present. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Sierra Nevada Kellerweis finishes wet and very drinkable. Little aftertaste is associated with this. Overall, the beer is quite enjoyable and I rate highly. Try it!

RJT

I have tried this beer three times and still cant like it. Sorry for those who rated this high. Beautiful pour, the smell was too yeasty and not enough bready notes. It felt like the makings of a wheat beer without the wheat. Yeast Water. Couldnt drink much of this even on a hot day. One of the worst Hefeweizens I have had. Sorry Sierra Nevada. Beer Disciples Rating: C- 62/100

Appearance: Light-Medium gold; hazy, not quite transparent. Fine, velvety texture.

Aroma: Banana; spicy; wheat; earthy clove; hint of lemon

Flavor: Banana, Cream-Soda like consistency, very clean after taste. Balanced by a earthy, spicy clove base. Rich, but not overbearing; More light than heavy. A nice bouncy kick and after taste.

Mouth feel: Medium bodied; fine effervescence; smooth and really well balanced. Pretty fun to drink, actually.

Drinkability: Very easy, unoffensive, classic

Serving type: bottle

Opens lively, pours like a rampant champagne. Big wads of yeast drop to the base and dissolve into the mad flurry of fine carbonation that pushes up to the surface with lightning speed. The head is huge, a beautifully formed billowing white cloud that lifts a good inch atop the rim of the glass. It holds for the length and laces well. The body of beer a sandy yellow and opaque, definitely spot on for appearance. A little sulphury at first is the nose, sweaty socks, then  a good waft of unripened banana and fresh zested lemon, a little clove-like phenolics, gritty wheat and damp toothpicks. Tangy, sweet juicy bananas, limes and lemons hit the mouth first, a little vanilla ice-cream softens it with a good base of wheat malt across the mid-palate, clean and smooth. Good body, firm mouthfeel without becoming clammy, the carbonation spritzy just on the tip of the tongue. Mild phenols play late, it fades off quickly in the swallow.  Keeps good, very refreshing overall, just lacking the delicacy of Bayern weissbiers. Still, a solid example of the style, nice. I could easily throw these back all day! (12fl/oz, No- 108810832, Cellarbrations Carlisle)

Interesting - a little sweet, but generally  good interpretation. LOTS of banana and candi sugar like notes on the nose. Really sweet candi bananas throughout with a short finish. Easy drinking, but a little cloying for me. Will stick with the Weihenstephan, but this would do in a pinch.

355ml bottle. Pours a cloudy straw gold, with a huge white head, which lasts very well. It has a classic sweet and fruity weizen aroma, with a touch of cloves to pique the interest. More bitterness up front than one would expect of a German hefeweizen, but this mixes well with sweet banana in the body. A long, dry finish has hints of cloves and cinnamon. As a weizen, this was never going to be an especially complex brew, but it does have enough going on to sustain my interest.
On tap at the Euston Tap, London. Reasonable plainish beer. Some wheat, some paper. Smooth, plain, quite refreshing.

This is one of my favorite session beers.  Slightly hazy straw color.  Banana, bubble gum and clove nose with a clean refreshing flavor that matches the nose.  Just complex enough to keep you interested but simple enough to not have to think too much about it.

Beautiful orange-yellow color with good foam. The smell is pleasant and yeasty banana, also slightly clovy. starts very creamy, yeasty, grainy and slightly clovy. Slight banana aroma in the background. The aftertaste has much banana aromas, clove disappears almost completely. The further course is pleasantly creamy yeasty. Not as bitter as some German Weizen.

What a great recommendation from a friend! Poured a foggy and faint yellow, with a big white fluffy head. Smelled thick of bread, bananas, and honey with subtle hints of hops. The flavor is just as great. Notes of wheat, honey and bananas confront the taste buds. Undertones of hops, vanilla and spices put this particular brew over the top. Fantastic all over, this is a Hefeweizen that would do a German proud.

Bottle at home.  Aroma:  yeast, citrus.  Appearance: cloudy, dark gold.  Taste:  sweet with a little sour note, citrus.    Palate:  fizzy, medium to full body.   Overall:  amazing, great example of the style and extremely enjoyable.

Quality pour: 1.5" white head with lacing to match (a new ring every sip). Cloudy yellow-gold beer. Aroma is super yeasty with the expected banana and clove. Palate is extremely soft. Beautiful bready finish. Sierra replicated this style perfectly, and putting it head to head with German imports (Ayinger, Weihenstephaner), it sometimes wins, because its fresher. Now if only we could get them all side by side at their freshest...
Hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, banana and yeasty. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 040910

Pours hazy..like the bitch should. Nice pillow of a white head atop the body. Seemingly good retention. Nice powerful clove and banana aroma and possible some bubblegum notes.  Taste is slightly tart and full of wheat malt flavors and various ester like qualities and some spicy bite but not a whole lot.  Finishes somewhat tart and medium full body for the style and creamy like it could be a little light on carbonation but satisfying.  Overall the banana comes out in the aroma a little more than the clove and the flavor favors the spicy phenols and wheat malts.  I liked it.

Color: very cloudy yellow lighter hue them most, with completely white head.  Smell is plenty of wheat, lemon, honey, and slight peppery spiciness.  Flavor is very sharp of lemon peel with some wheat, grass, lemon, and an earthy note.  Not sweet at all.  Almost need an orange to balance out the massive acidic lemon notes.  Good beer, although I dont think ill be buying this one again anytime soon.

10-JUN-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer.
Hazy yellow with lasting white head.
Smooth yeasty spicy weat nose.
Orange peel, clove, banana and weat on taste.
Quite some hoppy bitterness but also a little too sweet.
Really smooth weaty palate. A little lemon helps balance the sweetness.
Nice brew.
Pours a semi-cloudy yellow color with a decent white head.  Aroma is wet bread and citrus.  Smooth refreshing taste of sweet malt, bread dough light citrus and a bit of banana.  Quite good!
6/10 i mörkhet. Luktar sött, fruktigt och besk. Fruktigt besk i smaken med en mild besk eftersmak.

Bottle pour into tulip. The nose was luscious, giving off strong smells of banana, citrus, light peach, zesty spice and yeast. The pour produced a light honey colored body and a quickly disappearing white head. Taste is slightly yeasty with some bread like malts and some citrus coming through. Pretty darn good.

Best American hefeweizen I have come across to this point...Sierra Nevada really nailed this one. True to the Bavarian style that got me into hefeweizens, bananas and cloves on the nose, good spice notes and fruity undertones on the palate, and it could not go down any smoother. This ones a winner.
Good Hefe. A nice bana, clove and sweet malt aroma and taste that finishes with a hint of sweet candy and citrus.

Pours a hazy straw-yellow with a large, foamy white head.  Good carbonation keeps a thin head and promotes a noted and pleasant wheat aroma with a whiff of banana and clove. Classy wheat taste brings tones of lemon throughout with some spicy clove and a hint of banana underneath.  Wheat grain aftertaste leaves a clean and slightly sticky mouthfeel.  Nice summer beer, and the aroma/taste immediately makes me think of a late summer wheat field.

Poured into a pint glass. Aroma is spicy cloves and sweet fruity esters along with a banana and pineapple presence. Appearance is hazy gold with a medium sized fluffy white head. Some brown specks in the white head from the yeast sediment. Taste is spicy cloves up front moving toward yeasty, fresh baked banana nut bread. Nice bubbly carbonation on the tongue and medium bodied. Easy drinking.

Bottle from Alexander Wines, Coventry. Full haze with a foam the density of Gillette. Aroma of banana shrimps, galangal and lime. Pleasant banana, clove and toffee apple spiciness finishing with a hint of bitterness. Chew of rubber; esters watered like a Kristall or commercial European weizen (Grolsch). Pleasant drinking but the weakest SN beer Ive tasted.

Poured a beautiful bright hazy gold with a nice headed that had a slow fade to lacing.  Aroma was of sweet malts and wheat with a nice hop backing.  Taste was fruity with hints of cloves, bananas and citrus prodominating the malty backbone and the finish was moderate hops without much bitterness.  Palate was good.  Overall, a nice hefeweizen!
user_location: Town of Maple Creek, Wisconsin, USA

text:
Pours a hazy light golden color with a fluffy white head that dissipates quickly but leaves lace all over.
Smells of clove, banana, phenol, and a restrained sweet honey malt deep underneath. Taste is more of the honey and sweet malts with some cloves and spice. Light body, medium carbonation, creamy mouthfeel. Nice light easy drinking brew.
(bottle)  Great aroma of yeast and citrus.  Nice looking complexion.  Flavors of Weiss, banana, vavnilla with lemon.  A solid Hefewiezen by Sierra Nevada.  (200th rating)
Nose with nice wheat and citrus.  Well balanced with medium body.  Citrus and yeast abundant.  Nicely balanced and a great wheat in a world of bland.
a solid example of hefeweizen.  it pours pale yellow with thin white head, the aroma is clove and banana, quite tasty.

Pours a well-hazed golden body under a lively, sudsy white head. Tart, dusty aroma of green banana and grains, with lighter notes of sour milk, clove and leafy green vegetables. Soft, dry mouthfeel, fulfilling on the palate, yet not "heavy". Wheaty banana flavor, tart and dry. Long-lasting aftertaste. A refreshing, summery Hefe, true to style, on one of this years first truly summery days in Chicago... although I felt a little bloated after I enjoyed two bottles. ~~~~~~~~~~~~ 6 pk./12oz., Foremost Liquors, Oak Forest, IL

Bottle. Pours Cloudy golden yellow with a fine, white lacing. Aroma predominantly of wheat, citrus, and light spice. Flavour of wheat, lemon, wood. Quite floral. Initially bitter on the tongue, then softens to a silky/buttery mouth feel- yet still lively. Very refreshing.

12 oz. bottle, pours hazy golden yellow with a white head. Very wheaty aroma with banana, clove, citrus and orange peel. Flavour of banana, clove, wheat and orange peel - banana and clove flavours linger. Very well-made hef.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2012 Re-rate 2/29/12: Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks zvikar.  Hazy pale yellow color with a white head. Wheaty and fruity aroma with lots of citrus, some banana and light spiciness. A pleasant sweetish mellow flavor, fruity and lemony. Medium-bodied. Nice and refreshing. 7/4/7/3/15=3.6

Bottle sample at a blind Hefeweizens tasting. Thanks Mark. Lovely cloudy yellow color. Aroma of wheat and nice fruitiness (banana, citrus). Sweetish fruity flavor with a bit of bubblegum and light spicy and tart notes. Medium-bodied. A good Hefeweizen, my 1st place of the tasting. 7/4/7/4/14=3.6
grassy and bubblegum aroma; cloudy hazy wheat pour with large white head.  taste a little banana, great palate!  solid hefe!!!

A 12oz bottle from Picks Liquors poured into an English Pint. 

Hazy golden color with minimal white head. Nice lacing though. 

Not much there by way of aroma. Slight hint of bananas but mostly doughy yeast. 

Taste is slightly sweet and slightly sour. A bit of an aftertaste of salt. 

Light bodied and thin textured, way overcarbonated and a abrupt finish. I maybe taste the clove, but definitely not the banana. Pretty much just tastes like overcarbonated water...with a little kick.

Overall, I dont like this beer. Not much in the way of taste. Ill finish this one, but probably wont be buying it again.

Very light and hazy yellow with a thick white head.  A good banana and fruit aroma arrives just before a really nice citrusy flavor of a good wheat beer.  This is excellent and shows that us Americans can make a good Hefeweizen.

Bottle from South Bay Drugs: Created a thick frothy foam head which left a ton of lacing behind down my glass, and the liquid was a glowing yellowish white color. My nose was instantly gratified once I took a sniff because of the high quality of yeast bringing out banana, clove and gum ball machine bubble gum aromas. The flavor is clean and pure German hefeweizen fashion with a base of wheat and spicy yeast that not only holds it ground with clove and banana but also a bit of mint or green rosemary not yet dried. Fantastic beer that Im already spreading the word about to people who like hef styled beers. I hope to see this more available in distribution because being summer Im sure to pick up another sixer of it.

Bottle purchased at Consumers Beverage Niagara Falls. Pour is a cloudy golden yellow. Fast thick white head and some cascading white lacing. Aroma is not very strong and slightly metallic, there is a little banana peal in there as well. The taste is very light, with some banana right away and a slight bite on the finish. Pretty typical German style, great on a hot day.

Bottle. Cloudy with a small head and left no lacing. Lots of wheat flavours present but nothing else, which is one of my criticisms of this style. The wheat leaves no room for any other flavours. Quite pleasant but not really my thing.
Has a milky yellow color. Hints of banana and citrus in the aroma and taste. Has mild bitterness but finishes on the dry and sweet side. Very well done brew.
Straw color with tall foamy white head.  Fresh citrusy, yeasty aroma.  Taste: notes of lemon, clove, yeast, spice and wheat.  Fresh tasting, easy drinking, refreshing light body, good summer beer.

12oz bottle. Light yellow color, very foggy with a decent head. Leaves lots of lacing on the side of the glass, an attractive feature I think. Banana aroma. Crisp palate, nice, consistent and refreshing finish. Sweet initially, with a short sour aftertaste. Very drinkable, "refreshing", even.
Hazy orange of color with a small white head. An aroma of wheat, sweets and bread. A flavor of bread, sweets, wheat and flour.

If subtlety in Hefeweizens is your thing, give Kellerweis a pass.  This beer takes each individual aspect of a wheat beer and dramatizes the living hell out of them.  The looks are ridiculous; the billowing head on this bastard threatens to overtake the kitchen, while the cloudy liquid beneath tempts you with its oddly bright murkiness.  And to simulate the aroma, simply insert a banana into one nostril and a clove in the other, then snort.  Tastes like the biggest hefeweizen in history, yeasty tartness intertwined with the aforementioned nose-pluggings.  Hefes get no love amongst the hop-addled set, but Kellerweis deserves its due; this beer is best US-made wheat-bomb Ive found yet.

Bouteille bue dans un restaurant de Burlington. Cette bière une fois servie est très pâle, peu de mousse cétait formée. Jai pensé quelle était filtrée. Le nez est peu odorant, il est de blé et léger. Des notes dépices et de banane sont perceptibles. Le corps est mince, elle est agréable, facile à boire et aigre en finale. Une mauvaise bouteille ?
Bottle.Pours cloudy yellow with a big white head.Aroma of toffee, banana and wheat.Flavor is sweet with some acidic notes.Medium body, average carbonation.
I like hefewizens, and was hesitant to try out the "american" version... I was pleasantly surprised. Very nice beer, its going into the rotation.
Im not such a beer snob that I will follow Sierra Nevadas advice and pour two third of this beer, swirl and then pour the rest. Interesting advice though.
Okay hefe with the usual amounts of bubblegum flavor, cloves, orange tones and peppery malt backdrop.

On tap at urge in Poway. Murky swampwater yellow-orange. White head to gooey lace. Taste lemony tart yeasty with hints of cinnamin. Creamy back. Inoffensive and drinkable but not outstanding for style.

Very hazy gold pour, with a smooth, pillowy white head.  Amazing hefe aroma with a load of ripe bananas, slight clove, and some lemony notes.  Taste is pretty wheaty, with a return of the ripe bananas from the nose, very slight bubblegum and clove tones.  Smooth, full bodied, nuanced, sweet, clean finishing.  This hefe is fantastic.

My favorite of my least favorite style. Pours a hazy gold with a nice white head. Full bodied, lacking the esther-y flavor profile I associate with this style, although the banana is in the nose. Easy to drink, easy to like.
12 oz. Poured star/golden with a dense white meringue-like head. Smell was super yeasty, with lots of orange peel and clove. Light on the palate, the flavor was doughy, lightly tart, very refreshing.

On tap on the home kegerator. Works out quite well.

Pours a nice light copper color with a good white head and some pretty sticky lacing on the way down. The nose is all about the American C hops with some excellent citrus notes throughout. The taste is slightly-bitter citrus hops with a very mild malt presence in the background. Not excessively bitter, but does the job right. Drinkability is really high, as this is perhaps the most classic of all the craft beers.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-25-2010

Cloudy golden pour topped with a foamy white head.  Clean clove, fruity aroma.  Medium body mouthfeel with nice ample carbonation level.  Sweet banana fruity taste with a crisp clean finish.  Another excellent beer from Sierra Nevada.

Appearance:  cloudy gold, nice head.   Aroma:  citrus, wheat and banana (bubblegum and butterscotch?).  <Taste:  wheaty and full, balance of spices.   Finish:  	medium, smooth and bready, yet crisp.   Notes:  Very enjoyable HW, probably the best American version Ive had. Great full mouthfeel, and yet very crisp and refreshing.  Flavors were pretty complex, yet balanced and somehow simple as well.  Almost a perfect summer beer.
UPDATED: JUL 31, 2011 Bottle, thanks logan, Decent overall, pretty light hefe, good malts nice pour, overall pretty good taste to this one, Not a huge fan, there are better SN offerings

Poured into my Kellerweis glass. Colour is that of a hefe, cloudy wheat colour. Aroma is very mild of clove and banana, Ive definitely had stronger. Flavour us mild, slightly sweet. Full bodied with a mild Carbonation. I have not added a lemon to this. Overall a good wheat beer that is fun to drink out of the Kellerweis glass.

Poured into a Sierra Nevada weisen glass.  Color is a cloudy yellow straw with a white head.  Aroma is yeasty with some spices.  Flavor is similar with a lot of wheat and yeast flavors up front and some spice on the finish.  Body is light and carbonation is good.  Overall a good hefeweizen.

Moderate, off-white head, cloudy golden in appearance. Malty, banana aroma, slightly yeasty. Taste has a spicy bitterness to it in addition to fruity aftertaste, quite fizzy. Underwhelming, but a good treat nonetheless.

One of the easiest to drink wheat beers that Ive had, with a smooth combination of clove, spice, nutmeg, and a hint of banana.  Its a tiny bit spicy with a nice consistency and a hazy lemon-gold color.  However, I do find wheat beers a little too "fall flavored", so I am a little biased.

Pours light hazy light golden straw with well retained white head and light lace. Clove, banana and grainy aromas. Med high carbonation, light-medium body, refreshing light, yet semi complex finish. Grains lingering with a touch of banana and light clove on the finish.

Awesome wheat beer.  Hats off to these guys for producing one of the best Wheats I have had outside of Germany.  Nice and light, refreshing and full of wheaty goodness.  Highly recommend this one.  Only reason that it didnt get a 5....  it causes hangovers unlike German wheats.  8-)
Pours cloudy with a small head. Nice aroma of wheat and clove. Taste a bit muted for the style. Finishes crisply.
350ml bottle.  Pours a very hazy pale yellow with a medium head.  Aroma is banana and wheat.  Milky banana start.  Watery clove finish.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2011 12 oz bottle.

It pours a nice golden color with a hint of peach. The head is big, white, and foamy, though it doesnt hold as well as most Hefe heads and doesnt leave too much lacing. I love the color, but the head could be nicer.

The smell is pretty traditional. I would say the citrus is amped up more than in other traditional German hefeweizens but it also could be a freshness factor. The clove lingers in the background.

The flavor is predominantly clove and wheat malt. There is a nice tartness from the lemon and there is a lingering taste of ripe banana. It is an all-encompassing Hefeweizen, much like Weihenstephaner, though the mouthfeel here could be worked on.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-01-2010 01:06:19

Kellerweis smells of citrus and bananas. It has an unfiltered yellow appearance, and poured a strong head (good carbonation). First taste welcomes much hops along with a wheat and banana flavor. It is light bodied and tastes amazingFor all who read, try this beer.
Bottle. Fruity, musty aroma.  Pours a slightly orange color.  Sweet flavor, very fruity with a bit of a musty, dusty flavor.  Finishes light, pretty refreshing.  4.8% alcohol.
Nice banana and clove aroma.  Pours a nice cloudy yellow. One of the better tasting American made hefewezeins.  A great session beer.
The aroma of banana comes to mind. The appearance of a light golden pour with minimal head. Creamy taste with a medium body. A slight carbonation fizzy
nice cloudy golden yellow in color. A very small white head when poured. A nice banana taste that mixes with the wheat. Very quality beer.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2012 Bottle @ home. Hazy and milky light yellow orange appearance. Strong banana, clove, and wheat scents in the nose. Very yeasty, banana and clove flavor. The yeast associated flavors are much stronger than its German counterparts. Yeasty and fruity finish.

Murky golden yellow color. Simple nose of wheat and some banana, with a little bit of spicy clove. Nice creamy wheat mouthfeel, with fizzy carbonation. Flavors of wheat with some lemony citrus and spice. Finish is long with some very distinct banana flavors coming out, especially as it warms up a bit. Im a big fan of Sierra Nevada, this is not one of their outstanding beers, but is still very solid and drinkable.
Quality Hefeweizen.  Strong banana flavors, fresh bready wheat, very well balanced.  Nice looooooong finish.
Authentic Hefeweizen, coming from a brewery more known for their hoppy beers, has the yeasty and banana flavor down well.

Pours hazy yellow, white head.  Aroma is notes of banana, clove, touch of sour yeast, with notes of esters.  Taste is similar, with notes of banana, bread, clove, touch of sourdough yeast, some biscuit.
Looks the part - like aroma bananas and a bit doughy. Flavour a bit pears, maybe not the freshest but still holds up pretty well.

bottle.  Pours a cloudy dark yellow color with off white foam.  Aroma of spiced wheat, banana, sourdough.  Flavor is crisp, fresh wheat with a sweet banana flavor, with a more sour, yeasty finish.  Quite nice.

12 oz bottle purchased from state liquor store - pours a fairly hazy straw white color. There was a tiny pure white head that quickly dissipated when I poured, but it was fairly cold when I poured it. Aroma has a fair amount of bananna, as well as a bit of clove, some lemon zest and a hint of grains of paradise spiceyness. Flavor has a chewy continental malt background, with a bit of honey and lemon and a subtle spiceyness. Finish is a bit on the bitter side for the style, in my opinion. A good hefe, but doesnt really stand out in any way to me.

355ml bottle from Utobeer.  Hazy orange gold colour with thin white head.  Too much rose petal flavour on this.  Some soapy lemon that reminds me of a Belgain Wit on the aroma, some banana esters also and some cereal that reminds me of a Germanic hefeweizen.  But there is this rose petal on the aroma too and on the finish, which is perhaps just too much and spoils the balance of the beer.  Seems not to be a Belgian Wit, nor a German weisse beer nor an APA with wheat and an estery yeast.  Faint hop bite on finish.  Just seems to be doing too much.  Drinkable in mouth.  That rose petal though steals the other flavours from this beer.  Decent everything, but lacks balance.

Very little aroma, mostly of wheat and released CO2. Very cloudy appearance with lots of yeast in the bottle. Complex flavor of primarily yeast and clove that turns sweeter towards the finish. Definitely the best American-made Hefeweizen that Ive had and one of the best overall.

12 oz. bottle from HyVee Marion

Ar:  Great hefeweizen nose.  Banana and spice dominate.  Nice.
Ap:  Pours a hazy straw with a small head that dissipates quickly.  Not a very pretty hefe, would have liked a nice pillowy head.  Oh well.
T:  A bit of spicy sweetness up front.  The finish is nicely tart, and the aftertaste is a bit spicy.  Quite nice.
P:  Chewy body with effervescent carbonation.  Nicely refreshing.

O:  Very good hefe from SN.  For a style that is so often butchered, I was very pleased with this offering.
this was pretty good for an American hefe. carbonation and sweetness was typical but just right for this beer. id try it again.

Poured a hazy golden with smallish head, just right for this knd of beer. Nice spice notes of clove and corriander, perfect on a warm day at a cafe, glad Im in Florida. Well made, very good for this genre.

from Mondial de la Bière, Strasbourg - cloudy golden-blond colour with a little foam left; estery nose with notes of grsapefruit, banana and hay; slightly sticky, medium-bodied and highly carbonated, sweet but quite dry, long fizzy fruity finish with notes of corn

12 oz bottle. Pleasant aroma; I pick up a lot of bubblegum, some clove and banana, and even a little bit of smokiness. Pours a cloudy and deep straw color, frothy one inch white head which sticks around in proportion to how much beer is left. Taste doesnt hold up to aroma; substantial wheat here with a mild hop bitterness. Lively carbonation; I am left with a slightly bitter finish. Might be able to appreciate this one more when its not 16*F/-9*C outside.
very good poor which gives off a nice yellow glow. I think it is a good hefe from a bottle .

Hats off to SN for brewing and bottling a great Bavarian-style hefeweizen. Having home brewed for years and spoken with many a craft brewer, this is a tricky style to bottle. This beer pours a nice cloudy pale yellow with a pillowy white head. Aromas are the trademark banana and clove with a hint of the phenolic medicinal character. Flavors mirror the aroma with a subtle tartness and a crispy, refreshing finish. Not to bastardize the style but a splash of OJ in this beer does wonders for a hangover.

This is a very fine example of a hefeweizen.  Taste is pretty heavy on the wheat, slight hints of bananas and spices.  Flavor really opens up well at warmer temperatures.  Medium thickness, no bitterness to speak of.  A really good hefe.

Surprised to find that I didnt have a rating for this as Ive had it numerous times. Hefeweizen is one of my least favorite styles of beer. There are many mainstream American breweries that dont make it well at all. Step up to the plate Sierra Nevada. Youve out done yourself with this one. Bigger in body than many hefs yet it maintains the light refreshing component as well. Highly recommended.

Hazy golden appearance. A refreshing aroma with weat and orange. A quite small mouth with bavarian yeast, banana, orange. Its quite dry and not as rich as I like my hefeweizen.

This beer had my attention when I read the banana additives that the label decisively let my brain wrap my head around.  I had never had banana in a beer, so I said what the heck mine as well try it.  First taste, the body was full, hefeweizen of course, the wheat and hoppy flavor could be easily detected, then the smoothness of the gulp was noticed.  The banana didnt hit you until the end, when you could taste the subtle sweetness, then the aftertaste was loaded with it.  I absolutely loved the beer, will be coming back to this again shortly. Good work.
Poured hazy golden yellow, yeasty, banana, little bready, little spice, slight citrus.

Flavors are generally mild and dominated by yeast.  Overall its sweet with a nice touch of hop bitterness.  One of the more refreshing choices in this style, it doesnt try to blow you away with banana or clove flavors.

35 cl bottle at home, bought at ølKonsortiet, Aalborg. Clear golden color, unclear in the bottom of the botle. Fine, but dissapering white head. Aroma has lots of fruit and citrus. Flavor is more than medium sweet, fruity and a little bit bitterness in the finish. Would like some more carbonation.

12 oz bottle:  slightly hazy straw with a persistant ivory cream...characteristic, effervescent tiny bubbles stream from the bottom of the tall glass.  Wheaty aroma in the classic bavarian style with loads bubblegum and banana yeast.  Sweet flavours with cereal malts and sourdough.  Lingering strong lemony yeasty notes...not bad.
Pours a hazy orange body with a white, fluffy head.  Slightly sweet citrus taste, though not overdone.  A nice brew overall.

Lots of 12 oz. bottles poured into a pint.  One of my new go to beers.  Pours hazy gold with decent head.  Aromas of citrus and spices.  If I could, I would drink it every day.  Not necessarily the best beer Ive ever had, but would certainly drink over and over and over again.

The banana and clove aroma really hits you in the nose when you smell this beer. Very smooth hefeweizen to drink. Cloudy yellow pour with huge white fluffy head. The flavor is not over the top, it is well done and taste great! Good stuff!

Bottle. Golden yellow and hazy, some white head. Aroma has lots of clove, citrus, bit of bubblegum, banana. Bit of sweetness on the palate but finishes with some hop bitterness. Well balanced, smooth, and right on style.

One of the first hefes Ive had in a very long time that wasnt just a typical, standard, the same banana, clove, bubble gum flavors.  Its very smooth, and easy to drink.  i could roll through a few of these while I normally would never say that about typical hefes.  It has a balance of citrus notes along with some slight hop flavor as well.
Had many bottles of this over the summer, but never rated.  Smooth and sweet, more bubblegum-like than clove as the spicing was mild.  Crisp and refreshing on a summer day.  Excellent.

Bottle. Pours a bright golden yellow that is pretty hazy, and a decent white head that I wanted to stick around longer.  Big citrus, and lesser banana and cloves, but very solid aroma.  Banana comes through more in the taste, but again with citrus very present.  Chalkier and plush body, with sparkly carbonation.  Definitely tasty, and sticks to the traditional take on the style.  Refreshing and nice, but nothing overly interesting.

Bottle. Color is light gold with a thin white head. Smell and taste banana and citrus and a small hint of yeasty (general hefeweizen). Short finish but very nice and balanced in the mouth. Very delicious and session beer.
More of a kristall weiss.  Very light in every way.  Light color, light aroma, and light flavor.  Flavor is correct at least, with coriander and some banana, but definitely needs more.
Bottle. Low lasting creamy white head. Hazy dark yellow milky body. Sweet powerful banana aroma and flavor. Strangely heavily carbonation. Long sweet aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 Aroma is clove, lemon, slight banana. Appearance is golden brown, hazy, medium white head. Taste is clove, lemon, mild banana, yeast/bread lingers. Spicy tangy floral bitterness. Palate is medium plus. Coats the tongue, but is still crisp. Leaves well balanced not over-powering flavors. Rerating after 7 years,not as impressed this time. Too much lemon and IBUs are higher than I would like. Could use more malt. Still good and quite drinkable. A style I have really started to appreciate.

Bottle, from Rhythm & Booze, Brigg. Hazy lemon yellow, thin but lasting white head and good condition. Gentle lemon citrus and banana in the nose with some yeast notes, quite thin and citric in the mouth with a quite dominant yeasty bitterness and a background banana fruitiness, fairly brief finish with some lingering banana but bitterness again shouting loudest.

Bottle served in a footed pilsner. Pours hazy pale gold in color with a medium sized white head. Decent retention and lacing. Aroma is classic hefe, with fruity esters and wheat dominating a bright nose. Mid-sweet flavor. Fizzy carbonation, grippy yeast texture, and a medium dry, sweet finish.
Bottle. Cloudy golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma and taste of banana, citrus and a bit coriander. Short finish but very nice and balanced mouthfeel. Pleasant but a bit boring.

Pours cloudy and yellow with little to no head.  Sharp banana smell with spices. Much better smell than look.  Tart taste with bananas and clove. Very light. Not getting a lot of an aftertaste. Ive had a lot of hefes and this isnt bad, but it isnt terribly good either.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours cloudy gold color with a smaal white head. The aroma has notes of grass, ripe banana. Flavor is sweet, spicy and crispy at the same time, reminds me of a slightly oxidised beer. Also notes of dough and yeast. The mouthfeel is very crisp on the tongue, with a long finish. Ok Hefeweizen

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense off white head. ARoma of light yeast, sweetness, vague grape some spices and light fruits. Flavour as well light yeasty and grapy. Has vague banana and sweetness. Medium bodied. Dry light grapy but otherwise fruity end.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a dark, hazy yellow with a large, foamy, white head. The aroma is wheat, bread, and limes. The flavor is sweet and a little tart.It has a light body and a smooth clean finish. Overall, a simple beer, but very good.

33cl bottle.
cludy orange, huge smooth white head. not soft.
nice spicy ctrussy aroma. id say more like a wit and less like a weizen, but anyway just like i like it. dry, citric, faint wheat.
flavor is peach, wheat, yeast, very mild. not dry. much more like a hefeweizen than a wit. pretty soft on the palate. I could drink a lot of this..

12 oz bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with a large white fluffy head. It has the standard banana, citrus and yeast aroma of a hefeweizen. This beer is pretty good. It tastes a lot like a German hefeweizen. It has a nice creamy mouthfeel. And tastes of banana,  wheat and citrus. I think Ill buy this one more in the future.
Straw to golden and hazy.  Aroma is banana, clove, a bit overly yeasty.  Mild sweetness, a little acidic.  Low to medium body, clean, slight dryness.  Above average hefe.

Sierra Nevada Kellerweis Hefeweizen 
12oz bottle poured into Verboten Weizen glass.  Almost clear, golden color with lots of bubbles and one finger white head that lingers.  Yeast, wheat and clove smell.  Tastes just like it smells, too banana wheat.  I love wheat beers but this is just boring, I just dont like the flavor.

Fairly light coloured, not as hazy as most hefes, and not as much head, and not quite as pretty for that matter. The aroma is mild, citric tartness and hey. Smooth and pleasant flavour, banana and lemon, lacking spicy/clove flavours, but refreshing.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2011 Nice hazy yellow color. Typical Hefe Weizen smell, but with less clove. Flavor has a sourness to it which I dont like, sharp carbonation, slightly watery; not a whole lot. Not very impressive, but not horrible. Get the Weihnstephaner instead.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Yello cloudy body. Aroma has esters and banana and a citrus feel. Flavor got citrus, hops and some sweet candy, banana. Little bitternes and is little to watery.
Golden orange with white head and clings. Lots of banana and clove in the nose. Taste is much the same, with a nice creamy palate. Decent hefe, nothing too exciting.

Bottle. Pours a huge, pillowy head atop hazy yellow-gold. Nose is stone fruit, tropical fruit, and spices. Taste is an excellent example of hefe, with a slight hoppy savory tinge that cuts the flavor clear. Mouthfeel is pleasant and prickly. Good.

Single 12oz bottle - Not buying the rating on this one.  I didnt find the "uncommon depth and flavor complexity" the description was purporting.  Sorry?  Some cloves and banana do come through--as well as some creaminess--but not enough to interest me.  Okay brew that Im glad I only purchased a single of.
Pours cloudy golden with a large white head. Mild sweet banana flavor, with a slight wheat flavor.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with large creamy white mostly lasting head. Aroma is yeast and banana. Sweet spicy flavor.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2012 Stunning yellow beer and snow white head. Peach, bananas and spices makes a delicate and very nice aroma. Easy to drink, slightly sweet but full of taste. Just a tiny under carbonated. Brilliant example of a hefeweizen. (On my FL trip.)
Bottle. Cloudy straw color with a fluffy white head. Banana and yeast aroma. Flavor is banana, citrus, spice, and yeast. Light watery body with carbonated tingle, and a dry finish.
Light cloudy gold color with large white head. Citrus and coriander aroma with mild, fruity flavor
Hazy yellow body with lasting solid white head. Lots of banana and soft cloves in the aroma, taste is similar though starts to get a bit thin, bubblegum notes as well.

350ml bottle from Westholme Stores, Goring. Hazy straw colour with a dense billowing off-white head; spicy Hefeweizen-style aroma; rather thin and watery with a sweet and weak banana flavour; and a clean creamy finish that lacks spice.
Cloudy orange yellow pour. Aroma is wheat, citrus, a little funk. Crisp clean slightly sweet beer. Very refreshing.
Bottle.Hazy yellow  colour with small white head.Aroma is fruity of yeast and banana,mild and fruity a bit gassy but sweet and crispy.

Single 12 oz. bottle, $1.50 @ HyVee, Storm Lake, IA. Got out my big German weizen glass so I can let the foam play. Sure enough, kicks up a big white head, though not quite as fluffy as a draft hefe. Hazy golden color, just as claimed. A bit of clove in the nose, but not as much ester or banana, which is okay with me. Taste shows some fine wheat and malt, a bit spicy and a little citrussy. Slight bit of bubblegum and yeast after going halfway through. It is pretty easy to handle, though; you could empty a whole glass before you notice. Full blown hefeweizens are hard to capture in a bottle, but SN has a nice entrant in the sweepstakes.

Great Sunday night chill beer. No dominating flavors...very subtle hints of banana were noticed. Smooth and gently bitter...an above average hefeweizen!

K-4.0/5
S-4.0/5
bottle in a field at Cropredy 2010 ... hazy borange yellow ... yeasty banana ester nose ... overfizzy ... again banana esters ... light hop ... light clove spice ... ok

Beer poors golden clear with a nice thin white head.  With a couple of ounces remaining I swirled bottle and poored yeast sediment in the beer.  Aroma is huge of clove and bananna.  Flavor is mild bitter, mild sweet, and mild sour.  Overall the flavor is dominated by yeast characteristics.  Palate was perfect balanced by both the carbonation and finishing gravity.  Overall this beer is great and I look forward to getting it on more occasions.  NOTE:  The fist time I had this beer I didnt enjoy it this much.  I believe it is CRITICAL to swirl the yeast and poor it in to the beer to get what the brewer intended and the best flavors from this beer.
Part of the sampler tray at the brewery. Tought to judge based on two ounces, but quite enjoyed this one.

Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass.  Classic hefeweizen appearance, nice and cloudy with a fluffy white head.  Aroma of banana and bubblegum, taste of bananas with a hint of clove and a bit of bitterness at the end.  Well- carbonated, but not overly so.  Nice and refreshing, but nothing special

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Cloudy golden color, white head. Slightly sweet, fruity aroma. Wheaty flavor with a spicy background, notes of coriander and banana. Smooth mouthfeel. Medium body, medium carbonation. Quite nice.

Bottle: Pours a Cloudy Golden, with typical white head. Lacing is nonexistent for me. Aroma of  Yeast, Banana, Citrus, Flavors are quite similar, with just a touch of citrus bitterness and spice on the finish. I noticed that it was modestly carbonated as well.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a medium white head, over a cloudy yellow (SRM 30 body......noes is banana, clove, bubblegum....taste is lemon, banana, with a lingering  clove finish.....mouth feel is light, carbonation medium to high.This is a typical well done Hefe with heavy banana and clove in both the aroma and flavors. BJCP 7/3/15/4/7
nice mild bitter end on this good hefe. I was actually surprised by how good this one was.  Pretty light and refreshing good buy..

Bottled.  A hazy gold coloured beer with a nice white head.  A good yeasty wheaty aroma with a little banana.  A fuller bodied hefe than most Germans yet with all the right kind of flavours.  A nicely brewed beers and certainly one of the best hefes Ive tasted, beating the Geramns at their own game.
Hazy golden color with a thin white head. Aroma was of banana and cloves. The flavor was a spicy clove mix. Not too bad.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Nice smell. Lots of bread and yeast with a little bit or orange. Flavor is kind of spicy with some clove, a little lemon, biscuity malt. Creamy mouthfeel. Sort of a sour finish. A very pleasant, drinkable beer.

Aroma is definitely banana and spice.  The flavor is very nice, though I didnt think it had much depth to it as others have said.  A solid hefeweizen, though.  And it had a bit of a bready aftertaste that I enjoyed.

one of the only American Hefeweizens made using the traditional Bavarian style of open fermentation. This difficult and labor-intensive technique adds uncommon depth and flavor complexity. Our hazy-golden hefeweizen is deeply flavorful, refreshing and perfect for a sunny day. To serve, pour two-thirds into a glass, swirl and pour the rest.

Bottle.  Aroma of banana and candy.  Cloudy golden body with thin head.  Flavor is overall nice and candied, hints of banana and clove, nice balance. More complex then some Hefs, easier to drink and not as boring.  The aroma def adds to the overall impression.

Presentation: It was poured from a brown 12oz bottle into a tall Pilsner glass that works well for 12oz hefes. The label had a brief discretion and the ABV is at 4.8%. 

Appearance: The body is very cloudy with a pale yellow/tan color. Its head is like any good Hefeweizen, it is tall, thick and fairly long lasting. This makes for good lacing on the glass. 

Smell: In the nose I pick up lots of bready and phonic yeast character with notes of banana and spicy clove. 

Taste/Palate: On the tongue there are loads of bready yeast notes with hints of mashed up banana, clove and tangy wheat or sour dough bread. I am also getting very slight notes of pineapple or some other tropical fruit. The body has a solid medium feel with a firm smooth texture and mild carbonation. 

Notes: It is not my favorite Hefe but it is still very enjoyable and well crafted.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a large head that disappears quickly. Very strange malty banana flavor for a hefeweizen which I am not too fond of. Not really what I was expecting at all for a hef. I guess thats why it was on sale. It has a really strange putrid aroma, but the taste is slightly better. I wont be buying this one again and as far as Im concerned they can dump this offering and try again. Mildly refreshing, taste gets more bitter as it warms up. Not much hops, but thats normal for most hefs. Will not buy this again!
Pours hazy light amber with a white head that dissipates quickly.  The first sip is full of cloves and bananas and that is probably why I didnt like it very much.

12oz. bottle poured into a weizen glass. Bottled on May 11th. Pours an opaque, hazy yellow with a half inch of head that dissipates quickly. No lacing. Nose is yeasty with notes of banana and clove. The flavors dont jump out at you like they do with many other Bavarian hefewiezens. Medium-light body with somewhat low carbonation. The taste is quite nice. There is enough body so that the beer sits on the palate long enough for the flavor to come out. Sweet citrus (tangerine) and banana with a slight hint of coriander. The extra body adds to the flavor but takes away from the drinkability. Still, very sessionable.

I am consistently impressed with Sierra Nevada...their beers seem to fall in one of two categories: solidly good, and a few that are outstanding.  I wouldnt put this one in the outstanding category because it is almost a bit generic for the style, but it is well-executed.

Theres just the right amount of fruitiness--suggestive of bananas, but not too estery.  Little sourness, which I greatly appreciate--American breweries often seem to go awry in the sour arena when it comes to wheat beers.  Just the right amount of sweetness...still refreshing and light.  A very pleasing brew.  But again, I would not say this is the best of the best of Sierra Nevadas brews.
Very crisp finish and flavor. Hints of citrus and a bit of spice. Very refreshing yet full bodied. A very good example of the style, and one that I would not hesitate to pick up again.

Bottle - Great example of a German hefe, better than many from Germany even. Light, crisp, great cloudy golden color. carbonation just enough, and flavors of summer grass, citrus, clove. Slightly bitter finish. Great job Sierra!
Six pack bought while visiting my bro in Ohio.  An excellent example of a German Hefeweizen, just as good if not better then the ones from Germany.  Great job Sierra Nevada!

12 ounce bottle.  Ive had the Kellerweis several times in the past but have never had the opportunity to review it proper.  Pours a light yellow gold with a small fizzy head.  Im not sure if this beer is filtered or not, Im assuming not because its very cloudy.  Very heavy nose of bananas and cloves.  Tart lemon taste with something that almost reminds me of whole grain mustard.  Some grassy notes.  I remember now why I like this beer.  Its sweet up front, but has a crisp dry finish.  Really enjoyable.

12 oz bottle poured into a lager glass.  Pours a very hazy golden color with a thick white head and lots of bubbles.  Aroma is of cloves, banana, and grass.  Taste has some sweet and spicy notes up front.  Long bitter finish.  Mouthfeel is creamy and full-bodied.  Im not a huge fan of the taste.  Its complex, but not as enjoyable as other hefeweizens Ive tried.

Victory Prima Pils meets a wheat field with lemon trees on the fringe.  Super summer soaker thirst quencher.  Yeasty, smooth lemon, hints of clove, and freshly baked bread.  Silky smooth on the tongue with tingly bubbles on the back of the throat.  Lemon gold colour with a very frothy head that lingers.  Now my second favorite Sierra Nevada brew....behing Bigfoot of course!  Thanks to Roy at True Vine for the hint!

hazy gold, thin but lasting white head, full body, high co2.

aroma: wheat tart, wild yeast tang, stale hops.

taste: tart wheat, lots of spicy musty yeast, hints of banana and clove yeast esters, note of vinyl in the finish.

very yeasty, even for style. almost has the flavor and body of of a pale weizenbock, but without the extra alcohol.
Thanks to rcasta, drank it in Coatepque Lake!!!  Really nice, well balanced, nice sweet and spicy.
dusty wheat aroma, pale yellow/orange color. flavor is wheat, quite dry, not as much yeast notes as i would expect. little bit of bubblegum. finishes very dry. love this stuff.

Pours a beautiful cloudy gold color with a bountiful white head. The aroma has hints of clove, grass, and vanilla. The flavor was quite sweet with bananas, dough, bubblegum, and just a hint of lemon meringue. The feel was very crisp on the tongue with a long, but satisfying finish. Wonderful summer brew!
el coatepeque Agosto 2010 con los menendez brothers.  muy completa, talvez se le pone a la victory
(2009 rating) Fairly light in aroma and flavor. A little bit of spice mild vanilla and dough after taste. Not a whole lot to say beyond that.

Sampled at SBWF09
Hazy golden with a bubbly head.
Light and fresh.
Yeasty and spicy in both aroma and flavour.

Pours a murky golden with a nice lasting white head. Aroma of banana sweet spices. Taste is same as aroms. Palate is light body, nice carbonation. Finish is banana, some yeast with sweet spices. Overall a nice crisp and refreshing brew, easy drinking. Nice brew.

Bottle.Pours a pale, hazy yellow with a white head. Tart, yeasty aroma. Faint notes of rubber. Flavour is tart and a bit sweetish. Yeast. Tart, mildly bitter finish; a bit watery. Sort of standard hefeweizen, but didnt pick up any coriander, banana og bubblegum. Not bad, but kind of boring. 03.08.10.
Hazy orange of color with a small white head. An aroma of wheat, sweets and bread. A flavor of bread, sweets, wheat and flour.
Cloudy golden yellow color with no head.  Aroma of clove, banana, and wheat.  Flavor of lemon, banana, clove, and grain.  Nicely done.

bright floral and citrus aroma--mostly orange peel, with a hint of spice and metal.
cloudy orange with red tint and thick frothy eggshell head.
flavor is on the bland side, mild sweetness with barely discernible sour and bitter tastes.
light body, medium carbonation. this is ok, but a bit watery all around.

(Bottled, sampled 2010-04-14) Murky orange-golden with a medium, foamy and lacy head. Fresh aroma of sourish wheatiness and banana-citrusy fruit. Quite yeasty flavor with citrus-orangey fruitiness, some cardboard, and light flowery hops. Medium body, quite soft CO2. An ok weizen, maybe slightly dull.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy bright yellow with a white head.  Yeasty clove and banana aroma, apple, wheat.  Flavor is a good balance of clove and wheat, very mild tart apple, finishing with a bit of honey.  A very nice hefe.

Bottled version. Pours out a hazy yellow orange color. Nice head retention. Classic banana and spice aroma. Flavor is very well balanced and finish is quite refreshing. Looks like Sierra Nevada hit the nail on the head with this one!

Appearance: Pours a hazy lemon yellow with a 2-3 finger frothy head which dissipates quickly. Nice lacing throughout.

Smell: Hints of wheat and banana with a slight hint of citrus.

Taste: Nice spice flavor up front with hints of banana and just a bit of malt. Very mild bitterness at the finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium bodied with a nice amount of carbonation. Crisp and very smooth.

Drinkability: Very drinkable which is saying something for me because I tend to shy away from wheat beers.

Overall: Excellent representation of the style. I would definitely recommend this.

Bottle from Bellingers, Jet Garage, Grove Nr Wantage, Oxon, consumed 22-07-10   Pours  urine yellow with a head that shot off so quick that I hadnt time to note any details. Some spice and honey on nose. Taste is honey drizzled banana, soft in the mouth, tasty stuff.   A6 A3 T7 P3 Ov13  3.2
As far as german hefes brewed by americans go this is pretty decent.  nothing else worth describing

Pour from a 12 oz bottle. Cloudy medium yellow brew with a large white and thick head. Good head retention. Aroma domingaed by wheat grain and yeast. Excellent flavor with a strong wheat /yeast bitterness and bite. Excellent with a slice of lemon but quite fine straight form the bottle. A superior wheat brew.

This is the first American beer that I have had that I would have guessed was from Bavaria in a blind taste test.  The bubble gum/banana flavors of the yeast are present here with a subtle, but firm, touch.  Depending on the food there is also a hint of smoke hiding in the back ground.  Beautiful hazy golden color with a bright carbonation that is very refreshing.  My favorite American wheat beer that plays in the same league as many Southern German offerings.  You should try this beer.
bottle. cloudy yellow body with a thick foam head, the smell is dusty wheat. The taste is mild wheat and sweet malt. good carbonation

Bouteille de 12 oz, rapportée de Californie par Suzanne. Arômes de blé cru et de levure (pain frais, épices, légère touche de banane). Robe blonde et très trouble, belle petite mousse et effervescence moyenne. Relativement bien maltée, sans être sucrée, le blé est bien exprimé. La levure apporte des touches épicées, mais demeure relativement peu fruitée. Finale peu amère. Un très bon exemple du style.

12 oz. bottle from The Royale.  Pours a hazy yellow-gold with orange tints and a big off-white head.  Aroma of yeast, banana, lemon citrus, clove, wheat, pale malts, and spice.  The flavor is pretty faithful to the nose, with a nice balance between the fruits, spices, and bready malt and yeast body.  Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a wheaty, spicy mouthfeel.  Dry finish.  Nice beer, and an excellent example of the style.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Flavor is banana, clove, bubblegum. Less forward on the bananas than most hefes Ive tried. Very enjoyable on a summer day while listening to jazz.

Cloudy, yellowish/orange.  Very nice snow white thick head that had a combination of large and small bubbles.  Looks good.  Some spice in the nose.  Maybe cloves?  Getting some kind of artificial "plastic" smell.  Getting a bit of the yeast and wheat, but having trouble detecting the banana.  The taste had small amounts of bitterness at the end.  Slight bit of sourness, but not much however.  Seems to be balanced very well.  No one flavor is dominant over the other.  Still not picking up the aforementioned banana.  Very light, crisp, smooth and watery mouthfeel.  I could definitely set a few of these back on a hot day.  Very nice looking beer, but the smell brings the score down just a bit.  I would drink this again if it was offered.  Im just having trouble finding a Hefe or a Wheat that I really like.
Bottle, 4.8% at KØ10. Cloudy yellow colour. Very small white head. The flavour is OK malty, hint of banana. Good mouthfeel. Tastes like a German wheat beer.

I am starting to understand why sierra nevadas reputation is so good.  Nose is dominated by the yeast with a strong cheese aroma and hints of hay.  Color is pale and cloudy with a fluffy white head.  Taste is citrus and hints of spice from the hops. Palate is very clean and full bodied.

Bottle.

Cloudy yellow with a medium-sized, fluffy white foam. Aroma of yeast, citrus, banana, spices. The taste was refreshing with bananas, spices and citrus. Light body and balanced. Stable but not as good as the better Germans.
Weak head, thin mouthfeel, nice aroma but the flavors werent very complex.  It tasted like a an upgraded budweiser, but not upgraded enough to justify purchasing another six-pack.

Despite good press about this American take on a Hefewizen , it wasnt all that IMO. All the customary banana and cloves with rich , sweet, sticky palates but not much soul or dexterity.  I was kinda expecting some misplaced  floral grapefruity type hops just to add the American touch . HAH.
bottle pours hazy yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma is strong wheat with light citrus notes.  Flavor is sweet wheat with light banana notes in the finish.  Good stuff.
Wheat with light banana notes. Mild sweetness, minimal bitterness, medium body, & highly quaffable.  Decent.
Perfect beer for a cookout. Probably my favorite wheat beer. Light and fruity but plenty of body with excellent mouthfeel
12oz bottled poured into a mug.  Just an all-around good, hefe.  Very crisp and refreshing.  Not one of the sweeter hefes.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2010 Pours a somewhat cloudy gold with a big frothy white head. Aroma is full of doughy yeast, banana, spice, lemon juice, and grapefruit. Flavor is immensely refreshing, and fits the bill for the current scorching weather beautifully. Notes of banana continue in the flavor, with more citrus, light floral hop, and refreshing yeastiness. Palate is crisp and clean, super refreshing. Awesome summer beer.

Botle. 

             Aroma is wheat and malt, hazy yellow, small white head. Taste is mild wheat. Light bodied, balanced. Good, but for this brewery?

bottled. pours a brilliant golden color with a frothy thick white head. Smells of alcohol, rotton fruit and clove.  it is moderately sweet, with banana and clove overtones. it is a little too carbonated for my taste, but overall its a decent beer.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity wheat malty yeasty banana aroma. Fruity wheat malty banana flavor with some yeasty hints. Has a fruity malty spicy banana finish.

I really enjoy strong hoppy bears, this is not a strong hoppy beer but it is one of my favorites nonetheless. Sierra Nevada proves its self once again as one of the best brewers on the planet with their rendition of a german hefeweizen. This beer is sweet and mellow, clean start to finish. Bottle.
This was delicious. Very, very easy to drink. Yeasty, good body, no bitterness. Lovely golden color. Would make a wonderful session beer.

12oz bottle from Winooski
Appearance : Hazy yellow medium head. Light veil stays until the end.

Aroma : Lots of wheat. A bit citrusy. A little bit dusty. Very clean and fresh. Herbal notes. Very light funkyness also.

Taste : Wheat, a bit grassy. A little bit tart/tangy. Finish is wheat, light peppery notes maybe. A tiny bit salty also. Quite deep.

Overall : Wow. Highly drinkable and refreshing. Soft carbonation. I have to slow myself down so I have the time to rate it. Nose is ok but it has nothing very special. Taste has that little sharp/citrusy/tart note that makes it very drinkable and refreshing. Nice wheat profile but not too much. It is hard to believe how drinkable this is. I may buy a sixer of this one next time ! A perfect summer session ale.
Excellent beer, not as good as Pualaner, but a very good american hefe that is reasonably priced.  Agree, this is 10 times better than Sierra Nevada Summerfest.

Bottle. Aroma is slightly sour and yeasty with some banana and lemons in the background. Appearance is a bright yellowish golden color with an inch of pillowy head. Also some small yeast clouds throughout the glass. Taste starts off with a mellow clove and lemon citrus flavor followed by honey, bubblegum, bananas and a little bit of spicy dough. Mouthfeel is crisp and zesty with medium carbonation. It finishes dry with a pleasant clove aftertaste. A very refreshing and respectable American interpretation of the classic German Hefeweizen style. This should be Sierra Nevadas "official" Summer beer over Summerfest as its much more festive and flavorful.

I gave this to a German friend at work. The next day it was like, wow Americans can make great beer! Most people I have met from Germany think that the beer in America is that mass produced piss. Very good hefe. Its German approved and that aint easy.
Aroma heavy with spices and lemon.  There is lemon, bread, coriander and other spices on the tongue.  Murky dark yellow pour with a small head.  Nice bit of finishing spiciness.

Draft. Pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is wheat, yeast, and citrus. Citrus fruit and banana flavors at first with more yeast, wheat, and grain flavors coming in later. Sweet and well balanced. Medium mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Outstanding Hefeweizen.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours hazier than a hippie in Haight-Ashbury.  Aroma of yeast, clove, banana, phenol, malt, hippies. Intense, delicious, complex... mouthfeel is very nice, like hippies.  Medium bodied, like...oh forget it. 

I really wish I would have picked this up sooner >:(
Aroma of bread and spicy yeast.  Pours cloudy yellow with a head that lasts.  Med bodied with a smooth, creamy texture, finish is a clean with a nice velvety feel, one of the best hefes around.

Bottle from the Rake, drunk 18th May 2010. Cloudy light orange with a white head. Nose is mainly banana with cloves and a hint of bubblegum. Nice palate; good weight, not too sticky, quite dry at the finish. Taste is similar to the nose. Not too exciting but no obvious problems either.

355ml bottle (Amsterdam, Helsinki)
5 pretty bland, weird chemical aroma
4 pale hazy straw, tight white head
5 tap-water taste, minerals all over. 
3 pleasant carbonation. some slightly acidic and chemical feel. for an american weissen this is pretty OK, but in german terms its crap
12 best US weizen evar? actually drinkable!
Is a hazy yellowish color.  Smells of hops and pears!.  Tastes a bit citrusy at the beginning with a slightly bitter finish.  Is a good beer.  Would drink again

Golden yellow, nice head, tiny carb bubbles, decent lacing.Aroma has faint banana, cant get any clove. flavor again faint banana and clove, slight yeast character. Mouthfeel lacks a little, otherwise pretty solid.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2010 Appearance: Very cloudy brown color. 
Aroma: Little aroma when cold, slight banana smell when warm. 
Flavor:  Not very sweet, fruity or spicy. Some yeast and malt flavor. A piney bitter hops flavor is too dominate. 
Overall: Not exactly what Im looking for in a Hefeweizen. Its too bitter and the pine resin flavor doesnt go with this style. However, traditional Hefe flavors (fruit, spice, yeast) are easier to detect when the beer is warmer which was ture with this beer. So it got better as it got warmer, but it still wasnt my favorite Hefe. Way over-rated on this site. IMO 
Not "most yummy".
