UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 This is most yummy.  A very nice example of the style.   Full of flavor. Serving: Bottle

Medium white head. Hazy pale yellow body. Wheaty pale yellow body. Wheaty yoghurty aroma with not a whole lot going on. Dry-acidic-sweetish wheaty citric taste with herbal notes. Mid-bodied. Mild mouthfeel. Dry bananaish wheaty aftertaste with mealy herbal honey notes. Adding the yeast and protein at the bottom lifts the beer considerably. A nice drinkable beer without much character. (0.35l bottle, Skjord Burne, Gilleleje.)

Draught at Bishops Arms Avenyn, Göteborg, on June 7, 2010Cloudy yellow color, fluffy lasting white head. Acidic, banana scent. Banana, estery, phenolic, sweet tast. Banana aftertaste. Moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.
This is what a hefeweizen should be.  Its smooth with a beautiful cloudy orange color and subtle wheat flavor.  Fantastic!

On tap at MBBF in Idaho Falls 
Appearance: Hazy straw yellow with a nice white head 
Aroma: Banana esters and spices 
Taste: Banana, spices and wheat 
Decent Hefe.

Pours a golden hazy blond color with a thin white head that held up throughout.  Lacing the glass to the last drop.  Aroma of bread, bananas, and spice.  Very clen taste with hints of yeast, cloves, bananas, and a very light balanced finish. Should be called KILLERweis!

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is yeast, banana and a hint of clove. Flavor is banana, light spicy hops and creamy wheat malt. Light body, medium carbonation. Quite decent hefe.

Pours a hazy golden yellow.  Moderate white head that dissipates slowly.  Aroma is banana and a hint of clove.  Flavor is spicy to start with, but mellows into some banana and circus peanut sweetness as the beer warms a bit.  Medium mouthfeel and a little overly carbonated for my taste.  Not the greatest hef out there, but a nice lawnmower or session beer.

Part of a mix a six from Party Source.  This is a great beer.  Pours a cloudy yellow/orange with little to no head with decent fizz.  Aroma is hops, almost weed smell, banana, orange, clove, and citrus.  Taste is the same.  Easy finish.  Delicious beer.  God damnit I love Sierra Nevada.

12 oz. that was bottled 22 days ago according to the bottle code; booya; hazy light orange with eggy white head lingering and leaving scattered lace; lemony grains with white sugar, bubblegum, light cloves, honey and sweet wheat; lovely creamed yeast texture with doughy tropical fruits; light fizzy mouthfeel going down with light flavors of pineapple, clove and stale lemon; faint creamed wheat in the finish; yummy; one of the few beers I go after as a 6-pack 

Original Rating 9/4/09 (Score - 3.8) - 12 oz. bottle; hazy, dull gold with huge eggy white head; lovely aromas of cloves, honey, sweet malts and wheat; creamy texture with a yeasty fizziness; bread, lemons and mild clove flavors; like other hefes, it seem that the nose rocks and the flavor falls flat; love the nose and texture; very nice and crazy drinkable; yummy
12oz bottle. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Fairly decent brew for the style. Primary taste of citrus with underlying clove and banana.

Six pack from Broudys Liquors, Orange Park, FL for $6.99.   Clove, wheat and light banana aroma. Cloudy golden orange beer with a medium white head.  Spicy clove and wheat with tangy lemony citrus flavor.   Light mouthfeel with a crisp finish.  Pretty good beer and doesnt stray far from the style.  Hit the spot on a hot June day in Florida.

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2011 Cloudy orange with a large white head. Aroma of white pepper, cloves, apple and lemon with hints of banana. Light bready texture with mild sweetness and a little citrus/ yeast sourness. Contrary to the commercial description, its mildly flavoured and not very complex - but its certainly a nice refreshing drop (and one that travelled pretty well). [3.5]Bottle. Cloudy orange with a large white head. Aroma of vanilla, wheat, bananas, a little citrus, cloves and white pepper. Very much bread in a glass. Very wheaty with banana and vanilla. Not much of citrus tang and the spices are subdued. Surprisingly, this one (which was an "official" import) in less good nick than the last (which wasnt).
Aroma is pleasantly sweet with a nice mix of banana, clove, and a little cinnamon. Nice banana up front in the flavor. Well balanced. Hint of floral hops, maybe.

Shared bottle @ Tryk Bar, Copenhagen. (thanks Gunnar!) Hazy golden with a large off-white head. Fair lacing. Aromas of wood, hay and clove.Sweet, spicy, bitter and acidic flavors. Light to medium bodied and dry. A good light beer for the summer!

355ml bottle @ Kaisla. Poured hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is familiar, fruity and banana and wheat. Flavor does not quite add up, mostly sweet fruits; peaches I think, with some hops. banana in the finish. A fruity beer, but not very typical german hefeweizen IMO.

355 ml bottle. Finland.
Hazy yellow/orange/golden colour with small white head.
Mild fruity citrus, banana, peach, wheat and some hops in aroma.
Weizen yeast, wheat, peach, banana, apricot and some sweet hops in flavour. Balanced and fruity.
Hazy yellow with a fizzy white head. Faint citrus grain and malt aroma. Creamy palate nice citrus bread taste quite good.
Pours a beautiful cloudy and deep yellow with a substantial head. Aroma is of velvety wheat malt, clove, and bananna. Taste is the same with a wonderful smoothness. Great beer.

Bottle at Andys. Hazy golden in color with a small white head. Banana, light wheat and clove aroma. Malty and hoppy notes. Spicy clove and caramel malty flavor. Medium bodied.  Dry light hoppy finish. Nice beer.

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma of banana, light wheat and some faint clove. Flavor was sweet malts, banana, soft wheat and subtle clove with a medium body and had a crisp & refreshing finish.

Hazed golden pour, thick, classic white hefeweizen head on it.  Very nice aroma of cloves, banana, juicy citrus, light toasty wheat.  Tastes lightly toasty with wheat bread notes and orange, light clove.  Definitely has more citrus and toast than banana compared to most hefeweizens.
Shared bottle @ Tryk Bar, Copenhagen. Pours hazy light strawcoloured with a small white head. Nice yeasty aroma, banana. Taste is medium sweet, very fresh and crisp traste, some spice, coriander.
Hazy golden orange color with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of citrus, wheat, clove and banana. taste is of yeast, citrus and wheat.

Strong banana and clove presence on the nose and in the mouth. I like my German hefeweizens with plenty of yeast, and this doesnt disappoint. Its a little heavy on the palate for a hefeweizen, but tasty overall.

Kellerweis stands toe-to-toe with the best Bavarian weizens.  The aroma fairly reeks of banana and clove, while the very cloudy, lacy pour perfectly matches the style.  The flavor likewise is banana and clove with a light sourness and a light herbal hoppiness.  The texture is markedly creamy and soft, but the finish is rather short.  Nevertheless this is a very refreshing summer beer.

Bottle from BoE. Orange, slightly hazy, with a white head. Wheaty aroma with clove and banana. Taste has a bit of brown paper, some clove and aspirin, as well as bread dough. Some dryness in the finish. Not as enjoyable as I had anticipated: perhaps because it was a cold grey day.
Bottle. Orange and opaque. Sharp fruity nose, decent clovey taste. All good until... a bitter, slightly metallic aftertaste that doesnt suit the weissbier. Wouldnt go for this again.
Bottle.  Hazy light amber pour with a thick off white head.  Aroma of yeast and lemons.  Great taste of flowers, yeast, bread and citrus with an even finish

Bottle - Pours a cloudy dark honey color.  Small white head.  Aroma of bananas and spices.  Flavor of bananas and yeast.  Light to medium bodied.  Good beer, easy drinking and much better then some, but nothing really special.
citrus, banana, vanilla, golden, amber, cloudy, frothy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, thick feel, long finish,

Hazy orange colored brew with a white head which dissipated quickly. Spicy, herbal, fruity aromas. The taste was great, a whole lot going on here. Tasted of cinnamon, citrus, caramel, wheat, floral hops, with some banana. Very refreshing and easy to drink. Would purchase again.

Bottle from Fresh Market. Pours a massive off-white head with strong staying power over a transparent lager-yellow body. The aroma is robust with round notes of vanilla, banana, and clove. Flavors are similar with an addition of dry, soapy yeast in the finish. The body is light and the carbonation a tad too soft for this style. Nevertheless, this is a tasty and incredibly easy-to-drink beer.

Bottle  Pours a cloudy gold with a froathy white head.  The head is lasting and laces quite well.  Has a lemoy aroma with hints of doughand wheat.  The carbonation is good.  Has a good wheat flavor with a good amount of lemon citrus.  Refreshing and good.  Has a medium body.  A dryish texture.  Decent finish with a pleasing aftertaste.
UPDATED: SEP 10, 2010 Pours a hazy golden with white frothy head with decent lacing.  Aroma of dough and bananas.  Flavor of bananas.  Not as sweet as a Paulaner. Light bodied

Awesome, frothy white head, cloudy pale yellow in color.  Aroma of yeast, ripe banana, a little woody.  Flavor is not offensive as most are of the style to me.  Very easy and not too much wheat, yeast, or citrus qualities that usually ruin it for me.  A soft palate and a light banana finish.  Good job, boys...

12 oz bottle. 
Cloudy golden, huge hefe head that lasts and lasts, leaving rings of lace on the glass.
Aroma is mostly lemony, banana and clove layered beneath.
Flavor is slightly sweet banana, wheat, spice, and a solid lemony citrus finish.
Very refreshing. Nice job SN

12 oz bottle pour courtesy backyard acquisition.  cloudy straw color with thin white head.  little lacing.  scent is heavy on the lemon/coriander and taste followssuit with the wheat body and tart flavor.  finish leaves a tart candy film to cover mouth.  good version of the wheat.
Pours hazy golden with small white head. Heavy citrus, light malts aroma. Well bodied round hefe flavor, not too sweet. A bit sour. Nice and ctisp on palate. Finish is short with tones of acidy hops.

A cloudy straw colored pour with a large, frothy white head.  The aroma is very much wheat, very reminiscent of cereal.  The taste is lightly sweet with lively carbonation and a slightly oily texture.

350ml bottle. Poured a coppery orange with golden orange edges and an initially, though quickly disappearing, large rocky white head. Cloves, yeast and lemon with banana undertones on the aroma. Wheaty, yeasty upfront sweetness, light tangy citrus sharpness. Finishes with a fresh, subtle bitterness. Crisp, delicate mouthfeel, quite heavy carbonation giving a dryness to the palate.
Yeasty wheaty unfiltered clovey refreshment. Sweet! Great mouthfeel - its all good. Is this Sierra Nevada? Somehow it evades all "house" flavors.

The best American version of a Hefe i have come across. I have yet to be disappointed by Sierra Nevada and this beer proves why. Consider the other American attempts at Hefes. They all have that overpowering citrusy thin wheat taste to them (ex. Blue Moon and Shock Top). Granted this is not as great as Paulaner or Wiehenstaphaner, its a lil lighter. Still the "banana bread" did not fully crumble; and I feel Patriotic as i drink this beer because we finally, as Americans, did something that can stand next to a European beer.

12 oz bottle from New Seasons - Has a slight hint of Belgian flavor.  Usually I dont like that style, but in this beer its pretty killer.  Golden, cloudy, frothy in appearance.   This is a very good German style hefeweizen.  Quite different than the American version.

Spritely golden yellow pour, heavy on the fizzy white foam.  Just cloudy enough to look promising.  Aroma is strongly of bananas, bubble gum (or butterscotch, I cant decide) dough, wheat, and slightly funky hay.  Flavor is very faithful to the nose.  This is a darn, darn good hef.  Not my favorite style by a long stretch, but another very good offering by SN.  Fully-bodied banana and wheat flavors run throughout, and tastes much stronger than the 4.8 ABV.  Nice.

UPDATED: APR 26, 2010 Easily the best American Hefeweizen ive ever tried, and I pretty much gave up on this style being done right by an American brewer.  But a buddy of mine reced it, and I was really surprised at how good it was.  Very good representation of the style, with all the cloves, bubble gum, and banana notes that you look for in a Hefeweizen.   Im not sure that it will replace my beloved Weihenstephaner in this category, but its damn good too.
opens with banana, clove and huge bubblegum. Flavor is more of the same with lots of soft sweet wheat. Very good and drinkable. Finish is bubblegum, vanilla and wheat. Excellent
Pours hazy golden.  Aroma of wheat, yeast and bananas.  Taste is huge bananas.  Not a huge fan of hefe.

Pours a cloudy, yeasty yellow with a nice white head.  Nice lacing.  Aroma is yeast, cloves, banana, lemon and a hint of bubblegum.  Taste is sweet, the yeast, citrus and banana come through nicely.  Very light and easy to drink on such a nice night outside.  Very solid hefe.

Hazy light golden pour white head ... aroma of banana, wheat and light clove ..... tastes like bready malts with banana, light clove and a light hop bite at the end .... an easy drinking and light hefe .... the flavors are very balanced

(Bottle, Monks Café Wallingatan, Stockholm) Golden colour with huge, white head. Cloudy with sediment. Fruity, wheaty nose with banana, clove and a hint of citrus. Wheaty, fruity taste with notes of banana, pineapple, wheat-flour dough and slightly spicy hints of clove. Medium body, with some sweetness. Well in line with the style. Nice but not really ground breaking.

Bottled. 
Cloudy yeallow colour with low head. Doughy nose with sourish lemon, almond paste and choriander. Sweet banana up front in flavour followed up by clove and choriander, as well as dough and citrus. Medium-full body and almost complex hefe.

Bottled at Helsinki Beer Festival. Hazy yellow color. The aroma and flavor is pepper and clove aroma with notes of apricot, banana and lemon. Very pleasant and drinkable. Restrained spiciness compared to german weizens.

12 oz bottle from  Premier Gourmet.  Pours slightly hazy, pale golden in colour, with big frothy white head.  Big aroma of soft banana, hint of cloves.  Taste is the same, with mild yeast.  A great textbook hefeweizen!

Pretty low expectation for a Sierra Nevada kellerweis, but I was surprised by the pleasant, wet hop aromas and fullness of this beer.  Perfect for warm weather, no, really perfect for it.  Nice and full, and as lush as a wheat-based beer can be.  Excellent stuff.

Fresh fruity / yeasty aroma.  Pours cloudy amber with quickly dissipating off-white head.  Very good balance between bittering hops and malt / wheat sweetness here.  Finish is dry with just a little bit of squeak.  Im not a wheat / weiss fan, but Id buy this again.

Bottle from Beer Ritz, Leeds. Drunk at home watching the final round of the Masters. Hazy yellow pour with a fairly typical banana/candyish nose.  Pleasant mouthfeel and body. Sweetish flavour with notes of wheat and citrus and a touch of spice. Dryish finish. A pretty refreshing take on the style, just nothing earth shattering.  Hard to see why this is rated so high.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2010 Dark yellow, nice lasting head that clings to the glass until the not particularly bitter end.  Aroma is sweet wheat, slight bananas, and clove.  Taste mostly follows the nose, incredibly solid and easy to drink beer.  For the price and availability, one of the best go-to sessions in America.
Delicious brew. Aroma is wheat and light herbs. Taste is a true wheat and yeast. Reminds me of a true weizen from germany. Best tasting wheat beer I have had in the US. ++++
bottle at daleklizs bbq pors golden with a big tan head.  nose is light and sweet.  taste is sweet, cloves and banana its ok...

Fløska. Cloudy golden with a big nice white creamy well alsting head leaving a good lacing. Aroma of wheat and fruit with some yeast. Good mouthfeel Soft wheaty and fruity flavour with some wheat and a light bitterness. Pleasant but bit too mild.

(Bottle at HBF2010) Poured pale yellow and cloudy with medium sized and white head. Aroma contained fruitiness, banana and hops. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were hops, fruitiness, sweetness, pine and bitterness. Aftertaste was bitter and fruity. Refreshing.

Any density this beer has is perforated by millions of micro-bubbles, wild-flower honey, and bananas. And let me tell you, those bananas are prevalent in the body of this beer - it almost feels like youre downing pureed  batches of them. A nice zing of nutmeg rounds out the taste. One of the more spiced, barely nuanced interpretations of the German Hefeweizen. I will say this is a refreshing beer, better than Widmers, that I would consider propping up against my lips again in the future.
Pours out yellow with a thin head, has the slightest bite to the taste.  Overall taste is pleasant, with a slight fruity aftertaste.  Great beer.

Golden honey pour with a significant eggshell foam floating on top.  Aroma is wheat, banana, and orange peel.  Flavor also includes faint clove...fairly crisp and clean.  Decent light sessionable beer.

Big frothy head on top a well cvarbonated misty straw weizen aroma yeast banana soapyness some fruit flavour creamy soapy banana yeast lemon  and orange touch of spice finish smooth tastes creamy touch sweet malt smooth bitter okay beer

355ml bottle. Golden orange colour with an expected haziness and solid clean white head. Over ripe bananas dominate the aroma with a hint of clove coming through. Clean and crisp flavour that is smooth on the palate and easy to drink.
Yellow color, offwhite head. Wheat and bubblegum aroma. Bubblegum flavor, spicy, fruity and with banana notes.

Aroma: Citrus and floral as a hefe usually is.  Not too overpowering..
Appearance:  Golden, hazy, minimal head.  Looks appetizing.
Taste: Medium sweetness is intense to start but mellows as the beer warms.
Palate:  Medium bodied beer with a carbonation burst.
Overall:  Straight up a really good hefe for my tastes.

hazy golden with large white head.  average carbonation for style.  estery nose.  a lot of banana versus loves, great mouthfeel, which lacks from a lot of weizens.  great weizen, possibly the best ive had

Poured from 12 oz. bottles to fluted fest glasses at Brixies Spring Tasting in Brookfield, IL., with a slightly hazed, straw hue, an average, white, fizzy head, and spotty lacing. The aroma was banana, spice, light wheat, and a little lemon zest. The flavor followed similarly with lively carbonation in a light body. A light and refreshing ale for the warmer months ahead.
Bottle from Grape Juice.  Cloudy yellow pour with a fleeting head.  Aroma is grass, malts, spice, clove.  Taste is too much banana, buttery, yeast, and carbonation.

12 oz bottle pours hazy bread-colored yellow with huge fluffy white head that lingers.  Great effervescence.  Aroma of banana, jasmine, grass and caramel.  Nice honey sweetness and a bitter tea finish.  Very smooth and light carbonation, little buttery feeling.  Good example of the style.

bottle - Pours cloudy yellow/orange with a white head.  It has yeasty, citrus accented aromas.  The flavor is full of wheat and citrus with a touch of spice.  Its light bodied without coming off as thin or watery and is a very fine example of the style.
pours a super cloudy yellow with some floatahs taste is banana and cloves finish is nice and smooth great summer beer mmmmm

Bottle. Pours a very cloudy/hazy yellow/orange colour, with a fizzy white head. Aromas are of wheat, banana and some yeast. The flavours of the beer consits mostly of yeast, wheat and banana, with notes of clove, bubblegum and fruits. The beer has a light to medium body. Overall a pretty good, refreshing beer for both summer and spring. Not as good as the authentic german hefeweizens though.

Enjoyed from a 12oz bottle in a pub glass.  The beer pours a cloudy to almost opaque orangish yellow color, with a moderate to large white head that lingers over the beer for several minutes.  The nose brings prevalent but not overly aggressive notes of banana, along with some almost citrusy notes.  The palate shows similar yeast esters, again, almost resembling a Belgian White as much as a German hefeweizen.  The overall mouthfeel of the palate is light and spritzy, making the beer more appealing than many other versions of the style.  The finish leaves some tropical fruit character, along with a hint of what seems like lemon.  Overall, a nice version of the style.

bottle from bierzwerg.de]
Pleasant bubblegum and strawberry aroma with a little banana and promise of sweetness to come. Cloudy brown-yellow under a white blanket that recedes to a ring. Sweet bubblegum banana clove typical of hefeweizen with a slight bitter celery note. Medium body, moderate carbonation (too low for style), sweet finish. Good German style hefeweizen but does not deserve to be any higher than any of the good German ones (read: overrated).

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2012 tap this,is very nice almost,reminds me of  the,great new glarus hefes very nice body banana flavors and lovely hefe yeast twang lite sourness this,is fantastic!!!!!! 
bottle-i have had this beer many times but im rating this from a bottle that was 5 months old.  Fresh this stuff is great, aged a bit, it starts to fade a bit.  pours hazy orange with a small fizzy whiite head-clove, ginger, corriander and banana make up the nose-kind of different to have corriander in a hefe-maybe the age.  flavors are a bit metallic and wet grain.  fresh this beer has alot of complexity-i must rerate this one!  short finish of wet grains.  
a fresher bottle re-rate-the beer has more bubblegum like a true hefe when fresh but becomes more muddled as it aged.  the palate isnt over-carbonated like most american hefes which makes this one stand out.  alot of flavor for such a lite beer.

Be careful when you pour or you may have beer all over your counter!  Im lucky enough to have an official Sierra Nevada Kellerweis glass which can contain the initial enormous head on this beer.  Big banana/clove aroma eminates from the glass as the billowy white head eventually subsides to a nice mellow white layer.  Mildly cloudy and pale yellow, its very pretty in the glass.  Very light on the palate with a banana/clove flavor exactly matching the aroma rolling in from front to back.  A nice grain husk flavor complements this with a light hop background.  A great session beer and awesome with onion rings (especially if you can enjoy them in the Sierra Nevada taproom with fresh Kellerweis off the tap!).
Hazy golden color with thick white head; nose of banana and clove; taste of malt and yeast; medium bodied; overall a very nice hefeweizen.

Bottle 12fl.oz. @ home.Unclear medium yellow orange color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white to off-white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, wheat, moderate yeasty, banana. Flavor is moderate sweet and light light fruit acidic with a average to long duration, rubber notes. Body is medium, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft. [20100227]

Poured into an American Pint. Im not a huge wheat fan and I wouldnt run out and buy this, but it has some merit. Yellow hazy color with light lace on the glass. Smells and Taste of cloves. I dig it at first, but gets old. Also has a slight taste of banana with a yeast finish. Lightly carbonated and somewhat smooth. Not a bad beer, just not my style.

Bottle. Pours hazy light golden coloured with a creamy lasting and lacing egg white head. Aromas of banana, spicy yeast, bubblegum and orange fruit. Flavours of sweet malt, tropical fruit, spice and banana. Great hefeweizen

Cloudy banana yellow. Huge pure white head that lasts a long time. Hops, gum, vanilla, banana, and spice aroma. Flavor starts off tart and develops. Lemon peel, wheat malt, woody, and earthy flavors. Dry, tart finish. The texture is a little watery and the lacing is average. Carbonation is heavy all the way around.
bottle from Bierzwerg. Cloudy deep golden colour, mid-sized white head. Fruity nose. Medium-bodied, wheaty with lots of fruity flavours, mainly banana and mango. Good!

From Løvbjerg, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 080310.
Hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of banana and yeast. Flavor is wheat, cloves and fruit

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with dense white head. Pleasant doughy backbone with bubblegum and banana esters. This has the balance I like in a good hefeweizen. Spicy finish and some dryness too. Very tasty. Cheers Tom for the bottle.

Bottle. Pours a very hazy orange straw with large white head. Typical weizen aromas of banana and bready wheat malt. Flavours are a little sweet with some banana showing through. Quite dry on the finish with minimal hop character. Good beer

[Bottle] Pours clear orange with a very small white head. Aroma is the expected banana and grain, with a bit of vanilla, and almost some raspberry notes. Taste is similar, with banana, noticeable alcohol, and grain more pronounced than the aroma. Medium-thick mouthfeel, smooth and creamy. Nice, fairly dry, long finish. Overall a nice hefe, but falls well short of the best--such as Dancing Man.

Im on bottle number and I dont get it.  its from the fridge shelf - consumers on Elmwood Buffalo - did I just buy this way off season, and the bottles are old? Do NOT buy this beer unless it still looks nice and foggy. Anyway - nice blond look that required some serious bottle agitation to get the suspended yeast. Aroma is short and really isnt showing much. Taste is simplistic, a little banana clove and citrus. A let-down worth re-trying a much better six pack of, or better a single at Premier. Denisons and Franzi and Grolsch, WAY better,
Very good hefeweizen yeasty aroma banana, clove, dough. golden, cloudy, minimal head, white foam.  Slightly sweet, medium body with soft carbonation.  A very good hefeweizen.

[Bottle] Pours a hazy golden color with a small amount of dense white head. Aromas of bubblegum and clove are there, but lighter than the German versions. Taste is heavy on the sweet malts and wheat grain. The spice is toned back, but the bubblegum is still prominent. Good carbonation level and well balanced for the style.

The pour is a hazy, straw color with an average, white, creamy head which is mostly diminishing and leaves sporadic, frothy lace. The nose is pretty nice for a hefe with green bananas, lots of clove and nutmeg, lemon zest, tart wheat, and just a bit of bubblegum.  The flavor is similar with lots of clove still, bananas are still ripe, lemon zest, bubble gum near the finish, vanilla yogurt, and a nice tartness from the wheat.  The palate is nice with a medium body, a round and quenching mouthfeel, and a lively carbonation.  The finish has more bready/wheat notes, banana and clove still lingering, a light lemony acidity.  Right up there with some of my favorite German examples.  The bubble gum notes were not too overpowering and the sweetness was there but not overdone.  The acidity was quenching without overpowering some of the complexity.  Nice beer from SN.

12 ounce single bottle from Total Wine in Jacksonville, FL.  Color is typical for a hefeweizen, a bit cloudy with a bit of sediment.  Aroma is full of wheat, malt and a little banana.  Taste is pleasing and refreshing.  Im a bit surprised by this beer.  Good job Sierra Nevada.
Cloudy amber pour with a nice head.  Wheat, yeast, citrus, and a touch of hoppiness on the finish.  Very tasty.

Opening a 12 oz bottle... smell the yeast right away. Pours a hazed, deep gold. Dense frothy head. Swirling bottle and adding yeast. Smells yeasty, malty and semi sterile from the hops. Very attractive head. Tastes like light wheat malt and sour dough bread. Low citrus and banana flavors, but slightly spicy. Velvety smooth. Like a mink glove massage on my tongue. Perfectly balanced hop to malt. No bitters, all sour. The finish is cool and warm at the same time. Complex and well crafted. (Reminds me of the Hofbrau Munchen Hefe Weisse.) Feeling a sense of well being as I finish the glass. When this yeast strain matures in 15 to 20 years, it will rival the German varieties on every level. 
This is my very first Kellerweis. Uber impressive and an instant favorite.
Orange pour with a white head.  The scent was full of citrus and lime.  This initially brings a slight bubblegum like taste, followed by a hoppy, slightly dry finish.
12 oz into a glass. Citrus wheat, somewhat malty sweet balancing the slight banana and clove nose. I loved this. Would try again in the summer!
Pours cloudy amber with a white head. Aroma is light wheat, banana and clove. Flavour follows the nose.

Pours a hazy golden-orange with a creamy-white head. Aroma is definitely fruity - hints of orange pineapple and banana. Flavor isnt as deep as the aroma led me to believe. Still citrusy wheat flavor, and hints of banana. Solid hefeweizen, but not Sierras best brew.

Bottle from Utobeer. Cloudy golden with a big off-white head. Solid banana and clove aroma. Good balance between fruity and spicy, sweet and bitter flavours. Banana flavours in the lead. Quite an accomplished hefeweizen.

Cloudy tan colour with a moderate head.  The aroma has some apple, light banana, and some wonderbready pale malts.  The body is decent, creamy.  Pale malts lead with a fairly doughy character.  There is a light apple fruitiness, some modest banana and only an accent of quenching acidity.  Good weizen, not a show stopper but middle-of-the-road like the Munich ones.
Light pour with a nice white head. Light body but surprisingly flavorful. Citrus and fruits with a definite hefeweizen smoothness.

Lovelly looking beer in the pint glass, hazy pale orange, witha nice sized tight white head.
Aroma is pretty simplistic for a hefe..subdued spice and some bubble gum.
tste is as simple and subdued as the aroma..with some faint earth yeast in the end.
Pretty average on the palate in all respects.
Not a great hefe at all, quite dissapointed.
This stuff is really, really good.  Pours a hazy yellowish color.  Tastes super smooth, not citrus at all as I was afraid.  One of the best beers around!

12-oz bottle. Pours a heavy hazy golden color with a thick white head. (Take the time to get the yeast out of the bottom of the bottle.) Average lacing. Love the aroma. Cloves, coriander, and apricot notes. Very yeasty, but what do you expect! Subtle fermented fruit taste up front: lightly sour with a hint of paper napkin. Biscuit dough is there, too. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Long finish with lingering spiciness. Very pleasant and drinkable.
I think this is pretty awesome. Authentic but with a uniqued homed edge. It feels great in mouth and is a majorly thirst quenching beverage.

12 ounce bottle, thanks to Eric for picking this up. Pours a cloudy straw color with a thick white head. A sweet nose of spices, honey, yeast and citrus. A great flavor; initially smooth spices, banana and citrus, lots of rich sweet earthy straw and a near perfectly clean finish of mild citrus and malt. Very simple and very damn good. Give me a pitcher!
Bottle. Hazy orange colour with a huge white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, citrus, banana and spice.

This one is pretty good.  Upland brewing in Bloomington, IN is one of the only others that is this good.  A nice floral hazy hefe.  Nice light flavor that still is fulfulling.  Nearly as good as the Franzkaner (sp?).

Bottle. Pours opaque golden yellow with a thick and resilient head. Aroma: bread, hay, basement aromas, leather, and a little spicyness. The beer tastes slightly sweet and moderately bitter as time goes on.

12 oz bottle pours murky gold with a fluffy, off white head into a weizen glass; the head retains quite well.  This is a very musty smelling beer, more so than many other hefs.  Also bubblegum, dried bananas and apricots, clove, lemongrass.  The mustiness is subdued in the taste leaving only a nice, sweet, yeasty presence.  Lemongrass and wheat make up the bulk of the flavor with banana, apricot, earth, and clove coming in the finish.  Full bodied with a perfect silky, yet fuzzy mouthfeel and a medium level of carbonation.  Very refreshing and tremendously drinkable.  My favorite hef by far, so subtle and delicious.  Great brew.
Pours cloudy gold with a nice white head.  Aroma of banana and German yeast.  Taste is yeasty and spicy.  Nice easy drinker.  Good stuff maynard.
Bottle, pours cloudy gold w/ a huge fluffy white head, aroma is bitter Saaz hop w/ some yeast, moderately sweet, yeasty and smooth, refreshing and flavorful, tasty brew

Pour is hazed bright golden with a thin tight bubbled bright white head, attractive...smell is equally attractive with lightly floral with a substantial sweetness of bubblegum, some banana and band-aid along with lavender and vanilla...taste is sweet and yeasty up front with some bubblegum sweetness and a grainy and cereal flavor...then it turned very thin and watery very quickly...disappointing in the end...

Cloudy orange (though I had to mix the yeast back in to get this effect, almost all of it had settled to the bottom of the bottle), big head of medium to large bubbles w/ a web of lacing. Nose is big and estery, bananas and cloves of course and maybe a hint of sulphur. Flavor is balanced more towards cloviness. Carbonation is brisk but soft and the mouthfeel is overall very creamy. Pretty decent hefe.
Great yeast flavors across the mouth.  They really let the yeast do its business and have a nice mellow malt to let the yeast flavors dance on.  Not my favorite style,  but a great hefe!
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are wheat malt, hops, citrus and yeast.

UPDATED: JUL 5, 2011 Pours a very nice light hazy golden color with a thick white head.  Nice legs are left clinging to the sides of the glass.  The aroma is pleasantly light with some coriander coming through alongside a delicate fruity/citrusy aspect.  The yeast is definitely noticeable, but is not overly powerful.  There are some very nice spices initially upfront but gives way to an enjoyable fruity character.  The spices remain throughout and are enjoyable.  The finish retains the spice.  The beer is quite refreshing and is very nice.
nice golden hue, hazy. nice foam when poured. nose is banana bread and yeast. flavor is similar with some clove in as well. just a nice easy drinker on a hot summer day

A: Hazy golden color, some hints of orange. Not much head nor lacing.

S: Wheat, mild spice, citrus sweetness.

T: Orange, mild spice, bread, perhaps some banana (especially noticeable with any burps that you may let out while drinking this beer). Sorry for being crude, but its true.

M: Medium body, not much carbonation to speak of.

D: A very nice wheat beer, much better than the other American offerings Ive had.

12 ounce bottle.  Pours a hazy sunshine gold with a massive, foamy, white head that slowly fades.  Taste is of banana, fruit, yeast, wheat, some citrus and some spice.  Similar aroma.  Good mouthful, but it is slightly thin and mildly watery.  Drinkable, refreshing and rather enjoyable.

Bottle pours a hazy golden orange with a large foamy white head that laced.  Aroma of lemon, banana, light clove, wheat and some light metallic or sulfur from the aroma (but not really in a bad way, give it a true hefe quality).  Flavor of the same.  Banana and wheat is more pronounced innthe flavor.  Excellent hefe.
35 cl bottle. Slight hazy golden body with small white head. Flavour is yeast, wheat, citrus and watery.
Bottle. Golden - orange colour with a white head. Aroma is dry, wheat, banana, yeast. Flavour is dry, wheat, caramel, banana, yeast. Medium body. OK beer.

On tap haket, Göteborg - 2010-02-06
AP: cloudy golden beer with strong stady white head
AR: banana, yeast, wheat
F: banana, yeast, wheat

Poured from 12 oz bottle into a nonic pint. 

Appearance: Straw colored, hazy with a 1" head that quickly goes down to a film. Not a resilient head.

Smell: Fruity familiar hefe smell with a yeast background, a hint of banana and yogurt. I can smell what resembles the smell of rubber balloons also, but not in a bad way.

Taste: Banana, tangy lemon zest with some vanilla yogurt and spice sneaking in too. Very slightly bitter at the end - just enough to give it a nice smack. 

Mouthfeel: Creamy texture that is quite smooth going down. Plenty enough carbonation. Medium body to it.

Drinkability: A true guzzler. This is the perfect drink for any hot day when you want something refreshing and not filling. Scores a perfect 10 on the refresh-o-meter. Not sweet and syrupy - just right.

Comments: Every quaff made me want to come back for more. I think it measures up against any German hefeweizen. The best part about it is that its far more readily available, fresher, and cheaper than imported hefes. This is my idea of an everyday beer. Perfect also for someone wanting to try their first craft beer or hefeweizen. A good beer for those who dont like beer.

Cloudy golden color with a fluffy white head.  Delicate sweet aroma of spice with some banana and wheat.  Bread and light fruit dominates the flavor with a light citrus bitterness on the finish.  Nicely refreshing and easy to enjoy.

Bottled at Sorbon, Bromma, Sweden. Pours out in a i na shady golden colour with a rich fluffy white foam. Mild aroma of banana, cookies, dough and citric fruits. Medium-bodied with notes of banana, cloves and lemon. Low bitterness with hints of over-riped bananas, cloves, lemon and cinnamon.

Bottle from Utobeer. Hazy gold in colour. Light aroma of bubble gum and cloves, with some grainy cereals and yeast. Flavour had more of the same, with a light citrus edge and a touch of banana in the finish. Ok.

Bottle: Golden, hazy, rather small white foamy layer, visible carbonation; ripe bananas and wheat in the nose, covering a delicate clovey background; delicate to moderate sweetish-sourish flavour, medium bodied; shorter sweet-wheaty finish with a light tartness in the aftertaste. A decent Weizen, but kindly overrated........

Pours, to put it bluntly, a hazy urine color. Aroma is heavily laden with banana and clove, with a bit of wonder bread. Flavor is somewhatwonder-bready with a little too much bitterness at the end. 
Decent, if not spectacular.
Pours hazy yellow with a big white head.  Aroma is banana, with hints of clove and bubble gum.  Flavor is a nice light slightly spicy malted wheat, with hints of banana and bubblegum.  Great hefe.

12 oz. Pours a cloudy bright yellow with a loose, sudsy white head. Stringy little sheets of lacing. Bright banana and clove nose. Creamy medium body with plenty of fizzy carbonation. Sweet banana and clove mid-palate. Full bodied, full flavored, but has beautifully placed carb and low enough abv as to be completely refreshing. Great beer for almost any weather. Good stuff.

Bottle. Its a cloudy, orange-golden beer with a finger-thick white head leaving lacings. Banana and bubblegum, some wheat and yeast in the aroma. The flavor is on the sweet side, with a good dash of bubblegum. Wheat and yeast as well. Banana in the finish. Medium body with good carbonation. A quite decent weissbier, but overall too much bubblegum. 091023

12oz bottle.  Hazy golden body topped with a quickly receding foamy head.  Aroma of cloves, hint of banana and other spices.  Flavors of bananas, cloves, yeast and mild bitter.  Active carbonation, light body and a short finish of days-old bananas.  Easy drinker.

six pack from sun devil drank on 10/12/2009.

pours ochre crayon color... burnt orange yellow with a soft airy off white head and loads of webby lacing. 

the smell is very bread yeasty with notes of prickly clove, a little vanilla, a bit of honey and dusty wheat (though not as wet as usual for the style).

the flavor matches the aroma though the wheat is defined, not just dusty. it has a crisp clean finish with lingering spiciness and yeast. 

it is medium bodied and has a crisp mouth feel. it lacks that slurry and substance i like from the style... but it does get a bit creamier and softer as it sits. 7.5/4/7.5/3/15/3.7

Opaque yellowish golden. Bubbly head that fades to a thin coating. Nice lacing. Aroma is banana-clove. Flavor is banana-bubblegum chewed while standing next to a clove smoker, well maybe not that assertive! Lovely palate. Soft crisp and drinkable. I quite dig this beer.

12 oz bottle w/ yeast swirled in as instructed. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Typical banana/clove Hef aroma with some lemon and wheat. The flavor is tart and yeasty with some sweet wheat malt. Medium body with average carbonation and a tart clean finish. This is a nice, easy drinking Hef.

Nose of - as the label says - cloves and banana.  Pours a very cloudy pale gold.  Flavour is an excellent example of the style - fresh and gently floral with a great balance of grassy bitterness and tropical fruit sweetness.  Finish is complex yet continues balanced.  Thirst quenching and moreish.

Bottle at home.
Hazy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of spices, bananas, cloves and yeast.
Fruity flavour of spices, yeast and bananas with notes of hops.
Hoppy finish.
Light watery.

(sample)  Has a cloudy yellow color with large head and average lace.  Aroma is yeast and wheat malt.  Taste is of yeast esters banana and cloves.  It also has a wheat malt componet.  Medium body and thin texture.  Great American style Hefeweisen.

Bottle, 12 fl. oz. Pours an unclear orange/golden beer with a big white head. The aroma is wheat, banana and fruit (esters). The flavor is esters with fruit and banana. The palate is fruity and refreshing. Overall a good beer.

Bottled 35cl. Hazy orange (less than most german examples) with a surprisingly small head. In both nose and taste hints of glue, banana and cloves emerge. A refreshing german hefeweizen. Not too sweet but I dont like the glue component.
Cloudy gold.  Medium, creamy head. Aroma: Wheat, bananas. Flavor: Same+bubblegum. Clean, dry wheat finish.

Reviewed 11/26/2009 (bottle):

Pours a cloudy pale orange-yellow color body, with a big rocky foamy white head, somewhat lasting. Strong aroma of banana and some clove. Strong spiciness when inhaled deeply. Very fruity too. Light taste, some sweetness that tempers towards the end. Enticing, want to drink more. Very light, almost watery. Somewhat refreshing.
Bottle: Poured a hazy to golden color with a white head. Aroma is wheat and fruit. Taste is a crisp fruit and bread loaf.
Decent, though so balanced its a bit boring. Nothing to make it stand out from the pack.

35cl bottle: Hazy, bright yellow colour with a soapy head. Typical Hefeweizen aroma, thick banana bread yeastiness dominates, a hint of lemongrass. Nice, crisp bready and grainy malts join the esters on the tastebuds, with a typical sticky, yeasty finish. If you like Hefeweizen, this is a good take on the traditional style.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a small, wheat head. Beer seems to glow when held up to a light. Smell is of wheat and bananas. Taste is fruity, with lemons and other citrus as well as wheat. There was a little banana in the taste, but not as much as I expected after smelling the beer. This doesnt differ from the other top hefeweizens too much, but it is still a great hefeweizen that is easy to drink. This would be a great hot weather beer, but it is not too bad when it is chilly outside either.

Pours a hazy, pale, peachy gold, with a 1 finger creamy white head that fades to a thick skim and holds there pretty well. Aroma is wheat, lemon, citrus hops, yeasty white bread dough, light bubblegum and floral notes. Flavor is sweet grainy malt, wheat, lemon, light yeasty bread, floral notes, a hint of bubblegum and limestone and mineral notes toward the finish. Palate is medium bodied with a creamy entry, light carbonation and slightly dry chalky finish. Pretty good stuff, nothing special, but I think the malty side of things was well above par for most Hefes.
(Sample Date: 6/2/2009   Source:Other)   Grainy with some yeast phenolics. Bit of banana in the finish Light straw golden.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2011 12 oz. bottle- Pours cloudy with a thick creamy white head, aroma is all wheat with a little citrus. The flavor is also wheat, this is a Hefe you DO NOT have to put fruit in. Hands down the best  American crafted Hefe I have ever had.

From a twelve ounce bottle purchased in Cincinnati, Ohio - This hazey hued hefe pours a deep golden brew with a slight, tight, white head of foam and s banana+clove aroma. Tastewise, its good, but not as body strong as the German hefeweizens!

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2010 Pours hazy yellow with thick, creamy white head and excellent lacing.  Oranges and banana dominate the aroma with a hint of yeast.  Rather substantial body for a hefeweisen.  Lots of bright cirtus and flowers in the flavor.  Light banana in the finish. Solid hefeweizen that goes down easier (and faster!) than most.

Pours hazy amber golden with a small and quickly disappearing chalk-white head.  Aroma has a heavy sweetness of bananas foster and clove.  A noticeable bitter note as well.  The flavors is a nice spicy hefe with the obvious clove, but also some ginger and slight hint of lemon.  A balancing bitterness to it that is pretty floral.  There is a lot of good body to this beer.  Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: SEP 6, 2010 Refrigerated bottle poured into a weizen glass.  Pours a hazy borderline cloudy deep golden color with a white head.  The taste is nicely balanced by clove and banana with some yeast.  Taste is really good except a hint of sourness that peaks in the aftertaste.  Best American German style hefeweizen I have had.

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a wheat glass.

The color is a hazy orange with a slight yellowish hue. about two fingers of white foamy head and some nice lacing.

The smell is slightly fruity with a hint of bananas and some slight citrus flavors.

The taste is sweet with some wheat flavor mixed with some clove and citrus flavors. There is a bit of tangy flavor in the background that is ever so slight but give this beer a great fruit flavor that remains for a bit.

The feel of this beer is pretty light and goes down easy. Is one of the better beers Ive had in the lower ABV range. This may be my new session beer.

While Kellerweis isnt the best hefeweizen in the world, its much, much better than your average bland American pale wheat nonsense and actually comparable to German greats, like the Ayinger and Weihenstephaner, in my opinion.  The beer pours cloudy and golden banana in color.  The nose has a lot of good banana flavor.  It could probably use a bit more of that rich, spicy wheat flavor of the best German versions, but its still quite good.  Ive been told that SN got the yeast strain from a small German brewery, and it certainly has the notes of an authentic German hefe yeast.  The flavor is a tad sweet, but it dries out nicely in the finish.  I was nervous about this beer when it was announced, but SN has put out what is probably the best widely available American wheat beer.
Nice head, hazy yellow appearance. Smooth easy to like taste.   Enjoyed this one.
Yellow with a low but dense head. Bubblegum aroma with further notes of orange. The flavour is pretty bavarian in style, banana notes and a bit of koriander too. Nice.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle no. 92221-2002.  It pours a milky orange-yellow with a fizzy yet creamy off-white head.  The aroma emits clove, wheat, and a something like cough syrup.  Despite that odd sounding combination it is really quite enticing.  The body is about medium with a smooth texture.  The taste is a pleasant clove-filled delight with wheat and a little dryness at the end.

Pours a pale yellow with a touch of slightly puffy white head. Aroma has the standard banana and clove notes, but its a bit weak. Flavor is similar, although there is a more noticeable sweet spice. Its life on the tongue was shorter lived than Id expect. I found this dull. Not really my thing.

Pours cloudy a pale amber with a small head that quickly fades to nothing.
Nose shows mostly bready wheat and cloves, with some ripe banana, almost confectionery-like, later.
Flavours are mostly the same but quite weak, almost watery, with hardly any finish. A weak and boring bitterness becomes apparent later, but makes the beer no more interesting.
Could do with more carbonation.
Overall, quite ho-hum, nothing special.
UPDATED: JAN 1, 2014 Bottle (small sample). Mmmm - very nice hefeweizen. Clear yellow pour, green apple tart nose. Belgian yeast taste + clove. Good stuff.

Pours hazy orange with a lovely snow white head, looks an absolute treat, though probably darker than the norm for style. Nose is very soapy & bubblegummy. Palate has lively carb but a bit of stickiness still. Finishes with a touch of clove. Definately a good beer & would probably be great fresh, though seems to lack yeast complexity of the real deal. Similar to brewboys hefe which is a good thing, as far as new world hefes go.

Being a big fan of Hefes I like this brew.  Good sample of the type.  Not the best, but for an American version at a good price it is a winner.  I love the way Hefeweizens smell and this one is very aromatic.  Long in the mouth; the taste has a good hang time.
Cloudy, golden color. Fruity taste, but little hops. Good American version of a German classic.

Sierra Nevada Brewing Company--Kellerweis Hefeweizen--2009 Release.  12 oz. Bottle.  4.80% ABV.  15 IBUs 4.5 / 5.0.  Hefeweizen--Bavarian.  Big tight sediment.Lacy foamy rich white head.Cloudy dense yellow orange pretty hefe color.Rich Bavarian banana clove floral mild hop front.Creamy cloying mild sweet rich banana wheat yeast ester orange lemon hint body.Clean refreshing citrus spice end.	6/17/2009.  6 Pack--$6.99

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2010 Pours a light, hazy orange with moderate white head.  Aroma of citrus, spice, banana, yeast, orange.  Very well-balanced and refreshing.  Would be a very good beer for a summer evening, much less Christmas time!

Bottle->pilsner: Pours a large, creamy, white head atop a hazy and cloudy yellow body.  Aroma of molasses, herbs, pine, broth, and bubble gum.  The body is medium, texture alcoholic, soft carbonation and finishes bitter.  The flavorl duration is long, being lighlty sweet and acidic and moderately bitter.  Another quality (and fairly priced) beer from Sierra Nevada!

Bottle. Banana, lemon, yeast and wheat malt aroma. Cloudy amber-yellow color with nice head.  Slightly sweet banana, orange, lemon, and wheat malt.  Pretty light body.  One of the better US weizens but not spectacular.
Bottle. Has that classic hefeweizen aroma. Clove, citrusy lemon. Cloudy look with a nice white head. Taste also the clove, spicy lemon taste. Really good beer.

This could very well be my favorite hefeweizen Ive ever had. Pours a golden haze into the glass with a white head. Lots of notes of clove and banana on this one. Nice crisp flavor with bread/bakery feel to it. Finish is very refreshing. Fantastic hefe. Definitely give this one a try.
pours a hazy straw yellow, the banana/clove jumps out at you. smooth in the mouth but seems to have more depth than other hefes ive had lately. yeast character is evident but suits the style.

Bottle at the Rake.
A very decent waiss, bananas, fine body, but, on the other ahnd it is not a very exciting style. But the Kelelr part of it lifts the beer, some funky barnyard lifts the beer quite a bit.
Bottle. Hazy light yellow body, thin off-white head. Nose dominated by clove, banana, and bubble gum esters. Light, spritzy body with banana and clove and wet grass, relatively dry, yeast-dominated.

Pours a cloudy yellow gold with white pillowy head.  Aroma is mostly cloves with a bit of banana, wheat, and grass.  Taste is dry with a light tartness; flavors of bread and lemony citrus with very mild banana and clove presence.  Light-medium body with a silky mouthfeel and prickly carbonation.  I was expecting something more richly flavored but its not bad.  Certainly very refreshing.

Its unclear, yellow-golden with a creamy head. The aroma has notes of yeast, clove, light banana and wheat. The flavor is sweet and a bit perfumed with notes of yeast and especially clove, that doesnt leave much room for notes of banana and wheat. OK interpretation, bit the clove is IMO a bit too dominating.

Pours a huge 4 finger white head. Body is a hazy yellow with tons of carbonation rising to surface. Head retention and lacing are good.

Aroma  is of typical hefeweizen, wheat with fruity phenols. Cloves are also in there. Hops are not present.

Taste is of fruity, spicy yeast and wheat/ malt. Not getting too much clove or banana, very mild tasting. No hops are detected.

Mouth feel is good, not too highly carbonated. Light bodied but not watery. Head kinda faded halfway, wish it would have stayed.

Overall, it is a very sessionable beer. This is one of the best American attempts of the style, not the best in the world but nice to see Sierra Nevada making something not overly hoppy

12-oz bottle Albersons Lafayette, LA - Aroma: bubblegum, lemon (hop/yeast); Appearance: hazy, orange-golden color, minimal white head (not lasting), some laces; Flavor: sweet, salty (malt), slight sour, bubblegum, fruity esters of lemon, banana (yeast/hop); Mouthfeel: medium bodied, thin-oily texture, average carbonation, dry finish; Overall: the slight aromatics and malts are well balanced, small juicy beer with a refreshing slight long-zesty finish.
Bottle at home. Unclear golden - white head. Fruity, orange, sweetness, sulphorm yeasty, wheaty, zesty. Bland - boring.
slight fruity aroma, palate was wheaty, lemon, orange rind, crisp and sweet at the same time. body filled out more as it warmed up.

Appearance: Poured from the bottle an opaque hazy golden color. Decent head. I took the labels advice and poured 2/3, swirled the bottle, and poured the rest. Solid presentation.

Smell: Distinct hef tanginess in the nose.

Taste: The tangy nose carried over to the taste. Theres a refreshing crispness that borders on a tinny taste.  But it doesnt go over the line. Probably stays further from the line on draft.

Mouthfeel: The carbonation levels were noteworthy with the very tiny bubbles.

Drinkability: Not as complex as some other Hefs Ive had (despite what the label says) but the Kellerweis is a solid, straight forward representation of the style. Id have no problems recommending this to a friend that enjoys a better than average Hefeweizen.

Served in a 12 oz bottle.

Aroma- clove nose, phenolic, notes of citrus. very pleasant.

Appearance- golden yellow color, bright white head.

Taste- very good! great blend of clove flavors, with banana, hints of vanilla. very smooth and drinkable. nice carbonation gives it a light body.

Palate- light body, lively carbonation. slight sourness in the finish.

Overall, a great beer on a warm summers eve. would go great with fish, fruity foods. a very good american version of the style.

Pours an opaque yellow, a shade slightly darker than the bottles label. Accompanied by a sizeable white foam head. Aroma is of banana and citrus. Honey, clove, orange peel and other spices. Thin texture without much carbonation. A pretty unique hefe, but not really my type of brew. Reminds me faintly of Duvel or Golden Monkey, probably due to having similar spices. In my opinion this beer would greatly benefit from a fuller body and higher alcohol content.

Hazy orange color, decent creamy white head. Strong bubblegum and banana aroma. Wheaty, bubblegummy flavor. Smooth palate. Sweetish hefeweizen. Quite German, not much "American".
It poured a hazy golden liquid with a small white foam. Smell and taste of foam banana. Sweet and medium smooth.

12oz.  Aroma is full of wheat (both malted and unmalted) and a little banana.  When drunk theres a slight acid sourness and just noticable hop bite to balance the round wheat/grain/earth flavor.  Less bubbly then I was expecting but delicious.  Yay beer!

A very good Hefe.  Pours a cloudy golden color and the aroma is classic German wheat: clove and yeast.  The flavor is very tasty, banana, clove and yeast.  Surprisingly, this is a great wheat even comparable to the German Hefes.  A surprise from a mediocre brewery.
Overall good hefeweizen.  Very drinkable with a slightly pungent mouth feel.   Could detect hints of banana, cereal, nuts, and resin.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with a big frothy white head. Aroma of banana, flowers, citrus and clove. The flavour is banana, sweet malt and clove. Didnt bring much to this style but a fair brew.

Bottle ( 12oz ).  Slightly hazy yellow-gold with a fairly large fluffy white lasting head.  Nice light balanced aroma - grassy and fruity.  The taste follows, ever so slightly tart; a hint of earthiness to the floral/grassy bitterness, fruit sweetness is peach, pear and very light banana.  Light and soft body, decently carbonated, quick finishing and just a bit of sweet fruity linger.  I liked it.

Have had trouble finding this beer, but I am now very pleased I did. 
Bottle pour is cloudy yellow, with a foamy head that stayed thru most of the consumption. Mild carbonation is very well set for a brew such as this one. Aromas of lemon, citrus, slight sweet clove. Taste was very impressive, smooth, a little heavy in feel, notes of not-quite-ripe bananna, lemon, mild hops, and very good malts. I dont know if I would call the flavors complex, but they all compliment each other very nicely. I do believe the open fermentation process attributes are noticeable in this brew. A very impressive, well balanced hefeweizen from a reliable brewery.

12oz bottle.  Pours a hazy deep golden color with a thick soapy off white head, that settles into a ring.  Aroma is full of spice, yeast, banana and light citrus.    Nice spice flavor up front with hints of banana and just a bit of malt. Very mild citrus bitterness at the finish.  Mouthfeel is light and crisp with soft fizzy carbonation.    A very nicely done beer.
Cloudly yellow gold color. Crisp firm hefty attack. Light finish. Not sure I get heffys yet.

(bottle, 35.5cl) Cloudy, bright orange colour with a blond medium-sized foamy head. Mildly sweet and slightly dusty wheat-malty aroma with delicate fruity notes of banana and spicy cloves. Moderately sweet flavour with a tinge of bitterness, light to medium bodied with a smooth carbonation. Present wheat-character, yeasty and mildly fruity taste with cloves and notes of herbal, slightly woody hops; soft malty and slightly wheaty finish with phenolic spices. Decent, slightly dusty Hefe. 20.XI.09

On Tap at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center 24/09/2009
Banana fruit aroma. Small white head. Low carbonation. Golden coloured and very hazy in appearance with a little bitterness in a slightly creamy malt finish.

Pours a golden yellow with a small white head. Your get a nose of citrus, mostly lemons, but also some small amounts of banana. The taste is a very nice combo of citrus and bananas.Very drinkable beer,  and a nice offering from Sierra Nevada.

Bottle. Pours a dark hazy golden color with white foamy head. Nose is bananas, light clove, a light sweetness, hints of lemon. palate is full and smooth with a dry yeast note. Flavors are light banana, some grass, yeast, a nice light spiciness.

33cl bottle, as shown. 

Pours a characteristically cloudy pale orange with an initially big, creamy white head. Retention is moderate, lacing generous.

Aroma is of banana, orange and yeast. 

Medium carbonation and body, deliciously thick yet earthy mouth feel. 

Weizen flavour is very similar to the German SCHÖFFERHOFER hef, meaning its considerably less sweetish than the Bavarian variety - perhaps, the Sierra Nevada is leaner still: Spicy, not very sweet, with a limited range of fruit (banana and citrus, the latter dominating), with a decidedly sour, moderately bitter finish and citrusy after taste. 

Top-of-the-shelf hefeweizen, as good a beer as Ive come to expect from Sierra Nevada. If youre into the "real" hefe taste without the sugary elements, then THIS is your beer.

Not as wheaty as some Hefs.  Light head.  Not to murky good golden yellow color.  Light citrus, bannana and clove flavors.  In general not a fan of american hefs.  This is pretty good though.  Much diffrent than sierra nevadas other beers

Herbal aroma with come citrus mixed in.  Thick foamy head, cloudy yellow in appearance.  Flavor is surprisingly a spicy earthy malt with some yeast playing a part in the background and a herbal coriander/cilantro aftertaste.  Overall, not bad... a bit more complex than expected.

Pours a hazy yellowish orange color topped by a large and foamy off white head that slowly settles to a thin film. The aroma is classic hefe with notes of banana, yeast, clove,citrus, and spices. The flavor follows with sweet banana and bready yeast blended nicely the clove, citrus, and spices. Fresh wheat ties everything together. Medium bodied and smooth and very easy to drink with some nice hop bitterness on the backend. This is a nicely made hefeweizen.
Hazy dark yellow pour with a thick white head. Banana, clove and yeast aroma. Crisp malt, yeast, banana with a smooth taste. Very easy drinking.

This could be called Killerweiss. Kill smell, kill taste, killer palate - killerly the best of all the Sierra Nevada brews, bar none. Yum. Delicious Hefeweizen goodness. Too bad they said Kellerweis (meaning cellar-wise), instead of what they meant - Kellerweiss - cellar white (like Hefeweizen, cellar wheat).
For the style, I really enjoyed this beer.  Fruity aromas lead to a fresh, spicy flavor, with citrus and clove present.  Not at all my favorite style of beer, but this is quite tasty.

Thanks to bhensonb. Pours a hazy, dark yellow with a coarse, quickly dissipating head. Pulled this one as the last of my Dancing Man is all gone and I probably wont be able to get any more until next summer. Im afraid that SN isnt going to be a good substitution. The nose is banana/yeast, and the initial taste is the same. Spice notes follow quickly but are not strong. The beer has the unusual character of being both slightly sweet then slightly astringent/dry immediately on the heels of the sweet - bot both dont appear at the same time. The character in beers when these two are able to exist together create a nice complexity. The two dont exist together here and the result is not all that great. In the end this beer is a little thin, the palate is a little coarse. There is some substance, but this is no Dancing Man.

Big nose on this, burst out of the glass.  Heavy cloves, some banana and general fruitiness.  Appearance is a bit cloudy,   big head, couldnt fill the glass cause of expansion.  Palate is big-time bananas, wow.  Full body, a bit of small bubbled carbonation.  True to style and good.

A: Poured with a fairly large, white head that yielded some light lacing. Body is yellow and cloudy, just like a good hefe should be.

S: Very nice smell of light yeast, wheat, and hints of lemon and banana as well. Quite inviting.

T: Excellent taste, with wheat and citrus coming through. The banana is prevalent, but not sickening or overpowering at all (and Im not a fan of bananas)... works very well with this beer.

M: Medium-bodied and creamy, with lively carbonation.

D: Definitely the best hefeweizen Ive tried yet... its extremely easy to drink, well-balanced, and an excellent example of its style. Looking forward to having another sometime, as soon as I can.

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate yeasty esters, especially mango and banana. MOderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate but way too fizzy. OK Hefe but no way near 3.6 score!!!!!
A cloudy golden beer with a nice head & a lot of carbonation. The aroma had banana as did the taste with some bready qualities that was a little watery in the finish. A refresher.
Bottled.  Poured pretty cloudy. Spicy bananas etc.  Pretty well done for an american made hefe.

Pours a cloudy orange color with a thick off-white head. Spicy aroma with hints of banana, clove, and some wheat. Strong taste of banana. With a bitter aftertaste and some hints of hops and some yeast. It is a pretty good Hefeweizen overall.

Bottle.  Poured a cloudy pale orange-yellow color with an inch thick, fluffy off-white head that slowly receded and left some spotty lacing. Moderately spicy aroma with hints of clove, nutmeg, and wheat paired with some ripe banana, faint orange peel, light bubble gum, and some soft doughy yeast.  Smooth, moderately crispy entry with some light wheat and a bit of orange leads into a moderately spicy middle with hints of clove and banana that lead into a lightly bitter finish with some soft hints of grassy hops and a faint yeastiness.  Moderate carbonation and decent mouth feel.  Overall, its a decent hefe that you can buy in 6 packs.  It shows some promise on the nose, but the flavor doesnt quite hold up its end of the bargain.  Either way, its drinkable and enjoyable.

Admittedly, Im not a huge fan of wheat beers, but this one was a pleasant surprise. And who better for it to come from than Sierra Nevada? It had a really deep flavor with the characteristic wheat aftertaste. It was very enjoyable.
Flaske: Flot orange uklar øl med et kæmpe skumhoved. Dejlig klassisk duft af banan og hvede. Smagen er også banan med et overraskende velhumlet bid. Virkelig en dejlig hefe. Super.
Bottle. Hazy golden color with a lacing head. Nice wheat and malt aroma. Smooth taste, with a nice sent of malt. Hint of banana with a sweet finish. Very refreshing beer from SN.
12oz bottle. cloudy light gold color, small lasting white head.  great aroma of spices, cloves, some banana. tastes much the same, bananas, spices. nice spicy dry finish

Bottle at Flying Saucer, Houston.Pours an average thin yellow*orange with a semi-weak aroma of flat vlove and ripe banana.  Flavor is lemony banana and clove, with a hint of sweet grass in the finish.  Tingly on the tongue.  Not bad but not memorable.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
Poured cloudy, lemony color with 1.5 finger head. Great smell, banana and clove...smells just like a good hefe. Taste is like the nose, nice banana and clove flavor, with the hops not really doing much except their job, just balancing everything out, finish starts a bit sweet, but dries out a bit. Smooth, almost creamy, full mouthfeel, that is really nice.

Overall this is a really good hefe, and for the price, I could see me picking this up over most of the others out there.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy creamy yellow with a towering white head. Estery bubblegum and banana aroma. Estery, wheaty flavour, lots of banana and a little bubblegum, some lemony tartness in the finish. Surprisingly low spiciness. Nice and refreshing.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Poured from bottle into my new Summit Pint, which is kind of shaped between a pint glass and a weizen glass.

Very hazy pale orange with nice head and active bubbles and legs.

Aroma is a nice mix of bananas and cloves, with some wheatiness.

Fantastic balance of wheat malt, bananas and cloves. Mostly spicy at the end. Most Hefeweizens lean more toward one aspect or another (wheat, banana, clove), but this really is evenly balanced.

High carbonation and light body - works well for this beer.

All around fantastic summer beer. Wheat beers dont get much better (except for a couple German made Hefeweizens).

Clear golden pour with a huge, frothy white head.  Strong, yeasty aroma.  Flavor is pretty agressive, with a big grainy bite, lingering light spiciness.  For the style, this is quite bold and flavorfull.

Bottled. Poured into pint glass. Typical hefe type color, very small head. Mild banana and spice flavor, not dominant like Ive had in other versions. Good refreshing beer, low abv so this could be drank all day long on a hot summer day.

cloudy orange-yellow appearance. Like peach juice with large thick white head. Very full spice/fruit aroma. Bananas predominate. Fruity and spicy but clean to the taste. Fairly light, carbonation is not too extreme. A very refreshing, thirst quenching veer with enough going on to keep you interested. I feel like i could easily drink a few pints...In fact i think i will
Bottle.  Pours light cloudy gold with two fingers of nice foamy head.  Citrus hops and clove aroma.  Light and watery with citrus, banana, and clove flavor.  Finishes dry.

Bottle at the Bloomington Beer Festival. Poured gold with a near white head. Aroma was sweet with yeast notes, bring out a sweet grain or sugar cookie note. Flavor was sweet as well with a distinct yeast flavor and a dry finish. A bit sweet for my liking.

This beer pours a cloudy golden and is just a bit dirty looking.  An aroma that is fruity, yeasty, and funky.  This is a beer that is full of zest.  Plenty of fruit, yeast, and sourness.  Again, funky.  Nice and dry.  So very good.

Bottle [12oz]. Pours a slightly hazy, bubbly gold with an average size somewhat-lasting fluffy white head. Slightly sweet aroma of banana, yeast and light spices. Mild, yeasty flavour along with light spices, sweet malt, wheat and banana (too much banana for me, but any banana is too much for me). Average bodied. A decent Hefe, though a bit too sweet and banana-ey for me but thats a personal preference and not a knock on the beer.
bottle: a very good hefeweizen. Hazy orange, thin white head. bubbly and good. Smells of banana and spicy cloves. Tastes similar, nice balance of paper hops.
Bottle. 12 oz. Pours transluscent golden with a thin, wispy white head. Aroma of hay, wheat, hops, and lemon. Moderate to light bodied. Weak mouthfeel. Loose, clean finish. Decent hefeweizen.
12oz bottle. Pours cloudy golden in color with thine white head. Aroma wheat, lemon and spice. Taste wheat, spice and lite hops with dry finish.

Bottle (in NZ), pours a cloudy bright gold with a foamy white head. Cloves and a little banana, a touch metallic. A grainy palate, a good moderate dryness, with a lemons, pepper and cloves. An easy drinking Hefe.

bOTTLE. Pours cloudy orange with a large head. Smells promising. . .lots of coriander, banana, spice, and papery hops. Its very tasteful and delicate, not at all blunt or candied. The flavor follows up excellently. It is remarkably similar to Weihenstephaners classic example of the style, but doesnt quite live up to that legen. Still, complex depth of spices, grain, lemon, banana entertain my palate. This is a surprsing offering from Sierra Nevada. I love the brewery, but often when they stray from the standard PNW approach to brewing they falter. This ,however, is win.

Poured from 12 oz. according to directions.  Golden yellow with white large foamy head.Nose of grass, lemon, bananas and spice.  Tastes of banana, yeast, malt and lemon with good carbonation.  Very enjoyable beer.

Hazy orange colour with thin white head. Banana, clovey and corriander on the nose.
Thi mouthfeel, short spicey flavour.

Local bottle. Very nice pour; cloudy gold colour with a thick, fluffy white head. Pleasant aroma of wheat, banana, yeast and a little spice.  Great flavour too, but maybe a little thin. Nice hints of citrus though. Certainly enjoyable.

Rich, nose-filling aroma is wheaty and yeasty with just a hint of honey. It pours a hazy, appetizing amber with a fairly thick white head. Flavor is downright delicious, strongly wheaty with an undertone of yeast, a hint of citrus and just a whisper of honey sweetness. Texture is very tingly and pleasant. One of the best Hefeweizens I have ever had.

bottle 12oz. - Poured piss yellow with thin white head.
Aroma - some skunk and wheat, hope it tastes better!!
Flavor - Sour lemony and wheat taste. Better than last Hefe I had but thats not saying much. Also tasted some mild banana flavor...pretty good!
Palate - thin mouthfeel and has good carbonation. Finish is dry with alot of spice in aftertaste.
Overall - 2nd Hefe in a row and this is far better than first, still not my favorite style but drinkable.

In the bomber bottle at the 2009 Crescent Moon Summer Beer Festival. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Has a german yeast sulphurous aroma. Very doughy yeasty flavor. Lemons and bananas. This is good, but it has too fizzy a finish to be great.

Bottle as shown. Pours a cloudy yellow golden with a small frothy white head that lasts awhile leaving good sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is yeast, banana, clove and citrus. Thin mouthfeel with a dry wheat, banana and light citrus with a nice dry finish. Easy to drink a very good German Hefe from Sierra Nevada.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2010 12 oz bottle from the Four Firkins.  Pale, yellow, cloudy pour with a good foamy white head.  Wheat, yeast aroma with some spices coming through.  Refreshing flavor with subtle banana notes.
Bottle.  Cloudy golden beer with a strong white head.  The aroma is lightly yeasty, and the flavour is citric, yeasty and bitter.  Overall an average beer.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hazy pale orange colour, small white head. Aroma is wheat, herbs, spices and quite fruity as well. Mild bananaish notes. Flavour is quite much the same. Rather nice Hefeweizen which isnt too sweet.

12 oz bottle.  Cloudy olive yellow with a white head.  Nose is wheat and green banana with a touch of lemon.  Creamy body with a sharp tingle.  Taste is banana, lemon peel and clove.  Peppery finish; a touch metallic.  Easy drinker, a little sweet, lacking some body.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a hazy murky yellow with a large rocky white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is lemon and some spicy yeast with a little floral soapiness.

The flavor is sweet lemon balanced by some earthy yeast with a touch of banana and some grassy bitterness at the finish.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied and a little watery.

Overall, wheats are not my favorite style, but I like this one.  Its labeled a hefe but I get very little banana (which is good for me) and not a lot of spice - more of a Belgian wit to me.  Its very pleasant and easy drinking.

Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow color with a two finger white head, that went quickly. Aroma was banana, clover, malts, and yeast. Flavor was sweeter. Fruit on the palate. Nice crisp clean finish. Another great brew from sierra nevada.

Nice Sierra Nevada label.  Pleasant aroma of malt, floral sweetness, yeast, a bit of citrusy tang, and a touch of skank.  This is a nice, mellow, sweet hefeweizen.  It is not too wheaty or nutty, but it is not weak and boring like some American wheat beers.  Kellerweis tastes like ripe bananas with a touch of clove, and it has a sprightly finish.  I can picture this becoming a very popular hefe in the USA.

Aroma of muddled banana, clove, wheat and bubblegum... Flavor follows suit with the fruitiness of the yeast and the wheat shining through,,, Decent mouthfeel, odd styrofoam type finish... Flavors are a bit muddled...

On nose you get initially, what I call, the dirty old tennis shoe smell until it is settled. Once settled you get  a ripe banana yeasty straw flavor. This golden murky hefeweizen  is light bodied with a grain/yeast mouthfeel.

12 oz bottle.  Aroma: initial whiff: not much here.  After letting it sit a minute or so, the aroma reveals notes of banana, wheat.  This is a beautiful beer whith great head retention and lacing.  Flavor is so authentically Bavarian, I think a native Munich citizen would have difficulty differentiating this from classic German Hefeweizens like Hacker-Pschorr, Paulaner, or Spaten.  Tastes like the aroma notes.  Somewhat sour aftertaste.  Another quality brew from one of Americas greatest breweries.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2009 Very high quality. The pour shows a very hazy deep yellow beer. Then once you swirl the last bit from the bottle and pour it, the whole glass becomes a deep almost orange yellow masterpiece with a crown of uniform white gold foam. The aroma is very satisfying. Bury your nose into the clouds of summer. The scent is very classic wheat. Not only with the orange and spice, but with an extra layer of flowers and bananas. The taste is truely great. This beer has much more complexity than a normal Hef. First it starts out with a high quality wheat base. Very thoughtfully brewed with one intention. Taste. A few of the hints and undertones you can look forward to are: orange peel, lemon peel, flowers, bananas, light clover honey, and lavender. All of these flavors work with each other. There is no flavor conflict. This beer is a fine example of what American beer can be.

Bottle @ VinensVerden, Odense. Pours hazy orange with a lasting white creamy head. Nose is banana, wheat, bread, orange and hops. Clean and intense. Medium and smooth palate. Taste is clove, banana and wheat. Fine balance. Tasty.
Great!  Does what you expect, and more out of a hefe.  Lots of wheat, lots of yeastiness.  All kinds of goodness.

Oct. 09
bottle. Pours a nice yellow straw color with a nice head. Aroma of clove and banana, also earthy. taste great lots of yeast and wheat, just a hint of spice at the end. Very german like beer. Nice

12 oz. bottle. Colour... cloudy, golden-orange. Nose... quintessential butyl esters yeast, and wheat. Palate... burst of tingly carbonation, plenty of the expected banana,clove, citrus, yeast and wheat. A dead ringer for a hefeweizen from Bayern!
Bottle: Hazy yellow, white head, light lacing. Nose of clove and banana, lots of yeast, light wheat. Nice body. Snappy wheat flavor. Good decoctionish flavor. Creamy finish. Very nice!

Pours a chalky yellow into the glass with a booming white head.  Aroma is unbelievably fresh hefewezen yeast.  Lots of spice and banana.  Excellent!  Flavor is excellent wheat with a citrusy orange note.  Some cereal taste.  The body is exquisite.  High carbonation gives this beer a spritzy body.  This will be a staple in my refrigerator from now on!

Pours a hazy straw color.  Aroma is funky with lots of pungent yeast in the nose.  Flavor is, well, spicy and flawless. Lots of banana and clove funk.  Hefty body for a hefeweizen.  Finishes dry with plenty of the aroma lingering on the pallet.  I am wowed, even for SN.

Bottle I cant believe I have not has this untill now. WOW Pours out a cloudy gold topped with a white head. Aroma is very nice lots of spice, some light banana and malts. Taste more of the spice, pepper, lemon zest and some yeast. A very tast Hef. I have to get some more soon.
