Bottle:  Pours a dense, hazy gold with a sizeable white head.  Nose is loaded with clove, bread dough, lemon and has a faint hint of banana.  Nice carbonation/body.  Taste has a bit more of a toasted malt accent to compliment the other attributes.  Very smooth, well balanced with the lemon and clove notes coming through perfectly.

POurs a hazy yellow. Nose is spices, yeast, toasted malt, lemon, clove, nutmeg, cinnamon. Flavor is very yeasty, wheat, lemon zest, banana, some hops, sweet malt, toasted grain. Very well done, I just am not a fan of hefes.

bottle: weizen: pours a cloudy, dirty orangy yellow leaving a soapy head.  Nose reveals cloves, sweets sugars, citrus.  Loads of clove, yeast, spices on the front tongue... some bitters, banana at the end.  Medium to high carbonation helps to rinse this clean, also a mild creamy texture.  Nice brew! Surprised by SN on this one.

Pours a hazy orange-yellow with a med-large head. An attractive beer. The aroma is fruity, with some yeast and banana coming through. Pretty complex taste started off by a sweet front, yeast, banana and citrus coming through. Some wheat on the back end. A fuller body and this would be a great brew. Pretty good.

Bottle.  Hazy golden orange with an off-white foam.  Aromas are yeast and citrus with spices.  Wheat and caramel malts.  Flavours are sweet grain with sweet wheat.  Yeasty with light banana. Quite a lot of nuttiness.  Dry on the finish.  Decent.

Bottle in the rake. Alround rating: Quite wheaty, banana is subtle, quite a bit of peppery hop character, its far too carbonated for me. I think this is a decent drink, but i think people are getting carried away when they are rating this higher than weinstephan.

wow, really surprised that this is rated so high, i would have to agree with the last post, im shocked its higher than schneider weisse which i would consider one of the best of the style. its a really good version, but 95? questionable.

Bottle, bought @ Vinens Verden, Odense.
Pours very muddy, pale yellow with a big, creamy, white head. Lovely wheaty aroma with some banan and cloves. Low carbonation, fine creamy and lightly grainy mouthfeel. Flavour is rather sweet, good banana, some green apple, light zesty citrusy hops. Light coriander and cloves in the finish. Long, lingering wheaty and light hoppy aftertaste. Yes, this is a very good hefe, but there are so many better and cheaper ones in Germany.

Cloudy yellow orange with a firm and lasting white head. The yeast aroma of clove and banana is rather subdued, with a touch of grass. Sweetish grain flavour with a spicy touch. Nice and drinkable, but doesnt do much that any German standard weiss couldnt do.

Pours dark cloudy yellow with a white head. Banana and bubble gum aromas. The flavor is a great hefe. Sweet banana malts with just the right balance to make sure the sweetness is just right. Easy drinking flavorful brew. I enjoyed being able to taste pronounced flavors that I enjoy from a hefe with a good body to back it up. One of Sierra Nevadas better offerings. I could sit around and drink this beer all day and never get tired of it. Perfect for any time.

This beer pours a cloudy yellow-orange with a small white head.  The aromas are light bananas, lemon zest and slight cloves (although not that strong). The flavors are light bananas and mild cloves.  While this is a great representation of the German style hefe by an American brewer, it did fall a little short for me but I did like it.  Cheers

Pours hazy golden with little white head.
Banana bubblegum nose, quite nice.
Flavour isnt as full as Id like, but all the banana and bubblegum is there. Light carbonation contributes a silky mouthfeel, body slightly watery. Finish is quite fruity.

Bottle. Poured a cloudy yellow with a creamy white head that had a thin layer lasting and left light lace. Very nice wheat, citrus, and clove blend in the aroma. The flavor was much the same but just a step back compared to the aroma. Medium body and a light clove aftertaste.

Bottled at Stockholm Beer Festival.  Cloudy golden, no head. Some bubblegum and banana esters. Sweet with fairly clean mouthfeel, notes of glue, slight fruityness. The clean mouthfeel makes it a bit sterile. To style, but falling within the lower end of the spectre.
complex beer; hard to make successfully; well-done; banana, clove, hazy, medium sweetness,
Kind of a sweeter, crisper more flavorful version of hoegaarden and without the aftertaste. Good stuff.
It pours a cloudy gold color.   Aroma shows the traditional banana and citrus fruit.  The palate shows the nice spices and rolls into an overall long and spice driven finish.  A nice surprise.

Bottle. Pours hazy light golden coloured with a creamy lasting and lacing egg white head. Aromas of banana, spicy yeast, bubblegum and orange fruit. Flavours of sweet malt, tropical fruit, spice and banana. Great hefeweizen!

A Mes rate. Bottle at the Rake.Orange brown colour with a thin white head and fairly clean for a hefeweisse. Big banana bubblegum aroma with very little else going on. Very similar flavour. Fruity esters all round and rather sweet. Good malt, good length of flavour just a little uneventful. It has to be said the body is superb. Thick and juicy with just the right amount of carbonation to prevent it from sticking. Faint tobacco in the finish and again the carbonation gives it a gradual drying feel. Overall a pretty authentic weiss but I would prefer it to back off on the sweetness and replace it with just a tiny hint of sourness. That done, it would be superb. As it is, its just good.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a small sized head of foamy fine to medium sized white colored bubbles that were mostly lasting and left behind a hazy softly carbonated yellow-white colored body and a good lacing. The mild aroma was hoppy and floral. The crisp semi-flat mouth feel was tingly at the start with a mellow finish. The flavor contained notes of wit like malt and mild banana. An OK brew just nothing special.

Draught at SBWF.
Hazy golden. Very clean and true to the style. Probably the best american hefeweissen Ive had
Nice!  I havent seen this one before!  Light crisp aroma, quickly dissipating head reveals a golden haze with plenty of bubbles.  Dry spiciness with a hint of clove flavor....A Nice brew!

Bottle.  Hazy rich goldenrod pour with a tall white head, good retention and modest lacing.  Aroma of fresh banana, vanilla, mild clove and just a touch of yeast.  Banana and clove follow through to the flavor along with citrus note.  Crisp mouthfeel along the lines of a kristalweis and a clean, flavorful finish.  Might be the best American example of a German hefeweizen Ive had.

12oz bottle.  cloudy yellow pour with a thin off-white head that leaves a ring.  nice aroma of wheat, spices, bananas, yeast and hint of lemon.  the taste is what youd expect - a well balanced mix of sweet malts, banana, lemon and spice.  creamy light to medium palate with a tiny bit of tingly carbonation.  very drinkable.

Bottle. Really nice hazy yellow color. Good example of a hefeweizen. The taste has the traditional fruity character of vanilla, banana and orange. Big body for this kind of beer. Its a little too clean and uncomplex to compete with the best german hefes.

One of the best stateside versions of the Hefe, this one hits on all points. Aroma is full of banana, wheat malt, clove and a but of bubblegum. Looks great in a glass with its cloudy maize body floating a big fluffy white head. Flavor is full and round with a soft mouthfeel, and just enough tartness to keep you coming back. A little sweetness creeps in over time. Well done!

Poured from bottle.  Aroma is toast and lemon.  Dark gold, cloudy - especially when you mix in th sediment at the bottom of the bottle.  Strong white head.  Big lemon and malt flavors greet you.  Clove and spice in there too.  Blended nicely at finish.
user_location: York, SC via NJ, South Carolina, USA

text: Hazy golden body with a fluffy white head.  Great aroma of yeast, banana, clove, and a hint of citrus.  Smooth, soft, and creamy.  Wonderful flavor.  Citrus, banana, and spice.  A very good example of a Hefeweizen.
12oz - Pungent yeasty aroma, banana and clove.  Flavor is doughy and spicy.  Palate is creamy and smooth.  A great hefe.

Bottle from Cindirenes.  Pours hazy deep gold with white clingy head and lively carbonation.  The nose is grainy pale malt, hopcitrus, spice.  Tastes crisp, pale malty, hoppy, citric, and spicy, with some clovey and banana, and a very well balanced mouthfeel.  I bought only one of these, and I wish Id bought a whole sixer.  Very solid.

Poured hazy golden color with a big fluffy white head. Aroma of spices and banana. Good flavors of banana, cloves and other spices with a slightly tart finish. Excellent body that was smooth and creamy.
A pretty standard hefeweizen. Cloudy golden color, aroma of spices. Taste of bananas and yeast. Quite tasty and very refreshing.

(bottle - 12 oz) Cloudy gold pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet banana and a mild clove hint. Flavor begins with a grainy and mildly sour wheat flavor that gives way to a surprisingly citrusy and tart middle with a very mild spice and a smooth, dry wheat finish. Nice and refreshing.
US trip Aug/Sept 2009 - banana and clove on the nose,, layers of soft wheat flavours. 111F in the shade and this was very refreshing

Bottle. Aroma very bready, straight yeasty, along with clove, banana, bubblegum, tangy orange and lemon notes, all in all rather complex and interesting albeit traditional. Flavor quite yeasty, doughy, with light bubblegum and banana remaining. Nice level of creaminess but also a bit high on the carbonation. Pretty nice, certainly refreshing.

Spent most of this weekend drinking a 12 pack of this beer, watching college and NFL football and I gotta say its a damn fine beer.  Either in the bottle or in my glass, its just sooo easy to drink.  And for $7.00 a sixer, the price is right too.  

The beer pours out a medium hazy golden yellow body with a creamy 1" thick head.  Aromas are really traditional for the style...lots of banana, cloves, bubblegum with a smidge of yeast.  Flavor is light wheat, banana, yeast and bubblegum.  Slightly prickly on the toungue, medium bodied...creamy.  Very, very nice.
Similar to franziskaner weissbier except the aroma and banana and clove flavors are much weaker.

Bottle and served in my smaller Ayinger glass: Slightly hazy golden hue with a lasting fluffy white head and very good lace. The aroma has notes of traditional hefeweizen esters, banana, clove, yeast, wheat and some grassy vapours. A bit musty as well on the nose. The taste is sweet malt, wheat husk, fruity banana and slight spice upon the short finish. Some acidic twang comes about as it warms. The mouth feel is lively yet still soft, still could have used a tad more body however. Within the frame of the genre this is a solid offering and worthy of a try.

Very smooth.  Cloudy yellow.  Fairly long lasting filmy head.  Didnt have the distinctive taste of other Hefes that I have enjoyed more.  But the carbonation was unusually lively, and very drinkable.  I would definitely buy again.
(bottle). Cloudy, yellowish orange color. Small white head. Light yeast aroma.  Light yeast and citrus flavor. Avg duration. Smooth finish. Thin texture. Moderate carbonation. Spare lacing.

12 oz bottle served in a weizen. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a 1/2" off white head. Aroma is classic glove/banana/wheat. Palate is moderate in body, smooth, yet tingely on the tongue. Flavor is clove spice, fruity, mostly banana, and wheat. Classic hefeweizen.
Bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  The look is cloudy, white head, and golden yellow in color.  The smell is banana, clove, wheat, and yeast.  The taste is wheat, yeast, clove, and good.

Bottle:  Straw color with a light haze and a finger of creamy white head.  Nose is wheaty, spices (cloves), and yeast.  Some fruity esters.  Tastes very smooth into a crisp, tangy wheaty kick with a lighter spice and yeast presence.  Very nice.  SN scores a hit!
This is absolutely brilliant, beautiful banana sweetness and very refreshing.  Another winner from Sierra Nevada for sure.

bottle
pours golden hazy, thick creamy white head.
Aroma is yeasty, hints of hops, light spices and herbal.
Flavor, clove, wheat, yeasty with hints of fruits.
Smooth palate.

Aroma of toasted bananas and cloves, of course. A little minty and herbal. better than the average. Wheat and a hint  of orange rind.

Appearance is super cloudy bright yellow. Big creamy Noxzema head. Lots of powerful carbonation and good lace.

The flavor is heavy, spicy banana. Some spicy Belgian ale flavors too, like orange zest. Not too different from a typical hefe, but a pleasant flavor.

Dry feel at the swallow, a little ashy. Some smooth buttery notes on top.

A decent, thick and fruity beer overall. Solid, if pretty standard.

Pours a cloudy glowing hay color with minimal white head.  Aroma of banana, sweet malts, light citrus, wheat, and faint yeast.  Crisp body.  Flavor is along the lines of the aroma.  Banana, citrus, some light spices, and wheat.  A tasty wheat with a geed feel and nice finishing kick to it.

Aroma: Wheat, banana bread, citrus. Appearance: Clear straw yellow with a nice medium but dense head that leave some lacing. Flavor: Wheat, light clove, banana, citrus. Palate: light body, thin feel, lively. Overall Impression: This a very good hefe.. My 2nd favorite behind Paulaner.
Pours a nice golden color with creamy head. Taste and smell filled with citrus notes. predominate taste is orange and lemon. An excellent hefenweizen perfect for a summer day.

Poured from a bottle.  Cloudy orange color.  Thick white head with nice lacing and carbonation.  Smells of banana/banana bread and clove.  Hints of wheat.  Tastes banana, clove, yeast, grain, and lemon.  Some spice.  Overall quite drinkable.  

04Sep2009

Appearance: Intensely cloudy yellow honey in colour, medium size dense white head. Heavily carbonated.

Aroma: Clear citric notes, with grainy wheat hints. Can definitely smell bananas, kind a banana bread-like. Slightly acidic bready yeast.

Taste: Very bready grain-like flavours. Sweet fruity banana. Lemony citrus, providing a mildly sharp hit. There is a very subtle spicy flavour, possibly cloves.

Mouthfeel: Lively, and medium bodied. Quite chewy.

Drinkability: Easy to drink and enjoyable. Will probably have this again.
Bottle, #494. Opaque pour with large white head.  Sweet aroma of wheat, clove and citrus. Flavor follows with a bit of grassiness.  Not my style, but very good brew.

Cloudy opaque golden color with a massively foamy white head because I stirred up the yeast on the bottom of the bottle. A yeasty honey aroma dominated by a citrus orange smell. A slight grassy hops aroma comes out in the end. The taste is undoubtedly full of active yeast and wheat that is tempered by a salty lemon character. The palate is a heavy velvet like texture. While an interesting beer the freshness and abundant west coast hops that makes Sierra Nevada Ale so famous are not well displayed in this beer style.

Cloudy yellow pour with a 3/4 inch white head. Aroma is subtle banana with a hint of citrus. Flavor is bananas and cloves wit ha grainy wheat note and a liberal dash of yeast. Full-bodied, refreshing and good. A light, crisp finish. Nice.

12oz bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, tarnished golden color; medium-bubbled off-white head with good retention and solid lacing; nice pour. Solid amounts of cloves in the nose, with bready yeastiness and overripe bananas following; a nice citrus acidity as well; still, doesnt really dig in with the dense chewy breadiness and yeast of the best... Medium mouthfeel: lively carbonation; nice, lively citrus acidity and bready yeast and cloves upfront; still, the carbonation and the citrus never quite relax enough to let out the chewy malts and yeast character underneath; very pleasant, very drinkable, and just a touch standoffish from the acidity and the carbonation. Medium finish: toasty, bready notes and lingering cloves.

Bottle pours cloudy golden color with off white head.  Aroma is banana and clove.  Tingly mouthfeel from the high carbonation.  Flavor is spot on for this style.  Banana and spicy cloves dominate.  This is a great brew.

Deep golden-orange color. Cloudy. Rich wqheat malt aroma with banana and spices. Very yeasty and brady nose. Sweet, rich wheat malt; very fruity and spicy. Flavorful and thick. Finally a great American hefeweizen!

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2009 Pour from the 12oz. bottle: Aroma and taste is typical of a Hefe- liquid banana bread, clove, wheat, orange peel and a hint of pepper. Pretty good, but not
comparable to Weienstephan. Drinkability: Binge worthy. Rebuy: Sure. #107 on 02092009, DG.
( 12oz bottle)  Pours a hazy maize body with a medium off-white head.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, grass, clove, and light sulfur.  Flavor of wheat, banana, light pepper, clove, and breadiness.
Pours a slightly hazy medium yellow with a tall, lasting white head. A wonderful Hefe. The flavor had lightly toasted wheat, banana, which is very distinct ( Awsome )

Holy overrated beer batman. 
Poured a foggy gold with a a fluffy head. 
Nose is of green apple peel and not much else. 
Taste is somewhat bland, standard banana notes, no real flavors from grains, no other real yeast flavors, finishes with a lemon zing reminiscent of sorachi ace or glacier hops.
Im not the biggest hefe fan, but I think this one is better than average.  It is light and refreshing, but complex enough to have some interesting flavors.

Solid heffy. Good balance between citrus, bubblegum and banana. Easy drinker. Biggest complaint is that the yeast was totally packed on the bottom and swirling or shaking didnt budge the stuff. Made it seem like it was glued down which is kinda gross.

Ahhh... finally got my hands on some kellerweis. This was sold out at all the stores around here but I finally found some and picked up two six packs. Much better than other hefes I have had. A little foamy but in a good way. I love how the taste is nice and balanced and not overpowered by bananas. This one doesnt taste like babyfood as some of the other Hefes can. Nice spices, wheat, lemon zest and banana. Great summer beer for the BBQ.

2 12oz bottles, served in a tall weiss glass.  Hazy golden yellow pour with a big pillowy head of off-white foam that showed some good retention.  Thick, chunky lacing coated the glass.  The aroma consisted of lemon, fresh oranges, graham cracker, and some mild yeast spiciness.  The flavor had lightly toasted wheat, banana, light orange zest, and some very mild clove spiciness.  Medium, creamy body with lightly crisp carbonation.  Could have maybe used a little more spicy clove, but this was good stuff...glad to see this is going to be readily available.

Bottle at Sheffields Chicago. Pours a very nice golden bronze, cloudy, fluffy head. Nose is standard Hefe, banana, light cloves and nice bready notes. On taste, the body is round and soft, taste is very well balanced with enough breadiness to pair up with the sweet notes from the esters. Very good Hefe.

Pours a slightly hazy medium yellow with a tall, lasting white head.
Wheat malt aroma, little banana but there is some clove here.
The flavor follows the aroma.
Smooth full body.
Not too bad.

Still havent seen this in the Knoxville area. Bottle from a sixpack located in Asheville, pours a hazy straw yellow body with an immense vanilla head. Aroma of clove, twangy wheat malt, lemon, and ripe banana. Taste mirrors the aroma. Clove, twangy wheat, lemon, banana, and some white pepper. Some freshly sliced Valencia orange notes lurk underneath. Quite good. This will probably be the benchmark for American hefs for some time to come.

Poured a turbid golden color with a one-finger tall, fizzy white head.  The aroma was citrus, light yeast with some clove and other spices.  The flavor followed suit with lemony citrus flavors and light clove being the prevailing flavor.  Very little of the softer banana came in to play to give it needed balance.  Thin, refreshing mouthfeel.

Pours cloudy yellow with big fluffy white head.  Aroma is classic hefeweizen - lightly acidic, clove, sweet grains...  Flavor is very good and clean, other peoples descriptions are good, but Ill add that theres a nice lingering bready flavor.  Mouthfeel is foamy.  Overall, a very nice beer.

Very well made. Cloudy yellow-gold with a bleached-white head. Smooth and soft on the tongue. Flavorful malt side had hints of white cake, wheat and biscuits. Hops were mild yet aromatic. Yeast esters were really nice, with hints of banana, lemon, clove and faint perfume. Nice balance. Pleasant beer. Seems to fit the style well.
This is an excellent beer from Sierra, very much up there with the quality of their off season hop beer. Very smooth with a great sweet taste. There is something to be said about the flavor.

Bottle. Poured a cloudy yellowish-orange color. The head was fluffy and white with good retention and lacing. Pleasant hefe aromas that included the likes of banana, light lemon, and some clove. Light body with a slightly chalky mouth feel. On the dry side of the spectrum. Tasted of banana, hay, and clove. Not as tasty as it smelled, but a nice hefe nonetheless.
Bottle.. Pours yeasty golden with a fluffy white head.. Aroma and flavor is cloves, bananas and a lot of wheat. Super smooth..Great beer.

Bottle.  Pours a very hazy apricot amber with just a hint of a head.  Aromas are a nice mix of pears, soap, cloves, bananas, and bubble gum.  Pretty nice mix on the nose.  Flavor is pretty solid, too... with all of the above showing up at some point in the program, with the addition of some citrus (oranges would be my best descriptor) midway through act one.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: a pretty sun yellow with bright white whipped head that lasts. a - yeast, cracker, light banana f - all the things in the nose but add a bitter lemon zest p - super soft fluffy full body

12 oz. bottle served in tumbler- poured a moderately hazy dark yellow, medium carbonation with clusters of bubbles on the side of the glass, foamy and inviting head laced nicely and tried to steal my wife!  Aroma of bananas by the boat, citrus by the bushel, and clove by... insert your favorite bunch here.  Hits the mouth with a high-weak body, malt is mostly wheat from the taste- but they didnt use the grade "B" stuff, middle is where the cloves come out, a breadlike quality on the backend, finish is slightly sweet from the banana sensation, but very enjoyable.  Hard to believe that an American brewer (aside from Sprechers & Old Hat) got a classic German down pat- and if you dont like this brew, youre STOOPID!!!

Dark cloudy gold, thin white head. tangy pineapple, banana and clove aroma, but its kinda faint. Very, uh, fluffy? soft? Nive palate, regardless how you phrase it. Lots of pineapple and banana and bubble guma and clove in the flavor, with just a hhint of hoppy bitterness. Really nice session wheat beer. Thanks to nqualls for the trade!

Bottle.  Pours a large, frothy white head that becomes meringue-like towards the end.  Clear, honey golden body with abundant C02 bubbles.  Body becomes cloudy with yeast as the bottom of the bottle is poured.  Some chunky yeast particulate.  Aroma is a nice mix of banana and clove with a little citrus, a touch of vanilla and a fair dose of bready yeast.  Banana comes through bigger in the flavor with the spices pulling up a supporting role.  Rich, chewy wheat malt and a little citrus tang.  Medium bodied with average, refreshing carbonation.  Smooth with a clean finish.  Overall a really tasty Hefeweizen and one I could consume on a nearly daily basis.  Thanks to EithCubes for delivering the bottle!

Bottle.  Gold / yellow pour with white head.  Banana sugar sweetness, yeast and pleasant spices are in the aroma.  Flavor is the same, light sweet bread, butter, spices and yeast.  Just a pleasant beer overall.

Recent bottle from Premiere Gourmet.  Pours a beige body, with large but consistently fading head that whafts bannana and some other spiciness.  Leaves the odd lace dot.  Medium mouthfeel, with that unfiltered taste, and good carbonation, easy drinking hefe.  Not the most outstanding I have had, but certainly very drinkable.
Hazy dark gold color with a lingering white head. Big spicy peppercorn aromas with grainy malts. Medium body with a chewy mouthfeel. Lightly tart wheat flavor with spicy clove and black pepper. Nice.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text:
In short: A extra-full-bodied nourishing Hefeweizen.  Like a condensed traditional hefeweizen.  Very good even if a bit heavy for the style.
How: Bottle 12oz (many).  Consumed fresh soon after the beer release.
The look: Opaque dark yellow body topped by a medium white head
In long: Typical but unusually intense Hefeweizen nose with a truckload of bananas and fresh cereals.  Body is as full as it gets for the style, this is like chewing hay.  Simple but strong taste of young (greenish) bananas and compressed hay/straws.  Very yeasty.  No such things as spicy notes (coriander or others) and orange peels.  Good amount of grassy hops.  I drank my six-pack over the course of many days because I found it a little too sweet for the style.  Very nourishing but not really refreshing.  It loses a few points because of that but it remains a superior example of the style, this really is a Killerweis.
never been a fan of most SN products, but this is an exception. amazingly good stuff. like a good german hefe with the tart hoppiness that made sierra nevada famous. good stuff.

Brewed in the USA..... Courtesy of AFI96 thanks Waylo !!  Pours a hazy golden color with lots of carbonation and a small white head. Aroma of spices, wheat, bananas and yeast. Taste is much of the same with the addition of some lemon flavouring. Mouthfeel is medium in body with some tangy zest on the tongue. This would work well on a hot summer day !!!

Beautiful  deep creamy head, golden color.  intense  aroma of citrus, lemony zest.  Sweet creamy mouthfeel.  Malt notes creeps by light crispness of the hops and wheat. Yes you have the typical banana notes but the fruit notes are kept at a minimum.Would go great with a peach cobbler or apple pie. Could this be my favorite new hefe.
Bottled. Cloudy yellow pour, foamy, dense white head. Lemony nose. Soft mouthfeel. Flavor is lemon meringue, banana, and cloves. A nicely hopped finish. Flavorful and refreshing.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2009 Bottle courtesy of drowland. Pours a very murky yellow-orange.  Active head response.  Aroma has fair amounts of banana, chalk and wheat qualities.  First sip has quite a nice bit of spice to it, with the zip of citrus and softer fruit.  Wheaty with a touch of fruit.  Aftertaste lingers for a short while but fades faster than desired.  All in all, me likey.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy light orange with a foamy 3 finger off-white head that results in spotty lacing.  The nose is spicy yeast, citrus zest and malt.  The taste is wheat, light bubblegum, spicy yeast and lemon zest with some sweet malt and light hops in the finish.  Medium mouthfeel.  Freshing brew - very good. hefe.
A massive cream head covers a hazy golden beer.  The aroma is sharp and spicy.  Tangy and astringent.  Too much wheat and spice.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Cloudy golden with creamy white head.  Aroma of yeast and clove.  Flavor of malty wheat, light clove and predominately banana - more so as it warms.  Light body, adequate bitterness.  Nicely done.

Bottle: Poured a cloudy beige color weizen with a large foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of wheat malt with nice ester of banana and cloves. Taste is very refreshing with great notes of banana ester with subtle cloves and loads of wheat. Body is full with nice bottle conditioning and good carbonation. Very well done for the style with great refreshing factor  I think it is wonderful to keep this level of quality with the quantity of beer being brewed by this brewery.

Very nice nose with some banana sweetness, a bit of spice and some yeastiness.  Pours a hazy light orange with a thin white head.  Leaves nice lacing.  Taste is initially sweet with a bit of spice and hop at the end.  Very light and bubbly on the palate.  A great offering from Sierra Nevada.

12 oz bottle purcahsed at Lukass in Kansas City, Missouri.  Pour is a very hazy, unfiltered orange yellow golden, with a foamy one inch white head that falls quick.  Aroma of mildly sour wheat, muted bubblegum, and sweet banana esters.  There is a nice clove element behind that.  The nose is nice, though not terribly complex.  Taste is sweet banana esters, big clove and bubble gum.  The mild;y sour wheat from the nose is not present in the taste, and probably would have helped balance this out a bit.  Also some apple fruit present.  Palate is chewy medium, also notable unfiltered.  Carbonation is low to medium, right for the style.  This is a nicely drinkable hefe, though not terribly complex.

Everything in this beer is suitably done.  It is just a plain but class beer.  Often a beer with this sweet banna taste will have an overwhelming aroma but no Kellerwies.  It is very clean and smooth.
12oz bottle. Its good for an American weissbier, but not even close to the Germans. Compare back to back with a Schneider, Hacker, Erdinger or Paulaner.

Really good!  Wheat and pink grapefruit aroma, and sour grapefruit taste.  Terrific summer beer.  True to style in terms of the subtle wheat taste and well-rounded flavor.  Clean finish.  Cloudy with a thick white head.

12 oz bottle:  Aroma is bubble gum, orange, slight yeast,  and some coriander.  Appearance is a cloudy almost apple cider like look to it but a bit lighter and more yellow.  Taste is bubble gum, coriander, light citrus and yeast.  Palate is carbonated with a slight spicy aftertaste.  Overall, he a pretty decent Hefe that not overly hoppy like Sierras Porter or Stout.  Cheers!
Nice hazy light pumpkin orange. White head that lasts. Smells of fruit, specifically bananas. Nice light wheat smell. Tastes of fruits and spicy bananas. A little to sweet.

12 oz. bottle pours a rich, melted-buttery yellow, opaque with a creamy white head that leaves sparse, sticky lacing as it melts. Initial aroma is of stinky bellybutton lint (wtf IS that???) that warms up to a wheaty, spicy (corriander? cloves?) aroma.  Hearty body with a malt and wheat front palate, a yeasty sort of middle and a finish of that spice again with just a touch of lemon. Nice hefe with good body and expanded palate that I didnt expect. More complex but still an easy drink. Personally, Id dig this with spaghetti with sausage-marinara sauce and a huge chunk of really garlicky garlic bread.
Clear gold color with a medium head.  Nice aroma of just over-ripened bananas.  Same strong banana flavor, lots of wheat.  The cloves dont come out much.  Almost lemony at the finish.  Really solid.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2015 Have been waiting for this for a month and had to come all the way out to New Jersey for a bottle.  Big estery nose on cap open, heavy banana and wheat, lighter cloves.  Lemon-citrus and yeast.  Pale yellow with a large, creamy white head that clings and laces well.  Body is thin and mouthfeel is smooth and creamy, seemingly no carbonation despite the large head.  Watery banana and lemon, but theyre right, there is some complexity here, with a touch of spice and bitter pretzel.  Pale malt and strengthening clove.  The complexity is not quite as advertised, but this is sweet and ridiculously repeatable - easy to down a pitcher or two every night. [2009.08.19: 3.3]Ive had about three cases of this over the years and still enjoy it.  I want to like it more than I do; I recognize the German yeast strain (and props for using it!), I recognize the house character, and I like the slightly tart and grainy character.  But the yeast puts out a bit too much sulfur for me as used, and the bubblegum-leaning phenols dont mesh with the frequent slime.  [2015.05.03: 3.3]

A cloudy pour that reminds us of this beer being unfiltered. There is a bit of head on this one, about one finger. On the aroma, there is a fair amount of bananbread and cloves. Definitely a hefeweizen. On the initial flavor all of these aromas come through, but the body is also a bit fuller which whirls these flavors around for a bit of complexity. Though the fruit-like flavors from a typical hefeweizen are present they are a bit more muted and dont jump out quite as much as in a typical wheat beer. Overall, I would say this is a great beer for the summer but in general a good wheat beer if you dont want something that is too light (definitely no lemon to be served with this one).

Pours cloudy with half an inch of head.  Medium bodied.  On the aroma I get bread, banana, cloves and a couple of other subtle fruit nuances.  On the palate I am getting bread, banana, some cloves, spice and candied fruits as well.  Great beer for the summer!

bottle 355 ml 
Appearance:  thick murky amber , mid top 3+Nose:  Fresh , sweet-sour weizen character , grainy fresh weizen nose. Sweet finish. 7+Flavor/Palate : Soft bodied , clean velvet like texture. Drinkable wheat ale , perhaps not 100 % in Weizen style but well rounded and super drinkable.

Bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with an average, frothy white head, somewhat lasting with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy malt (cookie, straw, hay, meal), light hop (grass), average yeast (dough, earth) with notes of pear, banana, and dust.  Light bodied, creamy texture, average carbonation, and a chalky finish.  Short duration, light sweetness, acidity, and bitterness.

12 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow with a big sudsy white head that slowly fades to a fine film. The nose is strong with spices: white pepper, cloves and maybe some cinnamon. Not much fruit in the aroma, just spices. The taste has a good fruit profile with banana, pears and melons set in a spicy (mostly clove) malt backdrop. The palate is silky smooth, though a bit thin,  with prickly carbonation. The finish is long with lingering cloves. This is a very tasty hefe, but I think that they were a bit heavy handed with the clove.

12oz bottle from Bubbles Liquor World. Pours hazy pale yellow gold with small white head. Aroma smells like banana laffy taffys. Lots of banana, clove and spices. Flavor is banana, clove, grain and some spices. Really tasty hefe. Smooth and refreshing and perfect mouthfeel.  I thought I was not going to like this based on style and initial aroma but I would go out and buy a six pack of this.
Pours a hazy golden color with a white head.  Aroma is banana, clove, wheat, honey, and some spicy hops.  Flavor is wheat, honey, clove, banana, some grain, and a slightly spicy finish.

Beautiful murky straw pour, with tons of yeasty "floaties", a wispy head that leaves soapy lace.  The aromas are of generous banana and sugar & spice cookies.  The flavors have bananas, wheat, hints at lemon notes, yeast and tons of spices.  The finish closes nicely on a dry spice.  This is impeccably balanced, and a wonderful, wonderful example of the style.  The mouthfeel is slick, yet substantive in body.  Extremely complex, but nothing overdone, this is one incredibly put-together brew.

Opaque, hazy and gold with lots of lacing. Generous aroma of banana, bubble gum, clove and spice. Restrained and balanced complex flavor. Simply one of the best Hefes around. Sierra Nevada does not disappoint. Hello new favorite Hefe.
Generally not a weizen drinker myself, but this is pretty nice. A good bit of wheat tang to it, some citrus and banana. Refreshing beer.

From a 12 oz bottle - pours a hazy golden color with a very thick, long standing foamy white head.  Lots of lacing.  Aroma of banana, spice, and yeast.  Nice smooth taste of sweet banana, lemon, wheat and clove - much more of a German Hefeweizen than many of the American version but not overdone on the banana like some that try to be more German.  Perfect balance.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2009 Obscured lemon. Creamy stark-white froth displays good retention. Phenolic nose of plastic and clove, with subtler scents of dough, sulfur, dried pineapple and banana taffy. Soft, fine-bubbled carbonation. Thin and watery body. Initially spicy and arid with clove and sharp plastic notes, yet notably toasty as well. Not a whole lot of vibrancy to speak of, as the rampant toastiness creates a disagreeable tandem as it joins the overripe banana/banana taffy qualities. Though the body is fairly dry, dabs of baked apples exacerbate the dullness while contributing substantial flabbiness and weight. Decently layered in the malt department, as dry crackery malt overlaps the slicker and beefier wheat tang, but there is very little depth to speak of. Finishes clove-spicy and lightly floral, with dull banana notes lingering alongside hints of borderline astringent toasted grain and doughy yeast. Explosiveness as well as subtlety, cleanness and vibrancy (e.g. in this case the hop definition is poor, and the banana character is artificial/taffylike/overripe) are key elements that can make or break this style of beer. Sadly, it lacks all of those features. The wheat is also mushy and the beer is tainted by sulfur notes. Love the open-fermentation approach they took, but I cant say I am impressed. Was so hoping to love this as one thing the world is lacking is reliably fresh, well-crafted weissbier. Bummer.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a hazy bright golden color with a large yellow-white head. The aroma was dryish, wheaty and had notes of clove and bubblegum. The flavor was dryish, musty and wheaty with light elements of clove, banana and bubblegum. The finish was short, tangy and sweetish. Fairly full bodied. Good.

pours hazy orange gold with a thick pillowy white head.
aroma is strong banana and clove spice. 
Flavour is banana, light lemon citrus and wheat with some lingering spice in the finish.

Ive had this beer a few times now, usually after some yard or house work, but its such a nice refreshing summer beer I havent bothered with a rate until now. Hazy yellow-gold, big fluffy head with some pretty nice staying power.  Wheaty, malty, with the right amount of banana, clove and citrus flavors.  A light spice mingles in nicely.  A touch sticky.  Nice beer, one of the better Hefes Ive had.  Sierra Nevada seldom lets down.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a cloudy yellowish gold with a large linen white head that lasted until the last sip and left very light lace.  Pleasant aroma of wheat, sour lemon and cloves.  The flavor is almost exactly the same as the aroma with wheat, sour lemon and a bit of clove.  Fairly velvety mouthfeel.  Very refreshing beer.

Bottled sample shared with oakbluff.  Gold in colour with a bit of haze and strong carbonation. Aromas are of mild banana, green (somewhat minty) hops, vanilla, and a bit of bubblegum. The banana elements take on an additional citrus complexity in the mouth, along with more soapy Thrills bubblegum and a bit of clove and hops. Light bodied and refreshing.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2013 12oz Bottle. The Pour was a hazy amber yellow with an average (1-2 finger) white foamy head that lasted throughout and produced fair streaky lacing. 

The aroma was a light grain malt and a mild doughy yeast with notes of banana, citrus (lemon), a bit of coriander and a hint of vanilla. 

The taste was slightly bitter and rather yeasty with a hint of citrus pretty much throughout, with the finish having a slight spiciness towards the end. The flavor was short lived with a mild citrusy yeast taste fading quickly from the taste buds.

Mouthfeel was light in body with a thin creamy texture and a medium carbonation.

Overall this was a really good Hefeweizen, with a nice creamy yeasty taste and a good drinkability. This is a brew that I will definitely drink again, especially on one of those extremely hot summer days...

Bottle, gave a cloudy sandy-orange pour with a white fluffy head, glass of beer reminds me of a creamsicle, left some nice lacing on the sides of the glass, aromas of ripe banana sweetness, lemon and orange citrus, wheat, faint spice and bazooka gum fragrances in the background, flavors are similar to the aromas, creamy mouth feel, a nice and easy drinking beer.

Pours a hazy yellow-gold. Aroma is of sweet banana. Flavor is malty with strong hints of banana, corriander, and clove -- which gives a nearly chai taste. Palate is creamy and velvety. Very enjoyable, though a little sweet. The mixture of banana and clove makes for a fascinating taste, though a little unbalanced on the banana side.

12oz bottle. Color is a hazy yellow with average carbonation and a thin tight head.  Aroma of banana.  This brew has a light medium body that goes down easy giving a light banana flavor, some coriander and clove.  Its a fairly good Hefe but not great.

~Pours a cloudy gold/orange color with big creamy white lasting head.
~Scent of citrus, coriander, clove, yeast and wheat.
~Banana and clove like flavor with some tart citrus.
~Medium frothy feel with a citrus spice finish.
~Enjoyable Hefeweizen, above average.

am in a phase of my beer adventures where I dont buy the same beer twice when I go to the beer store... I have bought a six pack of this beer 4 times already. This is the beer that should restore our faith that american brewers can make hefes. This was stunning.... Smells of clove and banana. Pours a very cloudy dark yellow with a fantastic white head. Simply the best medium body and carbonation of any session summer ale I have had. Crisp and clean on every sip or guzzle. Flavor was mild and sweet with spice and banana. Quite Herby and spice and delicious.. I hope this is a year round product from SN

Bottle. Murky pale golden body with a fizzy white head that slowly diminishes. Nice aroma, though not overly strong, of banana, clove, lemon, toasted grain, bubblegum with a hint of sulphur. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly bitter. The finish is lightly sweet and lightly to moderately bitter with a nice tartness at the very end. Medium body, watery texture and lively carbonation. Ive had several of these in the past few weeks and am tasting this one side-by-side with a Weihenstephaner. It is holding is own for the most part though not quite on par  the aroma is a bit weaker as is the body. Still, this is a refreshing, flavorful, well-made hefe.

Wonderful aroma of coriander and citrus orange peel. This beer poured a cloudy unfiltered golden color with tremendous head and lacing. It tasted as good as it looked with notes of banana, spice, and clove. Very refreshing and lively on my palate. This is the best German hefeweizen Ive ever had! Near flawless score for superior craftsmanship.

Bottle.  Pours a yeast clouded hazy golden with a creamy bubbly off-white head.  Leaves a wide swath of white lacing.   Lots of yeast in the bottle to swirl and dump in.  Aroma is rich with notes of clove and banana, some sweet bubblegum.  Flavor is not as rich asd the aroma, but mildly conveys a yeast rich bready character with lemony tart  notes being more prevalent.  Pretty nice and refreshing.  Finishes tartly bitter that fades and lingers lightly.  Full carbonation.

Bottle. Golden-amber beer with a cream colored head. Wheat, spice, and light banana aroma. Wheat, light spice, and light banana flavor. Medium bodied. Refreshing. Wheat, light spice, and light banana lingers. Solid.

Aug. 13, 2009; 12 oz. bottle. Golden & hazy, with generous, quickly-dissipating head; splotchy, slip-sliding lacing. Unusually flavorful, zesty & palate-pleasing for a hefeweizen. Remains light & citrusy despite ample evidence of a malt backbone. Probably the best example of the style Ive yet tried.  Not to jinx Sierra Nevada, but this brewery never drops the ball.
Hazed golden/orange pour with fluffy head and lace. Bananas and clove on the nose. Fruity banana and clove flavor. Medium full bodied with creamy soft carbonation. A very nice drinker

Bottle.  Pours a deep hazy gold with a nice fluffy white head.  Banana, bubblegum, hops, caramel, cloves and a lemony smell too.  Flavor is very yeasty and full of banana.  Light clove notes and very small hop bite.  Very well done.  Cheers.

This beer was very good.  Not my favorite style but this brew was true to its form.  Had all the charateristics of a good hefe.  ITs easy to see why it scores so high on this site.  Another winner from one of my favorite breweries.

Cloudy yellow pour with a frothy big off-white head. Aroma of bananas and cloves. Flavor of bananas and cloves. Very mellow refreshing beer. Low carbonation. Easy to drink, could easily drink a 6-er in a single session. Very tasty and nice lacing.
Fantastic nose of bananas and clove. Taste is about the same.Fantastic. I cant add much more than is here already. Smooth and tasty for a Hefe.

This poured a cloudy yellow color with a big white head. Aroma was really nice yeast, wheat, clove and banana. Flavor was very very smooth and well blended with mainly notes of banana and spices, somewhat yeasty as well. A nice and surprising offering from SN.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellowish/golden body with a medium fluffy white head which suprisingly didnt last too long. Nice bananna and light clove aroma with some wheat notes. Nice smooth body. Nice balanced malty and sweet tart finish. Really nice hefe on a hot day here in Buffalo

been enjoying this one for a bit now. honey colored with a white head. spiced clove and banana sweetness with just a bit of apple. smells like banana laffy taffy, tastes just how i expect. light sulphur, and herbal notes underneath a dominant banana sweetness. bubblegum, and finishes drier and leaves a lasting banana and clove earthy yeast flavor. well made beer that is going to keep me happy in my non airconditioned hole during the hotter days. 4 8 8 5 17

Appearance:  Pours a pastel yellow gold, with tons of cloudy haze. Even though there is a lot of action going on in the body, the fluffy white head quickly disappears.

Aroma:  A little banana and a little breadiness. Nothing overwhelming, but very defined.

Taste: Big mouthful of banana, a little sourish fruity twang, some clove, and finishes with some SN trademark spicy hopiness.

Mouthfeel:  Thick, almost chewy. Fizzy!

Overall: I love this beer.
Very wheaty beer. Much better than other American versions of hefe. Banana and spice. Nice.

Hazy golden orange with a one-finger head, good retention, and very nice lacing. Strong bready aromas with a touch of citrus and yeast. Flavors were similar, with a nice addition of spices. Sweetness yields to a slightly bitter finish. Light to medium body, lots of carbonation, and a nice soft mouthfeel.

Aroma like a true hefeweizen, done very well.  The aroma is yeasty, banana, clove. The appearance is a hazy yellow, white head, true to the style.  The flavor is wheat, clove, other spices, banana sweetness, The finish is spiciness, slight hop bittering.  Nice mouthfeel, slightly on the thick side, smooth.  Well done hefe.  I was trying to determine if the beer had any similarities to kellerbier, or if the open vessel fermentation had any effect on this brew.  It did not appear so. This simply comes out as a good hefeweizen.

The occasion is rare that Im in the mood for a hefe but today was that day (94 degrees out). Pours an attractive, very cloudy yellow orange (like pale orange juice) with a white billowy head. Yeasty clove/banana nose with a touch of grass and flowers. The flavor is a delicious blend of wheat, banana, lemon/citrus, clove, bubblegum, hay, grass and herbal noble hops. Pleasantly sweet on the palate while the hop bitterness just plays a balancing role - which mustve felt weird for Sierra Nevada. Medium body which coats the mouth very nicely; moderate carbonation. While its nothing mind-blowing, it just really hits the spot as the perfect drinkin beer.

Sierra Nevada has graced us with not one but two new beers this year, although getting my hands on, much less keeping their Torpedo IIPA in stock is proving to be a feat of magic and miracles. On the other hand, their Kellerweisse Hefeweizen is much easier to find and just as delicious to sup. While I laud the Torpedo for its exuberant yummyness, I also chastise it for its lack of availability. Thats alright though; it is a temporary issue which will eventually be resolved. Hopefully. In the meantime, I am going to sup on many a 6pack of Kellerweisse Hefeweizen. Sierra Nevada finally got a wheat beer right. Even better, its a bottle-conditioned Hefeweizen which guarantees a longer shelf life and some maturation with age.


Clouds of orangesicle, yellow cream, and white marshmallow puffs fill my glass with rich beauty; truly a work of art. Her white head floats suspended, lazing about with nonchalant lessez-faire while I make sure to swirl the bottle dregs into my glass. The dregs WILL be mine! As I pour the last of her luscious chunky bits into my glass, a billowing bouquet of bananas, banana cream, banana bread warm from the oven with nuts aromatizing the air while spices and clove tease my senses. Amazingly smooth, creamy, and bursting with all the hefeweizen esters I love so much. A touch of toasted meringue and I am on to quaffing bliss. Just as her nose promised, the mouthfeel is also smooth, creamy, and boldly going where many beers before her have gone. Gliding over my tastebuds, banana cream lays next to banana pudding while I slice into a huge chunk of warm banana nut bread exuding cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove. Real butter is really good so of course I slather a generous amount over my banana bread which melts into the Kellerweisse Hefeweizens gorgeous palate. My breath is warm with clove and spice while toasted nuts lightly dry my palate just in time for another generous quaff. She is gentle as silk, belying her lightly chewy mouthfeel. As she grows just a touch drier, the palate evolves from banana bread warm from the oven to dry banana bread mix. Exquisite balance. Each quaff is traced by beautifully creamy lace and far sooner than expected, my glass is empty. Good thing I have more in my fridge because I feel a second coming.


German Hefeweizens are a love-hate relationship for many. I, of course, fall amongst the love em camp. Great year round, they especially shine in the warmer muggy months where the sun shows no mercy and the skies are an endless deep blue sea. Excellent job, Sierra Nevada. A true German-style Hefeweizen, she is a proud new addition to a long established family of good beers.
Pours a hazy amber with a white head.  Smells of sweet wheat, some coriander, spicy.  Tastes sweet with corinder, ginger and some clove showing up on the finish.

12oz. brown bottle served in a shaker pint. Poured a cloudy, pale gold with a big white head. Plenty of carbonation which is typical of the style. Spicy aroma with more clove than banana, which is how I prefer a hefe. Light to medium body. More banana in the flavor and some wheaty spice. They really nailed the creamy mouthfeel that you typically only get in a German Hefe. Seems to be some noble hops in there. Dry finish. One of the best American takes on Hefe.

I cant imagine a much better Hefeweizen.  True to continental styles, and hopped and a tolerable level: Im impressed!  Very good hefe with spicy aroma and wheaty goodness in the flavor.  Complex and refreshing.
Pours an expected hazy gold with thick white head, lots of lacing.  Aroma of wheat, citrus, banana, yeast, and a bit of spice.  Flavor matches well and is very refreshing.  Thoroughly enjoyed.

The palate of this beer has a little bit of banana, lemon, and also a little yeast. apperance of this beer is very clean and solid. the finishes of this beer is semi sweet.  This is a soild new release

The palate of this beer has a little bit of banana, lemon, and also a little yeast. apperance of this beer is very clean and solid. the finishes of this beer is semi sweet.  This is a soild new release

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2012 Looks like a tropical smoothie with a decently frothy white head that doesnt retain very well. Pretty strong aroma of banana, clove, lemongrass, and yeast. Strong banana on the flavor. A little bit sweeter than I had expected, but a really solid hefe. Silky and creamy mouthfeel with a sweet, wet finish. As my beer knowledge has matured I have come to really respect S N. They make some great beers and this is no exception.

12oz bottle. Pours a clear golden body before adding the last bit in which it immediately turns very cloudy and more orange than gold. Thick, two-finger width, frothy, white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a moderate lacing. Aroma is full of citrus, banana bread, and clove. Some bubble gum, yeast, and wheat as well. I like this moderately sweet aroma. The flavor is solid, but I like the aroma a little more. Soft cloves are aplenty as well as a milky banana-wheat bread, yeast, a subdued citrus zest, pear, and more of that bubble gum taste. Finishes semi-dry with a creamy banana, yeast, wheat, semi-zesty citrus that lingers for a moderate amount of time. Medium to full bodied, creamy smooth, and a nice soft carbonation. Overall, Im rather impressed with this. The creamy banana bread flavor is pretty nice. A solid new release.
Golden body, a little cloudy with a white head.  Nice sweet banana, clove, yeast aroma.  Sweet, light flavor - more banana and yeast; very little aftertase. Excellent beer for a hot day.

I think it came up a little short of being an excellent representation of a hefeweizen but didnt come across as a wheat. I dont like wheat and love Hewes so I feel Im the perfect critic for this beer. So take my advice and grab a sixer of Kellerweis. 
DO IT!

Sweet lemon and gingerbread aromas.  Some clove, and a little spiciness. Golden color, slightly opaque. Flavors of banana bread, cloves, some lemon, some cream. Palate is pretty rich and creamy with a nice sweet and lightly bitter duration. Nice hefe.

Pour is a hazy orange yellow body beneath an inviting creamy white head.  Bananas and clove, just true to style.  American brewers (exclude New Glarus), take note, this is how to brew a hefeweizen.  This is pretty spot on and rivals many of the German counterparts.  At this price point, this IS one of the best domestic beers you can buy.  Excellent stuff!
Sampled at the Denver Brew Fest.  Pretty solid.  Nice nose of bananas and fruity esters.  Flavor is just as good.  Really dug it.  Excellent hefe.

Banana-like beer with a bit of spiciness.  The aroma, sour and rotten, turned me off and really impacted the enjoyability of this beer. The flavor was smooth and nice, and I probably could have liked it more.  But, ooooh that smell.

Bottle 35,5 cl. Hazy and opaque yellow with a dense, off-white head. Very sweet banana and yeast in the nose. Medium body, sweet banana and yeast again - no real tartness or phenols. A mild, smooth and pleasant Hefe, but Im not sure I understand what all the fuss is about. 100709

Diolch Mr JoeMcPhee for this bottle. Nice hazy orange colour with a thin white lace. Fruit aroma with hints of herb, wheat, banana and clove. Smooth texture yet leaves a tingle on the tongue. Strong influence of banana in the flavour , hint of spice. Nice beer and the best hefe Ive had in a while. Solid beer.

Yeasty aroma with some sour smells. Swirling hypnotizing sediment wheat beer pour. Fairly well mannered wheat spice beer initially. Just a thin head. Decent wheat beer character, fun and interesting. Taste grows on you. Becomes even more mannered as the session continues. Very nice creamy carbonation. Some bitterness builds toward the end of the session. Over all good beer experience.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of light bread and grain, light flowers for the hops, moderate musty basement for the yeast, with hints of banana and clove. Head is small, frothy, white, with a scant amount of lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is murky yellow/amber. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly acidic and bitter, and a toush sour. Palate is on the lighter side of medium, watery yet a litttle slick and has a soft carbonation. A little middle-of-the-roadish, but still a well crafted German Hefeweizen.

2 bouteilles de 12 oz partagées lors dune dégustation avec Glouglouburp et des amis dans un camping du Vermont. Arôme: Odeur de bananes sucrées et de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde blanchâtre. Présence dun moyen col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de bananes et de citron avec une pointe de céréales et de clou de Girofle. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Palette: Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de banane en arrière goût. (Rating #2556)

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a cloudy golden color with a medium sized white head.  The aroma is wheat malt, toasted, slightly spicy, banana, and bubble gum.  The flavor has the toasted wheat malt base with bananas and citrus fruit, clove, bubble gum that grows as it warms, and a slight smokiness.  It is at the same time chewy and smooth.  Its nice to see that this is in the regular rotation.

Hazy yellow, some banana and sweetened lemon juice aroma.  First sip is sweet like fresh bread, finishes dry and toasty.  That leaves room in the glass to pour out the sediment from the bottle which creates increased density in the glass and aroma.  Deeper in the sip as well with a creamier body, still fairly dry in the finish.

12oz bottle, pours a light a tangerine color with a white head. Smells like banana bread...I cant wait to take a drink. Very light feel, quite refreshing. A light banana and nutty taste, I dont usually enjoy wheat beers but this is scrumptious. This would probably be a great beer on a hot day after dealing with asshole clients all day. Surprising and delicious.

Bottle. Murky gold. Short white head. Aroma is candied fruit, bubblegum, banana, light spice and wheat. Taste is strong banana and bubblegum with lemon, wheat, yeast, light spice, candied fruit and sweet malts. Very tasty! Body is light and bubbly. Refreshing on a warm evening! Ends with more sweet malts, yeast, wheat/grains, bubblegum, banana, and light spice. Nice hefeweizen!

bottle- yum. Love this beer. Love Sierra Nevada- this beer represents everything that SN does so well- flavorful, yet understated- beers of true character- not over the top, knock you in the face elements that drown out everything else in an otherwise good beer- this has yeast driven flavor characteristics that drive the beer without overwhelming it. This was admittedly not one of my favorite styles before, but I will seek it out now.

12 oz. bottle into a pint glass

Its clean, quality, and easy to drink. It has typical aromas and flavors, but its surprisingly smooth, and some would probably say its a bit light for the style.

12 oz bottle. pours a cloudy golden yellow with nice fluffy head. Aroma is grass, spice mainly cloves. Tasts is cloves hints of banana and citrus.Very refreshing and very drinkable. Probably one of the best american hefeweizens

This has to be the best American-made hefeweizen Ive ever had.  Poured into a weizen glass from a 12 oz bottle.  Pale, cloudy yellow with a thick, pillowy white head, and heavy carbonation.  Aromas of grass and citrus.  Fizzy but watery consistency.  Lemon flavor with a crisp hop finish, and some lingering bitterness.  This is a well-balanced hefeweizen that compares favorably to the best German examples.  Id love to line this one up side-by-side with Weihenstephaner or Paulaner.
Cloves and bananas dominate this beer and I like it.  Nice orange-ish color.  Lovely spice aroma and the taste is great.  I have had this on tap and bottled.  Both are great.
Pours a cloudy straw color with a good size head.  Strong banana aroma.  Nice refreshing thirst quencher. Nice soft feel on the palate.  Finally a true hefeweizen made in America.

Tasted 8/2/09.  12oz bottle.  Activated pour produced two fingers of off-white head.  Hazy and sedimented with a golden straw hue.  Heady aromas of citrus and candy circus peanuts.  Estery with a slight banana note.  Medium bodied and rather soft.  Silky complexion.  Moderate yet tame effervescence.  Good grainy cereal wheat note.  Crisp finish.  Trace hops.  Mild spices.  This is very easy on the palate!  Super smooth and quenching.  The banana lingers and shines in the finish.  This is very nice!

pours a cloudy yellow with a large white foamy head, and a very good lacing.

smell is of wheat, citrus, banana, and some spice.

taste is crisp, wheat, a touch of citrus, some banana, and spice, ends on the dry side.

Bottle.  Pours a hazy straw color with a big off-white head.  LOTS of ripe bananas in the aroma along with some cloves and hints of orange rinds in the background.  Thin to medium-bodied with plenty of carbonation.  Crisp and refreshing.  Sweet and wheaty upfront taste-wise with some bananas and bubble gum.  Tangy orange rinds follow.  A touch of lemon at the end.

Pours a bright cloudy lemon rind yellow with a three finger billowy white head. Aroma of lemongrass and barnyard. Nice interplay of sour wheat and estery yeast. More spice and isoamyl acetate than usual. Flavor is spicy, notes of lemongrass, wheat, mild banana and bubblegum. Palate is softly carbonated with a full wheaty mouthfeel.

Pours from the 12 oz bottle a cloudy, opaque golden yellow color with a one finger head that settles into a heavy collar.  Kind of hard to see what carbonation may be taking place in the haze.  The aroma is floral & spice, with just a faint hint of banana and lemon.  1st sip is initially sweet & crisp, with some spicy clove, a hint of banana, and a tangy, almost citrusy aftertaste.  The mouth feel is quite tingly.  Drinkability is off the charts, what with the crisp, tart flavor & the relatively low abv.  An excellent session beer for the hot, hazy dog days of the summer!!!

Bottle. Pours a cloudy light amber-yellow with a huge fine-bubbled head. Aroma of wheat and bananas with s touch of citrus. Wow, the taste and feel is much softer and more delicate than I expected. Malty, fruity (bananas and citrus) and a bit of cloves, with a touch of bitter at the end. Took me half the glass to pick out the flavors, and this one goes down fast and easy. This beer practically drinks itself, and I could see me consuming a 6-er of these too quickly. That would be perhaps a bit of a shame as the flavors are also worth savoring.

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2009 Cloudy golden yellow, modest head. Moderately wheaty nose, maybe some lemon, but mostly cereal grain wheat. Wheaty and citrus flavor, zesty, grainy with light hints of bubblegum and very light hints of phenol coming through. Banana? barely if it all.  Light palate is refreshing for what it is. I agree with others: an above average American wheat. On 2nd thought, this beer really grew on me over the course of the 6 pack. Banana and wheat characteristics came through better, and the beer just felt very well built.

12 oz bottle from Oak Tree. Pours a murky brownish/amber with an average sized foamy white head. Aroma has lots of wheat and fruit going on with a slight touch of sourness. Medium to fuller bodied with slight creaminess. Flavor is lots of wheat and grass notes along with fruit, peach and orange, some hay as well. Not bad and a lot better then the last crappy Belgian Wit I just rated, however I think Im good on wheat beers for awhile.

bottle thanks to swalden28.  poured a hazy yellow with a nice white head and some lace.  aroma was banana, bubble gum, and citrus.  flavor was banana, bubble gum, citrus, clove, and some florals.  medium body with high carbonation.

Poured from Bottle into Weizen glass.

Pours a cloudy golden with some touches of orange around the edges and has a soft, creamy white head that remains a nice layer atop the glass. The aroma is filled with yeast, banana, lemon zest and touches of bread. The flavor is sweet upfront with lemon and is accompanied by some banana and yeast. It has a crisp light to medium body. The aroma on this beer is phenomenal, very bubblegummy and spiced but Id like just a touch more of that in the flavor. All in all definitely worth it to buy a case of this stuff for some fun weekend activity.

pours a hazy golen yellow iwth a white head.  Its carbonated!  bunch of bubbles.  notes of bread, clove, spices, banana, baby wipes.  taste is wheat, lemon, spices.  decent body.  Refreshing.  This was decent, but not as good as I was expecting from the reviews.  A few off flavors-  like wet leaves.  Definitely an above average  American Hefeweizen, but not as good as weihenstephaner hefe weissbier.    A nice lunch beer, though.
hazy pour with good amount of white head...nose of yeast, citrus, and banana...flavor is wonderful wheaty goodness

Pours a super cloudy golden color with thick white head that fades and leaves gobs of lacing.  Aroma is of tart wheat, clove, banana, light bubblegum and a half full porta potty.  Not sure what it is, but Im getting a bit of sulfur smell in this.  Taste is tart wheat, lemon, light clove and a touch of banana.  Finish is semi creamy with a tart finish.  Not sure what all the fuss was over this one.  I guess when you have access to fresh Dancing Man Wheat, all other hefeweizens pale in comparison.

Hazy straw-gold color beneath a thick foamy white head. Aromas of wheat, lemon, banana-like yeast esters and a touch of clove. Light refreshing tart wheat character balanced by a nice clove and pepper spice and faint malt sweetness. Very well made, authentic German wheat. Refreshing and drinkable, but still has substantial body and flavor.

12 oz bottle from Bier Stein. Pours out a hazy gold with a thick white head. Aroma is hefty on clove and peppery spice with a bit of light banana. Flavor much the same, light wheat but mostly clove and pepper. Very refreshing, would definitely drink again.

Pours hazy golden with white head.  Nose is the typical banana/clove but not overly strong with banana.  On the palate the banana is weak as well, but plenty of herbal flavors, hops come through too, and a decent clove/spice in the mix.  Wheat cracker is present.  Carbonation is good and feels fuller bodied than most weissbiers.

Pours opaque copper-ish orange with nice off whiter head. It left a ring of yeast at the bottom of the bottle. The aroma has some lemon acidity, grains, yeast and little else. The taste begins very refreshing with both sweet grains and a modest level of vague hoppy bitterness. By midway is picks up yeast and wheat notes to go along with mild banana and more grains into the finish. Nice.

Wow. Just wow. Easily the best American-made hefe there is. The mouthfeel was probably the kicker for me- so full across the palate and challenging each and every taste bud with good banana and clove loveliness.

bottle poured a nice hazy golden in color with a thin off white head. aroma has banana yeast, bread, wheat, and a slight bit of spice. pleasant mouth feel with plenty of carbonation. flavor has a nice wheat base, banana yeast, flowers, low spices, and a bit of sweetness. very drinkable and has a nice body through the whole glass.

Bottle from Sicilianos Market, Grand Rapids under BIG recomendation from 17thfloor.  Im even drinking it out of a weiss glass Gerrit!  Cloudy amber orange with medium, creamy white head.  Aroma is wheat, breadiness, citrus, nice balanced hops, some clove and yeast.  Flavor is wheat, citrus hops, banana, some clove, nice spiciness, medium sweetness, very dinkable.  Medium, creamy body.  Very nice, refreshing, really hits the spot.

From the bottle pours a beautiful, glowing, hazy orange-amber colored body.  Fine streams of bubbles effervesce towards the surface, sticking tight to the curve of the glass.  A tall, foamy, off-white head settles in slowly to a small but dense layer.  The aroma shows all the classic hefe signs, including sweet banana, bread yeast, clove, and orange peel.  It smells very clean and inviting, quite fruity overall.  The flavor mirrors the nose, smooth banana sweetness pairing seamlessly with spicy clove, orange, and lemon pith.  The wheat profile is as fresh as can be.  Above average hop bitterness lends a distinctly floral bite on the finish.  The palate is both smooth and spicy, perhaps just a bit overly saccharine, with fine, tingling carbonation. Overall, a top notch hefeweizen.

bottle... hazy golden pour , big white head , good lacing.aroma of yeast , banana and wheat. flavor is spicy and fruity.slightly sweet,very easy drinking ,creamy and smooth light bodied with medium carbonation . good summer brew.
12 fl oz bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Dry wheaty and mild fruity aroma. Fruity, light banana  and orange note. Fruity and mild estery finish. Clean and classic hefeweizen.

12 oz. Nearly opaque golden pear-colored with a lasting half inch head. Aroma of banana, lemon and resin. Flavor is the same mix with the resin making a nice dry finish. LIght-medium body is smooth, acidic-tingly and dry.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a pale, opaque gold with a pillowy white head.  Wheat, yeast, hay, a little varnish, and some spice in a fairly basic nose.  Medium-high carbonation with a light mouthfeel.  A little lemon, yeast, dust, clove, and a bit of banana on the palate.  Short finish.  I found this one to be rather uninspiring.  Eh.

Bottle.  Pours a murky apricot color with a medium to large head the color of whipped egg whites.  Spicy coriander notes, clean wheat profile, and a hint of caramel.  Thin bordering on medium bodied, sweet and mild.  Finishes a little bit empty.  Still the best of the 6 summer-ish brews I had today, the others being  SN Summerfest, Harpoon Summer Beer, UFO, raspberry UFO, and Smutty Summer Weizen.

Bottle; poured a murky, dark gold/amber color with a smallish white head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, and spice; slightly sweet and nice.  The palate was very nice; smooth and creamy.  The flavor was solid, but not great for me; and the after taste was not very good.  Sweet wheat, with a bit of banana and spice.  Didnt live up to the hype for me.
Pours out a cloudy gold with lots of foam. Taste is creamy, yeasty and some spice. Flavors of citrus, bannana, corriander, clove and bread. Good summer brew.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2010 From a bottle into a pilsner glass.  Pours with a ton of head.  Creamy white/gold color.  Be sure to get all the yeast from the bottom of the bottle!  Aroma was of yeast, orange and dough.  Taste was very yeasty, almost like a Belgian but not really... and with banana.   No alcohol taste present whatsoever.  Mouthfeel was extremely creamy.  I really liked this beer.  It was extremely complex with a cream-like consistency.  ONe of the best hefes Ive tasted period!

Hazy dark gold color with a thin white head that lasts for a while. Aroma is big pungent citrus and some spice. Flavor is a touch sweet and pretty well carbonated. Get a nice cinnamon and clove flavor in back of a lemony tang. This has a bit more character than a mass market hefe but is still very drinkable and interesting enough to keep you satisfied. Not so much so that it will make you slap your mother though. Going down great after my weekend in the yard playing with rocks.

Bottle into weizen. Pours a hazy gold with a two finger, white, fluffy head that has good retention and leaves spotty lacing. Aroma of lemon zest, yeast, cloves, unripe bananas, but less pronounced than other hefeweizens. Flavor is sort of sour apricot, unripe bananas, slight nutmeg, yeast, malted wheat. Creamy on the palate. A little watery and cardboardy compared to Weihenstephaner or Ayinger versions. Not bad but in no way the groundbreaking American hefeweizen comeback. Fairly basic and lackluster.

I was disappointed.  This was a pretty straight forward mass market hefe, not nearly as complex or as interesting as the best American or German versions.  Cloudy pale gold to pale amber, big white head.  Nose of wheat, yeast, lemon and banana.  Matched in the taste.  Opened a Franziskaner for comparison and found it much more interesting.

Bottle sample at the Brevard Beer Fest  Definately one of the best hefeweizen out there.  It has what you would expect in a hefeweizen with a large head, banana and citrus aroma, fruity and yeast taste with a tough of bitterness in the finish, but Sierra Nevada made every component better and came up with a winner.
best example of a traditional german hefe from a domestic producer imo. giant thick foam head, with aromas of banana/clove/corriander. nice balance & good long clean finish.. nicely done s.nevada
From a bottle poured  a hazy straw color with a fair amount of head.  Nice light sweet fruity malty flavor with a quick finish.  Very drinkable.

jazzed to try this.. .. seems traditional .. . pours with a creamy head .. . straw haze .. . decent mouthfeel .. . decent stuff but it didnt quite mesh well with all the other stuff going on .. . would love to try this on tap! .. . I like how a Ducks opinion of me severely depends on whether I may or may not have bread!
Beer tasting at the Total Wine Pembroke Pines, FL 7/24/09 Available for $1.29 Very good!

bottle... pours a deep hazy golden with a nice white head... rock solid hefeweizen... big thanks to Sierra Nevada for crafting such a great beer in this style.... Im typically not a big hefeweizen fan, but this one has got some serious character... big banana, malt driven, citrus laced aroma... solid body with some spice and light fruit notes... sweet, slightly bitter with a touch of yeast... excellent and very enjoyable after work....

Poured a hazy yellow-gold with a medium sized off-white head and good lasting time.  Malty aroma with some banana and yeasty notes.  Light citrusy lemon as well.  Wheaty lemon flavor with some clove spice in the middle and finish.  Heavier than I thought it would be but I drank the whole six pack anyway.
Surprisingly true to the style.  Bright & hazy gold pour.  Fluffy off white head and drippy lace.  Spicy sweet aroma.  Citrus, yeast and light gum.  Dry finish.  Clean and refreshing

Hazy apricot pour with modest white head. Aroma is citrus, nectar and light sugary fruit with banana-clove and apricot. Flavor is wheat malt with some spicy notes and a strong sugary backbone of apricot and banana. Citrus comes through near the finish but doesnt act to overpower- just provides a nice balancing element. Palate is superb for the style, with a clean dry finihsh. A great example of the style- very well done.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy light orange with a small, foamy white head.  Aroma of clove, banana, wheat.  Typical hefe but not overly spiced.  Light and a touch fruity.  Flavor is sweet initially, light and fruity, with a tangy spiciness and citrus.  Top notch hefe indeed.
7/4/8/4/15 (3.8/5)

Great golden pour with fluffy white head.  Nice clove and banana to smell, some green apples as well.  A metallic woody tinge is there.  The body is smooth and buttery nice mouthfeel here and easy to drink.  The flavor is mouth coating and layered.  A nice flavor profile here with obvious spiced fruit notes but also some quiet toasted bits and pieces, light sugar, vanilla and oak.  Very tasty.

Beer pours out of the bottle a golden/orange with a very tall, frothy, white head that leaves a ton of lacing on the side of the glass. Aroma is a strong wheat note, a light clove spiciness with some light banana esters and finishes with a strong yeasty note. Flavor has a clove bit at first that quickly fades into a cinnamon spiciness, middle has a heavy yeastiness with a banana fruitiness following it up and melding with the residual spice flavors until the end. Mouth feel is almost spot on, only a tad bit light on the yeast. Overall, as with all of Sierras offerings, a very good example of the style.

Best Hefeweizen Ive had in quite some time.  Sierra Nevada nailed this one.  Light malty aroma with a big banana and clove scent followed by oranges and strong yeast.  Cloudy, vibrant orange-yellow body with a lasting 1" bright white head as well as some thick lacing.  Refreshing, light and crisp.  Also mildly tart and sweet.  Snappy wheat flavor as well as plain biscuits.  Fruity oranges, banana and lemon peel.  Spicy cloves and earthy yeast.  Great one, a near perfect summer beer.
bottle. pours hazy orange with white head. nose has banana, bready, orange and a yeastiness that adds cinnamon and clove. flavors of banana, clove, bready, yeasty. refreshing hefe.

Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly lasting.
Body is hazy medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain, husks), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with light notes of lemon peel, melon rind, banana/gum, clove.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.

Light to medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

The aroma isnt unpleasant, but the German wheat character is muted and unexciting...it comes off a little like an American wheat (light, mild-to-bland, citrus zest) mixed with a German wheat. The mouth experience is its weaker point, being thinner and more watery than your average Hefeweizen.  Looks nice, but otherwise is quite ho-hum.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2013 My Bottom Line:
Banana bread allusions seep into clove and citrus nuances as the cushiony body of this intricate Hefeweizen also brings forth minutious pears and herbal hop bitterness.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A tower of foam sits atop the cloudy straw golden.
-The clovey phenols become more prominent in the finish.
-This is exactly the kind of beer which everyone (with an open mind) can enjoy; its complex, but its so drinkable that it doesnt compel you analyze it.
-Residual sugars are well calculated, setting a fluffy base on which the yeast can express its milky banana bread personality.

Bottles.
Pours cloudy dark yellow with white head. Banana and clove aromas. Flavors of wheat, clove, bananas, bread, yeast and bubble gum. Medium body with aveage carbonation. Well done.

Pours a nice cloudy yellow color with a huge white head. The aroma is some spiciness, some fruitiness, some banana and some sulfur. Flavor is also good some lemon and some orange with some breadiness, and some spiciness. A little sulfur in the flavor keeps this from being fantastic. The palate is perfect for the style riding the line between smooth and creamy with just enough body.
Pours a hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is standard hefe banana and clove. Flavor is bready yeast, clove, and a bit of citrus.

Pours a cloudy, dirty yellow. The head lay lacing in full sheets, white as fresh snow.  nose heavily painted with banana and a thin layer of clove.   In fact, the banana is vividly intense.  Its a touch thin in the mouth with shallow waves of wheaty, banana yeast esters, and a touch of autumn spice.  Highly carbinated, I may add.  I wish it was a bit sweeter and chunkier...but at least the flavors can still be heard and understood.
Bottle into pint glass.  Really hazy yellow beer with a nice white head.  Good hefe.  Not my style at all, but a very nice and sessionable summer beer.
