bottle shared at July BA tasting.  Pours a cloudy, pale yellow with white bubbles along edge of glass, in lieu of head.  Think this was served too cold because I did not pick up any nose here.  Taste was spicy with Belgian yeast.  Mouthfeel was thin.

Bottle...  Poured a cloudy, vibrant golden/yellow/orange with a gorgeous white head, nice retention.  This is a really authentic German weizen from Sierra Nevada.  One of the best from the states.  Floral, citrus and nice esters on the nose.  Nice, dry palate.  Flavors or orange peel, wheat and yeast esters and banana.  Crisp finish.  A joy to drink.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2010 bottle-Ive really never been to much of a wheat fan at all but this one suprised the hell out of me..very nice taste, spicy cloves and bananna are very present, a little fruit and plenty of wheat to balance this out..For sure this is a nice Hefe with some depth and character, good job Sierra...

Pours a cloudy dark straw with two fingers of frothy white head that leaves sheeting lace in its wake. The nose is a solid hefe yeastiness complete with banana, rock candy and light clove over a round wheat body. The mouthfeel is soft and wheaty on the light side of medium-bodied (fairly full for the style) with a clean finish. The flavor is of sweet wheat with solid banana esters and supporting notes of clove and a crisp citric acidity that creates a staccato finish. This is easily the best widely distributed American-made hefe that Ive sampled. Given their distribution and price point, I would think this beer is making some German brewers a bit nervous about their sales numbers, here in The States. This is the real deal.

Bottle: Pours a cloudy golden brass with a frothy clump of white head.  Aroma of lightly sweet wheat and banana esters with some nice Bavarian yeasty notes.  Body starts with good fullness, carbonation and light sweetness well balanced with a good clove spice and a hint of lemon citrus toward the crisp finish.  Very drinkable and true to style.  I hope this becomes a regular staple for Sierra Nevada.

Pours a hazy golden color with fluffy white head. Aroma of wheat and pale malts, banana, and yeast. Flavor was rich with wheat, pale malt, apricot, banana, and some citrus. Full flavored but light in body and very refreshing. Great for a day out on the beach or on the boat.

Deep hazy orange tinted golden coloured body with a frothy golden tan head - very nice in appearance! Aroma of pale wheat, yeast, coriander seed, apricots and a hint of juniper berries. Light-bodied; Super mellow wheat flavour with a cool coriander seed freshness, a curacao blast and a little bubble gum on the palate - nice and refined. Aftertaste shows mostly yeast, a bit of bread and a very mellow sweetness. Overall, this beer is very mild, but it works well for the style and the season - middle of summer. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased from Half Time in Poughkeepsie, New York on 11-June-2009, sampled at home in Washington on 19-July-2009.

Pours a cloudy golden hue with thick billowy white head that sustains well. Nose dominated by banana esters and clove phenols, hints of wheat and sweet fruit. Flavor follows suit, banana and fruit syrup sweetness up front balanced out by milder tones of cloves and grassy hops, finishes sweet. Medium-body with thick creamy texture, moderate carbonation. A complex and flavorful American hefe variant, texture may be a bit to thick and chewy for purists, bit overall delicious!

UPDATED: AUG 12, 2012 
Name: Kellerweiss
Date: June 23, 2009
Mode: Bottle
Source: Greens, Atlanta
Appearance: opaque yellow. pillowy white head, lots of drippy lace
Aroma: sweet banana aroma, touch of bubblegum, spicy balancing clove
Body: creamy body
Flavor: sweet banana flavor, light spicy clove, just a hint of the bubblegum
Overall: sweet and creamy banana hefe

Name: Kellerweiss
Date: June 25, 2012
Mode: draft
Source: tmac kennesaw
Appearance: opaque yellow, creamy off white head, solid lace
Aroma: sweet banana aroma with a heavier clove presence than the bottle
Flavor: dry wheat flavor, banana and clove in balance, just a touch of estery sweetness
Overall: much too dry, I hope the bottle hazent changed

Aroma: 7/10; Appearance: 7/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 8/10; Overall: 16/20
Rating: 3.8/5.0Drinkability: 9/10
Score: *** /4

A solid hefeweizen for sure. Nice banana and clove aroma. Good wheat character. Crisp palate. Heavily sedimented. Perhaps slightly over carbonated, but in general a very enjoyable beer. And, for the price you cant beat it.

Stop in to a Sunoco to get a pack of gum and you find this little gem on a shelf.....never seen it anywhere else.  A really delicious Hefe from Sierra Nevada who I am continually impressed with, turning out large amounts of quality beer.  Sweet, with subtle bananna, well balanced and spicey.  Light-medium carbonation.  If you find it pick up a six pack....you wont be disappointed.

Nice cloudy light yellow color.  Smells of malts and yeast with a hint of lemon.  Taste is of sweeter malts with a little citrus.  Has hardly any aftertaste.  A pretty good brew, especially coming from a brewery that loves to use hops.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2009 Wonderfully cloudy, straw yellow with a dense, rocky, white cap of foam.  Great foam retention.  Aroma is yeasty, bready, slight cloviness with a touch of lemon and banana.  The flavor is citrus and clove with a sufficient amount of carbonation without being abrasive.  Light on the tongue.  Quite a refreshing and well designed hefe.  Im not catching the "uncommon depth and flavor complexity" though.

I picked this up at the Binnys in Orland Park, Illinois.  This is right up dm9831s alley, and I must present him with some.  It pours a hazy yellow body with a tall white head and leaves much lacing in its wake.  The aroma is yeasty and bready and has loads of fresh bananas with some wheaty tartness.  Very spritzy mouthfeel.  The flavor is wheaty with fresh bananas, bubblegum, a dash of clove, and a touch of lemony tartness.  Very well executed example of the style.
UPDATED: AUG 13, 2009 yeah certainly worth the $8 bucks a sixer. Sweet/tart and smooth.  Easy drinking moderate bosied and wel integrated.  No bannanas in mine.

This stuff is delicious. Amazing aroma of bubbly gum, bananas and a hint of clove... a little bit of bready aroma but its o.k... Flavor is sweet, bubble gum wheaty, bananas with a nice slightly chewy mouthfeel. Great stuff!!

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2009 Bottle. Poured with a bright yellow color and hazy, with a gigantic head. The aroma is classic German with banana and yeast. It drinks with the same classical characteristics, quite effervescent and tangy on the palate. A delicious Hefeweizen.  #900 7/17/2009

Pours slightly cloudy straw color with a big white head. Strong banana aroma with some wheat, cloves and pepper.  The flavor is a little underwhelming compared to the aroma, wheat with a banana aftertaste. The body is very light, good but not great.

Nice to have something a bit different from Sierra Nevada, a nice classic wheat beer, good for summer, with a distinct cloudy appearance with primarily orangy-banana-like smell and flavor. A bit of bacon drippings even! Moderate white head. Slightly thin on the aftertaste.

Bottle poured a cloudy gold with a lasting creamy white head. Aromas of wheat, yeast, bananas, light bubblegum and light clove. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth finish. Flavors of wheat, yeast, banana and light clove with a smooth yeasty finish.

From bottle. Nice banana clove aroma, bready and yeasty, light and fresh. Light characteristic sulfur notes with malty undertones. Cloudy butterscotch-amber with thin foamy-creamy lacing off-white head. Medium watery body with medium-high carbonation, just short of fizzy. Starts bready and wheaty, with a great classic Hefeweizen flavor. Banana and clove, light carbonic acidity, and clean finish. Very light hop bitterness, almost undetectable. Full in flavor, sweet and refreshing. This is a very nice beer and really captures the essence of good German wheat beer. It could be just a bit more full bodied, but other than that its a keeper.
bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  gold with a white head.  nose is clove, banana, yeast and spices.  very nice on the palate with a clove flavor that finishes with some fruit.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2009 Thanks to andrew for this pour.  Hazed yellow white with a creamy off white head.  Laces in spots down the glass.  Yeast citrus, bread in the nose.  Drinkable light malts that are slightly sweet with creamy carbonation.  Decent hefe.
Excellent. Pours a golden yellow with a big white head. Aroma of clove, banana. Flavor is light and refreshing. Just like its supposed to be.
Bottle.  Pours a hazy golden body with a white head.  Sweet citrus and banana, lemon grass and a chewy body.  Hints of apple and clove nice brew.

From a 12 oz bottle this poured a very cloudy gold with a very fat white head and thick lacing.  Nose of banana and soap.  Mouthfeel somewhat thin. Flavor is full of citrus and ripe fruit.  Hops in the finish.  Fine version of this style.
Bottle. Thick head. Cloudy dark yellow. Banana aroma. Flavour is mostly banana then lemon and yeast. Solid but not spectacular. Appearance and palate keep the score high.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2010 Pours a beautiful hazy gold with plenty of yeast floating throughout; large white head. Aroma of bananas, cloves, soap, and bubblegum. Slightly peppery banana flavor up front with a nice citrus and spicy finish. A little too much carbonation, but otherwise an excellent American-brewed hefe.
We are in a beer tasting club, several of us get together in honolulu and rate 8 beers every week.  We have our own scales as well as the scale used on this website to record our fun weeks!

12 oz bottle, though counting on running into a tap somewhere. Egg yolk looking pour as sediment haze is  inconsistent, and slowly dissipates. Lemonade yellow to light. With big silky tight-bubbled white head. Aroma of spice, banana, some bubblegum esters and a wheaty-malt base. Some yeasty pizza-dough. Mouth is well. Light, thin, playful. Banana, spice, upfront. Citrusy orange, wheaty mid. Spicy, crisp hop finish. Hefes not a favorite style of mine, but this is pretty satisfying. Good effort by SN.

12 oz. bottle from Plaza Liquors - Pours a hazy light golden color with a two finger thick off white head.  Light lacing.  Aroma is esters and spice.  Flavor is light citrus, esters, lightly sweetened malt, light spice, and a bit of yeast.  Light to medium body.  A nice beer.

Solid brew. One of the most satisfying beers Ive ever had. First thing I noticed was the warmed banana aroma drifting out of the bottle. Pours a hazy yellow with chunks of live yeast still drifting about (slightly unsettling). First taste to hit the tongue is banana and wheat, followed by yeast, then spicy cloves. The suspended yeast gives a nice, velvety mouthfeel.

Pours a hazy yellow/straw gold with a thick and decently long-lived white, rocky head that leaves a stripes and swaths of lace all over the glass. Tiny bubbles trickle up unendingly. The aroma is very doughy and yeasty bread with some perfumey character and soft fruit - like undercooked banana bread. The flavor is malty and wheaty with a nice floral and fruity ester profile that complements the sweet malts. At mid-tongue there is a pleasant balancing bitterness that is fairly neutral, slightly spicy. The finish is dry with some grainy pilsner malt notes gaining traction along side the wheaty, estery, floral, and lightly sweet flavors that are throughout. The mouthfeel is crisp in carbonation - though not too sudsy (perhaps a touch less carbonation texture than expected) with a light graininess and a medium-full body. Overall, a very enjoyable wheat beer. Its no Wiehenstephaner, but it is very German tasting and very drinkable and tasty.

Nice pour, good head, lasting. Hazy gold in color. Nose was nice enough, estery, phenols, fruity light bananna notes. Light bodied, lightly oily. Typical Hefe flavors, babanna, citrus and yeast, light doughy notes. Sorta pastey finish. Umm yeah, nice Hefe. Just yer typical Hefe albeit a well done American one. Props to SN for the swell attempt. Meh.

Bottle straight out of the SL coolers, purchased as a sixer, consumed the first bottle on premises. A darned nice pour, great head and lacing, hazy cloudy golden-yellow colored pour. The aroma was bananas, esters, light spicing, well-balanced. The flavor was solid, great balance, perhaps one of the best American Hefes out there. I like these to err a tad on the spice side, so that was the only thing that dropped this from the best of its class. A great job by SN!

Bottle: Effervescent cloudy orange with a dense thick white head. Nice dryish aroma- mild phenolics- wheaty with mild clove and a touch of dough. Nice creamy yet crisp feel. I like that theres no an overload of banana. When it warms theres a soft lemon & vanilla chaacter to it. Has a bready base with some spicy phenolics giving off mild clove notes. A very nice and individualistic Hefe.
Bottle thanks to Rciesla Not a big fan of this hefeweizen. Flavor was dark wheat and slight fruit esters. Will have to try again and pour this into a glass.
Cloudy yellow with nice big white head. Aroma grains- wheat, biscuits, banana, cloves.  Good body and smooth. Dry and a bit astringent (in a good way) at the finish. Solid hefeweizen.

Pours very hazy cloudy yellow / orange with a large white fluffy head.  The aroma has rich wheat, clove, bananas (but not too much), creamy vanilla and while all of it is there and represented it is gentle and rounded. Medium smooth body with some semi-sharp carbonation that adds to the flavor instead of being distracting.  The flavor has more dryness than the aroma with dried bananas, pepper, clove, grainy wheat, light spicy hops - it is clean and crisp.  The finish has a good amount of graininess and a touch of citrus acidity.  This is a great hefe & it takes a lot for me to say that.

Sierra seems to be doing everything right, style-wise with this hefe:  a yeasty, wheaty aroma with hints of lemon and banana; smooth, well rounded taste.  Picking up more spices in addition to the flavors suggested by the aroma.  Just a little tartness in the lingering aroma.  Very nicely executed.
Cloudy gold, small white head...Light yeasty aroma...Yeasty flavor, sweet with banana and bubblegum...Crisp carbonation...Excellent

Nice golden yellow haze, fluffy head, looks spot on. The smell is also exactly what you would expect, banana and cloves but nice. Flavor is nice solid hefe, yeasty and delicious. I am not partial to hefeweizens but this is a good example and way too easy to drink.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-12-2009 02:10:47

12oz bottle. well it sure does look good. the pour is beyond hazy, more like opaque. a beautiful golden color with lemony edges.  a respectably fluffy white head forms on the top of this elixir. typical heffe aroma of ester banana and clove as well as some bread crust and a soft a proper hop aroma. begins with sharp and prickly carbonation that enhances the esters and mild hop character. very dry with no overwhelming sweetness on the finish. lemons and a fresh spiciness are the last flavors to grace the tongue. overall an extremely well crafted beer. very rare that american heffes can even approach the authenticity of the german stuff. cheers to the guys at SN!

wait, swirl the 1/3 left in the bottle?  thats waht I did, and it made for a consistently yeasty pour.  body is cloudy deep golden butterscotch color, head is very tall, white, and thick like meringue. aroma is unripe banana, unripe peach, yeasty wheat malt, and faint citrusy bread crust. flavor starts tart dry yeasty wheat malt, some peach pit, and dried lemon rind.  then sweet wheaty maltyness, faint banana, and a bit of clove. finish of dry hops and yeasty wheat.

Huge off white head with the initial pour, the body is a very hazy gold orange. It looks like a classic hefe. The nose is light banana and mango. There is also a little bit of fresh bread dough. The taste has some old chewed bubblegum and a little bit of banana peels. There is also some nice clove spice in the finish. The flavors are a little rounded out when you dump in the yeast.  The carbonation is light and creates a creamy smooth mouth feel. Nice for the style, this still isnt quite for me.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2009 Picked up at SL, everyone said this beer rocks so i finally got some... Poured into a weizen. Big head orange in color. Nice aroma of hops and banana. Taste is the same.. Nice orange, banana taste. Little hop bitterness to balance it out. Nice hefe... Easy to drink. Nice beer

I went into a liquor store to grab some whisky for my father in laws birthday when a lovely lady handed me a cup of this to sample  It was the best of the four beers I tried that day.  I was pretty impressed with this one.

Poured a murky golden color with a large, white head that left nice lacing on the glass.  Aroma of light floral hops, banana, clove, citrus, toast, wheat, and some vanilla.  Taste of citrus fruits, banana, some bubblegum, moderately bitter hops, and a dry, tart wheaty finish.  Thanks Paul for the bottle!

Pours hazy gold into a weizen. Bright white head recedes to skim surface leaving spider lacing. Clove and banana aromas. Crisp upfront with cloves, turning thin and slightly sour bubblegum in the finish.

This is a really good hefe.  The belgian yeast is very prevalent which is nice considering that this amount of flavor is typically linked with the 9+% strong belgian ales.  Beautiful hazy golden color with a nice effervescent white head.  Smooth banana flavor and a nice crisp palate round out this tasty beer.  Great stuff.

Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of wheat and bananas. The flavor is sweet with notes of wheat and lighter notes of banana and citrus, leading to a dry wheaty finish.
12oz bottle, cloudy light amber, smooth white foam, slightly tangy, citrus and spice. Im not particularly fond of this style but this is certainly the best of the few Hefeweizens Ive tried.

12oz bottle. Pours murky orange with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is of hops, spice, citrus, malt, and pepper. Taste is of spicy hops and lots of citrus. Has a backbone of bready malt that evens out the spicy hops. There is also lots of pepper as well. Each sip ends with a lingering spiciness and a slight hop burn. The finish is very peppery. The mouthfeel is very carbonated and sticky, reminding me of an orange juice. A very sessionable beer that is refreshing, as well as tasty.

Bottle. Poured with a bright yellow color but completely opaque and hazy, with a gigantic head. The aroma is classic Germany -- banana and yeast. It drinks with the same classical characteristics, quite effervescent and tangy on the palate. A delicious hefeweizen!

Pours a murky yellow orange color with a large foamy/creamy white head that persists for at least 5 minutes then begins to shrink. Nose is sour and slightly rubbery, little bit of rubber ball and new sneaker, but also some tennis ball fuzz, cut banana that is starting to turn, and just a hint of spice. Tastes of lemon zest, creme custard, glazed donut, banana pudding, little bit of spice, and milk, and that delicious metallic taste you get from a particular metal (not sure, have a go at your key ring and see if you find it). Mouthfeel is velvety and the finish is on the sweet side. Id like to see more of that traditional tangy bite. No wonder this appeals to american palates. Unbelievably quaffable- This is a pint racing beer!  Id keep this around as a staple, well done.

12oz bottle.  Pours very hazy creamy gold with a generous soft foam head.  Smells of  lemony-citrus wheat slightly overpowers the banane and clove.  Tastes of lemon, wheat, banana, yeast, and very nicely spiced.  Body is great, with perfect carbonation, and creamy soft mouthfeel.  Aftertaste is sweet and long lasting.  Very refreshing.  Im not a big hefeweisen fan, but this is the best one Ive had yet.

(12oz bottle) Pours opaque yellow with great head. Nose is sour, clove, plastic, coriander and wheat. The taste has clove, banana, spicy coriander. I understand why people say this is a really good hefe because it is. Is it the best hefe out there? No and in my opinion it isnt a true German style as others have said. That being said Sierra Nevada knows how to not mess up a beer and this is a great example of their mastery of making good beer. One of the most drinkable beers Ive had in quite some time, and a perfect addition to summer. Will be in my fridge frequently I imagine.
Pours a pillowy, lacing, white head with a hazy golden straw colored body.  Smells and tastes of yeast, banana, and clove.  Solid wheat beer.

aroma is ester-full with predominant note of heavy clove, bordering on smoke. deeply and darkly spicy. during a taste, the aroma broadens, revealing the sweeter side of weizen yeast, some tropical fruit.  appearance is eggy, clouded and sunny. kudos for a weizen with a different sort of esters then the usual fare.

Bottle pours a desidedly orange ellow.  Bige fluffy white head.  Soft aroma of wheat and bubblegum and banana.  Lavor is a ver nice soft combination o the above with a little bavarian spice.  Soft full palatte that is lively carbonatwd but not fizzy.
Delicious.  I happen to be brewing a GernanHef right now and I hope it turns out something like this.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2009 Bottle.  Poured with a bright yellow color but completely opaque and hazy, with a gigantic head.  The aroma is classic Germany -- banana and yeast.  It drinks with the same classical characteristics, quite effervescent and tangy on the palate.  A delicious hefeweizen!  (#3600, 11 July 2009)

Bottle. Pours a nice cloudy golden color with a very large frothy head. Aroma of banana, cloves, and wheat. Flavor is very nice: banana and wheat dominate, but the spice is also present. Very nice medium bodied hefe. And at the price they are charging for it, it is sure to be a summer staple of mine.

Cloudy yellow pour with nice white head.  Lemon and clove all over the nose.  Flavor is banana with lemon zest and spice.  Nice bite of yeast as well that round out a great texture.  Not a style that I tend to grab, but this is good.

12oz bottle-pours a rich white head that laces and cloudy straw yellow color.  Aroma is lemon/banana/clove, light malt.  Taste is lemon/banana/clove, light malt/wheat, creamy.  Towards medium body.  Soft carbonation.  Thanks butters for sharing.
Very tasty but a little bit too far to the banana/pear side of the spectrum as opposed to the clove/yeastiness extreme, which I tend to prefer.

Nice aroma of wheat, banana, clove, and yeast.  Pours a cloudy light yellow, with a huge fluffy white head.  Nice crisp flavor, a bit of hop bitterness seems to pop out in the middle.  Finishes long and clean.  Light on the palate, and amazingly refreshing.  I may have found a new favorite summer beer.

This is one of the best hefes I have ever laid my lips on.  The beer starts with an opaque dark golden color with an extremely hazy and cloudy body.  The head is huge, generous and bright white.  It leaves a great amount of lacing around the glass.  The nose is inticing and inviting, with notes of bubble gum, banana, cloves and spices.  The body is thick and deep, but extrememly smooth and drinkable.  The flavors are quite complex for a hefeweizen, with big notes of bubble gum, cloves, spices, banana, bread and yeast.  The finish was a little spicy with a little more bubble gum flavor.  This is definitely a top-notch hefe; one of the best.

Bottle at VB throwdown.  Cloudy orange body.  Smells bananay(not really sure that that is a word) and yeasty and cloves.  Has a very smooth malty flavor along with candy sugar and the cloves.  Pretty nice.

I am rather picky about my Hefes, but let me tell you, this is a well-done hefeweizen. If you disagree, you are a fucktard. Pours a hazy orange amber with a white head. The aroma is not quite as assertive as good German imports, but it has a nice nose of yeast and banana esters. The unfiltered body is light to medium, refreshing without being watery. Flavor of pale wheat malts, with the phenols of banana, bubblegum, and clove all melded to create a nice balance. Moderate attenuation. Clove becomes more pronounced on the finish with perhaps a small hint of European hops. I like this beer better without the yeast in the pour, which is not normal for me. I think it ruins the finish on this one. Great beer, but not the perfect Hefe for me.My ideal Hefe would have just a bit more body, bubblegum, and sweetness. However, I will be buying more of this because its priced just right, fresh, and in 12 ounce bottles.

Bottle.  Pours a cloudy honey lemon color with a foamy white head.  Very nice aroma of wheat, cloves, bananas, and yeast.  Similar flavors followed by a dry citrus zest almost sour/tart aftertaste.  Refreshing and light, but flavorful.  Well done.  Another tasty offering from Sierra Nevada,

Pours a cloudy gold color with a small white head. Aroma is spicy - yeast, bubblegum. Taste is banannas, bubblegum, and yeast. Reminds me of Paulaner Hefe. A good Hefe, very drinkakable beer, good for the summer time.

nice example of a traditional German Style Hefe from a well distributed brewery. Pretty aromas of banana, and clove. Balanced on the palate with wheat, clove and yeasty qualities. One of the best traditional hefes from a domestic producer.

12oz bottle from Sams, Durham. Nice hazy pour, very vibrant and enticing, with a creamy white head and a quite lively body. Pleasant yeasty aroma, with just a touch of expected citrus and spice. A lovely mouthfeel, and the flavor is dry rather than sweet. Well done and refreshing, even if a bit unassuming.
Sampled in a bottle. A pretty well done hefe. Not too much of an overpowering flavor, but its quality with lots of complexity. Cloudy with a good amount of head. A really nice brew.

Bottle from Sams.  Really cold.  Pours cloudy bright yellow with foamy white head and great lacing.  Big banana, clove, and lemony citrus as well as yeast on the nose.  Similar, with a nicely dry palate. At $8.99/sixer, its looking likely this will always be on stock in my beer fridge through August.  Refreshing as hell.

Opaque, golden-orange pour with a 1-finger, white head.  The smell is banana and clove balanced with toasted wheat and sour citrus zest.  Lots of banana and clove flavor with a healthy dose of Belgian yeast esters.  Finishes with more slightly sour citrus zest.  The body is slightly sticky, quite full, and has lots of carbonation.  This is really an awesome widely available summer brew.

Beautiful hazy yellow gold pour with big frothy white head. Aroma of wheat, clove, some banana and citrus. Flavor is pretty good. Wheat forward, with citrus and banana notes. Some yeast and spice. Has nothing on New Glarus Dancing Man, but might be your best bet when it comes to American Hefes outside of WI.

Pours a foggy bright gold with a medium sized head that leaves nice lacing.  Nose is mostly of banana.  Taste is strong of pale malt with distinct notes of cloves, more subtle notes of banana and citrus.  Citrus finish.

Great summer option; refreshing, crisp, and bright but with flavor.  This hits me as a belgian ale/ hefeweizen hybrid due to the depth of yeastiness.  Aroma and flavor goes from grassy to banana goodness to light spicey sour.  Good one.  Thanks Sierra Nevada.  2009 12 oz.
Impressive traditional hefeveizen  - strong wheat malt character.  Strong yeast notes of banana and tart pear.  Clove and grass.

Staggeringly high marks for a bright beer like this.  I was really pleased with the mellow but complex qualities.  Will be interesting to see if this rating holds up.  Nose has that great opening of Cable Car.  Color is perfectly bright but also evenly hazed for a great golden color.  Flavor is almost tart up top, then into light grain, wheat, and the first part of that banana flavor that Hef is known for.  But this one doesnt turn artificial because it is swiftly reigned in by nice even malt: the whole thing creates a nice sweet semi-grain bread effect that I find not only sessionable but enjoyable again and again.

Location: Not sure where it was purchased, 7/6/09


Aroma: Clove, yeast, banana, wheat, bubblegum

Appearance: Hazy banana yellow, foamy white mead, lots of lacing on the glass

Flavor: Nice flavor, typical of the German wheat style, nice mix of spice and sweetness

Palate: Relatively easy drinking beer, decent mouthfeel, nice example of the style

Overall Impression: 
A pretty nice American attempt at the German Hefe.

12oz bottle 7/6/09 (Binnys Naperville)-Pours a hazy cloudy orangish yellow with a big tight white head. Aroma of banana, clove, and yeast. Taste of the same with all of the flavors being very pronounced. This medium bodied brew is a very good American Hefe. Great job.
One of the better hefes Ive had.  Pours hazy straw color with white head.  Aroma is yeasty and banana.  Taste is banana, bubble gum, yeast.  Really well done by SN.

Bottle thanks to Butters.  Hazy golden orange color with a thick frothy white foam.  Aroma is big spiciness, yeasty, dry malt, some banana and bubblegum.  Taste is much nicer, clearer banana, citrus, bubblegum, balancing yeasty clove spicing.

This is a cloudy straw-colored beer with a moderate white head and a banana aroma. This is a very refreshing wheat beer that is slightly carbonated and slightly sour, with a flavor of peach, cloves and banana.

I wasnt impressed with this one. Pours standard color with fluffy white head. Aroma of cloves and banana. Taste is first of hops, followed by a smooth finish. Seems to lack the bite and complexity of other Hefes. Maybe, Im just not thrilled with the American style.

2009 Bottle - Pours a hazy dk straw color with a large frothy white head...aroma is lightly belgian, with spice and cirtus...flavour is creamy in the mouth, banana, pear, lemon, clove and a ton of yeast and only slightly tart on the back end...this was such an incredible surprise, absolutely enjoyable from first sip...easily the best summer drinker Ive found this year, and would be enjoyable the 3 non-freezing seasons of the year...damn good stuff...
Bottle from jessup plaza. Poured a cloudy orange color with a nice white head. Aroma of clove, banana, lemon and wheat. Taste is light and refreshing with lots of banana and clove. Very good.

12 ounce bottle in weizen glass.  Cloudy pale orange with nice dense lasting head.  Nice banana clove bubblegum aroma.  Very sweet vanilla peach with tangy lemony wheaty body and mild bitter bite in finish.  Somewhat cloying.  A little fuller and heavier than necessary, but one of the better American Bavarian-style wheats, and a helluva lot better than the old Sierra Wheat.

Pours a bright, cloudy yellow orange with a big creamy white head that shows very good retention and solid lacing.

The aroma is wonderful and everything youd want and expect from a hefe.  Theres the bubble gum and banana sweetness mixing with some lemony hops and, as it warms, a clean peppery spice  aroma.

The taste has an initial lemon zest pop before the sweet malted wheat takes over, with the bananas coming in strong.  The finish is slightly bready and with a bit of peppery spices that tingle the palate.

The mouthfeel is very active with lots of carbonation.  It seems to have a light mouthfeel but still completely fills the mouth, which is definitely saying something.

This is a fantastic hefe from Sierra Nevada and a great craft beer introduction for most people out there.  I drank this one with some non-BA friends and they absolutely loved it.  Kudos to SN for putting a beer out there that will undoubtedly please the masses and, I think, impress the beer geeks out there as well (me included).
Nailed it right on the head.  Shouldnt be a surprise, these guys generally know what they are doing.  I downed a cold 6 of kellerweis yesterday for the 4th, out by the pool.  Yum.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden orange with a fluffy white head. Fruity aroma, with banana, a hint of lemon, and some spices. Well balanced flavor of banana, clove, other spices, and a hint of citrus. A solid hefe that is certainly approachable for the non beer geek.
Plentiful white frothy head.  I really had to swirl that bottle to get the sediment.  Banana, clove, citrus notes...fantastic

Very cloudy, deep orange-golden beer with a very thick, sticky white head.  The aroma is great.  Rich wheaty nose.  Light bubble gum, a bit of clove and a soft sweet spiciness.  More of the bubble gum character than I normally get from hefe and the banana is dialed back a bit as well.  Amazing soft wheaty palate.  Rich and silky with a long creamy finish.  A kiss of tartness and spice on the back... man, these guys nailed this one out of the park.  Ive found a new go-to beer for this summer.

(2nd Shenandoah Throwdown, 12oz bottle, thanks wickedpete) Small but persistent creamy white head atop cloudy light amber body with nice lacing.  Aroma is moderately sweet, big banana, some bubblegum, clove.  Taste is medium sweet, banana, clove, light lemon.  Light-medium body, some creaminess, acidic crispness.

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2009 Bottle from kegs & barrels in Plano, TX. Pours a cloudy light gold with white fizzy head. Aroma is nice, some wheat malt, lemon citrus, grassy, some tartness, some banana. Flavor is wheaty malt, fruity, citrus, lemon zest, some banana. Mouth feel is light body, soft, with high, almost fizzy carbonation. Overall, very enjoyable beer! Honestly, did they accidentally let some Belgium yeast escape in their open fermentation room???? This beer taste too good to be a regular open fermentation brew...

Style & glass: Hefeweizen; Weizen

12 fl oz x 4.8% ABV = 57.6 / 60 = .96 beers * 150 C = 144 calories (est.)

Available at: Canals Lawrenceville, NJ for $7.99

Aroma is lemony, biscuits, and clove, some banana. Visually, its a hazy yellow with a bright white head. Taste is crisp, citrusy, and bright, quite refreshing. Feels crisp, light, and easy. Overall, a very nice brew. Thanks, Sierra Nevada!
Cloudy dark orange color with a decent initial head.  Nice aroma full of banana and spices with a similar taste.  Full of flavor but not sickening.  Very good hefe.
pours out a cloudy color with a larger beige head.  aroma was your typical hefe with notes of wheat and cloves.  flavor was very much the same.  a damn fine brew.

Bottle At Coles, Buffalo NY. Jumping on this Bandwagon. Great job by SN. Poured into a Schneider weiss glass. Slightly hazed yellow with fluffy two finger head. Aroma is not overly banana & clove but subtle with some citrus. Taste is spot on. Delicate balancewith cloves, banana & lemon. Extremely well done & perhaps my go to summer of 2009 beer. Smooth

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy gold. Looks like a true german hefe. Huge clove and banana wth some light bubblegum. Taste matches. Slightly watery but it is  session beer after all. Layered and complex flavor, perfect carbonation. Slightly tart. This tastes better than many german hefes. Amazing job by SN.

hazy and straw in color, big clove/banana nose, hard to realize this is a S.N. product. Beautiful foamy white head! Body lacks though, a bit watery. Nice wheat flavor but this is where it fails compared to the German brands. Nice try, had everything going for it but just doesnt cut it for me.
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text:
Impressive near-white, foamy head. Five fingers thick to start--three fingers one minute after the pour--nice. Settles into a rocky look. The beer itself is quite cloudy, providing a white hue in an otherwise yellow liquid.

Sour corn mash aroma with a significant dose of wheat and yeast. No citrus smell that is typical of this style.

Perhaps this is the smoothest hefeweizen Ive ever had. No yeast bite; the wheat is present without shouting. Strong flavor of banana (although its nowhere in the nose). Thicker and less spritzy than many wheat beers (adds to the sweetness). Overall, a very quaffable beer.

Bottle Code 91131 17 12; Sampled June 2009
The beer pours into my New Belgium Goblet with a hazy, straw-hued, pale amber color.  It is topped by a two finger, pale tan colored head.  The aroma is not exactly the classical balance that a typical Hefeweizen has; instead this is a balance between spicy notes, some pepper, a herbal hop note, definite clove, perhaps some light banan as well as som grain like notes with a big wheat contribution and some hay-like notes.  I like the added herbal and spice note that are not typically found in a Hefeweizen, at least to this level; these notes are well in balance with the other, more typical notes.

The beer is fairly light bodied and it has a spritzy carbonation as it rolls across my tongue.  The finish has a spicy hit of clove to it that is definitely traditional.  The beer is quite dry, but does have something of a chewy body to it.  There is a light tartness here that couples with a bit of pepper in the finish and the wheat character is nice and chewy with a touch of grassiness.  This is quite easy to drink; in fact I find my 12oz pour disappearing a bit too quickly.  Clove flavors are present here, but the banana character is quite soft.  There is a hop character here that contributes to the perceived spiciness of this brew as well as contributing a mildly biting bitterness in the finish.  I do like the body of this brew, especially as this warms up a bit, it is fresh and chewy, though it is not quite as good as the decocted, lush, fresh, Live Oak Hefeweizen.

This is on the spicy / herbal side compared to your typically traditional HefeWeizen, but it actually works quite well here and in fact boosts the complexity.  The traditional Hefeweizen notes are here, but they are perhaps not as pronounced as when found in a traditional example; luckily the additional character is here, as this would be a bit too muted without the spicy / herbal components.  I definitely feel like I need to pick up a couple more of these before I ultimately decide if this one is a go to beer or not.

Purchased: Plaza Liquors, Tucson AZ

Poured from bottle a cloudy straw color with a large off-white head leaving a nice lacing in the glass as it dwindled.  Aroma is light with bubblegum, clove and citrus.  Flavor is crisp with very little sweetness, lots of lemon, clove, soft banana, and some yeasty notes.  Palate has a malty full mouthfeel, light acidity, and some lemony tarts and yeasty bitters.  Overall, nice weizen, much better than their american wheat beer...imo anyways.

Sampled on 7/2/2009. This Hefeweizen pours a moderately cloudy orange gold color from a 12oz bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head with good retention and nice lacing. The aroma is light malt, banana, clove and some lemon. A medium to full bodied Hefeweizen. The malts are fruity and sweet, lots of banana and clove, with a nice touch of pineapple. Lively carbonation. There is a very appealing softness to this beer as well. Nice touch of yeast as well. Nice balance. Excellent summer beer. Glad this one will be a regular beer.  Mouthfeel is full. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Holy crap this beer blew me away! Good aroma. Biscuit, light malt and just a hint of lemon...very little clove or banana. Pour was a nice cloudy light orange with lots of swirling bubbles and a one finger white head. Taste was extremely crisp and refreshing. Here is where the trademark banana flavor comes in. There is a yeasty bite that is complemented by the strongest (and for me best) carbonation Ive had in some time. This beer is great on so many levels. This will be my 2009 July 4th Fireworks beer.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12 ounce bottle from Frenchys in Woodland, CA.  Spicy, peppery, lemony aroma with some metallic hops.  Pretty nice aroma.  Modestly hazy golden body with a huge frothy white head.  This leaves good lacing.  Spritzy, lemony flavor to start before a little banana and mostly doughy, biscuity malts take over.  Light metal later on.  Very drinkable and palatable.  They did a good job with this one.

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2015 Bottle.  Turbid and cloudy honey gold colored body with a fine-bubbled white head.  Nose is soft and delicate banana, dry pineapple and solvent/hefeweizen yeast... wonderfully aromatic.  Soft but crisp, chewy and frothy.  Could use a little more fullness in the finish, but overall its delicious, uncomplicated and agreeable.
Pours cloudy orange-yellow with thick fluffy head.  Aroma is a bit fruity but a lot of yeast. Velvety on the palate. Flavor is some banana but not much else. Good beer overall.

Really good beer!
Pours with a murky, yellow hue, with a small head that is mostly diminishing.
Aroma is of citrus, barnyard, yeast, light-floral and alcohol notes.
Flavor is of flowers - daisies?, lots of yeast, with a bready ending - rye?
Watery mouthfeel with light carbonation.

Pour is a cloudy yellow with a large white head.  Aroma is deffinatly clove with some vanilla and banana.  Flavor is is a bit more malty with some yeast and again some cloves. Deffinatly a summer quencher. A little light in the flavor department but this is another well done beer from sierra nevada.

Ive been really excited about this one. Pours classic hefe, cloudy straw color with a great tangy nose of banana and clove. Flavor is really well-rounded wheat/ fruit and classic bubblegum towards the finish. Really starts to shine when it sheds a few degrees and the fruit/clove/yeast/bubblegum mingle and really shine. Occasional touches of the SN hops. Awesome. First american wheat Ive had that was even good, much less outstanding. Ill buy a lot more of this. I think it lives up to the substantial hype.

This is summer in a freaking glass!  Pours a beautiful hazy hefe yellow with a nice white head.  Nose is bread, orange, citrus, banana, and clove.  Flavor is very similar with some sweetness to it.  Some fizz in this medium-bodied beer.  Finishes clean and somewhat bready, but excellent example of this style.  Lawnmower beer- liquid summer.  Awesome beer for this season.

Really nice aroma of strong clove and some banana, soft wheat notes too. Pours hazy yellow orange with a nice fluffy head. Lots of nice flavors of banana and clove, some vanilla, a touch of citrus and wheat malt in the back end for a quenching aspect. Smooth body with nice live carbonation. Insanely drinkable. Will buy much more of this.

I have never been satisfied by a domestic version of a HefeWeizen, but I do not know why, this one seemed very interesting. Poured a "textbook" cloudiness with a strong clove nose. Not too much banana which appeared on the palate with more clove and sweet touches of vanilla. Impressive. I now have found my US version of a Hefe.
A very unique style.  Flavors were definitely banana and vanilla throughout.  Nice wheat tones and sweetness.

On draught at Winking Lizard. The beer is a hazy yellow-orange color with a medium white head that diminishes steadily. Rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tangy fruit, yeast and mild hops. Light body with flavors of lightly spiced hops, fruit and grainy malt. Notes of yeast as well. The finish is bananas and yeast with a fruity aftertaste. Decent overall.

This new, unfiltered Hefeweizen from Sierra Nevada reminds you of why this early pioneer in the craft brewing scene is still one of the best breweries around. It pours a very cloudy golden and has a nice clove/banana aroma. The taste is an almost creamy mix of doughy wheat and more clove/banana. The spice presence is just right. Very enjoyable. A bit on the light side for the body, but Im not complaining.

Well, she sure pours nice - a thick, fluffy head sits atop a turbid orange beer - a lovely balance of honey sweetness, wheat/bread, and well-integrated phenols (clove mostly) in the nose - some earthiness to the aroma, too - medium-bodied - nice and creamy in the mouth - semi-dry, moderate tartness/wheaty tang - some yeasty fullness through the middle - light notes of banana, touches of clove - slightly bitter and spicy on the back - really well-balanced - one of the best American-made hefes Ive ever had.

Bottle pours hazy gold in color with a creamy white head. The nose is primarily filled with bread, banana, and cloves with a slight yeasty character.  The overall mouthfeel is round, full, and soft. The banana bread comes through in flavor as well, but is complimented with heavy notes of clove, and more subtle touches of nutmeg and vanilla.

UPDATED: JUL 10, 2011 Overall solid. Nice and drinkabel. Mostly everything I would like in a nice wheat. Very bready. Cloudy orange color with a white fluffy ehad. Aroma is bready, some banana, clove. Full body. Flavor if sweet, very wheaty, spicy, bananas and more cloves. Drinkable and refreshing. Nice wheat any time of year I would say.
Bottle. May be the best American Hefe I have ever had. Pleasant aroma and a full body taste while not being heavy. This goes down smooth.

Pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head and some sticky lacing. Aroma is banana, cloves, yeast, wheat. Flavor is wheat, banana, cloves, yeast, esthers, citrus. Nice mouthfeel and well balanced. Nice flavorful refreshing hefe.

12oz bottle from BevMo.  Pours a hazy medium golden orange with a bubbly white head, some spotty lacing.  Good lemon peel, banana and yeast on the nose.  Citrus, clove, banana, and yeasty flavors.  Much better than I expected, nice crisp finish.

True to its Bavarian legacy, the beer poured out cloudy golden in color and formed a large head.  The aroma was a classic mix of bananas and cloves.  The taste was a bit less sweet than anticipated, but extremely refreshing with a light spicy sweet and slightly sour taste.  Very creamy and soft in the mouth.  With the approachable and classic construction and absolutely flawless execution, this was a joy to drink.

Ive consumed about 1/3 of a case this week. Very yeasty, murky body with a thick, velvety white head. Some sulfur in the nose in some bottles, but I get that in virtually any beer as fresh and yeasty as this. Great mouthfeel for an American brewed hefeweizen. Good mix of clove-like esters, moderate citrus, and light phenols. Not overly fruity. A little dirtier than an elite German Hefeweizen, but tons of character and refreshment at the same time. Eclipses all NEW Sierra Nevada releases since Celebration, in my opinion. When it comes to wheat beers, this is the polar opposite of the bland and pedestrian Sierra Nevada Wheat and a welcome addition to the macro craft-beer world.
Pours hazy light golden with a well maintained wispy white head. Notes of citrus, banana, yeast and wheat. Medium bodied with lush carbonation. Delicious.

Hazy pour with a medium white head.  Aroma is fairly strong and authentic, but has a certain quality that is sort of a turn off.  Flavor is tangy, with more clove than I prefer.  Has a decent amount of citrus.  People will probably laugh, but it seriously reminded me of Hoegarden (which I dont care for, becuase I dont like watery lemonade)  Light body with more than necessary fizziness, almost hurts the tongue.  Its like mixing banana and clove flavored soda with pop rocks.  Actually, it reminds me of my recent homebrew batch that I screwed up with too much priming sugar.   I really tried to like this one, but its not for me.  Ill probably try it again someday though.  Hopefully it was a bad bottle.

5/06/2009:  Sierra Nevada Kellerweis Hefeweizen is super cloudy to the point of appearing to be opaque.  It has a tarnished bronze color that reminds me of dark applesauce.  There is a foamy, thick, off-white head on the that leaves plenty of lacing marks on the glass.  The aroma contains toasted wheat (actually, LOTS of wheat malt), and is roasty with a slight smoke characteristic.  The deep clove and banana flavor also has a hint of lemon and then more lemony citrus in the finish.  This beer has a medium body, is a little chewy.  Overall this beer is satisfying and refreshing.  It reminds me of a Dunkel Weissbier.
Pint (draught; 5.5% ABV) at the Sierra Nevada Artisan Ale Experience at Olives in Cincinnati, Ohio.
. . . . . . . . . .
6/25/2009:  From the bottle, Sierra Nevada Kellerweis is cloudy and a dirty, golden blonde color.  The aroma is smoky with caramelized wheat.  Banana and clove, wheat, and lemon citrus meld together to form the flavor.  There is some allspice/nutmeg in the finish.  This beer is malty and has a good mouthfeel and profile.  It is even slightly chewy.  Overall it is a really tasty Hefe!
12 fl. oz. bottle (Alc. 4.9% by Vol.) shared by alexsdad06.  Thanks Brad! Rating #102 for this beer.

Bottle OsS&BS-I-T-YVB Throwdown Murky straw-colored ale with a  small, creamy, white head. Decent retention. The aroma consists mainly of pale grains and clove. Light to medium-bodied with fizzy carbonation. The flavor is well-balanced and a touch tangy with a bit of clove. Finishes crisp and spicy.  Thanks to GoT for providing the bottle! Hefes just arent my thing.

Since I saw this a few weeks ago, I have been buying it as my session beer.  I think I have had about a case of this so far.  This stuff is great.  Pours out a yellowish orange color.  Smell is full of banana and a touch of hops.  Taste is great, incredibly refreshing, very easy to drink (chug?) down.  I hop this becomes a regular offering, because I will drink my weight in this beer.  Really good stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2009 pours a cloudy pale orange, head isnt as bubbly as i expected. smells very nice, yeasty.  flavor has wonderful balance of spice, yeast, grainy earthy notes, and citrus. nice and bready.  sweetness is perfect, not too much but enough there for a little zing.  nothing like the regular sierra nevada lineup.  really reminds me of fransiskaner.  light bodied but not anything out of the ordinary for the style. believe the hype, this is top notch. apparently the fucked up economy has had no effect on the quality of sierra nevada products.

Bottle. Pours with a huge, white head over a hazed golden body with good lace. Aroma is grainy with wheat, citrus and banana. Taste is wheat, vanilla, banana, light clove phenols and citrus. Medium carbonation and a dryish finish. Up there with Franconia for one of the best US produced Hefes...

Pours cloudy orange with a creamy head with lasting lacing on the glass.  Sweet aroma leads to a spicy, slightly yeasty flavor with hints of banana.  An exceptional American hefeweizen.  Refreshing and perfect for the sunny months.
Bottle @Track 84, Warwick, RI. Pretty good. A estery wheat beer, without the sweetness, wheat and lemon, with estery fruit (but dry fruit), refreshing. Nice.

This is an excellent hefe, I am impressed. Cloudy orange gold, creamy white head.  Good lacing, and wisps of yeast.  Banana, citrus, grass, lemon zest, sweet biscuity malt, clove, and some foral hops.  Silky, creamy mouthfeel.  Im not usually big on this style, but I could drink a lot of this.

bottle.
Pours a hazy straw yellow with a big, foamy two inches of bright white head.  Somewhat more rounded nose than many hefes- some banana and fruity sweetness, some light spicy cloves and oranges.  Aroma is good, if muted.  Flavor starts with a light dose of sharp clove spiciness, then moves into grainy yeast, smooth mild sweetness.  Light bitterness.  Some citrus notes in the flavor.  Palate is crisp and actively carbonated.  Overall, a good, interesting, somewhat unique hefe.

This poured a light cloudy golden color. The aroma is very bready with some lemons and hint of yeast. The flavor contains a nice hit of wheat, lemons, and some cloves. The finish is sour. Overall this would be a good session brew but nothing amazing.
12oz bottle. Kind of a dark hazy yellow color. Banana, lemon aroma, it had a very creamy white head as well. Sweet, more banana and light lemon, no acidity at all, very enjoyable
user_location: Redlands, by way of Wisconsin,, California, USA

text: Pours a hazy light golden color with a small head, nice lacing. Banana, bubblegum, and spices. Nice palate, full but not overly. Excellent.

Reviewed a 12oz bottle that pours opaque yellow/gold with a two finger white head that quickly diminishes.

Full and smooth with some banana flavor up front and a touch of vanilla on the finish make this a very nice summer beer. I think its very well done.
what an excellent beer. its got a nice crisp aroma of the usual bubblegum and banana, tastes smooth with a feeling of fullness and a slick texture. bubbles scrub nicely. all around this beer works.

A nice murky yelllow-golden hue with a nice whie head.  Aroma had some sweet malt notes, banana, but also a nice spice profile,mainly corrainder, clove stuff like that.  Flavor seemed to feature the spicyness of this brew.  A akmost peppery flavor to it with a nice lemony note to balance it out.   Seemed to have some grit to it which by no means was negative.  A good beer.
Bubblegum, bananas, very nice and traditional german hefe flavors. Visual was as expected as well. Basically the template for how to make a german hefe in the US.

Aroma is sweet banana, wheat, and lemon.  
Taste is crisp hoppy lemon-wheat banana, with a surprising amount of sourness.
 Body is full, yet not cloying.  A touch watery for a hefe, light on the spice, and heavy on the lemon and wheat with a banana accent.
Finish is lingering wheat sourness and banana.
Wow.  Surprising.

A very nice hefeweizen from sierra nevada. I thought that it might have a little bit of a sour bite, but I was mistaken. It has a variety of complex fruit flavors, which sits very nicely in the mouth. Very enjoyable.

12oz Bottle  Gravity Beer Market  Olympia, WA
Aroma: Big wheat malt aroma. Lots of clove and banana esters. 
Appearance: Dark yellow in color, Hazy with a thin head.  
Flavor: Big Hefe flavor this was filled with clove and banana flavors also.   
Palate: Dry wheat finish, with a Good Mouthfeel.  
Overall: One hell of a summer Hefe.

Aroma is familiar of the style. Although the banana is not as explosive as some German brands. Bread dominates the nose with the fruit being more subtle. Appearance wise it doesnt fall short of the standards. Taste is similar to the bouquet. Bread, full bodied, but soft and lacks an acidic or citrus bite. With that said still very good.

Sampled at Hyuns bachelor party, glad to get to try this.  Hazy gold, nice head, attractive.  Aroma was lightly of wheat, banana, clove, faint lemon.  Flavor matched, but Im not adequately expressing the depth and complexity of the yeast at work here and how it was perfectly balanced with the grain.  Perhaps just the faintest hint of floral hop to balance.  Exceptionally well executed hefe, I was really, really impressed.
Bottle from BevMo. Hazy orange in color. Nice white head. Sweet yeasty aroma. Smells are all there. Rich mouthfeel. Grainy flavor. Somewhat spiced with a bit of yeastiness. Pretty good.
Hazy yellow body, frothy white head.  Spicy aroma.  Flavor of banana, clove, and yeast.  Very complex and inviting.  I think this is worth the hype; an exceptional hefe.

Bottle.  Pours a great golden cloudy color and a huge white billowing head.  Aroma is very pronounced.  A lot of banana and yeasty notes in the aroma.  Taste is both complex and light.  Flavor is crip, but has several layers to it.  Lots of wheat and yeast traditional flavors, but banana and mild citrus backbody  makes this pretty enjoyable.  The best hefeweizen Ive had.

(bottle) Pours a light hazy gold with a large white head that possesses a meringue-like consistency and retains nicely.  Aroma is strong of banana, light vanilla, some bread, along with a nice twang of wheat and clove.  The flavor is banana and vanilla as well, with a bit of clove, some breakfast cereal, the characteristic twang of wheat, and a bit of lemon right before the finish.  The flavors are all there, but they are far more subtle when compared to Dancing Man.  Instead of being crisp, the finish lingers on with some flavors of stale bread, yeast and grain which is a shame.  The mouthfeel is perfect, full and creamy with spritzy carbonation.  All in all, an above-average hefe that would be great if it didnt display that undesirable finish.

Is there something about Sierra Nevada that RBers just root for?  As if we just desperately want them to make awesome beer?  I think so.

I think they did a superb job here.  I agree with the RB consensus that this is just so damn solid.  A great mix of the basic German Hefeweizen flavors, but most importantly, backed by a really strong body.  There is just a wonderful fullness to this beer.

12oz bottle, no date.  Cloudy golden with a one finger creamy white head, fair retention.  Good amounts of bananas, clove, wheat, and hints of cinnamon.  Nothing too spicy or too sweet, and no rancid wheat things going on.  The flavor adds some crisp lightly tangy lemony wheat notes.  Minimal bitterness in the wheaty finish.  Moderate prickly carbonation with a light to medium body.  If this is a year round beer, my camping trips just got better.  This rating doesnt do the beer justice--probably my second or third highest rated hefe--it still isnt as good as Dancing Man, in my opinion.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text:
12oz bottes six pack. This has to be one of my top summer bers, very enjoyable and drinkable in larger quantites. Pours a shade of orange with edges of gold... a thick white cap of head and sheets of lace. Aroma is thick with ripened bananas, cloves, lemon & tangerines. Medium light body with moderately light carbonatonand a light, crisp finish. overall, a great summer brew.
.

Sierra Nevada Kellerweis is a cloudy wheat colored beer with a thin white head that has outstanding retention and lacing.  It has a spicy clove aroma (oh, and banana).  Its light bodied and smooth; a little watery at the finish.  The banana/clove flavor is prominent in the taste, but its not the only thing going on.  There is a nice, fruity, wooden bitterness with almost a hint of cassis.  This is an ideal Hefeweizen.
Gold. with a little haze. Big white head. Aroma is big banana, then yeast, lemon, and spice. Nice and smooth, clean and very easy to drink.
Lots of banana in the aroma and even more in the flavor. This is certainly in the German style, but its so over-the-top in banana that its just too much for me.

Pours a cloudy gold with decent head that laces nicely. Aromas of yeast clove, little banana. Flavors of yeast, clove, little banana with an added spiciness. Tastes pretty authentic to the Bavarian style, I was impressed as it didnt have the nevada taste that is in every nevada beer - very light if any, true to the style. But still over rated in my opinion

Bottle. Well done hefe. Not as good as a fresh German Hefe a la Maisel but better than most German Hefes that arrive here somewhat aged. Nice aromas of yeast and clove, good flavor profile of spicness and banana.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2010 Just a great beer. One that makes me revist my top hefes list and realize the top 5 are from 02/03. Mmm, those need revisiting because this assumes the place of those newbie hefes. Very real banana presence here in the aroma, just lovely, conditioned so finely you may expect weird dusty rem-NANTs in the head. Aroma of cloves is next, layered in there with the waves of sweet, well-ripened banana. The cloves are dusty and dry. Some slight bubblegum, pure sugar sweetness in the aroma. The flavor is tangy, soft bread bubblegum sweetness, and a bit of lactic and even citric flavors. Well put together and highly drinkable - this is a fresh palate beer to start your day. So easy to enjoy. So many of SNs beers are just SO SOLIDLY MADE. 

In answer to questioners about the quality vs. New Glarus, well, I havent had Dancing Man Wheat, but this is a very favorable comparison to my two favorite NG wheats; Black Wheat and Solstice.
user_location: Łódż, Warsaw, Poland; Michigan, Ohio, USA

text: Pretty delicious rendition of some of the better Bavarian style hefs out there. A little dryer, but nice and tasty all the same.  I did notice a little musky flavor as it warmed up a little, but thatll teach me to stop drinking mid beer and eat food!

Soft, funky, wheat beer aroma - a little banana.  Fairly foggy, honey gold.  Decent label. Clean drinking, nicely mouthy, dry and starchy.  Lightly toasted and bready.  A cohesive brew. Beats the Smuttynose Weizen handily in back-to-back consumption.

The aroma is right on for the style. Its got malt, bananas, cloves, and bubble gum. The appearance is cloudy gold with a large head that leaves nice lacing. The flavor is like the aroma with a watery finish. The palate is smooth but thin enough to be refreshing. Overall a very good session beer that ends pretty clean and slightly fruity. It starts off stronger than it finishes.

Bottle. Poured hazy orange yellow with thick white head. Aroma of citrus, banana and something else unknown. Mild wheaty and clovy flavour, with bit of banana.  Not much finish, just sort of drops off the table.
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: hazy straw colored with nice white head.  Banana esters.   Spicy, clovish like a Bavarian wheat but there is something just a bit off in the finish, its a bit harsh.   Could it be the hops?  Starts off with promise but fails in the end.

12 oz bottle.  Hazy golden color with a nice pillowy head.  Maybe not as glorious as the German hefes but still nice-looking.  Aroma is strong bananas and bubblegum with mealy wheat malt and cloves.  Flavor is nice and complex.  Banana pith, vanilla, cloves, light lemony note, bread dough, and a bit of bubblegum.  Smooth creamy body that feels very authentic going down.  Easily the best American hefe Ive had.

A pretty nice brew from SN: Pours a cloudy golden colour with a large fluffy white head. ORange peel, Yeast and some coriander on the nose. Taste was really pleasent. A super refreshing Hefe with a creamy citrusy texture. A winner for sure, i will be buying this all summer long.  :)
Straw cloudy yellow in color... Aroma screams banana... Flavor is a wheaty banana explosion, with a nice spicy palate... Great beer, very refreshing...

Amazing.  One of two American Hefeweizens (the other is New Glarus Dancing Man) that I find remotely interesting.   This is as good, if not better than than many German Hefes.    Banana, clove, bubblegum and citrus on the nose.  The pour is cloudy and awesome looking.  The taste is divine.  Reminds me of Paulaner, and that is about the highest compliment I could give a beer.  Awesome. If loving Hefeweizens makes me less of a beer geek, then color me a noob.

Beer of the moment, here. Bottled. Nice pour, lovely head, very yeasty. Spicy, very bready nose, loaded with umami, white vinegar. Pretty unique. Big yeasty flavor, sourdough, perfectly thick body and carbonation. Easily drinkable, my only complaint is a bit of a rubbing alcohol note, and perhaps a lack of spiciness against its German counterparts. A very well crafted beer.

Moderately strong banana and clove aroma, but also with a rubber drain pipe smell. Cloudy golden medium white head, consistent streams of carbonation from the bottom of the glass, decent lacing. Nice medium to full bodied mouthfeel. Tastes like it smells including the off flavors, which do go away. Lemon and chives are also present. Its pretty good but far from "ground breaking" as I have heard it described.

Tallahassee, Fl. - Fermentation Lounge - 12 oz bottle. Pours a nice murky dark yellow with a soft pillowy white head that leaves good lacing on the glass. Clean clove-like aroma with doughy notes in the back end. Flavor has nice banana accents, lots of doughiness, some nice hints of spices in the back end. Thick, rich mouthfeel - very solid entry from the folks at SN.

Bottle, served in a weizen glass. Cloudy golden yellow body with over 2 inches of bright white head. The nose is all yeast: ripe banana, dough, and a touch of clove. Flavor is similar with and added earthy element. Slightly sweet at the front of the palate but manages to dry up by the finish. Full, creamy body with a slight prick of carbonation coming through. A very well made hefe.

12 oz bottle.  Pours an initial slight hazy light gold yellowish but the swirling and final pours are rediculously cloudy with chunks of yeast snot floating around- high carbonation and massive sticky white head and some nice lace.  Aroma is light on the banana esters, but is skewed just slightly more towards the clove phenolics with hints of vanilla- really a nice balance of esters and phenols- tons of doughy wheat malts as well with a wierd light all grain bread toastiness, and whole wheat fresh bagels with touch of lemon citrus.  Flavor is so doughy fresh wheat, huge malt, and creaminess- probable decoction mashed to pull the full maltiness out- light lemon zest, phenolic yeastiness, light clove and hints of vanilla with a very slight spicy hop character- dry and just beautifully soft in the mouth despite a very high carbonation.  This is serious good stuff- and right up there with Schneider and Weihenstephan, although all are so unique.  Ill have to try them all side by side soon.  Awesomely well made.

Sample at Whole Foods.  Aroma: cross between banana/pumpkin bread which is probably just a dumb way of saying that the first hit is an orange stuck full of cloves.  Spicy mustard color on the pour with an off-white head and slight carbonation but otherwise finishes smooth.  The flavor is much the same with a really great spicy honey taste.  I am seriously pleasantly surprised by this beer:  a style I dont particularly like or a brewer.  Good job SN!
by far this is my favorite hefe beer, its not a typical but rather has a hint of hops mixed in with your wheat flavor and a banana with a tad bit of hops that very good summer beer

Source:  12 oz bottle purchased at Chucks in Bowling Green. Glass: Pint glass. Appearance: Cloudy yellow color with a one finger white head.  Aroma:  Wheat, bananas, clove and yeast.  Absolutely perfect for the style. Flavor: Cloves and wheat with the right amount of banana. Palate:  Medium/light body with solid carbonation.Overall:  I havent tasted many better than this one.  Absolutely love it.

Bottled.  Poured hazy, yellowy golden with a thick, well-retained cap of white head.  The aroma was banana-tastic with notes of cinnamon, earthy spice, and vanilla.. soft overall and well-balanced.  The flavor opened with some tangy orange zest and wheaty character with a heavy dose of tasty bananas.. drier, tasty spices and yeasty notes rode out the finish with banana sweetness and just a dab of bubblegum.  Light-medium bodied with creamy, rolling carbonation balanced against tasty sweetness and refreshing tartness on the palate.. really an excellent beer that Im glad comes in sixers!

12oz bottle.  Ultra Brickskeller-style pour courtesy of Ann.  Thick orange color.  Big, rich head.  Extremely well done Hefe.  yeasty, creamy and rich, perfect mouthfeel.  Great clove and banana flavor, but isnt one-dimensional like so many others in the style.  Quality beer, perhaps the best US Hefeweizen Ive had.

Rich, hazy mustard yellow with a lively head. Piquant aromatic medley of German wheat, German yeast, and zesty phenols with clove more prominent though banana playing lightly as well. Richly complex and enjoyable bouquet with touches of spiciness. If there is any drawback, perhaps it is a bit under-bodied, however the flavors of wheat, German yeast, and spicy phenols are again pleasant and conjure up the German pub experience.An outstanding German hefe and definitely a top-notch American example.

12oz bottle from Kingdom Liquors (Tampa, FL). Pours a hazy amber golden color with one finger white head that settles quickly. Aroma is sweet and floral with notes of banana, clove, grass, hay, spice, light citrus and lemon notes. Flavor is sweet and floral with notes of banana, clove, yeast, nuts, gras,s hay, honey, some light caramel notes. Generally light to medium body with a refreshing spicy finish. Nice Hefe -- rivals some of the Germans we have had.

12 oz bottle from GM Liquors. Nose of wheat, banana, and yeasty light funk. Murky yellow with a big pale yellow head. Flavor is loads of banana, light bitterness, and grainy white bread. Finish is lightly bitter with a touch of pepperiness. Great hefe, glad I can get it locally and cheap!
Sampled at ACBF. Mild sweet wheat aroma. Cloudy yellow color with a medium white head. Wheaty with a little bitter finish.

12oz. Pours with a big fluffy white head. A nice hazy and opaque yellow color, lots of yeast present, of course. Aroma is strongly yeasty with some banana ester and nuttiness. Creamy, yeasty flavor - banana esters abound, and its got a pleasant level of spiciness throughout. A smooth palate with a clean, semi-dry finish. Evidently I really liked this beer, because I downed the 12 ounces in about as many minutes. Its wonderful for the ridiculous hot weather weve been having here lately. A competing hefe with the lovely Live Oak Hefeweizen, Id say.

Bottle from Double D.  Hazy banana yellow-orange with a large white head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, clove and some tasty banana nut bread.  Standard hefe faire with banana, clove, yeast and wheat.  Pretty easy drinking and quality addition to the sierra Nevada line.

Pours hazy, dark orange with a white head.  Smell is wheaty, and creamy.  Taste is creamy, strongly wheaty and slightly fruity and citrusy.  Extremely drinkable, fresh and flavorful.  Rich creamy body and normal carbonation.  I really like this and am glad that it is readily available for the hot Texas summer.
Aroma like whole grain banana bread (as I woud imagine it.)  Pretty light mouthfeel but medium strong flavor of banana cream.  Pretty nice.

12oz bottle.  very cloudy opaque yellow under a large creamy white head.  moderate amount of lacing.  delicate wheaty, banana aroma but fairly one dimensional.  the flavor opens up with banana and pink bubble gum.  not too spicy though. medium-full bodied.  fairly dry.  creamy and smooth palate.  a great german style hefe.
bottle, golden yellow with some solid foam, aroma is light banana, some clove, flavor is wheat, grain, banana, drier, yeasty finish

Hazy straw colored liquid with a slightly off-white head. Initial dry wheat and grain scents are gradually replaced with some cloves, banana and mild citrus. Solid feel with just a bit of zip behind it. Full wheat flavors with with cloves and mild citrus coming in the middle. Big yeast shot at the bottom of the bottle. HInts of the SN hopping. Very good traditional hefeweizen. I will certainly visit this one again this summer.

just a nice representation of the style. full bodied and creamy with banana and touch of clove it is oversweet and demonstrative as it is very good. wonderful brew featuring what hopefully is American wheat and a quality yeast. great beer. what else from this GREAT American brewer! i would like to add that i fully appreciate the lack of that turpentine type flavor that i get from so many brews of this style.

6-pack 12 oz. at Greens Buford Highway. This beer looks awesome! It has a nice haze orange appearance. Very nice fluffy head sitting on top. It looks great. Poured very well. Pleasant aroma of banana/yeast/citrus/spice/clove. Very nice aromatic and very nuanced (aroma) beer. Great aroma! Wow a very nice taste. Banana with some yeast. Some spice and clove come out as well. I wish the beer had a better mouthfeel. The mouthfeel isnt bad, but it would be a 4 if it were a little better. Creamy at first but then drops off the chart as less creamy. Still that flavor is great. The banana/yeast/clove/and spice that you smelled are all in the flavor. This is a damn good hefeweizen, especially from an American company. Very good. Cheers.

12oz bottle.   Picked up a sixer the first day that it hit the shelves here in SB.   I knew that the people at SN would delver if they put their heads into crafting an authentic hefeweizen, and I was not wrong.   Pours a hazy gold with a big white head.    The arome has a good mix of fruity esters and spice that is exactly what you expect.   Ripe banana and clove are in balance to the max.   The flavor has wheat and all the yeast character you would expect.   Medium-light bodied with smooth texture.   Nothing new in the genre, which is pretty narrow in the traditional sense, but just well balanced and quite tasty.   Just as good as the better german examples, and fresher here.   Definitely my new go-to hef this summer.   You dont tire of drinking it, even after a few bottles.

Pours hazed orange with a thick foamy white head that leaves great lace. Aroma is banana, clove, wheat, and bubblegum and I could smell the beer clearly the moment I opened the bottle. Very thick and creamy body and a great wheat taste. Quite the easy drinking beer and rivals the traditional German brews.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2009 12 ounce bottle - $1.99 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

"To serve, pour two-thirds into a glass, swirl and pour the rest." Youre the boss, bottle!

Appearance: Rather well hazed, dull, dark yellow body with a voluminous, lasting, whitish head. Fair amount of gooey lace left on the way down.

Smell: Ah, the unmistakable aroma of wheat malt, replete with some sweet-scented, tangy qualities but also a scent of gently kneaded whole wheat bread dough. Pungent notes of semi-ripe banana and spice with a lesser hint of chewing gum and squeezed lemon.

Taste: Sweetish, tangy malted wheat with a distinct taste of grainy, mealy bread dough. Add in a few freshly-sliced lemon wedges and some dried banana chips. Good dash of earthy ground cloves. Spicy-minded hops with a low, subtle bitterness imparted. Very thin vein of tartness in the last third of the sip. Finishes dry, spicy, with little "goodbyes" from the wheat, lemons, and bananas. Nice.

Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied. Medium-plus carbonation. Smooth, somewhat fluffed mouthfeel which has nice depth but also a delightful airiness about it.

Drinkability: Remarkably enjoyable and certainly recommended! It was difficult completing the review before I had greedily gulped this one down. Regretfully, I picked only the one lone single, but Ill be sure to return for a proper six-pack.

12 oz bottle shared with MereLikesBeer. This poured a very cloudy straw yellow with fluffy white head. It had classic wheat beer aroma and flavor, with lots of yeasty notes as well as banana and clove on the flavor profile. Great first wheat beer from Sierra Nevada! Cheers!

This is a pretty good all around beer.  For a wheat beer, it stands true...I tried this with BeerBaron617, and it was a little less than what I feel for a wheat beer, but at the same time, the more I drink it, the better I feel about it.  It poured a nice hazy golden straw yellow color with a white head.  Aroma was nice and wheaty, with hints of some spice - maybe the clove everyone is talking about.  Taste was pretty good.  At first, it wasnt very carbonated, which was odd, but then it sort of started to go that way, which was even more odd.  Very strange.  Ok, I dont know what else, but yeah, its pretty good.
pours cloudy amber with a small head that fades quickly.  smells of bananas clove and other spices.  tastes almost belgian with a heffeweise taste also.  pretty decent white.

Tasting  Wine Source.  Hazed gold, creamy white head.  Banana clove aromas round with a touch of warming yeast.  Subdued spice and banana cream flavors are nicely balanced on a touch of backend breadiness.  Light bodied, soft carbonation, lightly spiced finish.  A decent rendition that is quite sessionable...

Bottle:  The aroma consists of banana, bubblegum, wheaty citrus notes, and faint clove.  It pours a cloudy orangish-yellow with a half inch white head that diminishes to a ring around the edges of the glass within a minute or so.  The flavor starts with light-moderate citrus.  The finish has light-moderate banana, light bubblegum, clove, and a hint of smoke.  Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and a soft mouthfeel.

super murky yellow body with a white head.nice aroma of wheat,cloves,bananas,and yeast.flavor is much of the same with a nice full mouthfeel.this has so much flavor for a 4.8 % beer.this is a perfect summer sippin brew.

Bottle from BevMo.  Wow, I like this one a lot.  Phenomenal appearance, hazy straw color with a lasting white head and good lacing.  Aroma of banana, clove, and yeast.  Flavor is more of the same, sweet and wheaty.  Body medium for the style with a creamy palate.  An ideal session beer.

this stuff poured like I had mistakenly bought banana puree! very cloudy yellow body, great white head that leaves some scattered lacing and a nice frothy ring, practically no highlight; the flavor mimics the aroma - tropical fruit, typical hef spice, just tart enough - big and tasty, but simple; the palate is creamy yet somewhat prickly - its enjoyable; overall very good.

Cloudy amber-gold with big, foamy off-white head / Nose of sour malt, lemon, orange peel, and spice / Medium body, some sweetness, with good balance of big malts with some hop dryness on the finish / Flavors of sour malt, wheat, lemon, orange peel, banana, clove, and coriander / A big hefe, but outstanding.

Pours a cloudy orange color with a thick mostly white head. Banana and spice aroma. Banana tastes provides this beer with a lot of sweetness. Pretty creamy. See sediment floating. Overall a full flavored hefe, which is something that is hard to find even at ayinger.

hazy golden pour with slight offwhite head.  Arroma is bananas and wheat.  a touch of vanilla and brown sugar.  pretty yummy.  I dive in and am welcomed by a big wheaty flavor and some great banana overtones.  Fantastic.  finish is a bit dry.  Indeed this is my favorite American style hefeweizens.

Bottle pours a hazy dull mustard color with large fading white head.  This is much more focused on the wheat than lemon or banana, but there is still hints of citrus. Nose of vanilla, clove, wheat. Extremely quaffable and good creamy body due to the yeast. Bitter lemon pith and wheat finish. Man what a pleasant surprise.  Probably the best commercial american version of this german style Ive come across.

Bottle from BevMo. Pours a very hazy golden color with a frothy white head. Aromas of banana and clove? Citrus! Medium plus body with frothy carbonation. Flavor starts wheat, then goes very, very banana. And bready. And clovey. This may be the best American hefeweizen. Course Ive only had 66, including the Germans. Still, its really good.

12oz bottle.  Close to perfect looking hefe, cloudy golden yellow with a tall thick foamy slightly off-white foam with cascading lacing.  Aroma is nicely balanced, not too much phenols or esters, balanced blend of yeasty, banana and doughy, however, it does have a bit of the "mass-produced" aroma.  Flavor is on the fuller side, sweet candied wheat, a mix of doughy and biscuity, light citrus, lemon rind, chewy yeasty, hops are just in the back ground begging to come out, hopefully theyll do a huge hopped up version a la New Glarus, over ripe banana in the finish.  Body is heavy sticky water, softer carbonation, almost a chewy hefe.
