Short 12oz bottle, yellow label.  I have a feeling this is gonna end up  being a top rated German Hefeweizen .  Appearance is a solid haze of golden yellow. Thick, frothy, white foam adds to the beauty.  Aroma of fresh bananas, some box, a pinch of clove, tropical fruit complexities, and a bit of musty bread.  The smell alone makes my mouth water.  Flavor is extremely fruity.  Very dry mouthfeel.   Nice earthy wheat flavor, hint of lemon, some spiciness.  Finishes with a fruity breadiness,  like a spiced coriander banana bread.  Finish is very thirst quenching.

12 ounce bottle from Wine Warehouse in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a very murky orange color with a large head. Good head retention and lacing. Aroma of yeast, bread and light tropical fruit notes. Taste is bread, pineapple, bubblegum, caramel, spice. Medium bodied. This is very nice.

12 oz bottle courtesy of a 6 pack from Binnys South Loop (Chicago, IL). Pours a very hazy gold yellow, moderate offwhite foamy head that laces, dissipates to a small amount. Aromas are nice, a good Hefe vibe as estery banana and cloves come through, a nice mellow sweetness, some yeast, and faint creaminess. Initial is a nice light body, quaffable, with good estery banana, clove, yeast, wheat with touch of bitterness on the backend. Refreshing, quenching, light on the palate but still flavorful. Shows a good tartness in the body. This is miles from the old Sierra Nevada Wheat, and shows a solid American version Hefe. A welcome addition to my summer wheat beer rotation. Cheers.
Bottle pours hazy golden with a great head.  Yeasty aroma with some grain and bread.   Some banana in the body and a medium mouthfeel.  Easy drinking.  Nice lawnmower beer.

Its got a very hazy appearance which is fitting. Decent head retention. A very fruity aroma to it. The bottle is spot on with the banana/clove flavors but the wheat stands out well. Loads of carbonation that can easily quench thirst and it has a good mouthfeel to it. The bottom of the bottle is covered in yeast.

On tap at Capital Ale House - Downtown on 06/02/2009. Cloudy orange body with a medium creamy white head. Big banana, citrus, and light clove aroma. Sweet citrus and banana flavor. Medium light body with moderately high carbonaton.

12oz bottle courtesy of GandGKevin. pours a beautiful, hazy yellow, gold with a thin, white head and great lacing. aroma is excellent with notes of belgian yeast, banana, cinnamon, clove, green apple, and a hint of spice. flavor is very good as well with belgian yeast and biscuity malt blended nicely with slighty sweet notes of banana, lemon peel, and wheat with a touch of spice. palate is medium bodied with solid carbonation and a light, crisp finish. overall, a great summer brew.

Perfect appearance. Cloudy orangy yellow color with a huge white head. Banana and bubble gum in the aroma. Very light and fruity taste with a spicy clove finish. A much better summer beer than their Summerfest.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2009 On tap at Capital Ale House Downtown.  I was really impressed with this one, as it actually stands out as one of the best hefeweizens Ive ever encountered.  The aroma really stood out as being top-notch, with intense wafts of banana and light fruit floating out of the glass.  The beer was a beautiful golden color; a bit more on the yellow than orange side.  Flavor was similar to the aroma; yeasty with strong infusions of bananas and citrus with a bit of clove.  Very impressive, but I will be interested to see how well it holds up in the bottle.

Edit:  I had to dock the score just a couple tenths of a point because its a little thinner out of the bottle compared to what was served on tap.  Still very good though.

On tap at the Sierra Nevada tasting at the Winking Lizard Bethel Rd. location on 5/13/09.  Orange/copper pour with a medium white head.  Yeasty aroma of bananas and bubble gum with some malt.  Banana yeast flavor with a citrusy and spicy finish.

(Sample Bottle)  A lot of bottle sediment. Pours a shade of orange with edges of gold... a thick white cap of head and sheets of lace. Aroma is thick with ripened bananas, buttered biscuits, lemon & tangerines. Starts yeasty and fructose sweet but lightly tart and on the finish. A pleasant medium palate,  not too much chewy-ness, nor too thin in body by any manner. Gotta give it up here  Sierra brewed up a marvelous Weizen!

Draft at SN tasting at Olives.

Poured cloudy orange color with an average frothy off-white head that mostly diminished with good lacing. Moderate wheat, citrus and yeast aroma. Medium body with smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium smooth sweet flavor with a medium sweet finish of moderate duration.

This is a good session beer.

Draught at TJs:  Aroma of wheat, spices, yeast, slight bubblegum, slight lemon, and slight clove.  Poured light brown/flaxen in color with a small, white head that lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Fair lacing.  Lightly sweet flavor.  Tastes of wheat, yeast, spices, slight Smarties candy, slight bubblegum, and light lemon.  Light to medium body.  Tingly, chalky texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Lightly chalky wheat and slight lemon finish.

Draft at Eli Cannons. Poured in a pint glass, so have no idea what it would look like in a proper glass with a bubble for the head to form but the color is nice and hazy orange. The aroma is strong banana esters, very simple but good. Thick mouthfeel. Good grain textures here. Not too sweet or sticky. Much better than expected and is a clean and impressive rendition.

On tap, Eli Cannons on Sierra Nevada Artisanal Ale night.  Pours hazy apricot-gold with a small head.  Aroma is ripe banana, clove and pale malt.  Palate is full, without being overbearing.  It also maintains pearly carbonation, though soft.  Flavor starts mild and sugary sweet, then moves towards spices and banana.  Flavor builds to crescendo by finish, a distinctive quality of this beer.  Finish of traditional Hefe yeast clove-banana that lingers just long enough.  My friends very much enjoyed this beer, and it is hard to deny its overall quality even though I tend to underrate wheat beers.

On tap at Sheffields in Chicago. Pours a very cloudy glowing orange with a small creamy white head. Aroma is very creamy malt and lots of yeast, banana clove, the usual. Just a hint of spiced bread. Flavor starts surprisingly citric and fruity, I expected much more of a dull sweetness but it gave a slight tart character. Gains a rich banana cream pie like maltiness a big yeast character towards the finish before leaving a small grainy and ever so slight bitterness. Medium body and active tongue tickling carbonation. Very refreshing hefe, perfect for the hot day I drank it out on the patio and a surprisingly nice tartness.

This is really good if you are a fan of hefeweizens that dont have that clove coriander smack you in the face this is the kind of beer that brings out the best flavors from the grain with the yeast and comes across with more of the banana clove goodness. if you like the banana flavor this beer is for you. Had this on draft and poured a cloudy yellow. It is a great beer and from what I understand this is the only keg in the state.

Draft at Duffys in Chico.  Served with lemon wedge in shaker.  Cloudy, dull yellow with thin diminishing head.  Banana and white bread nose.  This beer was served very cold, so the flavors were hard to pin down.  Faint graininess, smooth dough, rumpled tropical esters, and a wonky but subdued clove phenol.  Rather light body, dry finish, and sparkling carbonation.
